en: Even here, however, mobility is apt to be more limited than one might suppose.

zh: 在美国，尽管它有“从乞丐到富翁”的意识形态，但大多数的流动都只造成向上或向下移动一点点——尽管如果这种移动在一个家庭中连续发生好几代的话，也可能造成一个大的改变。
en: In the United States, in spite of its t4rags to riches” ideology, most mobility involves a move up or down only a notch, although if this continues in a family for several generations, it may add up to a major change.

zh: 我的论点并非是要说所有这四个领域都与所有的问题有关联，而是说它们彼此之间的连接各不相同并且这种连接取决于实际出现的问题。
en: My argument is not that all four fields are relevant to all problems, but rather that they are linked differently to one another and that the linkages depend on the problem at hand.

zh: 因此，象征人类学离不开语言学，而人类进化的研究不仅需要生物人类学和考古学，在处理某些问题时，它还需要语言学和文化人类学。但四领域结构的批评者指出，大部分的人类学研究并不需要冒失地跳出它自己的领域，这也是实情。
en: Thus, symbolic anthropology cannot do without linguistics, while human evolutionary studies require not only biological anthropology and archaeology, but also linguistic and cultural anthropology for some problems; but it is the case, as critics of the four-field structure argue, that much of anthropological research does not necessitate venturing out of one's own field.

zh: 然而，我们始终无法事先预料到在什么时候、什么地方，跨领域的合作将是富有成效的。
en: Nevertheless, it cannot always be predicted in advance when and where cross-field collaboration will be productive.

zh: 因此，对美国人类学来说，重要的是保持沟通渠道的畅通和保证新的一代受到良好的训练，使他们能够充分理解到：当需求或机会出现时，除了它们自身外，所有的学科都能够从其他领域的贡献中汲取养分。
en: For that reason, I think it is important for American anthropology as a whole to keep the lines of communication open and to ensure that new generations are trained with enough understanding of all the fields to be able to benefit from the contributionsof specialties other than their own when the need or opportunity arises.

zh: 《布伦特兰报告》还将教育作为衡量“人口素质”的 一个“关键尺度”（世界环境与发展委员会1987:105)。
en: The Brundtland Report also treated education as a "key dimension of 'population quality'" (WCED 1987:105).

zh: 这里的教育指的是一般由国家体系提供的教育，而不包括非工业社会儿童通过参与生计活动而得到的传统训练。
en: What is meant here is the kind of education generally provided by state systems, and not the training received traditionally by children in non-industrial societies through their participation in subsistence economies.

zh: 反全球论者认为国家教育是推行“科学帝国主义”的重要机制之一，通过这种教育用“知识”（episteme)取代了 “技艺”（techne) (Marglin 1990)。
en: Anti-globalists would argue that state education hasbeen one of the principal mechanisms through which "scientific imperialism" has advanced, through which "techne" is replaced by "episteme" (Marglin 1990).

zh: 所以福斯特父子的工作不仅仅深植于当时的时代精神中，还深植于发源于16世纪和17世纪的人文主义和科学革命的坚实传统中。
en: So the Forsters' work was embedded not only in a Zeitgeist, but also in a solid tradition emanating from humanism and the scientific revolutions of the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries.

zh: 另外，福斯特父子的工作在当时也并非绝无仅有。
en: In addition, the Forsters' work was not unique in its time.

zh: 更晚一点的先驱人物要算彼得·科尔布（Peter Kolb 1719）,他对南非尤其是科伊科伊（Khoikhoi）的描述成为那个地区民族志的里程碑式的素材（Raum 2001）。
en: A more recent forerunner was Peter Kolb (1719), whose description of Southern Africa and,in particular,of the Khoikhoi became a milestone source for ethnographic accounts of that region (Raum 2001).

zh: 在《西太平洋的航海者》（1922）的导论中，布罗尼斯拉夫˙马林诺夫斯基庆贺了专业的科学民族志的诞生：“一个时代已经结束，在那个时代我们可以容忍把土著人描绘成失真幼稚的人物漫画呈示铪我们。
en: In his introduction to Argonauts of the Western Pacific (1922) Bronislaw Malinowski celebrates the advent of professional, scientific ethnography: "The time when we could tolerate accounts presenting us the native as a distorted, childish caricature of a human being are gone," he declares.

zh: ”他宣称，那样的画像是虚假的，就像许多其他谎言一样已被科学截穿”（Malinowski 1961:11）。
en: "This picture is false, and like many other falsehoods, it has been killed by Science" (Malinowski 1961:11).

zh: 这一论断表明民族志作者中业已形成一种惯习，即将民族志写作定义为高于和对立于旧有的不太专业化的写作体裁，诸如游记（travel books)、个人回忆录、报刊文章，以及传教士、移民和殖民地官员等人的记述。
en: The statement is symptomatic of a well-established habit among ethnographers of defining ethnographic writing over and against older, less specialized genres, such as travel books, personal memoirs, journalism, and accounts by missionaries, settlers, colonial officials, and the like.

zh: 乔治˙艾略特（George Eliot)的小说成为这种参与观察的情形的缩影，这种观察是在一个“通常条件下……在一个可知的共同体中，在虚构的过去中。
en: George Eliot's novels epitomize this situation o f participant-observation in a "common condition ...a knowable community, belong[ing] ideally in the past."

zh: ”例如，《米德尔马契》（Middlemarch）将一代人从它的写作年代投射到1830年。
en: Middlemarch, for example, is projected a generation back from the time of its writing to 1830.

zh: 而且，这是当许多常规民族志用现在时态描写一种正在过去的现实——“传统”生活——时，它们所假设的大概的时间距离。
en: And this is approximately the temporal distance that many conventional ethnographies assume when they describe a passing reality, "traditional" life, in the present tense.

zh: 对一个可知的共同体的虚构“可以为了一个广泛的道德行动而被再创造。但被采取的真正步骤是放弃任何对现存社会的直接反应。作为一个普遍的回溯性条件，价值存在于过去；价值也存在于现在，但只能作为一种特殊的和私有的感性、作为个人的道德行动”（第180页）。
en: The fiction of a knowable community "can be recreated there for a widely ranging moral action. But the real step that has been taken is withdrawal from any full response to an existing society. Value is in the past, as a general retrospective condition, and is in the present only as a particular and private sensibility, the individual moral action" (180).

zh: 在此有必要针对克拉伦顿法令（罗伯逊，《文献材料汇编》，1883,第5卷：第71页）事先做一些说明。在这次著名的制宪会议上，亨利胁迫英国所有的主教接受了这些条款，这也就意味 着北安普敦会议必定充满着矛盾和冲突。
en: Something should first be said, however, about the Constitutions of Clarendon (Robertson, Materials, 1883, vol. 5:71), which Henry had forced the bench of English bishops to accept at the celebrated meeting there, for these set the terms of the Northampton confrontation.

zh: 贝克特本人则表现得顾虑重重、意志软弱，进而采取妥协让步的方式试图平息国王的怒气。
en: Becket himself had then quailed and faltered and sought to appease the king.

zh: 但北美土著和西非的一些社会，因为有一系列繁多的禁止婚姻的规则，所以从个人而不是从血统的观点看，与一般性的交换相似。
en: However, some societies, especially in Native North America and West Africa, have such an extensive array of negative marriage rules that their systems, from an individual though not a lineage point of view, come to resemble those of generalized exchange.

zh: 例如，布基纳法索的萨摩 ( Samo) 男子，不能与其自己父系群体中的人，或他母亲的、他奶奶的或姥姥的父系群体中的成员结婚。
en: For example, among the Samo of Burkina Faso, a man must not marry a member of his own patrilineal group, or his mother’s, his father’s mother’s, or his mother’s mother’s patrilineal group.

zh: 这种“半复杂”或称“克劳－奥马哈”制度（因两支北美土著民族 而得名），介于更典型的复杂形式和基本形式之间。（参见 Heritier 1981 :  73 - 136)
en: These ‘semi-complex’ or ‘Crow-Omaha’ systems (called after two Native North American peoples) thus lie in-between the more typically complex and the elementary ones (see He ́ritier 1981: 73–136).

zh: 对于那些不熟悉它的人来说，克劳制似乎非常复杂而且不合逻辑。
en: To those unfamiliar with it, the Crow system seems terribly complex and illogical.

zh: 它为什么会存在？
en: Why does it exist?

zh: 在诸如霍皮人那样的社会，个体的身份取决于对继嗣群体的附属，而继嗣又是母系的，不顾代际区别而把父亲的姐妹，以及她的女儿、甚至她的母亲都归在—个单一的称呼之下，这是讲得通的。
en: In societies such as that of the Hopi, where individual identity is dependent on descent group affiliation and descent is matrilineal, it makes sense to merge the father sister, her daughter, and even her mother together under a single term, regardless of generation.

zh: 这些女人都通过生育“自我”的那个世系群来追溯自己袓先，就好像一个男性“自我”的子女，以及“自我”母亲兄弟的子女，是通过“自我”世系群的男人生肓的一样。
en: These are women descent is traced through in the lineage that sired ego, just as a male ego's children，along with those of his mother's brother, were sired by men of ego's lineage.

zh: 因此，“自我”将自己母亲这一方的交表兄弟姐妹同于“自我”孩子那一辈就完全合乎逻辑了。
en: Thus, it is perfectly logical for ego to equate his maternal cross cousins with his children's generation.

zh: 在李·杜鲁门看来，大约过去400年中，连续不断的资本主义商品交易累积了数量庞大的全球移民，包括自愿的和非自愿的。可以认为，这些移民已经改变了绝大多数社会。
en: For Lee Drummond, the culmination of some 400 years of massive global migration, voluntary and involuntary, of a continuous traffic in capitalist commodities, can be seen to have transformed most societies.

zh: 然而，其结果并不是那些分散的社会及其特征的重新整合，并整齐地结合成一个新社会，也不是一种旧有的分散社会肩并肩地各自保持自己的文化独特性的多数状态。
en: However, the result of these transformations is neither new integrations of what were once separate societies and features of societies, now fitting neatly together as one, nor pluralities whereby old separate societies simply retain their cultural distinctivenesses side by side.

zh: 相反，结果是很多社会文化的连续融合或联合：即“克里奥尔化”。
en: Rather, what results are socio-cultural continua or combinations: ‘creolizations’.

zh: 隐喻概念基于假定以不同的方式理解现实领域之间的差异性。
换句话说，我们借助某物提供的隐喻来理解其他事物。
en: In other words, something has to provide the metaphors through which something else is understood.

zh: 比如说，在伯尔德关于“人类与自然相关性的隐喻化”的比较分析中 (Bird-David 1993)，人际关系被看作是为狩猎一采集社会与其环境之间互动所提供的隐喻。
en: For instance, in Bird-David's comparative analysis of the "metaphorization of human-nature relatedness" (Bird-David 1993), interpersonal relationships are seen as providing metaphors for the interaction between selected hunter-gatherer societies and their environments.

zh: 因此，克利猎人与其采石场是由性隐喻来表达的——狩猎被描述为一种性交行为——而那亚卡人、巴特克人和姆布提人把森林描述为父亲和母亲（Bird-David 1993:113,120)。
en: Thus, the relationship between Cree hunters and their quarry is expressed through a sexual metaphor—hunting is described as an act of sexual intercourse—while the Nayaka, Batek and Mbuti describe the forest as a parent (Bird-David 1993:113, 120).

zh: 在这些案例中，人与环境的关系是以“隐喻化的”现实来体现的，人类社会关系是由从现实中提取的恰当隐喻来“非隐喻化的”（unmetaphorized)现实。
en: In these cases, the human-environment relationships are presented as "metaphorized" reality, and human social relationships are the "unmetaphorized" reality from which appropriate metaphors are drawn.

zh: 不可能对刻板印象和“事实”之间的关系做出一个总体的声明。
en: It is impossible to make a general statement about the relationship of stereotypes to "facts".

zh: 它们可能是夸张的，对社会事实进行了过于一般化和理想化的描绘。
en: They can be exaggerated, overly generalising and ideologically charged descriptions of social facts.

zh: 当毛里求斯的克利奥尔人将印度人描述成是小气的，这种刻板印象对应于印度人认为自己是勤劳而有责任感的民族的刻板印象。
en: When the Creoles of Mauritius describe the Hindus as miserly, this stereotype corresponds to one that Hindus hold of themselves as hard-working and responsible people.

zh: 此外，很显然，不可能把所有事物都包含在描述中，即使你的目标是提供一种对该社会的全面说明并且安排了长篇大论于此。让我们仔细研究内部看法和外部看法之间的关系。
en: In addition, it would be plainly impossible to include everything in a description, even if one's aim is to provide a comprehensive account of a society and one has a thousand pages at one's disposal.Let us look a little more closely at the relationship between the view from within and the view from the outside.

zh: 某种程度上，民族志的描述比其分析与受访者的经验世界离得更近些，因为后者完全是以对文化和社会的一般论述为目标的。
en: Ethnographic description lies closer, in a sense, to the world as experienced by the informants than the analysis does, as the latter may ultimately aim at general statements about culture and society.

zh: 这个层次——由该社会本身的成员自己经验和描述的生活——某些时候被称为“主位”观察；与其相对，外部观察者的分析式描述或解释，叫做“客位”观察层次。
en: This level – life as experienced and described by the members of a society themselves – is sometimes spoken of as the "emic" level.Its counterpart, the analytical descriptions or explanations of the researcher, is the "etic" level.

zh: “世界中发生的每个事件，都是受空间座标x、y、z和时间座标t制约的。”诸事件间的基本关系或“间隔”，就是空间一时间关系。
en: "Every event that happens in the world is determined by the space-co-ordinates x, y, z and the time-co-ordinate t," The fundamental relationship, or "interval," between events is one of space-time.

zh: 虽然以往曾将空间和时间设想为外部世界之彼此独立的属性，但现在已把这两者看成不过是某种基本的和首要的属性即空间一时间的诸侧面而已。
en: Whereas formerly space and time were thought of as properties of the external world independent of each other, they are now seen to be merely aspects of the basic and primary property, space-time.

zh: 引用明何夫斯基（Minkowski)的话说就是：“我想向你们介绍的空间和时间观念，已经从实验物理学的沃土中抽出枝芽，而它的力量亦正蕴藏于其中。它正在迅猛成长。
en: To quote Minkowski: "The views of space and time which I wish to lay before you have sprung from the soil of experimental physics, and therein lies their strength.They are radical.

zh: 控制可以描述为：“对递归的非线性系统模式的阐释”（Harries-Jones 1995: 3）。
en: Cybernetics might be described as: the ‘elucidating of patterns in recursive, nonlinear systems’ (Harries-Jones 1995:3).

zh: 更一般地看待世界的模式特征：想象之间的关联与事物之间的关系；关联的模式与那些从环境上看似乎并不存在关联的生活和经历的氛围有关，且最终与那些最初看上去毫无关联的现象的存在相关。
en: More generally it deals with the patterned nature of the world: with the connectedness of phenomena and the connections between things; with the way patterns of connectedness both relate spheres of life and experience that might circumstantially seem unrelated, and are ultimately responsible for the existence of those seemingly unrelated phenomena in the first place.

zh: 怀特海德（Whitehead 1925）相当深入地讨论了控制：本世纪以来一个错误的观念一直困扰着哲学文献，即“独立存在”。
en: Cybernetics takes seriously Whitehead’s counsel (1925): The misconception that has haunted philosophical literature throughout the centuries is the notion of ‘independent existence’.

zh: 没有这种模式的存在；每一事物都必须和宇宙中其他事物联系起来加以理解。
en: There is no such mode of existence; every entity is to be understood in terms of the way it is interwoven with the rest of the universe.

zh: 控制是关于世界的线路图，以及怎样才能更好地位了人类社会及其与自然环境的关系的未来充分认识并维持这一线路图。
en: Cybernetics is the elucidation of the circuitry of the world, and how that circuitry can best be appreciated and maintained for the future existence both of human societies and their relation to the natural environment.

zh: 另一种重要的分析言语的人类学方法来自罗伯特·潘恩（等人）关于政治口号的讨论。
en: Another important anthropological approach to discourse has been the work of Robert Paine (and others) on political rhetoric.

zh: 潘恩把口号当作一种特殊的话语类型，认为虽然大多数的言语行动都是“言之有物”的，但口号的核心在于“说就是做”（Paine 1981:9)。
en: Paine distinguishes rhetoric as a particular kind of discourse, arguing that while most speech-acts concern "speech about something", the kernel of rhetoric is that "saying is doing" (1981:9).

zh: 这时，口号往往伴有音乐或戏剧化表演，因为此时所做的与效果密不可分。
en: In this, rhetoric most resembles music or drama, for there too the doing and the effect are inseparable.

zh: 口头艺术包括叙事、戏剧、诗歌、咒语、谚语、谜语和文字游戏，甚至还有取名的程序、赞美和侮辱——只要它们具有特定的结构形式。
en: The verbal arts include narratives, dramas, poetry, incantations, proverbs, riddles, word games, and even naming procedures, compliments, and insults, when these take structured and special forms.

zh: 叙事似乎是最容记录和搜集的一种口头艺术。
en: Narratives seem to be one of the easiest kinds of verbal arts to record or collect.

zh: 也许因为它们也是最适于公开发行的一种口头艺术而且在北美文化中最受欢迎，所以它们得到大量研究和关注。
en: Perhaps because they also are the most publishable, with popular appeal in North American culture, they have received the most study and attention.

zh: 一般而言，叙事分为三个基本的再出现的类别：神话，传奇和故事。
en: Generally, narratives have been divided into three basic and recurring categories: myth, legend, and tale.

zh: 马林诺夫斯基最著名的作品是《西太平洋的航海者》（Malinowski 1922)。
en: The most famous of Malinowski’s works is Argonauts of the Western Pacific (1922).

zh: 该书以陈述主题、方法和范围开篇，接着描述特罗布里恩德群岛地理状况以及作者怎样到达这个群岛。
en: Argonauts begins with a statement on subject, method, and scope, then describes the geography of the Trobriands and his arrival in the islands.

zh: 随后他转向描述库拉（kula)交换规则，以及有关独木舟、航海以及独木舟巫术和典礼仪式的详情。
en: He moves on to the rules of kula exchange, facts about canoes, sailing, and canoe magic and ceremony.

zh: 夸富宴在夸扣特尔人群体和他们的邻居中很流行，这些人是富裕的猎人和渔民，他们所在的社会比起以这种方式谋生的其他社会，更加等级化一些。
en: The potlatch was practised by Kwakiutl groups and their neighbours.These peoples were prosperous hunters and fisherfolk, and lived in more hierarchical societies than is common among groups with this kind of livelihood.

zh: 这一系统中的贵族需要不断地捍卫并试图提高他们的相对等级，其方式是相互赠送炫耀性的礼物。
en: The aristocrats within the system continuously had to defend, and to try to improve, their relative rank by giving spectacular gifts to each other.

zh: 这种现象可以被描述成具有竞争性的礼物交换，包含了一种加速的机制。
en: This phenomenon, which could be described as competitive gift exchange, contains a mechanism for acceleration.

zh: 当B首领从A首领那里收到一份礼物，他在回赠礼物的时候就会超越后者。
en: When chief B received a gift from chief A, he would have to surpass the latter in his return gift.

zh: 在某些情况下，这种竞争达到顶峰的时候会毁掉大量的物质财富。
en: This competition could, in some cases, culminate in the destruction of considerable material wealth.

zh: 每个冬天，首领们互相邀请参加各自的大型盛会，盛会上会提供丰盛的食物和饮料，还会给客人们赠送奢侈的礼物。
en: Each winter the chiefs invited each other to large parties, where abundant food and drink were served and lavish presents were given to the guests.

zh: 对实现世界政治统一的抵制力量，在某种程度上似乎被跨国公司的兴起抵消了。
en: The world's resistance to political integration seems to be offset, at least partially, by the rise of multinational corporations.

zh: 因为这些公司跨越了国界，它们是推进全球整合的力量，尽管有各种政治差异把人们分开。
en: Because these cur across the boundaries berween states, they are a force for global unity despite the political differences that divide people.

zh: 人类学家非常熟悉这种情形，就像下面这段对祖尼印第安人整合机制的描述那样：四五个不同层面的系统相互交织，因而维持了整个社会的统一性，如果这些不同层面相互駐合的话，这种统一性很快就会消失，因而很有可能带来隔离和分裂宗族、兄弟互助会、祭司群体、地下大会堂，在某种意义上还有赌博团伙，都是分化机构。
en: Situations such as this are well known to anthropologists, as illustrated by this description of Zuni Indian integrative mechanisms: segregation and fission.The clans, the fraternities, the priesthoods, the kivas, in a measure the gaming parties, are ail dividing agencies.

zh: 如果它们相互一致的话，社会结构十的裂缝就会很深；通过彼此相互交织，它们制造出各种分支，这些分支造成了一种几乎不可思议的复杂性，但却绝不会导致这个民族实体的分裂。
en: If they coincided, the rifts in the social structure would be deep; by countering each other they cause segmentations which produce an almost marvelous complexity, but can never break apart the national entity.

zh: 塞罗尼-龙 (Cerroni-Long l999)说，时代要求人类学家主动地去制止各种形式的“文化福音主义”带来的危险。
en: As Cerroni-Long argues (1999), times demand that anthropologists actively counteract the dangers of "cultural fundamentalism", in all its colours and practices.

zh: 在这种氛围下的多元文化主义、跨文化主义、跨民族主义也是一样需要警惕的。
en: Multi-culturalism, transculturalism, transnationalism are phrases in the air, so to speak.

zh: 人类学的力量在于我们提倡多元视角主义（perspectivism):综合了殖民话语与后殖民话语，以及各种潜在的活跃的颠覆二者的力暈。
en: The strength of anthropology is that we appreciate multi-perspectivism: there are a multiplicity of colonial discourses and post-colonial ones, and a plurality of potential and active subversions of both.

zh: 我们能够认到宇宙的多样性才是人类学真正的成就。
en: Our recognition of this universe of pluralities is surely anthropology's real competence.

zh: P.R.桑迪(Sanday，P.R.
en: Sanday, P. R. (1981).

zh: ，1981):《女性权利与男性统治：论性别不平等的起源》 （Female power and male dominance: On the origins of sexual inequality) 剑桥市：剑桥大学出版社。
en: Female power and male dominance： On the origins of sexual inequality.

zh: 在这项跨文化研究中，桑迪教授揭示了人类社会组织男女关系的各种方式，并说明男性统治并非内在于那些关系之中。
en: Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.In this cross-cultural study, Professor Sanday reveals the various ways male-female relations are organized in human societies and demonstrates that male dominance is not inherent in those relations.

zh: 相反，它似乎倒更像是由于长期食物短缺、迁徙和殖民统治等所引起的紧张局势的产物。
en: Rather, it appears to emerge in situations of stress as a result of such things as chronic food shortages, migration, and colonial domination.

zh: 下一步是查看词素是如何组合起来组成短语或句子的。
en: The next step is to put morphemes together to form phrases or sentences.

zh: 这一过程通常被叫作识别语言的句法单位，或词素组合成有意义的语符链或语符列的方式。
en: This process is known as identifying the syntactic units of the language, or the way morphemes are combined into larger chains or strings that have meaning.

zh: 做这件事的一种途径楚使用被称为框架替换（frame substitution）的方法。
en: One way to do this is to use a method called frame substitution.

zh: 起初慢慢地表达词素并依靠指点或手势，田野工作者能够推导山这类语符列“我的猫”、“你的猫”，或“她的猫”，以及“我看到你的猫”，“她看到我的猫'这就开始确立短语和句子形成的规则或原理，即语言的句这种研究的进一步成就极为依赖个人的创造力、机敏、逻辑和在语言方面的经验。
en: By proceeding slowly at first, and relying on pointing or gestures, the field linguist can elicit strings such as my cat, your cat, or her cat.I see your cat and she sees my cat.This begins to establish the rules or principles of phrase and sentence making, the syntax of the language.

zh: 在北美，核心家庭并非总是拥有它们随着工业主义的兴起而曾经拥有过的那种程度的独立性，在早些时候一个更加农业化的时代，小型的核心家庭有时是一个较大的扩大家庭（extended family）的一部分。
en: In North America, nuclear families have not always had the degree of independence they came to have with the rise of industrialism.In an earlier more agrarian era, the small nuclear family commonly was part of a larger extended family.

zh: 送种家庭，部分是配偶家庭，部分是血亲家庭，它可能包括祖父母、父母、兄弟姐妹，也许还有伯(叔)和姑（婶），以及一二个堂兄弟姐妹。
en: This kind of family, in part conjugal and in part consanguine, might include grandparents, mother and father, brothers and sisters, perhaps an uncle and aunt, and a stray cousin or two.

zh: 所有这些人，他们或有血缘联系，或有婚姻联系，都在一起劳动和生活。
en: All these people, some related by blood and some by marriage, lived and worked together.

zh: 因为年轻一代的家庭成员把自己的配偶（丈夫或妻子）带回家来生活。扩大家庭就像血亲家庭一样具有时间上的延续性。
en: Because members of the younger generation brought their spouses (husbands or wives) to live in the family, extended families, like consanguine families, had continuity through time.

zh: 较老的家庭成员相继去世，同样，新的成员出生进入这个家庭。
en: As older members died off, new members were born into the family.

zh: 拉马克相信，生物体器官的进 化或退化是根据它们是否使用了其潜能而决定的。
en: Lamarck believed that organs improve or decay according to whether they are used to their potential or not.

zh: 他还主张，个体 获得的特性能够再传递给其后代。
en: He also held that individuals acquired characteristics which could be passed on to their descendants.

zh: 比如，一个幼时学过绘画的女孩， 能够将这种天赋传给她在子宫里的孩子。
en: For example, if a girl learned to paint at an early age, later she could pass on such talents to her children in the womb.

zh: 坦白地说，拉马克具有进化论思想，但他对进化机制有所误解。
en: Plainly, Lamarck had the idea of evolution, but he misunderstood its mechanism.

zh: 查尔斯•达尔文（Darwin 1859)拒绝接受拉马克的观点。
en: Charles Darwin (1859) rejected the Lamarckian view.

zh: 他则主张，进化只能通过遗传我们现在所称的遗传特性来实现。
en: He argued instead that evolution proceeds only through the passing down of what we now call genetic traits.

zh: 偶然的突变将产生更大量的变种，而且在各自的环境中最成功地生存下来的那些变种将更有效地繁衍后代。
en: Accidental mutation produced greater variety, and the forms which were most successful in their respective environments would reproduce more effciently.

zh: 1848年失败的“大的”泛德意志革命到1871年“小的”由普鲁士完成的德国统一之间的政治期是民俗研究(Volkskunde；folklore studies)独立出现的大环境——也就是说，与后来民族学（Völkerkunde Ethnology/Ethnogrphy)分离。在某种意义上，这是对先前转向“双重内省”趋势的逻辑继承。这一内省在1830年代从哲学和艺术浪漫主义以及政治民族主义那里获得了新的能量。
en: The political period between the failed, 1848 "large" pan-Germanic revolution and the 1871 "small" Prussian unification ofGermany was the wider context for the separate emergence of Volkskunde, or folklore studies—separate, that is,from what became Völkerkunde,or ethnology/ethnography.In a sense, this was a logical continuation of the earlier turn toward a "twofold introspection," which by the 1830s had received new energy from philosophical and artistic Romanticism and from political nationalism.

zh: 人类学说明中的描述部分通常接近于当地人对世界的概念化，而一个主要的挑战在于把当地的观念转译为人类学家的工作语言。
en: The descriptive aspect of an anthropological account is usually close to the native conceptualisation of the world, and a major challenge lies in translating native concepts into the anthropologist's working language.

zh: 当描述一个社会和文化的生命世界时，人类学家常常诉诸对受访者的直接引用，按其从内部所显示的那样给出对世界的说明。
en: When describing a social and cultural life-world, the anthropologist will often resort to direct quotations from informants, to give an account of the world as it appears from within.

zh: 另一方面，分析，通过人类学的比较术语的描述，力图从理论层次上把该社会与其他社会相联系，这样，也就是说，用这个社会本身不存在的概念去描述这个社会：这里的人民有哪一种“亲属制度”？
en: The analysis, on the other hand, will try to connect the society, at a theoretical level, to other societies by describing it in the comparative terms of anthropology.It will, in other words, describe the society with concepts which do not exist in the society itself.What kind of "kinship system" do the people have?

zh: 他们如何解决“冲突”？
en: How do they resolve "conflicts"?

zh: “男女之间的劳动分工”是什么样的？
en: What is the "division of labour between men and women"?

zh: “宗教和仪式”的作用是什么？
en: What is the role of "religion and rituals"?

zh: “权力关系”是怎样的结构？
en: How are "power relations" structured?

zh: 多贡的村落也是按照家系团结起来的，而不是按照纯粹的政治和司法系统。
en: The Dogon villages are also integrated along lines other than purely political and judicial ones.

zh: 所有成年男性都参加的宗教崇拜意义重大，人们认为建立和培育历史延续感很重要。村子的所有家系都可以溯根到一个遥远的祖先，据称是他发现了他们现在的定居点。
en: The religious cults, in which all adult men participate, are significant.It is considered important to establish and nurture a sense of continuity with the past, and all lineages of a village can refer to a distant ancestor who allegedly founded their current settlement.

zh: 土地被认为是祖先所有，所以不能买卖。
en: The soil is spoken of as ancestral land and it cannot be sold.

zh: 这样，多贡的村落十分稳定。
en: In this way, the Dogon villages become very stable.

zh: 迁入或移出的移居传统上讲都是不寻常的。
en: In- and out-migration have traditionally been uncommon.

zh: 这种模式在许多非洲农业民族当中得以蔓延，但是在20世纪，特别是第二次世界大战期间，情况发生了变化，主要是因为殖民主义、国家教育系统的发展和资本主义劳动力市场。
en: This pattern has been widespread among many African agricultural peoples, but during the twentieth century, and particularly since the Second World War, it has changed, largely due to colonialism and the growth of a state educational system and a capitalist labour market.

zh: 在大学博物馆，展示是按进化方式安排的，顺着墙壁一字排开，从细胞到类人猿到人类。
en: In the University Museum, displays are arranged in an evolutionary format.Along one wall is the sequence from cell to primate to humans.

zh: 其他展示也详尽地阐述了这一体系，虽然并不总是那么直接；按照典型的博物馆风尚，他们展示了各种各样的动物骨骼，甚至是一名被判决的当地罪犯的骨骼。
en: Other displays elaborate this scheme, though not always explicitly; in characteristic museum fashion, they display skeletons of various animals and even the skeleton of a local criminal who was executed.

zh: 在这个博物馆，同样是在皮特河部分，还包栝一些文化上的手工艺术品：乐器、武器、工具和一些非常大的对象，例如大型（完整尺寸）的当地船和爱德华·泰勒爵士收集的一个巨大的图腾柱。
en: In this museum, too, is the Pitt-Rivers section, which contains cultural artifacts: musical instruments, weapons, tools, and some very large objects such as full-sized native ships and a huge totem pole collected by Sir Edward Tylor.

zh: 在确立了一种社会模式类型学后，道格拉斯展示了经验和文化怎样与每个类型相关。
en: Having established a typology of social patterns, Douglas then shows how experiences and cultures correlate with each type.

zh: 强群体一强网格社区会集结那些能够巩固信仰和凝聚社会的仪式，与其相对，弱群体一弱网格社区（如果可以这样使用这个词的话）就无法做到这一点。
en: The strong group-strong grid community musters rituals that fortify faith and solidify society, whereas the weak group-weak grid community (if one may use the word) cannot.

zh: 强群体一弱网格社会，着重强调像巫术和魔术这样能在客体身上展示出一种很强的社会界限感的实践；生活在这种社会的成员，会担心那些跨越界限、危害身体的讨厌的事物。
en: Strong group-weak grid societies emphasize such practices as witchcraft and sorcery that project a strong sense of social boundary onto the physical body; members of such societies worry about noxious substances crossing those boundaries and harming the body.

zh: 穆布提人以大约20人的规模群居，具有一种分类的亲属制度，即同样的亲属称谓被用来表示不同的（或根本没有）生物关系的个体。
en: The Mbuti live in groups numbering about 20 persons and have a classificatory kinship system, which means that the same kinship terms are used to denote individuals who are differently (or not at all) biologically related.

zh: 等级由性别、年龄和个人威望决定，生命阶段的转换由详细的过渡仪式（rite of passage）来标志。
en: Rank is determined according to gender, age and personal authority, and the transition between life-stages is marked by elaborate rites of passage.

zh: 婚礼也是重要的仪式，离婚是不被赞成的。
en: Weddings are also important rituals and divorce is discouraged.

zh: 尽管婚外性行为会有发生，但却是不被批准的，调情的行为面临严格的约束。
en: Although non-marital sex occurs, it is negatively sanctioned.Flirtation is subjected to strict rules.

zh: 与深受现代英美传统影响的多数社会科学家欢迎的这一对人类行为的解释相对比，普遍主义者更倾向于另一种观点。
en: In contrast to the kind of explanation of human behavior favored by most social scientists of the modern Anglo-American tradition, universalists would favor another viewpoint.

zh: 一种英美传统（经验主义）争辩说，人类具有如此大的可塑性，以至于可以将其思维方式和行动解释为主要是对其所处环境的反应。
en: One Anglo-American tradition, known as empiricism, has argued that humans are so plastic that their ways of thinking and acting are explicable primarily as responses to their environment.

zh: 普遍主义者追随一种叫作理性主义的哲学，后者假设人的心智有固定的分类，不管在什么样的环境下都会显露出来。
en: Universalists follow a philosophy known as rationalism, which postulates that the human mind has innate categories, which surface regardless of the environment.

zh: 然后，人类学与其他领域的认知科学一道，寻求发现人类思想的普遍特征 。
en: Anthropology, then, together with cognitive sciences in other fields, seeks to discover universal qualities of human thought.

zh: 作为对列维-斯特劳斯观察的补充，我们必须指出的是，西方曾有自己的食人行为，原因则和美洲土著的十分相似。
en: As a postscript to Lévi-Strauss’s observations, we might add that the West has a history of its own anthropophagic practices, the reasoning for which being very similar to those of indigenous peoples of the Americas, i.

zh: 例如，他们恢复和获得健康！
en: e.that they revitalize and give health!

zh: 西方医学有很长医学食人历史。特别是在16、17世纪帕拉塞斯式医药哲学盛行时。
en: Medicinal cannibalism in Western medicine has a long history, and was especially popular in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries when Paracelsian medical philosophy was followed.

zh: 民族志是新出现的跨学科现象。
en: Ethnography is an emergent interdisciplinary phenomenon.

zh: 它的权威和修辞已扩展到许多把“文化”当作描述和批评的新的问题对象的领域。
en: Its authority and rhetoric have spread to many fields where "culture" is a newly problematic object of description and critique.

zh: 本书虽然从田野调査及其文本开始，但向更宽广的写作实践开放：关于文化、相对于文化以及在文化之间的写作。
en: The present book, though beginning with fieldwork and its texts, opens onto the wider practice of writing about, against, and among cultures.

zh: 这一模糊的范围包括——这里只提-些发展中的视角——历史民族志（伊曼纽尔˙勒˙罗伊˙拉迪里，纳塔莉˙戴维斯，卡洛˙金斯伯格）、文化政治学（斯蒂芬˙格林布拉特）文化批评(海登˙怀特，爱德华˙萨义德，弗雷德里克˙詹明信）、对日常实践和隐形知识的分析（皮埃尔˙布迪尔，米歇尔˙德˙塞尔托）、情感的霸权结构的批评（雷蒙德˙威廉斯）、对科学团体的研究 (迪随托马斯˙库恩）、异想世界与奇幻空间的符号学（茨韦坦˙托多罗夫，路易˙马兰）以及所有聚焦于意义系统、有争议的传统或文化造物的研究。
en: This blurred purview includes, to name only a few developing perspectives, historical ethnography (Emmanuel Le Roy Ladurie, Natalie Davis, Carlo Ginzburg), cultural poetics (Stephen Greenblatt), cultural criticism (Hayden White, Edward Said, Fredric Jameson), the analysis of implicit knowledge and everyday practices (Pierre Bourdieu, Michel de Certeau), the critique of hegemonic structures of feeling (Raymond Williams), the study of scientific communities (following Thomas Kuhn), the semiotics of exotic worlds and fantastic spaces (Tzvetan Todorov, Louis Marin), and all those studies that focus on meaning systems, disputed traditions, or cultural artifacts.

zh: 历史人类学发展了它在博物馆中的一个强项，地方专业知识和档案材料促进了对写作历史的臆测性方法更早的超越，而在这方面又与德语区中来自启蒙时期的重要语言学学统结合得非常好。
en: Historical anthropology developed one of its strongholds in museums, where regional expertise and archival material promoted an earlier transcending of the speculative methods of writing history.This combined well with the important philological legacy in German, derived from Enlightenment.

zh: 德语学术圈中的人文学科被赋予了来自这一语言学学统的丰富的专业院系：日本、中国、印度和西藏研究；阿拉伯、土耳其和伊朗研究；等等。
en: The humanities in German-speaking academia are richly endowed with specialized departments that come out of this philological tradition: Japanese, Chinese, Indian, and Tibetan studies; Arab, Turkish, and Iranian studies; and so on.

zh: 尽管某种程度上还遭受到被萨义德（1979)批判的东方学的局限的影响，这些传统和研究记录经历了自身的改革，并在越来越多地刺激历史人类学发展的同时也被后者所影响。
en: Although still suffering to some degree from Orientalist limitations of the kind criticized by Edward Said (1979), these traditions and research records went through reforms of their own, while increasingly stimulating historical anthropology and being influenced by it.

zh: 尤其是，地区专业化和历史 专业知识的质量在关于南北美洲的土著人、撒哈拉以南的非洲、中东、西伯利亚、东南亚和美拉尼西亚的研究中都达到了新的水平。
en: In particular, regional specialization and historical expertise gained new levels of quality for native South and North America, Africa south of the Sahara, the Middle East, Siberia, Southeast Asia, and Melanesia.

zh: 为了反击泰勒、摩根和其他人的进化论的宏大架构，博厄斯早期采取了一种更倾向排他主义研究者的姿态。
en: Reacting against the grand evolutionary schemes of Tylor, Morgan and others, Boas took an early stance in favour of a more particularist approach.

zh: 他认为，每一种文化都应该从其自身角度被理解，如果以西方种族中心主义的类型学的“发展水平”为评估标准，将会从科学上误入歧途，对其他文化做出错误的判断和排序。
en: He argued that each culture had to be understood on its own terms and that it would be scientifically misleading to judge and rank other cultures according to a Western, ethnocentric typology gauging "levels of development".

zh: 相应地，博厄斯也推崇历史特殊论，其观点是所有社会和文化都有它们自己独特的历史，而不能被简化成是某个普遍性发展方案中的一个类别。
en: Accordingly, Boas also promoted historical particularism, the view that all societies or cultures had their own, unique history that could not be reduced to a category in some universalist scheme of development.

zh: 基于相关原因，博厄斯反驳了种族主义伪科学毫无根据的宣称， 尽管当时这种种族主义伪科学被许多重要的生物学家所支持。
en: On related grounds, Boas argued against the unfounded claims of racist pseudo-science, which were supported by most of the leading biologists of the time.

zh: “自由阐释的历史”是赫伯特•巴特菲尔德爵士提出的一个措词。1931年前后，他指出，历史学家也总是都常常会把历史视为一种变革论者和保守论者之间的冲突，变革论者（自由主义者）最终赢得并带来了影响目前情境的变化。
en: ‘Whig history’ is a phrase coined by Sir Herbert Butterfield around 1931, when he said that historians have all too often seen history as a conflict between progressives and reactionaries, where the progressives (Whigs) eventually win and bring about changes effecting the present situation.

zh: 自由阐释的历史因此是主观的和“现代主义的” （presentist)，而这就是为什么历史学家不喜欢它的原因。
en: Whig history is thus subjective and ‘presentist’, and that is why true historians do not like it (see, e.g.

zh: 他们说，好的历史是“历史性的”（historicist)，要有一种非常精确的世界感。
en: , Stocking 1968 [1965]: 1-12).Good history, they say, is ‘historicist’, in a very precise sense of that word.

zh: 在当代北美社会，一种越来越普遍的婚姻形式是连续一夫一妻制(serial monogamy)，在这种婚姻形式中，男子或女子连续与一系列配偶结婚。
en: A form of marriage increasingly common in North American society today is serial monogamy, whereby the man or the woman marries or lives with a series of partners in succession.

zh: 当前，50%以上的初次婚姻以离婚告终，而且某些专家推断，新近的婚姻有三分之二将不会持久。
en: Currently, more than 50% of first marriages end in divorce, and some experts project that two thirds of recent marriages will not last.

zh: 婚姻破裂后，孩子经常不同母亲一起生活。
en: [Stacey, J. (1990). Brave new families (pp. 15, 286, n. 46). New York： Basic Books.] Upon dissolution of a marriage, the children more often than not remain with the mother.

zh: 这一模式与社会学家和人类学家最初描述美国西部印第安人和低阶层都市美国黑人的那种模式类似。
en: This pattern is an outgrowth of one sociologists and anthropologists first described among West Indians and lower-class urban blacks in the United States.

zh: 女子早年就开始生孩子，那个令他怀孕的男子没有跟她结婚。
en: Early in life, women begin to bear children by men who are not married to them.

zh: 为了供养她们自己及其孩子，妇女必须在家庭之外寻找工作，但要这样做，她们必须寻求其他亲戚的帮助，最经常的帮助来自她们的母亲。
en: To support themselves and their children, the women must look for work outside the household, but to do so they must seek help from other kin, most commonly their mother.

zh: 在核心家庭发展循环的早期阶段，家户因此简直是不能成立的。
en: At the early stage of the developmental cycle of the nuclear family, the household is thus only barely viable.

zh: 这样的家户常常是与男方父亲的家户暂时合并在一起，直到他们的长子到了可以放牧的年龄。
en: Frequently such a household will temporarily merge with that of the man's father, until his oldest son is able to work as a shepherd.

zh: 在旱季，这种与丈夫父亲的家户联盟可能是特别重要的，在这个阶段，富拉尼人散布在一大片区域；到了雨季，他们以大型家族集团的形式居住在一起，从而更好地协同工作。
en: Such an alliance with the husband's fathe's household can be especially important during the dry season.During this period, the Fulani are scattered over a large area; during the rainy season, they live in larger kin groups and can more easily share the work.

zh: 其他形式的继嗣群体是联族和半偶族（参见图10.3)。
en: Other kinds of descent group are phratries and moieties (Figure 10.3).

zh: 联族(phratry)，如我们前面讨论过的霍皮人联族那样，是由至少两个氏族构成的单系继嗣群体，这两个氏族之间假设拥有个共同祖先，而不论是否真的如此。
en: A phratry, such as those of the Hopi we already have discussed, is a unilineal descent group composed of at least two clans that supposedly share a common ancestry, whether or not they really do.

zh: 和氏族中的个体一样，联族的成员也不能精辦地把他们的继嗣关系追溯到一个共同的祖先，尽管他们坚定地相信有这个袓先存在。
en: Like clan individuals, phratry members cannot trace accurately their descent links to a common ancestor, though they firmly believe such an ancestor existed.

zh: 人们在不同时期已提出財乱伦禁忌的各种心理学解释。
en: Various psychological explanations of the incest taboo have been advanced at one time or another.

zh: 西格蒙特·弗洛伊德在他对无意识的精神分析理论中试图说明其原因。
en: Sigmund Freud tried to account for it in his psychoanalytic theory of the unconscious.

zh: 按照弗洛伊德的看法，儿子对母亲有情欲（熟悉酿成尝试），造成与父亲的对抗关系（弗洛伊德称之为恋母情结）。
en: According to him, the son desires the mother (familiarity breeds attempt), creating a rivalry with the father.(Freud called this the Oedipus complex.)

zh: 儿子必须压抑这种感情，否则就激起远比他强有力的父亲的愤怒。
en: The son must suppress these feelings or earn the wrath of the father, who is far more powerful than he.

zh: 同样，女儿迷上父亲，即恋父情结，使她与其母亲处在对抗关系之中根据这一观点，我们可以预计，就家庭内杀人者而言可能发生同性偏见——母亲对女儿或儿子对父亲——但事实上，这种偏见并不存在。
en: Similarly, the attraction of the daughter to the father (the Electra complex) places her in rivalry with her mother.From this, we might expect a same-sex bias in the case of intrafamily homicides—mother versus daughter or son versus father—but in fact no such bias exists.

zh: 良知时常被认为是人类自我之最深层的、隐私性的个人特征。
en: One's conscience is often thought to be the most intimate, personal and private characteristic of one's ego.

zh: 如果人们想去寻找某些完全属于自己的、由个人始终如一地拥有的东西，那么，这里就正是这样一块地方。
en: Here if anywhere one ought to find something that is wholly one's own, a private and unique possession.

zh: 对一个普通人来说，这种良知似乎就是分辨是非的机制和先天能力，正如他具有分辨上和下、垂直与平行的机制一样。
en: To an ordinary individual the conscience seems to be a mechanism, an inborn ability, to distinguish between right and wrong, just as he possesses a mechanism for distinguishing up from down, the vertical from the horizontal.

zh: 随着时间流逝，世系群代代相传，新成员不断降生，其成员可能太多而难以管理，或因人数太多以至于该世系群的资源难以供养他们。
en: In the course of time, as generation succeeds generation and new members are born into the lineage, its membership may become unmanageably large or too much for the lineage's resources to support.

zh: 每当这种情况发生，就如我们在中国人宗族那里看到的那样，裂变（fission）便产生了，这就是说，原先的世系群分裂成新的、比较小的世系群。
en: When this happens, as we have seen with the Chinese tsu, fission occurs; that is, the lineage Small Places， Large Issuests into new, smaller lineages.

zh: 每巧这种情况发生，通常新世系群的成员会继续承认它们彼此之间最终的联系。
en: When fission occurs, usually the members of the new lineages continue to recognize their ultimate relationship to one another.

zh: 这一过程的结果是产生一种更大型的继嗣群体：氏族这个术语，及其近义词血统宗族，人类学家对其有不同用法，它们的含义在一定程度上是模糊不清的。
en: The result of this process is the appearance of a second kind of descent group, the clan.The term clan and its close relative, the term sib, have been used differently by various anthropologists, and a certain amount of confusion exists about their meaning.

zh: 这些例子决没有穷尽在卡保库人文化中存在的各种相互关系。
en: These examples by no means exhaust the interrelationships found in Kapauku culture.

zh: 例如，通过男子计算世系和几乎不断的战争往往增进男子的统治，因而在卡保库人社会，发现男子独占领袖地位，占有妇女的劳动产品以进行其政治“博弈”，也就不令人惊讶了。
en: For example, both patrilineality and endemic warfare tend to promote male dominance, so it is not surprising to find that positions of leadership in Kapauku society are held exclusively by men, who appropriate the products of women's labor in order to play their political "games".

zh: 尽管有相反的断言，男性统治绝不是所有人类社会的特征。
en: Assertions to the contrary notwithstanding, male dominance is by no means characteristic of all human societies.

zh: 相反，就如在卡保库人 的案例中，它也只是在那特殊环境下才产生的，如果那种环境变化了，男女相互关系的方式也将会改变。
en: Rather, as with the Kapauku, it arises only under particular circumstances that, if changed, would alter the way men and women relate to one another.

zh: 由于工业化和民族国家对大量异质化人口进行的整合，保留基于宗族或家系的社会组织在许多情况下都变得不可能。
en: Due to industrialisation and the integration of large, heterogeneous populations in nation-states, it has in many contexts become impossible to maintain clan- or lineage-based social organisation.

zh: 在这种社会里，每个人都要依靠大量与自己没有关系的人，而且每个人都要对自己的生活负责，很大程度上是没有来自家族群体的支持的。
en: In this kind of society, everybody is dependent on a large number of persons they are not related to, and each person is responsible for his or her life, largely without support from the kin group.

zh: 劳动合同代替了宗族土地和家庭交易，并且社会流动性很强。
en: The labour contract has replaced the clan land and the family trade, and social mobility is high.

zh: 婚姻的思维方式以个体选择为基础，取代了之前基于家系的婚姻模式。
en: A marriage ideology based on individual choice has replaced the former lineage-based marriages.

zh: 货币经济和普遍的工薪式思维方式将居住地点和生存的问题变成个人而非集体的问题。
en: The monetary economy and the ideology of universal wagework has turned questions of subsistence and place of residence into individual and not collective issues.

zh: 这些可能会使我们相信亲属制度不再重要了。
en: This may lead us to believe that kinship has ceased to be important.

zh: 但是，在其社会组织的潜力之外，它还具有重要的象征维度。
en: However, it has important symbolic dimensions in addition to its social organisational potential.

zh: 《撒旦的诗篇》（The Satanic Verses，Rushdie 1988）这部小说给它的作者从德黑兰的什叶派牧师那里招来了追杀之祸（fatwa），也就是死刑。这本书从根本上说不是一本关于伊斯兰教的书，而是关于流亡的一种状态；关于在孟买与伦敦之间的印度航空公司420航线的中途一永久地。
en: The Satanic Verses (Rushdie 1988), the novel which earned its author a fatwa, or death penalty, from Shi'ite priests in Teheran, is not primarily a book about Islam.Rather, it is about the condition of exile; about being on Air India's Flight 420 halfway between Bombay and London – permanently.

zh: 在书中，拉什迪显示了流亡生活所带来的视角的转变如何引发怀疑和不确定感，因为流亡的人发现，当从不同的位置进行审视时，世界、历史和（最终）甚至真理都显得不同了。
en: In the book, Rushdie shows how the shift in perspective entailed by exile creates doubt and uncertainty, because the person in exile discovers that the world, the past and (ultimately) even the truth appear differently when viewed from different positions.

zh: 移民群体中的种族复兴可以从这个视角加以理解，利用乡愁和一种疏离感，这些复兴行动设法重新灌输一种对过去的延续感、本体论的安全感（Giddens 1990）和个体的安全感。
en: Ethnic revitalisation among migrant groups may be understood within this perspective.Drawing on nostalgia and a sense of alienation, such movements contrive to re-instil a sense of continuity with the past, ontological security (Giddens 1990) and personal security.

zh: 用功能主义的方法进行研究的主要代表人物是马克斯·格拉克曼（Max Gluckman 1963b）。
en: The functionalist approach is exemplified by Max Gluckman (1963b).

zh: 他说，流言蜚语是一个由文化决定并进行传递的过程，是一种社会事实，具有约定俗成的规则和重要的功能。
en: Gossip, Gluckman begins, is a culturally determined and sanctioned process, a social fact, with customary rules and with important functions.

zh: 值得注意的是，流言蜚语有助于维系群体的统一、道德和历史。
en: Notably, gossip helps maintain group unity, morality and history.

zh: 要是你探究特罗布里恩德岛民的事务，你就会发现……当地人对违背外婚制规則的观念的恐惧，他们相信疼痛、疾病、甚至死亡是氏族乱伦的必然结果。
en: If you were to inquire into the matter among the Trobrianders, you would find that ...the natives show horror at the idea of violating the rules of exogamy and that they believe that sores, diseases, even death might follow clan incest.

zh: [但是]从当地人的放荡不羁者的观点看，suvasova(违犯外婚制）确实是特有趣味的而且是痛快的性经验形式。
en: [But] from the viewpoint of the native libertine, suvasova (the breach of exogamy) is indeed a specially interesting and spicy form of erotic experience.

zh: 我的大部分知情人不仅承认而且确实夸耀自己犯了这一过错。
en: Most of my informants would not only admit but did actually boast about having committed this offense.

zh: 在有些社会，乱伦禁忌只在特殊情形下被禁止。
en: In some societies, the incest taboo is suspended under special circumstances.

zh: 例如，在埃及人和夏威夷人中，兄弟姐妹婚姻在皇族中是允许的，这显然是考虑到只有皇族足够有益于皇族。
en: Among the ancient Egyptians and the Hawaiians, for example, marriage of brothers to sisters was permitted among the royalty, apparently on the ground that only royalty were good enough for royalty.

zh: 神话中的神经常是被允许乱伦的，显然也是出于相似的原则考虑。
en: Too, the gods of mythology are often permitted incest, apparently owing to a similar principle.

zh: 简而言之，人类学家可以认为乱伦禁忌在人类社会中的存在具有普遍性，但是必须对其进行精细的定义。
en: In short, anthropologists can define the incest taboo as a human universal but only by careful definition.

zh: 哈金提出了一个很简单的论点：当前被视为“真理”的判断所依赖的是一个先于它发生的历史事件——一种关于真理和谬误的思考方式的出现。这种思考方式建立了考察一个命题所需的条件，即这一命题首先能够被视为真或伪。
en: Hacking puts forward what is basically a simple point: what is currently taken as "truth" is dependent on a prior historical event—the emergence of a style of thinking about truth and falsity that established the conditions for entertaining a proposition as being capable of being taken as true or false in the first place.

zh: 哈金这样写道:“通过论证，我想指出的不是逻辑，而恰恰是它的反面，因为，逻辑是真理的保存方式，而一种推理的风格则带来了或真或伪的可能性……推理风格创造出真和伪的可能性。演绎和归纳仅仅保存了这些可能性”（第56—57页）。
en: Hacking puts it this way: "By reasoning I don't mean logic. I mean the very opposite, for logic is the preservation of truth, while a style of reasoning is what brings in the possibility of truth or falsehood...styles of reasoning create the possibility of truth and falsehood. Deduction and induction merely preserve it" (56—57).

zh: 哈金并不“反对”逻辑本身，他反对的是逻辑宣称自己为一切真理得以建立的基础。
en: Hacking is not "against" logic, only against its claims to found and ground all truth.

zh: 逻辑在它自己的领域内是可靠的，但是这一领域却是有限的。
en: Logic is fine in its own domain, but that domain is a limited one.

zh: 一言以蔽之，世界上没有任何一个社区、国家或环境没有受到旅游业的某种程度的影响。
en: In a word, there is not a community, a country, an environment in the world which tourism does not affect in some degree.

zh: 有了国家政府的支持、跨国企业的推动，国家代理机构（比如世界旅游组织）的管理，加上越来越多的世界人口和每年2700亿英镑的营业额，估汁旅游业已经是世界上规模最大的国际工业。
en: Sponsored by national governments, promoted by multinational enterprises, regulated by international agencies (e.g.the World Tourism Organization), engaged in by more and more of the world's population, and with an annual turnover in excess of £270 billion, it is estimated that tourism is the world's largest international industry.

zh: 最近，旅游业已经被认为是人类学关注的主要概念之一。
en: Latterly, tourism has also been recognized as of major conceptual concern to anthropology.

zh: 特别是可溶性铝的增加，规模日趋增大。并且，人们还发现铝消费与老年性痴呆、阿兹海默症和帕金森综合征等疾病有关。
en: The increase of dissolved aluminum, in particular, is becoming truly massive, and aluminum consumption has been associated with senile dementia as well as Alzheimer and Parkinson diseases.

zh: 今天，这些疾病已成为美国主要的健康问题了。
en: Today, these rank as major health problems in the United States.

zh: 凡是出现严重分歧和尖锐对立的地方便不存在什么策略，因此博弈论的模式也就派不上用场。
en: Where there is radical dissensus there is no game, and hence no applicability for games-theory models.

zh: 一方正循规蹈矩地 “下棋”，而另一方却正按照“见者有份”的观念，大肆劫掠。
en: One side is playing chess, the other side is playing "for keeps."

zh: 因此我们必须透过策略和表面上的无序去探寻其内部的有序和连贯。
en: We must go deeper than games to find consistency and order in observed disorder.

zh: 一方面，我们可以对生产力生产关系进行马克思式的分析，马克思认为生产力和生产关系将卷人其中的人这一范畴联系在一起从而形成了一个极为精密复杂的结构。
en: On the one hand, we can go to the Marxist analysis of the precise structure of the productive forces and productive relations interlinking and separating the categories of human beings involved.

zh: 生活在热带区域的人们常让蜂蜜引路鸟（honey guide bird）引导他们寻找野生蜜蜂的巢穴，鸟儿反过来也受益于人类提炼蜂蜜的能力。
en: Human beings in tropical regions allow the honey guide bird to show them the way to wild bees' nests, and the bird in turn benefits from the human beings' ability to extract the honey.

zh: 一只被工作人员教会了美国手势语的大猩猩（Gardner等 1989)也会将其所学的知识传递给它的伙伴（Fouts等 1989)。
en: Chimpanzees have been taught American Sign Language (Gardner et al. 1989) and have then taught it to each other (Fouts et al. 1989).

zh: 我建议我们放弃任何声称文化是人类独一无二特性的企图，借此假装人类是“不同”的，并以这种方式将人类与其他动物截然分开。
en: I suggest that we abandon any attempt to claim culture as a uniquely human characteristic, and with it the pretence that human beings are "different" in a way that sets them significantly apart from the rest of the animal kingdom.

zh: 就任何物种都不同于其他物种而言，以自己的方式生存于世，并以自己特有的方式影响世界而言，人类是独特的。
en: Human beings are different in the sense that any species is different from the rest, in having its own way of living in the world and its own distinctive impact on the world.

zh: 它们还假定，学术体裁和文学体裁相互渗透，描述文化的写作真正是试验性和伦理性的。
en: They assume that academic and literary genres interpenetrate and that the writing of cultural descriptions is properly experimental and ethical.

zh: 它们把焦点放 在文本生产和修辞上，以便突出文化叙述的建构和人为的性质。
en: Their focus on text making and rhetoric serves to highlight the constructed, artificial nature of cultural accounts.

zh: 这种做法削弱了过度透明的权威模式，把注意力引向民族志的历史困境，亦即，民族志总是陷人发明文化而非再现文化的境地（Wagner 1975),这些文章所提问题的范围不属与任何传统意义上的文学，这一点将很快变得明显。
en: It undermines overly transparent modes of authority, and it draws attention to the historical predicament of ethnography, the fact that it is always caught up in the invention, not the representation, of cultures (Wagner 1975).As will soon be apparent, the range of issues raised is not literary in any traditional sense.

zh: 大部分的文章虽然焦点在文本实践.然而都抵达了文本之外的语境:权力、抵抗、制度限制以及创新的语境
en: Most of the essays, while focusing on textual practices, reach beyond texts to contexts of power, resistance, institutional constraint, and innovation.

zh: 现代描写语言学的长处之一是其方法的客观性。
en: One of the strengths of modern descriptive linguistics is the objectivity of its methods.

zh: 擅长这一方法的人类学家研究一门语言，不会抱有这种观念，即该语言必定有名词、动词、介词或在英语中可辨别的其他形式类。
en: A descriptive linguist does not approach a language with the idea that it must have nouns, verbs, prepositions, or any other of the form classes identifiable in English.

zh: 相反，他或她看到在该语言中出现的东西，而且试图根据它自己的内在作用把它描写出来。
en: The linguist instead sees what turns up in the language and makes an attempt to describe it in terms of its own inner workings.

zh: 为方便起见，把近似于英语名词和动词表现的词素称为名词和动词，但如果有人认为那种名称会引起误解，那么它们就可能被称为 “x-词”和“y-词”，或“A形式类”和“B形式类”。
en: For convenience, morphemes that behave approximately like English nouns and verbs may be labeled as such, but if the terms would be misleading, the linguist instead might call them "x-words", and "y-words", or "form class A" and "form class B".

zh: 但是撇开受到强调的因素不谈，所有的亲属称谓都完成了两项重要的任务。
en: But regardless of the factors emphasized, all kinship terminologies accomplish two important tasks.

zh: 首先，它们把相类似的人分到同一个具体的范畴之下；第二，它们把不同类的人分到截然不同的范畴之下。
en: First, they classify similar kinds of persons into specific categories; second, they separate different kinds of persons into distinct categories.

zh: 一般而言，两个或更多的具有相似地位的亲属共用一个称谓，而这个称谓就突出了这些相似性。
en: Generally, two or more kin are merged under the same term when the individuals share similar status, which then emphasizes these similarities.

zh: 运用上面提到的原则,就形成了六种不同的亲属称谓制度：爱斯基摩制、夏威夷制、员洛魁制、克劳制、奥马哈制以及苏丹制或者描述制，六种亲属制度中的每一种制度都根据堂表兄弟姐妹的归类方式来辨别。
en: Six different systems of kinship terminology result from the application of the principles mentioned: the Eskimo, Hawaiian, Iroquois, Crow, Omaha, and Sudanese or descriptive systems, each identified according to the way cousins are classified.

zh: 灭绝是这样一种现象：一种文化的大部分承担者都死了，而那些幸存者变成了难民，生活在有着其他文化的民族中间。
en: Extinction is the phenomenon whereby so many carriers of a culture die that those who survive become refugees living among peoples of other cultures.

zh: 此类例子可以在今天世界上的很多地方看到（参见图15.4）；最近的例子应该是在南美洲的很多地方和巴西的亚马逊盆地。
en: Examples of this may be seen in many parts of the world today; the closest examples are found in many parts of South America, again as in Brazil's Amazon basin.

zh: 一个有详细记载的案例发生在1968年，一批杀手受雇去消灭几个印第安人族群，其中包括辛塔拉加族。
en: One particularly well-documented case occurred in 1968, when hired killers tried to wipe out several Indian groups, including the Cinta-Larga.

zh: 为了完成这项任务，他们从轻型飞机上撒下砒霜，扔下炸药，并用机关枪扫射；至于辛塔拉加人，杀手们选在他们举行一个重要的本族仪式的时候下手去袭击一个村子，因为这个村子被他们视为发展的一个障碍。
en: For this they used arsenic, dynamite, and machine guns from light planes; in the case of the Cinta-Largas, the killers chose a time when an important native ceremony was taking place to attack a village seen as an obstacle to development.

zh: 人类学的研究范围非常浩大。
en: The scope of anthropology is vast.

zh: 它会考虑文明的“发源地”、伟大的历史文明和当代生活，当然，其他领域也会考虑这些主题。
en: It treats the "cradles" of civilization, the great historic civilizations, and contemporary life, sharing, of course, these topics with other fields.

zh: 但是，人类学最独具特色的关注焦点是在这样一类群体身上，即那些默默无闻和快要绝种的群体、异国他乡的群体和小的群体。
en: But the most distinctive focus of anthropology is on a kind of group that at first glance seems to relegate the field to obscurity and eventual extinction: the exotic and the small.

zh: 人类学想要了解最基本的人类共同体的本质。
en: Anthropology seeks to know the nature of the elementary human community.

zh: 我们首先来看一下俗民社区。
en: We shall first try to discover the category, folk community, in folklore.

zh: 例如，亚芙尼亚人的写作吸收了与诡术家（trickster）形象联系在一起的哲学的、神话的和纯粹诙谐的一个悠久的传统。
en: For instance, Amerindian writing draws on a long tradition of philosophical, mythic, and simply humorous engagement with trickster figures.

zh: 黑人自传写作也有一个久已确立的传统，可以追溯到被带到美洲的西非穆斯林（及其他）奴隶的叙述。更直接地，在现代时期，黑人自传促进了二战后黑人民权运动的核心发展。
en: Black autobiographical writing is also a long-established tradition.One can trace it back to the slave narratives of Muslim West Africans (and others) brought to America, and, more immediately in the modern period, black autobiographies contributed to the core development of the post—World War II civil rights movement.

zh: 没有拉尔夫˙艾利森的《看不见的人（Ellison 1952）、克劳德˙布朗的《曼切尔德在希望之乡》（Brown 1965）、马娅˙安热卢的《我知道笼中鸟为何唱歌》（Angelou 1969）、《马尔克姆˙X自传》（Malcolm X，with Alex Haley，1973)，以及埃尔德里奇˙克利弗的《冰上的灵魂》（Cleaver 1968），黑人民权运动是难以想象的。
en: That inovemenl is hard 10 conceive of without thinking of Ralph Ellison's Invisible Man (1952), Claude Brown's Manchila in the Promised Land (1965), Maya Angelou's I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings (1969), The Autobiography of Malcolm X (with Alex Haley, 1973), Eldridge Cleaver's Soul on Ice (1968).Chinese-American (like Mexican-American) writing has generated class-linked differential reactions.

zh: 尽管通观人类的大部分历史，人们依赖神话和民间传说来问答这些问题，而不是系统地检验通过仔细观察获得的数据。
en: Throughout most of their history, though, people relied on myth and folklore for their answers to these questions, rather than the systematic testing of data obtained through careful observation.

zh: 在过去200年里，作为回答这些问题的科学研究的人类学已经产生。简单说来，人类学（Anthropology）是研究任何地方、任何时代人类的学科。
en: Anthropology, over the past 200 years, has emerged as a scientific approach to answering these questions.Simply stated, anthropology is the study of humankind in all places and throughout time.

zh: 人类学家主要感兴趣的是单个物种——智人——人类及其祖先和近亲。
en: The anthropologist is concerned primarily with a single species—Homo sapiens—the human species, its ancestors, and its near relatives.

zh: 因为人类学家是被研究的人类的成员，他们难于维持对其研究对象的不偏不倚的态度。
en: Because anthropologists are members of the species they study, it is difficult for them to maintain a scientific detachment toward those they study.

zh: 我其余的问题都以一种或另外一种方式与民族主义或民主联系在一起。
en: My remaining questions all relate in one way or another to the issue of nationalism and democracy.

zh: 这两种思想之间关系的密切程度超过了国际主义民主人士（我应该把自己计算在这个类别中）所感觉到的舒适程度， 这一点长时间地打动着我。
en: It has long struck me that the connection between these two ideas is closer than most internationalist democrats (a category in which I should like to count myself) feel comfortable with.

zh: 不是所有的民族主义者都是民主主义者，也不是所有的民族-国家（nation-state）都是民主治理的。
en: Not that all nationalists are democrats or all nation-states are democratically governed.

zh: 20世纪60年代，认知人类学的支持者继承了他的传统，即关注现代西方科学和他们所研究的本土的世界观之间的关系。
en: In the 1960s proponents of cognitive anthropology took up Whorf’s concern of the relation between modern, Western science and the indigenous worldviews they studied.

zh: 这些支持者把自己的研究领域称之为“民族科学（ethnoscience)。
en: They called their field ‘ethnoscience’.

zh: 这个术语没有明确指出其与“认知人类学”（当时的一些人也确实这样看这一学科）、“成分分析”（保留了其主要的方法）或是“新田野民族志” (the new ethnography, 20世纪60年代杜撰的词，用来区分刘易斯，宾福德的“新考古学”）的不同。
en: That term did not always designate anything at all different from ‘cognitive anthropology’ (which was how some still saw their enterprise), from ‘componential analysis’ (which remained their main methodology), or from ‘the new ethnography’ (a catchword coined in the 1960s to make the comparison between their work and ‘the new archaeology’ of Lewis Binford).

zh: 这种观点的一致性仍然没有改变。
en: So far the consensus holds.

zh: 但是有一点学者们是真正存在分歧的。
en: But there is one quite serious point on which scholars do genuinely disagree.

zh: 几乎所有的民族主义者(nationalists)都将他们本民族认同(national identity)的起源追溯到近代以前的时代。
en: Almost all nationalists trace the origins of their own national identity far back into the pre-modern era.

zh: 问题是他们这样做对吗？
en: The question is, are they right to do so?

zh: 例如，人类学家可以转向考古学的或历史的资料以检验有关文化变迁的假说。
被认为因为某种特殊条件引起的文化特质，考古学可以通过研究这种条件过去事实上发生的处境对其加以检验。
en: Cultural characteristics thought to be caused by certain specified conditions can be tested archaeo-logically by investigating situations where such conditions actually occurred.

zh: 民族史学（Ethnohistory）是一种历史民族志，通过口述历史，探险者、传教士和商人的描述，以及通过对地名、生死记录和其他档案材料的分析来研究最近的文化民族史学的文化分析——就如考古学——对理解变迁来说是有价值的研究方式。
en: Also useful are data the ethnohistorian provides.Ethnohistory is a kind of historic ethnography that studies cultures of the recent past through oral histories; through the accounts of explorers, missionaries, and traders; and through the analysis of data such as land titles, birth and death records, and other archival materials.The ethnohistorical analysis of cultures, like archaeology，is a valuable approach to understanding change.

zh: 通过考察被认为是引起某些现象的条件，我们可以发现这些条件是否真正先于那些现象。
en: By examining the conditions be¬lieved to have caused certain phenomena, we can discover whether or not those conditions truly precede those phenomena.

zh: 这一领域的理论启发，主要来自弗洛伊德的精神分析心理学和精神病学。
en: The theoretical inspiration for this field came mainly from the psychoanalytical psychology and psychiatry of Sigmund Freud.

zh: 弗洛伊德主义重点关注儿童时期的经历，将其作为成年人个性的一个决定因素，文化和人格研究遵循这一重点集中关注儿童抚养，即将文化价值和心理性格灌输给个体的方式。
en: Following the Freudian emphasis on childhood experience as a Substance determinant of the adult personality, the culture and personality studies focused especially on child rearing – the way it transmits cultural values and psychological dispositions to the individual.

zh: 例如，俄国的包裹婴儿习惯，被看做是倾向于对极端情绪作出反应的一种民族性格。
en: The Russian habit of swaddling, for example, was seen as reflecting and encouraging a national character prone to extremes of emotion.

zh: 在传统上，人类学被划分为四个领域：体质人类学和三个文化人类学分支学科:考古学、语言人类学和民族学。
en: Anthropology is traditionally divided into four fields: physical anthropology and the three branches of cultural anthropology, which are archaeology, linguistic anthropology, and ethnology.

zh: 体质人类学（Physical Anthropology)主要研究作为生物有机体的人，而文化人类学（Cultural Anthropology）研究作为文化创造者的人类。
en: Physical anthropology is concerned primarily with humans as biological organisms, while cultural anthropology deals with humans as cultural animals.

zh: 当然，二者是相互联系的。我们若不知道人类是如何创生的，我们就 不能理解人是如何思考和行动的。
en: Both, of course, are closely related; we cannot understand what people do unless we know what people are.

zh: 我们想要了解生物特性焉如何影响文化，文化又是如何影响生物特性的。
en: And we want to know how biology does and does not influence culture, as well as how culture affects biology.

zh: 在欧洲大陆，虽然现在用“社会人类学”做为“民族学”的同义词正在迅速普及，但“人类学”一词仍然常表示“体质人类学”。
en: In continental Europe, the word ‘anthropology’ often still tends to carry the meaning ‘physical anthropology’, though there too ‘social anthropology’ is now rapidly gaining ground as a synonym for ‘ethnology’.

zh: 的确，目前欧洲最主要的专业组织叫做“社会人类学家欧洲协会”（European Association of Social Anthropologists或l’Association Europe ́enne des Anthropologues Sociaux）,该组织成立于1989年，这个时期是该 学科在整个欧洲包括西欧和东欧迅速发展的时间。
en: Indeed, the main professional organization in Europe is called the European Association of Social Anthropologists or l’Association Europe ́enne des Anthropologues Sociaux.It was founded in 1989 amidst a rapid growth of the discipline across Europe, both Western and Eastern.

zh: 在美国，“民族学”一词与“文化人类学”并存。
en: In the United States, the word ‘ethnology’ co-exists with ‘cultural anthropology’.

zh: 体质人类学家研究作为生物有机体的人，追溯人类动物的演化发展，考察过去和现在人类内部的生物学变异。
en: Physical anthropologists study humans as biological organisms, tracing the evolutionary development of the human animal and looking at biological variations within the species, past and present.

zh: 文化人类学对人类文化惑兴趣，或者对社会的生活方式感兴趣。
en: Cultural anthropologists are concerned with human cultures, or the ways of life in societies.

zh: 在文化人类学领域有考古学家、语言学家和民族学家。考古学家通常从过去的文化出发研究物质对象，试图以此解释人类行为：语言学家研究语言，文化借助语言得以维持并代代相传；民族学家研究已观察到、体验到的文化，与他们想要了解其文化的那些人进行讨论。
en: Within the field of cultural anthropology are archaeologists, who seek to explain human behavior by studying material objects, usually from past cultures; linguists, who study languages, by which cultures are maintained and passed on to succeeding generations; and ethnologists, who study cultures as they have been observed, experienced, and discussed with persons whose culture they seek to understand.

zh: 对特定文化环境中音乐的研究，开始于19世纪对民歌的搜集，如今它已经发展成一个专门的领域，叫作民族音乐学（ethnomusicology）。
en: The study of music in specific cultural settings, beginning in the 19th century with the collection of folk songs, has developed into a specialized field, called ethnomusicology.

zh: 就像力了民俗本身而进行的研究一样，民族音乐学与人类学既有联系，又独立于人类学。
en: Like the study of folktales for their own sake, ethnomusicology is both related to and somewhat independent of anthropology.

zh: 不过，从该领域所关注的各种问题当中抽出几个一般人类学感兴趣的概念，还是可能的。
en: Nevertheless, it is possible to sort out several concepts of interest to general anthropology from the fields various concerns.

zh: 首先，我们要问：一种文化怎么看待音乐？
en: To begin, we may ask these questions： How does a culture conceive of music?

zh: 把音乐和其他表现形式区分开来的最重要的东西是什么？
en: What is considered of primary importance when distinguishing music from other modes of expression?

zh: 对一个人来说是音乐的东西，对另一个人来说只是噪音而已。
en: What is music to one person is mere noise to another.

zh: 音乐是一种交流的形式，其中包含着非言词成分。音乐传达的信息往往是抽象情结而非具体观念，不同的倾听者会以不同的方式体会它。
en: Music is a form of communication that includes a nonverbal component.The information transmitted is often abstract emotion rather than concrete ideas, and it is experienced in a variety of ways by different listeners.

zh: 此外，人们选择词语和句子以便传达意义，而在一种文化中有意义的东西，在另一种文化中可能没有意义。
en: Moreover, people choose words and sentences to communicate meaning, and what is meaningful in one culture may not be in another.

zh: 事实上，我们的语言用法影响我们文化的其他部分，而文化的其他部分也影响我们的语言用法。
en: In other words, our use of language affects, and is affected by, the rest of our culture.

zh: 关于语言与文化其他方面相互关系的全部问题是民族语言学（ethnolinguistics)研究的领域，这是语言人类学中的一个专业，几乎已成为独立的研究领域。
en: The whole question of the relationships between language and other aspects of culture is the province of ethnolinguistics, an outgrowth of both ethnology and descriptive linguistics, which has become almost a separate field of inquir.

zh: 民族语言学注重研究与社会、文化和人类行为有关的语言结构和用法的每一方面。
en: Ethno-linguistics is concerned with every aspect of the structure and use of language that has anything to do with society, culture, and human behavior.

zh: 就人类学的大部分历史来说，人类学家依靠印刷出版的资源以共享信息，特别是依靠白描型的民族志，偶尔辅之以照片，在很少的情况中，辅之以影片和类似的记录。
en: For most of the discipline's history, anthropologists have relied upon print resources to share information, especially the very linear genre of ethnography, occasionally supplemented with photographs and, in fewer cases, film and analog recordings.

zh: 民族志特别反映出西方人对学术工作的态度是我们学科的基础。
en: The ethnography in particular reflects our discipline's roots in the Western approach to scholarly work.

zh: 然而，人类学家研究并与之共事的许多民族，具有他们所依靠的不同的“读写能力”。
en: However, many of the people anthropologists have studied and worked with have different literacies that they draw upon.

zh: 的确，文化人类学家研究各式各样的人类行为，包括音乐、口述故事、仪式 舞蹈、编织和粗糙雕刻等。
en: Indeed, cultural anthropologists work with numerous guises of human behavior, ranging from music to oral narrative, ritual dance, weaving, and spray-paint grafitti.

zh: 人类学在所有研究的最自然的“多媒体”中是可论证的。
en: Anthropology is arguably among the most naturally "multimedia" of all studies.

zh: 民族志记录的是民族，如同彼得·梅森（Mason 1990: 13）命名的那样“是种翻译和演绎的形式”。
en: Ethnography is the recording of an ethnos, and, as Peter Mason phrases it (1990:13), ‘a form of translation and reduction’.

zh: 他接着说（Mason 1990: 13）：“所有的民族志，都是对遭遇他者的经历的记录，是一项使他者丧失独特性的举动”。
en: ‘All ethnography’, he goes on to say (ibid.), ‘is an experience of the confrontation with Other set down in writing, an act by which that Other is deprived of its specificity’.

zh: 他谈到这种写作受到特定风格和文化传统的限制，必须满足某种期望。
en: He notes that such writing conforms to particular stylistic and literary conventions.It must meet certain expectations.

zh: 尽管在日前的人类学工作中历史角度变得更加重要，特别是 1980年代以来，大多数人类学研究仍然可以被描述为不考虑历史演进的“快照”。
en: Although the historical dimension has become more important in recent anthropological work, particularly since the 1980s, a majority of anthropological studies could probably still be described as synchronic "snapshots".

zh: 我们可以使用术语“民族志的现在时”去描述相关文献的时态特征。
en: We may use the term "the ethnographic present" to characterise the literary tense involved.

zh: 在某种意义上说，探究努尔人、特罗布里恩德岛民或斯瓦特的帕坦人是“在什么时候”像专论中描述的那样，建立某种文化或制定某种形式的社会组织，这是不相关的问题。
en: In a certain sense, it can be irrelevant when the Nuer, the Trobriand islanders or the Swat Pathans enact a certain culture or form of social organisation as described in a monograph.

zh: 对这些人民的研究的重要性主要地并不在于他们的历史的或地理的解释力量，而是在于他们帮助我们从最广泛的意义上去理解社会生活的差异之处和共同之处，他们帮助我们了解人类生活形式的比较性知识。
en: The importance of the studies of these peoples does not lie primarily in their historical or genealogical explanatory power, but rather in their contribution to our understanding of differences and similarities of social life in the widest sense.They contribute to our comparative knowledge of forms of human life.

zh: 这在我们的研究所所处的东中欧比在别的什么地方都更明显。
en: This is nowhere more evident than in East-Central Europe, where our institute is located.

zh: 德国学者在18世纪发展出开拓性的研究议程，创造了众多的关键术语，此后很久一个统一的德国国家才形成。
en: German scholars developed pioneering research agendas and coined numerous key terms in the eighteenth century, long before the forging of a unified German state.

zh: 在这里，就像在欧洲的其他地方一样，人类学的领域一直都被打上了民族主义的鲜明烙印，即使是在其人类学的遗产后来被苏联马克思主义理论的锲入所改变的那些地方，其连续性也仍然是实质性的这些演讲首要关注的是关于民族学心（而非民俗学即关于自己的人民的研究）的比较研究事业的四个变体，但是我们必须承认，民族框架几乎从一开始就一直影响着人类学的这两个发展路向。
en: Here, as elsewhere in Europe, the anthropological field has been strongly marked by nationalism.Even where this legacy was later modified by the imposition of Soviet Marxist theories, the continuities remain substantial.These lectures are primarily devoted to four variants of the comparative enterprise of Völkerkunde rather than to Volkskunde, the study of one’s own people, but we need to recognize that national frames have influenced both of these strands of anthropology almost from the very beginning.

zh: 我们以英语中 " uncle"  一词的亲属类别为例。
en: Using English as our example, take the class of kin which English-speakers call uncle.

zh: 这里的名称就是" uncle" 一词本身。
en: The designatum here is the word uncle itself.

zh: 所指对象是家族谱系中所提及的如下各点（即父亲的兄弟、母亲的兄弟、父亲姐妹的丈夫、母亲姐妹的丈等）。
en: The denotata are genealogical points of reference FB, MB, FZH, MZH, and so on (that is, father’s brother, mother’s brother, father’s sister’s hus- band, and mother’s sister’s husband; denotata are customarily abbreviated in this way).

zh: 所以个体发现他们自己“在讲话时”依据的是无意识预设的语言代码和知识实践。
en: Thus do individuals find themselves "being spoken" by unconscious, preconditioned linguistic codes and knowledge-practices.

zh: 个体远不是在利用话语手段去达到全新的甚至有意图的目的，不过是在进行“没有新意和目的的模仿”（Kearney 1988: 6）事实上，要不是话语所提供的主体地位，人的意识将不复存在。
en: Far from speakers' employing discursive measures for the effecting of original or even intentioned ends, here is "mimesis without origin or end" (Kearney 1988:6).Indeed, were it not for the subject-positions which discourses offer, human consciousnesses would not exist as human as such.

zh: 话语造就了我们成为人的资格。
en: Discourses create our humanity.

zh: 但弗雷泽的确对巫术的两大基本原则做出有价值的区分。
en: Frazer did make a useful distinction between two fundamental principles of magic.

zh: 第一条原则，“同类相生”他称之为“模拟巫术”(imitative magic)(有时也叫交感巫术）。
en: The first principle, that wlike produces like, he called imitative magic.

zh: 例如，在缅甸，一个被拒绝的情人可能会请一名巫师做一个他所爱之人的人偶。
en: In Burma, for example, a rejected lover might engage a sorcerer to make an image of his would-be love.

zh: 要是这个人偶被抛入水里，随后施以某些符咒，那么这个不幸的女孩就会发疯。
en: If this image were tossed into water, to the accompaniment of certain charms, the hapless girl would go mad.

zh: 这样，这个女孩将会遭受与她的人偶相似的命运。
en: Thus, the girl would suffer a fate similar to that of her image.

zh: 弗雷泽的第二条原则被称为“接触巫术”（contagious magic），它指这样一种观念，即事物或人之间一旦发生接触就能彼此影响，即使此后不再接触。
en: Frazer's second principle was called contagious magic—the concept that things or persons once in contact can afterward influence one another.

zh: 另一种观点认为，本族语言使用者认为最能表达出词的意思的（当然在形式上也是正确的）分析，才是最好的分析。
en: There is a place for the alternative view that the best is precisely the one which is most meaningful to the native speaker (while also being formally correct, of course).

zh: 如果他们反对这种分析方法，那么这一方法就是错误的。
en: If native speakers disagree about which one this may be, then so be it.

zh: 这个问题的争论被称为“上帝真理与魔法的大对局”。“上帝真理”主张人们探究认知现实，而“魔法”对这种探知的可行性持怀疑态度。
en: The debate which ensued on this issue is called that of ‘God’s truth versus hocus-pocus’, with the ‘God’s truth’ side favouring the search for cognitive reality and the ‘hocus-pocus’ side maintaining a scepticism of this very possibility.

zh: 尽管世界上的大多数民族都被人类学家归类为父系的，许多群体——特别是在美拉尼西亚、非洲和北美——被归类为母方世系。
en: Although most peoples in the world are classified by anthropologists as either patrilineal or cognatic, many groups, particularly in Melanesia, Africa and North America, are classified as matrilineal.

zh: 一个常见的误解是：母系家族关系系统只是父系系统的一种简单颠倒，用女人代替男人。
en: It is a common misunderstanding that matrilineal kinship systems are simply inversions of patrilineal ones, where women have taken the place of men.

zh: 有些人甚至认为，母方世系与母权制是一回事，这是错误的。
en: Some may even believe that matrilineality is the same as matriarchy.This is wrong.

zh: 在母系社会，正如在父系社会，男人通常担任了正式的政治职务并控制了重要的经济资源。
en: In matrilineal societies, just as in patrilineal ones, men usually hold formal political offices and control important economic resources.

zh: 这意味着母系系统比父系系统更加复杂。
en: This implies that matrilineal systems tend to be more complicated than patrilineal ones.

zh: 图7.2说明了简化的父系系统和简化的母系系统。
en: In Figure 7.2 above, the difference between a simplified patrilineal and a simplified matrilineal system is illustrated.

zh: 从生物学上说，亲属关系在图表的两边是完全相同的；而实际上，我们看到，A群体与B群体各自所属的家族群体的组成方式十分不同。
en: Biologically, the kin relations are identical on both sides of the diagram; in practice, however, we see that person A belongs to a kin group composed in a very different way from person B's group.

zh: 因此，在1968年学生反抗活动之中以及之后，具有反叛性的人类学学生幵始研究并质问他们的教授们在纳粹时期都干了些什么——这并不是偶然的。西柏林是学生反抗运动的主要中心，而海德堡则是另外几个重要的中心地区之一，人类学的情况也是如此。
en: It was thus no coincidence that during the student revolt of 1968 and thereafter rebellious students of anthropology researched and asked questions about what their professors had been doing under Nazism.West Berlin was the main center of the students' revolt, but Heidelberg was one of its other important focal areas, and this was certainly so in anthropology.

zh: 在1968年，海德堡的人类学教授是威廉˙埃米尔˙米尔曼，当反抗的学生指控他曾经是纳粹主义的一名积极同谋者的时候，米尔曼选择了辞职并退休。
en: In 1968 the anthropology professor at Heidelberg was Wilhelm Emil Mühlmann.When revolting students accused him of having been an active accomplice of Nazism, Mühlmann chose resignation from office and went into retirement.

zh: 例如，历史语言学家试图通过研究原来语言的自然变化和来自北方的入侵者接触所产生的影响这两方面，来辨别和说明从中世纪早期的口语拉丁语向中世纪晚期的法语和西班牙语的发展。
en: Historical linguists, for example, attempt to identify and explain the development of early medieval spoken Latin into later medieval French and Spanish by investigating both natural change in the original language and the influence of contacts with invaders from the north.

zh: 在历史语言学家和描述语言学家之间没有什么冲突，人们现在认为两种研究方式是相互依存的。
en: No conflicts exist between historical and descriptive linguists; the two approaches are recognized as interdependent.

zh: 甚至现代语言也是不断变化的；例如，考虑一下英语中一词的变化了的意思。今天，它用来指男同性恋者和女同性恋者。
en: Even a modern language is constantly changing; consider, for example, the changed meaning of the word gay in English, which today is used to refer to homosexual persons.

zh: 它在1942年的戏剧《我们的心情洋溢着青春活力和欢乐》中的意思，说明这一词在现在和那时有不同的用法。
en: Its meaning in the title of the 1942 play Our Hearts Were Young and Gay illustrates the word different usage as recently as that time.

zh: 这类变化发生所依据的原则，只能由历史来确立。
en: Such changes occur according to principles that can be established only historically.

zh: 然而，变革论只在 20 世纪 80 年代才以其自己的能力作为一种范式出现，在这之前曾经是进化论和反进化论（在此意义上，它将瞬间变化置于缓慢进化之上）（比如 Cucchiari 1981) 。
en: Yet it emerged as a paradigm in its own right – at once evolutionist and anti-evolutionist (in the sense that it puts instantaneous change over slow evolution) – only in the 1980s (e.g., Cucchiari 1981).

zh: 今天它的主要特色是研究象征文化的起源，或文化起源 ( culturo - genesis ) 。
en: Its central feature today is the search for the origin of symbolic culture, or culturo-genesis.

zh: 通过给予对女性的第一次人类革命的煽动性力量，转向弗洛伊德的男性中心理论。
en: It turns Freud on his androcentric head by giving the instigating force of that Wrst human revolution to the females of the species.

zh: 这种变化的主要原因之一，可能是灵长动物的栖树生存。
en: One of the main reasons for this change is probably the primates' arboreal existence.

zh: 在树上生活的动物要不断活动并对环境做出反应。
en: An animal living in the trees is constantly acting and reacting to the environment.

zh: 来自手和脚、眼和耳，以及平衡、运动、热、触和痛的 感觉器官的信息，同时传递到脑皮层。
en: Messages from the hands, feet, eyes, and ears, as well as from the sensors of balance, movement, heat, touch, and pain, are simultaneously relayed to the cortex.

zh: 显然，脑皮层必须有相当大的发展，以便搜集、分析并协调这些印象，并把恰当的反应沿运动神经传回原来的感受器。
en: Obviously the cortex had to develop considerably to receive, analyze, and coordinate these impressions and transmit the appropriate responses back down the motor nerves to the proper receptors.

zh: 增大的脑皮层不仅使得灵长目动物更为有效地进行日常生存斗争，而且也为强化的大脑活动功能或者思维能力排除障碍,这种思维能力在人类产生中起了决定性的作用。
en: The enlarged cortex not only made the primates more efficient in the daily struggle for survival but also prepared the way for heightened cerebration, or thought—an ability that played a decisive role in humanity's emergence.

zh: 不管乱伦禁忌是由什么引起的，考察它对社会结构的影响，我们可以看到它的效用。
en: Whatever its cause, the utility of the incest taboo can be seen by examining its effects on social structure.

zh: 与反对乱伦密切相关是反对内婚制（endogamy），即在特定的个人（譬如堂 兄弟姐妹和堂表姐妹夫或堂表嫂或弟媳等）的群体内婚配的规则。
en: Closely related to prohibitions against incest are rules against endogamy, or marriage within a particular group of individuals (cousins and inlaws, for example).

zh: 如果该群体只被定义为直系家庭，那么社会一般禁止或至少劝阻内婚制，因而鼓励外婚制(exogamy)，即在该群体之外的婚配。
en: If the group is defined as one's immediate family alone, then societies generally prohibit or at least discourage endogamy and practice or at least encourage exogamy, or marriage outside the group.Yet a society that practices exogamy at one level may practice endogamy at another.
Among the Trobriand Islanders, for example, each individual has to marry outside of his or her own clan and lineage (exogamy).

zh: 个体构建并运用形式以便赋予它们多样化的个人意义；使它们在他们自己的生活中具有独特意义：他们的意图、兴趣、希望、需求、信仰、价值观念等等。
en: Individuals make and use forms so as to fill them with a diversity of personal meanings; they give them sense and significance particular to their own lives: their purposes, interests, desires, needs, beliefs, values, and so on.

zh: 这些构成了他们的形式的内容。
en: It is this which makes up the content of their forms.

zh: 而且，正是这种个体运用导致了他们在集体意义上的交换；个体不断地为社会生活带来文化形式，不断地构建社会并分享文化，为的是表达他们的个体意义。
en: Moreover, it is this individual usage which causes their collective exchange; individuals continue to bring cultural forms to social life, continue to make society and share culture, for the purpose of expressing their individual meanings.

zh: “内省癖”，是英国维多利亚女王时代的心理学家对探索内在动机的看法。
en: "Morbid introspection" was the British Victorian psychologists' view of exploring inner motives.
Just stiffen the upper lip and carry on!

zh: 与我居住的美国大学城的电话号码簿上列出的名单相比，英国牛津的电话号码簿上只列出了一小部分精神病医生和心理学家的名字，即使牛津要远远大于我所住的大学城。
en: The telephone directory of Oxford, England, lists only a fraction of the number of psychiatrists and psychologists listed in the American university town where I live, even though Oxford is much larger.

zh: 这一区别无疑反映出美国的心理学化，但是英美文化也有一个共同之处，即都注重控制激情。
en: This difference doubtless reflects the psychologizing of America, but Anglo-American culture shares the emphasis on controlling passions.

zh: 将阐释的方法应用于非洲南部的岩石艺术，要求具备两种知识：布须曼人的民族志和出神的性质。
en: Applying the interpretive approach to southern African rock art requires knowledge of two subjects: Bushman ethnography and the nature of trance.

zh: 就后者而言，要对它有一个清晰的理解，需要把民族志的资料和从实验室实验得来的资料结合起来。
en: With respect to the latter, a clear understanding comes from a combination of ethnographic data and data gained experimentally in laboratories.

zh: 因为所有的人都有着相同的神经系统，不管是来自美国的城市居民，还是来自非洲南部的寻食者，抑或是来自亚马逊森林的园艺农业人口，不管是谁，他们进入出神状态的过程都要经历三个相同的阶段。
en: Because all human beings have essentially the same nervous system, whether they are urban dwellers from the United States, food foragers from southern Africa, horticulturalists from the Amazon forest, or whoever, they all progress through the same three stages when going into trance.

zh: 在第一个阶段，神经系统产生出各种各样闪闪发光的、有规律跳动的、旋转的和不断 变换的几何图案，即所谓的内视现象（eiitoptic phenomena）（那些得过偏头痛的人其症状就类似于此）。
en: In the first stage, the nervous system generates a variety of luminous, pulsating, revolving, and constantly shifting geometric patterns known as entoptic phenomena (anyone who has suffered from migraine headaches is familiar with these).

zh: 能动在行动，而能动性即是这种能力、权力，正是其成为行动的来源和始作俑者，能动者是行动的主体。
en: Agents act, and agency is the capability, the power, to be the source and originator of acts; agents are the subjects of action.

zh: 韦伯（Weber）认为应区分行动与纯粹（动物）行为，行动是建立在一系列具有人类理性特点的行为基础上的。
en: Weber suggested thatacts be distinguished from mere (animal) behaviour on the basis of acts being seen to entail a number of features of human rationality: consciousness, reflection, intention, purpose and meaning.

zh: 他感到社会科学是一门对人类行动的意义和行动背后的选择进行解释性研究的学科。
en: He felt that social science should be an interpretive study of the meanings of human action and the choices behind them.

zh: 米德（C.H. Mead）力图澄清韦伯关于意义的概念以及对意义的社会科学理解（Verstehung），他将行动划分为：欲望、情境界定和完成。
en: G.H.Mead sought to clarify the Weberian notion of meaning, and its social-scientific understanding (Verstehung), by differentiating acts into: impulses, definitions of situations, and consummations.

zh: 能动在行动，而能动性即是这种能力、权力，正是其成为行动的来源和始作俑者，能动者是行动的主体。
en: Agents act, and agency is the capability, the power, to be the source and originator of acts; agents are the subjects of action.

zh: 韦伯（Weber）认为应区分行动与纯粹（动物）行为，行动是建立在一系列具有人类理性特点的行为基础上的。
en: Weber suggested thatacts be distinguished from mere (animal) behaviour on the basis of acts being seen to entail a number of features of human rationality: consciousness, reflection, intention, purpose and meaning.

zh: 他感到社会科学是一门对人类行动的意义和行动背后的选择进行解释性研究的学科。
en: He felt that social science should be an interpretive study of the meanings of human action and the choices behind them.

zh: 米德（C.H. Mead）力图澄清韦伯关于意义的概念以及对意义的社会科学理解（Verstehung），他将行动划分为：欲望、情境界定和完成。
en: G.H.Mead sought to clarify the Weberian notion of meaning, and its social-scientific understanding (Verstehung), by differentiating acts into: impulses, definitions of situations, and consummations.

zh: 但是，拟人论的阴魂不散。
en: But anthropomorphism dies hard.

zh: 当人们错将拟人论当成最为稳妥的现实主义时，就象那些认为个人，即男人和女人，才在真正地参加选举，修饰仪容，制造船舶，发明机械、撰写诗篇和奏演乐章的人们所做的那样，拟人论的垂死过程就犹为缓慢与困难。
en: The death is especially slow and difficult when anthropomorphism is mistaken for the soundest realism, as it is by those who actually see people, individual men and women, voting, enameling their fingernails, building ships, inventing machines, writing sonnets, composing symphonies, etc.

zh: 他们问道，“新的文化要素除了来自个人精神，来自男人、女人和儿童头脑中的创造性活动，还能来自何方呢？”
en: "Where else," they ask, "could new cultural elements come from but from the creative act of some individual human mind— from a man, woman, or child?"

zh: 依据年龄有成员资格的有组织的一类人，叫作年龄等级(age grade)。
en: An organized class of people with membership based on age is known as an age grade.

zh: 从理论上来说，年龄等级的成员资格应是自动满足的：一个人达到了合适的年龄，因而就毫无疑问地被纳入特定的年龄等级。例如，在我们马上就要考察的东非蒂里基人中就是这种情况。
en: Theoretically speaking, membership in an age grade ought to be automatic: One reaches the appropriate age and thus is included, without question, in the particular age grade.Just such situations exist, for example, among the East African Tiriki, whose system we will examine shortly.

zh: 然而，有时候，个体必须要通过购买才能加入他们有资格进入的那个年龄等级。
en: Sometimes, though, individuals have to buy their way into the age grade they are eligible for.

zh: 在北美平原的某些印第安人中间就是这样，他们要求男孩购买合适的服装，花钱学会某些特定的舞蹈和歌曲才能成为一个年龄等级的成员。
en: This was the case among some of the Indians of the North American plains, who required boys to purchase the appropriate costumes, dances, and songs for age-grade membership.

zh: 伯恩斯坦强调这些都是理想类型，且个人根据各自的社会背景在这些代码间游移，他还进一步指出，特定社会背景可以被视为是由这些代码中的一种或几种支配的。
en: While emphasizing that these were ideal types, and that individuals moved between codes according to social context, nevertheless, Bernstein further argued that particular social contexts could be seen to be dominated by one or other of these codes.

zh: 它们的用法代表了一种亚文化和社会关系中特定形式的功能（而不是个体心理学）。
