en: Their usage was a function of subculture and of particular forms of social relationship (rather than individual psychology).

zh: 那么严格代码是适用于“地位取向”的社会环境和社会关系，例如军队、监狱、年龄级次、长期建立的友谊与婚姻，而精细代码则适用于“个人取向”的那些社会环境和社会关系。
en: Hence, restricted code pertained to ‘position-oriented’ social milieux and relations—armies, prisons, age-grades, longestablished friendships and marriages—while elaborated code pertained to ‘person-oriented’ ones.

zh: 在撒哈拉南部的非洲社会，各种形式的年龄分群都得到利用。

en: The most varied use of age grouping is found in African societies south of the Sahara.

zh: 例如，在东非的蒂里基人中，七个命名的年龄组要经历四个前后相继的年龄等级。
en: Among the Tiriki of East Africa, for example, seven named age sets pass through four successive age grades.

zh: 每个年龄组含有15年的时段，因此每105年开放一次以接纳新的加入者。
en: Each age set embraces a 15-year age span and thus opens to accept new initiates every 105 years.

zh: 一贯具有绅士风度的雷德菲尔德善意地接受了这些批评，并且把它们加入到他于1950年代中期发表的综合性著作《小社区》（Redfield 1955)和《农民社会与文化KRedfield 1956)中。
en: Redfield, as always the gentleman, accepted the criticisms with good grace and incorporated them into his synthetic books of the mid-1950s, The Little Community (1955) and Peasant Society and Culture (1956).

zh: 正是从这个时候起，“农民”（peasant)被确立为一个分析范畴并成为一个独立的研究主题。
en: This was the time when the "peasant" was established as an analytic category and a subject matter in its own right.

zh: 在关于“农民”定义的无数争论中出现了两种研究方法。
en: Out of numerous debates over definitions of peasants, two approaches emerged.

zh: 雷德菲尔德的方法聚焦于“生活方式”、价值与世界观、社区凝聚力和传统。而沃尔夫的方法首先从物质基础和结构关系出发——农民是能够有效控制土地的农业生产者，他们的目标是生存而非再投资。
en: Redfield’s focused on "way of life," values and worldview, community cohesion, and tradition.Wolf's began with the material base and with structural relationships—peasants were agricultural producers in effective control of land who aimed at subsistence, not reinvestment.

zh: 之后，沃尔夫关于农民的研究越来越强调权力关系，它们与经济过程并不矛盾而仅仅只是其对应物。
en: After this beginning,Wolf's work on peasantries increasingly emphasized relations of power, not in contradiction to economic processes but as their counterpart.

zh: 一个氏族或部族，只要它的成员不是很多，只要社会关系尚能是个人间的关系，它作为社会组织与社会交往的机制便能够通行有效。
en: A clan or tribe could be effective as a mechanism of social organization and intercourse as long as its members were not exceedingly numerous, as long as social relations could be personal.

zh: 但是，当氏族和部族单元的规模在农业技术发展与食物供给增长的推动下日渐宏大时，它们往往会自行解体。
en: But when, under the impetus of a developing agricultural technology and an increasing food supply, clan and tribal units grew to huge size, they tended to fall apart of their own weight.

zh: 可见，原始社会往往是因人口数最绝对增长而解组的。
en: Primitive society tended therefore to disintegrate as a consequence of sheer increase of numbers.

zh: 要防止混乩，就需有一种新型社会组织。
en: A new type of social organization was therefore required if chaos was to be averted.

zh: 我们在国家中找到了这一新型组织。
en: This new organization was found in the State.

zh: 这是农业革命的另一个后果。
en: This was another consequence of the Agricultural Revolution.

zh: 20世纪60年代，由于女权运动的觉醒和各学科对自己宣布为知识的内容的其他形式的自我审查，这个主题的合法性在人类学界也受到了详细的审查，并由于认识论的根本转移而愈演愈烈。
en: The legitimacy of the topic came under scrutiny in the 1960s in a process that has since accelerated due to very basic epistemic shifts within anthropology in the wake of feminism and other modes of disciplinary self-inspection about its claims to knowledge.

zh: 这次转移留下的一个普遍的结论是很多原本被接受的亲属关系理论不再被看作是无可非议的了。
en: One prevalent conclusion forthcoming from such shifts is that much of received kinship theory is no longer seen as justifiable.

zh: 理由有很多。
en: The reasons are many.

zh: 女权主义者不仅关注特定社会的性别关系，也关注人类社会中普遍存在的把性别作为构筑原则的思想（Moore 1988: vii)。
en: The feminist critique concerns both gender relations in particular societies and the idea of gender as a structuring principle in humansociety generally (H. L. Moore 1988: vii).

zh: 前者在本质上可以被视作是一个实际问题，后者是理论问题。所以同样都需得到重视，如同马克思主义、后结构主义和后现代主义一样——人类学中的诸多方面都与女权主义有联系。
en: While the former may be regarded as essentially a substantive issue, the latter is a theoretical one and therefore merits the same treatment as, for example, Marxism, poststructuralism, or postmodernism – all perspectives with links to feminism in anthropology.

zh: 可能是因为他的排他主义，博厄斯从未将他的思想进行过系统化的理论论述。
en: Perhaps because of his particularism, Boas never systematised his ideas in a theoretical treatise.

zh: 他的几个学生和伙伴却发展出了若干文化的一般理论，特别是露丝·本尼迪克特（Ruth Benedict）、克罗伯和罗伯特·洛伊（Robert Lowie）。
en: Several of his students and associates nevertheless did develop general theories of culture, notably Ruth Benedict, Alfred Kroeber and Robert Lowie.

zh: 他最著名的学生是玛格丽特·米德（Margaret Mead， 1901—1978），尽管米德的关于几个不同的太平洋岛屿社会的畅销书被批评为是浅薄的人种学（参见第四章），但不能否认，这些书技巧地使用了来自非西方社会的资料，提出了关于性别关系、社会化和西方政治等方面的问题。
en: His most famous student was Margaret Mead (1901–78).Although her bestselling books from various Pacific societies have been criticised for being ethnographically superficial (see Chapter 4), they skilfully used material from non-Western societies to raise questions about gender relations, socialisation and politics in the West.

zh: 米德的著作可能比其他任何人类学家的著作都更好地显示了：文化批判的潜力是这个学科与生俱来的。
en: Mead’s work shows, probably better than that of any other anthropologist, the potential of cultural criticism inherent in the discipline.

zh: 与血缘家庭相反，夫妻家庭以丈夫与妻子的婚姻纽带为基础。
en: Conjugal, as opposed to consanguine, families are formed on the basis of marital ties between husband and wife.

zh: 夫妻家庭最低限度由已婚的夫妻及其扶养的孩子组成，又被称为核心家庭（nuclear family)；夫妻家庭的其他形式是一夫多妻制家庭和一妻多夫制家庭，这可被设想为有一个共同配偶的核心家庭的集合。
en: Minimally, a conjugal family consists of a married couple with their dependent children, otherwise known as the nuclear family; other forms of conjugal families are polygynous and polyandrous families, which may be thought of as aggregates of nuclear families with one spouse in common.

zh: 一夫多妻制家庭包括一个丈夫的多个妻子,而一妻多夫制 家庭则包括一个妻子的多个丈夫。
en: A polygynous family includes the multiple wives of a single husband, while a polyandrous family includes the multiple husbands of a single wife.

zh: 两种家庭经常列在多配偶制家庭的标题之下。
en: Both are often lumped together under the heading of polygamous families.

zh: 在这些社会里，有可能通过新颖地并置指涉熟悉物体的概念而获得创意。
en: Originality, in this kind of society, is possible through novel juxtapositions of concepts referring to familiar objects.

zh: 列维-斯特劳斯将这种思维操作方式称为拼合（bricolage）(一个“用手头现成工具摆弄修理的人”也可以翻译成杂物工、万事通)。
en: LéviStrauss describes this thought operation as bricolage (a "bricoleur" can be translated as a handyman, a jack-of-all-trades).

zh: 这种创造性的、联想式的而且“好玩的”思维模式可以与“工程师”的思维模式形成对照，后者是西方社会中主导的抽象科学，受到文字和数字的束缚和训练。
en: This creative, associational and "playful" mode of thought is contrasted with that of the "engineer"; the abstract science dominant in Western societies, imprisoned and disciplined by writing and numbers.

zh: 这种系统中，三个或更多的群体通过某种轮转交换妻子的方式相互联系起来，因而也许比半偶族系统的规模更大，因为它需要依靠更多的关系去运转。
en: A system where three or more groups are mutually linked through some kind of cyclical exchange of wives may be on a larger scale than moiety systems, since it depends on a greater number of relationships to function.

zh: 这样一个系统，你要对供应妻子的人（wife-givers）和取走妻子的人（wife-takers）做出种类区分，因而被叫做不对称的联盟系统，而半偶族由对称的联盟系统构成。
en: Such a system, where one distinguishes categorically between wife-givers and wife-takers, is called an asymmetrical alliance system, whereas moieties constitute a symmetrical alliance system.

zh: 后者暗示着群体之间的平等，而非对称的联盟往往但并不一定就意味着群体之间存在着等级差别。
en: While the latter implies equality between the groups, an asymmetrical alliance often, but not necessarily, implies rank differences between the groups.

zh: 上缅甸的克钦人在父方家系的层面上实行的是族外婚（Leach 1954），他们交换妻子的规则揭示了一种比雅诺马马人更为复杂和更有等级分化的社会组织形式。
en: The Kachin of upper Burma practise exogamy at the level of the patrilineage (Leach 1954).Their rules for wife exchange reveal a more complex and more hierarchical social organisation than that of the Yanomamö.

zh: 社会阶级结构的基础是角色分化。
en: The basis of social class structure is role differentiation.

zh: 当然，某些角色分化存在于任何一个社会，至少有依据性别和年龄的分化。
en: Some role differentiation, of course, exists in any society, at least along the lines of sex and age.

zh: 此外，任何必要的角色总会在某种程度上受到重视。
en: Furthermore, any necessary role always will be valued to some degree.

zh: 在寻食社会中，“好猎人”的角色将会受到重视。
en: In a food-foraging society, the role of "good hunter" will be valued.

zh: 但是，在一个平等社会中，已经有一个人承担了那个角色这一事实，并不阻碍另一个人承担它因此，角色分化本身并不足以造成分层。
en: The fact one man already may play that role does not, however, prevent another man from playing it, too, in an egalitarian society.Therefore, role differentiation by itself is not sufficient for stratification.

zh: 还有两个必要条件：对角色的正式评价—— 这种评价包含像喜欢一厌恶、崇敬一反感这样的态度，以及对有较高评价角色的获得机会的限制。
en: Two more ingredients are necessary: formalized evaluation of roles, involving attitudes such as like/dislike, or admiration/revulsion, and restricted access to the more highly valued roles.

zh: 寻食社会的一个重要特点是它的平等主义。
en: An important characteristic of the food-foraging society is its egalitarianism.

zh: 寻食者通常是髙度流动的而且又缺乏动物或机械运输工具，特别是去远处获取食物时，他们必须能不担许多东西行进。
en: Food foragers are usually highly mobile, and, lacking animal or mechanical transportation, they must be able to travel without many encumbrances, especially on foodgetting expeditions.

zh: 例如，在朱瓦西人中，每个个人的所有物的平均重量在25磅以下。
en: The average weight of an individual's personal belongings among the Juhoansi, for example, is just under 25 pounds.

zh: 寻食者的物质产品必须限制在最低限度的必需品上，它们包括用于狩猎、采集、捕鱼、建屋的工具，以及制造工具、烹饪器具、捅捉机和网。
en: The material goods of food foragers must be limited to the barest essentials, which include implements for hunting, gathering, fishing, building, and making tools, cooking utensils, traps, and nets.

zh: 他们很少有机会积累奢侈品或剩余物品，而且没有谁能拥有比别人多得多的物品，这一事实有助于限制地位差异。
en: They have little chance to accumulate luxuries or surplus goods, and the fact no one owns significantly more than others helps to limit status differences.

zh: 年龄和性别通常是重要的地位差别的唯一根源。
en: Age and sex are usually the only sources of significant status differences.

zh: 平衡互惠（balanced reciprocity)的不同之处在于，它不是长期过程的一部分。
en: Balanced reciprocity differs in that it is not part of a long-term process.

zh: 赠送和接受，以及所涉及的时间都是确定的，为了社会关系能延续下去，一个人有直接的义务以相同的价值及时回报。
en: The giving and receiving, as well as the time involved, are more specific; a person has a direct obligation to reciprocate promptly in equal value for the social relationship to continue.

zh: 在北美社会，平衡互惠的例子包括这样 一呰做法，比方说，当朋友或同事聚会时轮流交换棒球卡或购买饮料。
en: Examples of balanced reciprocity in North American society include practices such as trading baseball cards or buying drinks when one's turn comes at a gathering of friends or associates.

zh: 非西方社会的例子，包括人类学家罗伯特·罗伊在他关于阿布萨罗卡(克劳）印第安人的经典描述中讲述的那些例子。一个擅长鞣制野牛皮的妇女会为需要一个新圆锥形帐篷顶的邻居提供服务。
en: Examples from a non-Western society include those anthropologist Robert Lowie related in his classic account of the Crowhides might offer her services to a neighbor who needed a new cover for her tepee.

zh: 不过，在过去二十年内，性别人类学已经发生了一些引人注目的转变。
en: However, the anthropology of gender has taken some striking turns through the past two decades.

zh: 所谓的“女性人类学”兴起于20世纪 70年代，目的不仅在于了解妇女，更是要理解性别关系。
en: What has been called an "anthropology of women" arose in the 1970s, designed to understand not just women but gender relations.

zh: 这一学派的学者想要回答的早期问题，必须设法解决性别不平等和普遍的性别偏见问题。
en: The early questions scholars in this school sought to answer had to do with gender inequality and universal gender bias.

zh: 这些学者也寻求改正先前人类学研究中的男权主义者偏见。
en: These scholars also sought to correct what was deemed a masculinist bias in previous anthropological research.

zh: 它是指用以阻止一个国家强行干涉他国的宪法和内政的国际法。
en: International laws which prevent one state from forcibly interfering in the constitution and government of another.

zh: 它是指“普遍好客”的原则，使陌生人在他人的领土上有权被款待，使国家不能将新获取的领土视为“没有主人的”，不能将当地的居民视为“不存在”。
en: Laws of "universal hospitality" which grant strangers the right to be treated with civility when they arrive on someone else's territory, and which prevent states from treating newly-acquired territories as "ownerless" and their native inhabitants "as nothing".

zh: 它是指防止“战争罪行”、“反和平的罪行”和“反人性的罪行”的法律。
en: Laws which prohibit what are now called "war crimes", "crimes against peace" and "crimes against humanity".

zh: 这被认为是从“雅各宾激进派”国家（“Jacobin” state)继承的 “法国式综合征”。
en: This is supposed to be the "French syndrome" inherited from the "Jacobin" state.

zh: 这种理论所受到的主要批评是，它允许主导文化将它的标准以法律上虚构的抽象公民的名义强加于人。
en: The main criticism of this approach is that it allows the dominant culture to impose its standards in the name of an abstract citizen who is a legal fiction.

zh: 主导群体将自己包入普遍主义的外衣，忽略这样一个事实，即任何“抽象公民”也属于某一特定文化。
en: The dominant group wraps itself into the cloak of universalism and ignores the fact that any "abstract citizen" also belongs to a specific culture.

zh: 要超越“父亲之法和父亲之名”（The Name and the Law of the Father），必须从女人内部的完全的女性开始重新书写女人；既不模范男人，也不寻求成为他的社会契约的一部分（目标不是达到和男人类似的身份、地位或公共性），而是书写出超越先前所有规范语言的女性经验。
en: However, to go beyond ‘the Name and the Law of the Father’, it is necessary to rewrite the woman beginning from that feminine fullness within the woman; not to mimic the male or seek to play a part in his social contracts (not to aim for a male-imitation identity, status or publicity) but to draw on feminine experiences which lie beyond and before conventional languages.

zh: 这种“女性用语”强调并给出的是多元性、流动性、节奏感、差异性和恰当性，以此代替男性真理中的单一性、线性和僵化的（二元）对立。
en: Such a ‘feminine idiolect’ might emphasize, and give form to, multiplicity, fluidity, rhythm, difference and becoming, in place of the masculine verities of singularity, linearity and fixed (binary) oppositions.

zh: 这是一次以诗歌风格出现的试验，形成了新的话语形式（Irigaray 1991）。
en: It is a matter of experimenting with poetic styles and achieving new discursive forms (cf. Irigaray 1991).

zh: 强化仪式是标志群体生命而非个体生命危机时刻的仪式，不论这种危机准确性质如何——严重少雨威胁农作物的生长、突然出现战争对手、疫病横行或者其他危及到每个成员的事件——人们都会举行大型仪式以求减轻群体面临的危险。这将使人们团结起来共同努力，这样，恐惧和困惑就会向集体行动和一定程度的乐观主义让步。
en: Rites of intensification are rituals that mark occasions of crisis in the life of the group, rather than an individual.Whatever the precise nature of the crisis—a severe lack of rain that threatens crops in the fields, the sudden appearance of an enemy war party, the onset of an epidemic, or some other event that disturbs everyone—mass ceremonies are performed to allay the danger to the group.

zh: 受到危机影响的所有人之间被扰乱的关系恢复到正常的平衡状态，同时共同体的价值也得到颂扬和肯定。
性暴力及其作为战争武器而被使用的问题，必然成为前南斯拉夫冲突的后果而再度出现。
en: The issue of sexual violence and its use as a weapon of war has necessarily been taken up in the aftermath of the conflicts in the former Yugoslavia.

zh: 强奸一直在战争中使用，只是现在公众注意到了性暴力和性滥用问题，才被公开认识和讨论。
en: While rape has long been utilised in war, it is only now with the public attention given to questions of sexual violence and sexual abuse that it is being openly recognised and discussed.

zh: 阿蒂那·葛罗斯曼（Arina Grossman)在她关于二战时期最后几个星期东部前线德国妇女被红军强奸的分析中，以令人信服的方式提出必须将我们对强奸问题的理解作为历史去对待，还要提出这种理解在不同的历史背景下有不同的含义。
en: Atina Grossmann, in her analysis of the rape of German women by the Red Army on the eastern front during the closing weeks of World War Two, argues persuasively that we must historicise our understandings of rape, and that it has different meanings in different contexts.

zh: 因此，这一原则在直系上一个个体与其所有八个曾袓父母外曾袓父母联成亲属，从旁系使一个个人与第三和第四代的堂表兄弟姐妹联成亲属。
en: Thus, this principle relates an individual lineally to all eight great-grandparents and laterally to all third and fourth cousins.

zh: 由于这样一个巨型的群体实在太大了，在社会生活中不切实际，所以它通常缩减为一个由父亲和母亲的亲属组成的小圈子，称为亲类（kindred）。
en: Since such a huge group is too big to be socially practical, it is usually reduced to a small circle of paternal and maternal relatives, called the kindred.

zh: 亲类可以定义为通过父母双方与一个活着的个人保持着紧密联系的一群人。
en: The kindred may be defined as a group of people closely related to one living individual through both parents.

zh: 因为亲类是根据旁系而不是根据直系组织起来的——即据以计算每一级亲属关系程度的“自我”或核心个人是这个群体的中心（参见图l0.4)——所以它不是一个真正的继嗣群体。
en: Since the kindred is laterally rather than lineally organized—that is, ego, or the focal person the degree of each relationship is reckoned from, is the center of the group (Figure 10.4)—it really is not a descent group, even though it occurs in societies with bilateral descent.

zh: 亲属关系的研究，包括相关的婚姻和家庭制度直到最近一直都是人类学调查和争论的中心。
en: Studies in kinship, and the related institutions of marriage and the family, have until recently been central to anthropological investigation and debate.

zh: 就像拉迪斯拉夫·霍利（Ladislav Holy）所说（1996：1）：“如果说存在一个领域人类学家可以正当地宣布为自己所独有的，那就是亲属关系。”因此，处理跨文化的亲属关系主题是理解人类学大部分核心分析概念、理论和方法的历史发展的关键所在。
en: As Ladislav Holy remarks (1996:1), ‘if there was a subject which anthropologists could have rightly claimed to be their own, it was kinship’, and thus the problem of handling the topic of kinship crossculturally is the key to understanding the historical development of a large majority of anthropology’s central analytic concepts, theories and methods.

zh: 他们能够命名大量不同种类的亲戚，他们有精确的规则决定谁能与谁结婚，并且，群体被细化为半偶族（moieties）、氏族（clans）和亚氏族（sub-dans）。
en: They can name a large number of different kinds of relatives, they have accurate rules determining who can marry whom, and the groups are subdivided into moieties, clans and sub-clans.

zh: 亲属制度的研究一直以来都是人类学的一个核心话题。
en: The study of kinship has always been a core topic in anthropology.

zh: 接近1940年代末，特别是在英国的社会人类学，亲属制度如此重要以致绝望的门外汉（和学生）嘲讽地把这门学科叫做“亲属制度学（kinshipology）”。
en: Towards the end of the 1940s kinship was so central, especially in British social anthropology, that despairing lay people (and students) spoke ironically of the subject as "kinshipology".

zh: 许多非人类学家不理解为什么人类学对亲属制度仍然抱有极大兴趣。
en: Many non-anthropologists have reacted with incomprehension at the great interest in kinship still prevalent in the profession.

zh: 是什么方面使得亲属制度如此重要？
en: What is it about kinship that makes it so important?

zh: 简单的回答是，正是在许多社会中，亲属制度是单个的最重要的社会制度。
en: The simple answer is that in very many societies kinship is the single most important social institution.

zh: 第二类非集权或多中心权力系统是部落(tribe),不幸的是，不同的人以不同的方式使用这个词。
en: The second type of uncentralized or multicentric authority system is the tribe, a word that, unfor-tunately, is used in different ways by different people.

zh: 在一般公众那里，它常用来称呼那些没有组织成国家的民族，而不管他们是构成人类学家所谞的队群、部落还是酋邦。
en: Among the general public, it is used commonly to label any people who are not organized into states, irrespective of whether or not they constitute what anthropologists would call bands, tribes, or chiefdoms.

zh: 有时候，这一术语甚至用于某些事实上髙度集权国家的非西方民族(如阿兹特克人）,这样做就如把中国人称作部落一样没有根据。
en: Sometimes, the term even is applied to non-Western peoples who in fact had strongly centralized states (the Aztecs, for example), a practice no more warranted than calling the Chinese people a tribe.

zh: 在历史上，欧洲人发明了该术语，以把他们认为的低等民族与所谓高等的、“文明的”欧洲人作对比。
en: Historically, Europeans coined the term to contrast people they regarded as inferior with supposedly superior, "civilized" Europeans.

zh: 冷战深刻地影响了这一时期的社会科学，独立后新国家的出现则是另外一个影响要素。
en: The Cold War profoundly affected the social sciences in this period, as did the emergence of new nations after independence.

zh: 区域研究计划扩展到大学、研究机构和智囊团以及基金会的动议中。
en: Area studies programs expanded within universities, at research institutes and think tanks, and in foundation initiatives.

zh: 尽管被政治学所主导，但是这些计划仍然为人类学家在地方层面进行田野调查拓展出了空间，它们也极大扩展了学科所到达的古老文明区域的地理边界。
en: Although dominated by political science, these programs created space for anthropologists to carry out local-level fieldwork, greatly enlarging the discipline's geographical reach into the areas of old civilizations.

zh: 相同的战略利益带来了研究基金，它们挑选优先考虑的区域，随之而来的结果是研究倾斜于那些受到偏爱的区域。
en: The same strategic interests that yielded research funding selected the areas to be given priority, with a resultant skewing toward favored areas.

zh: 然而他们的文化背景是完全不同的，他们过去是五大湖地区林地的谷物耕作者和野生稻采集者，具有完全不同于科曼奇人在其袓居地的原米那些社会、政治和宗教的制度。
en: Yet their cultural background was quite different; formerly, they were settled farmers with social, political, and religious institutions quite unlike those of the Comanche in their ancestral homeland.

zh: 那些其袓先文化完全不同的民族对相似环境状况的相似文化调适的这种发展被称为趋同演化（convergent evolution)。
en: This kind of development of similar cultural adaptations similar environmental conditions by peoples whose ancestral cultures were quite different is called convergent evolution.

zh: 特别令人感兴趣的是，切延内人的转变是从谷物种植向寻食生活方式的转变。
en: Especially interesting is that the Cheyenne switch was from a farming to a food-foraging way of life.

zh: 与西方人的“进步”观念不同，生存实践的变化并非从依靠野生食物进步到农业，它也可能走另一条道路。
en: Contrary to Western notions of "progress", change in subsistence practices does not inevitably go from dependence on wild food to farming; it may go the other way as well.

zh: 矿主设想在他们不需要劳动力的时期，可以将矿工们送回他们的村子，但这是不可能发生的。
en: The mine-owners assumed that they could send the workers back to their villages in periods when their labour was not needed; this did not come about, however.

zh: 原计划周期性移居的劳动力实际导致农村部分地区人口减少，并且最终整个家庭会或多或少永久性地居住在采矿小镇上。
en: The labour migration, intended to be seasonal, led to a partial depopulation of the rural areas, and eventually entire families lived more or less permanently in the mining towns.

zh: 以前是农民而现在成为永久无产阶级的人口就出现了。在铜带省所做的最早的都市化的人类学研究中，戈弗雷·威尔逊（Godfrey Wilson，1941 — 1942）提出了一个“去部落化”（de-tribalisation）的术语，换句话说，他强调的是都市化所带来的社会一体化中的质的变化。
en: A permanent proletarianisation of a former farmer population had taken place.In the first anthropological study of urbanisation in the Copperbelt, Godfrey Wilson (1941–2) introduces the term "de-tribalisation"; in other words, he emphasises the qualitative change in social integration entailed by urbanisation.

zh: 阿帕杜莱的文章中的一个主要观点，也是其他关于全球化的学者持有的观点，是去领土化——它并不只是意味着大规模，而且同样意味着空间维度的重要性被削减——使对社会和文化世界进行新的概念化成为必要。
en: A major point in Appadurai's article, and one that other writers on globalisation have also made, is that de-territorialisation – which does not merely amount to large scale, but to the reduced importance of the spatial dimension as such – necessitates new conceptualisations of the social and cultural world.

zh: 20世纪晚期，科技、人员和金钱能够而且事实上也比以往更加频繁、快速而轻易地跨越全球四处移动。
en: Ideas, technologies, people and money can be, and are, moved about more frequently, quickly and easily across the globe in the late twentieth century than ever before.

zh: 它的一个后果，便是流动或颠沛流离人口的增长，常用移位来描述（displacement）。
en: One result, often described in terms of displacement, is the growth of populations on the move or living in exile.

zh: 它们还假定，学术体裁和文学体裁相互渗透，描述文化的写作真正是试验性和伦理性的。
en: They assume that academic and literary genres interpenetrate and that the writing of cultural descriptions is properly experimental and ethical.

zh: 它们把焦点放在文本生产和修辞上以便突出文化叙述的建构和人为的性质。
en: Their focus on text making and rhetoric serves to highlight the constructed, artificial nature of cultural accounts.

zh: 这种做法削弱了过度透明的权威模式，把注意力引向民族志的历史困境，亦即，民族志总是陷入发明文化而非再现文化的境地（Wagner 1975)，这些文章所提问题的范围不属于任何传统意义上的文学，这一点将很快变得明显。
en: It undermines overly transparent modes of authority, and it draws attention to the historical predicament of ethnography, the fact that it is always caught up in the invention, not the representation, of cultures (Wagner 1975 ).As will soon be apparent, the range of issues raised is not literary in any traditional sense.

zh: 大部分的文章虽然焦点在文本实践，然而都抵达了文本之外的语境：权力、抵抗、制度限制以及创新的语境。
en: Most of the essays, while focusing on textual practices, reach beyond texts to contexts of power, resistance, institutional constraint, and innovation.

zh: 东西方的关系，无论是虚构还是真实存在，现在都与全球化的进程密切相关，也是人类学越来越重要的研究对象。
en: The relations between Occident and Orient, whether imagined or real, are now bound up with the process of globalization, also an increasing object of anthropological enquiry.

zh: 1993年诺曼•龙在英联邦社会人类学学会十年大会后所出版的六卷文集中的一卷中谈到“全球化”、“本土化”，甚至“再本土化”（Long 1996)。
en: In one of six volumes stemming from the 1993 Decennial Conference of the Association of Social Anthropologists of the Commonwealth, Norman Long (1996) speaks of ‘globalization’, ‘localization’, and even ‘re-localization’.Globalization involvesprocesses of movement in population (e.g.

zh: 全球化涉及到人口移动（例如劳动力迁移）、技术、资本、科技和科技知识，以及符号意义（例如“现代化”和“全球化”本身，以及比 如在欧盟各国的“公民身份”新概念）的转移过程。
en: , migrant labour), skills, capital, technology and technical knowledge, and also symbolic representations (e.g., notions of ‘modernization’ and ‘globalization’ itself, and new concepts of ‘citizenship’ such as that of the European Union).

zh: 同族可能有互相帮助的义务，而官僚主义者必须使自己面对不同的人时都遵从同一程序和原则。
en: Kinsmen may be obliged to help each other out, whereas bureaucrats have committed themselves to following identical procedures and principles no matter who they are dealing with.

zh: 根据亲属制度的意识形态，按照不同的方式对待不同的人是适当的；而按照官僚主义者的思维方式，所有人都要在同样的正式规章和制度面前被一视同仁；当一个高职位的人雇用了他的一个同族，其他人可能会把这叫做裙带关系（nepotism，从字源来讲，来自对侄子的特殊照顾），这是“不公平的”基于亲属制度的差异对待。
en: According to a kinship ideology, it is appropriate to treat different people differently; according to a bureaucratic way of thinking, everybody is to be treated according to identical formal rules and regulations.When a person of high rank employs one of his kinsmen, others may call this practice nepotism (literally, particularism favouring nephews), that is, "unfair" differential treatment on the basis of kinship.

zh: 而按照亲属制度的逻辑，这种差异对待却没有不公正，而更多地意味着忠诚和团结。
en: According to a kinship logic, however, such a differential treatment is not unjust but is rather an indication of loyalty and solidarity.

zh: 两种逻辑，真实地共存于如今的每个社会，却在理论上难以调和——它们代表了背道而驰的两种道德。
en: The two logics, which coexist in virtually every society today, are thus difficult to reconcile in theory – they represent opposing moralities.

zh: 与一夫一妻制不同，它也限制人口增长，因此避免了增加资源的压力。
en: Unlike monogamy, it also restrains population growth, thereby avoiding increased pressures on resources.

zh: 另外，它也为家户提供充袼的男性劳动力。
en: Finally, it provides the household with an adequate pool of male labor.

zh: 由于其农业、畜牧与贸易三结合的经济，三兄弟一妻多夫婚姻受到西藏人的高度评价，因为它允许共妻丈夫三兄弟能同时从事上述三种工作。
en: For tripartite economies of farming, herding, and trading, trifraternal polyandry is highly valued, as it allows the three brothers who are cohusbands to pursue all three options at once.

zh: 群婚（group marriage）即几个男人与几个女人相互有性接触权的婚姻形式，这种婚姻也很少见。
en: Group marriage, in which several men and women have sexual access to one another, also occurs rarely.

zh: 就是在寻找现代婚姻替代形式的年轻人新近的群婚群体内，群婚看来也是短暂的现象，尽管有时它受到公众的注意。
en: Even in recent communal groups, among young people seeking alternatives to modern marriage forms, group marriage seems a transitory phenomenon, despite the publicity it sometimes has received.

zh: 群体成员、政治、再生产和社会稳定已经作为亲属制度的重要方面被提及。
en: Group membership, politics, reproduction and social stability have been mentioned as important aspects of kinship.

zh: 亲属制度的一个更具有深远的重要性的维度是其司法制度：人类学有关亲属制度的大部分词汇来自罗马法（Roman Law）并非巧合。
en: A further important dimension of the kinship institution is the judicial one: it is no coincidence that a large part of the anthropological kinship vocabulary derives from Roman law.

zh: 血浓于水，在世界的很多地方都这么说（虽然不是所有的地方），圣经上那个著名的浪子回头之后，迎接他的是父亲为他举办的盛宴。
en: Blood is thicker than water, it has been said in many parts of the world (though not everywhere), and the famous return of the biblical lost son was celebrated with a great feast.

zh: 杀害兄弟和杀死父亲在世上的许多社会都被认为是所能想到的最严重的罪行，而父母也总是会对孩子们的婚姻大事进行干预——不论婚前婚后。
en: Fratricide and patricide are considered the most serious crimes imaginable in many of the world's societies, and parents have always meddled in the marriages of their children – both before and after their consummation.

zh: 这些几乎永久存在的问题与这样一个事实有关：家族关系与遗产和继承密切相关。
en: These nearly perennial problems are tied to the fact that kinship is connected with inheritance and succession.

zh: 不幸的是，就如流行的看法一样，常识也并非总是真理。
en: Unfortunately, common sense, like conventional wisdom in general, is not always the truth.

zh: 值得一问的是：我们 能描述一个群体的人格而又不陷于刻板的印象吗？
en: A question worth asking is: Can we describe a group personality without falling into stereotyping?

zh: 回答似乎是肯定的；我们用抽象的方式可以谈论一个社会的普遍的“文化人格”，只要我们并不期望找到该社会内部的人格一致性。
en: The answer appears to be a qualified yes; in an abstract way, we may speak of a generalized "cultural personality" for a society, as long as we do not expect to find a uniformity of personalities within that society.

zh: 换言之，每个个体由于共同的经验养成与其他人的人格类似的某种人格特点。
en: Put another way, each individual develops certain personality characteristics that, from common experience, resemble those of other people.

zh: 然而，由于每个个人也受独一无二的经验影响，可能以新的方式对共同的经验做出反应，而且向这些经验注入独一无二（除了同非双胞胎之外）的遗传潜能，所以每个个体也获得独特的人格特质。
en: Yet, because each individual is exposed to unique experiences as well, may react to common experiences in novel ways, and brings to these experiences a unique (except for the case of identical twins) genetic potential, each also acquires distinct personality traits.

zh: 虽然涂尔干的温和“左派”的、拥护共和的社会学取得了学术界的主导地位，但它也并不是没有竞争者，而他也在自己的著作中与这些竞争者展开了争论。
en: Although Durkheim's moderately leftist and prorepublican sociology acquired intellectual dominance, it was not without its competitors, and heargued against those competitors in his writings.

zh: 柏格森的反理性主义是被政治“右派”采用的一种学术思潮。
en: Bergson's antirationalism was one current adopted by the political right.

zh: 在这种背景中值得注意的另一位人物是古斯塔夫˙勒庞（1931年去世），他的主要论题是群体行为和群体心理学（Le Bon 1995)。
en: Another figure of note in this context is Gustave Le Bon (d. 1933), whose main theme was crowd behavior and crowd psychology (see Le Bon 1995).

zh: 新要素不时地被结合到这个文化流程中来：金属、车轮、由望远镜的使用而引起的信念演变，等等，都在文化发展的一定阶段上加入文化传统。
en: New elements are incorporated into the cultural stream from time to time: metals, the wheel, beliefs consequent upon the use of the microscope, etc., enter the cultural tradition at certain stages of its development.

zh: 文化要素的新的结合或综合，即发明与发现，在这一相互作用的过程中继续形成着，蒸汽机的发明、元素周期表的发现及热力学诸定律的制订等，都是文化要素的新型综含体。
en: New combinations and syntheses of cultural elements—i.e., inventions and discoveries—are continually being formed in this interactive process: the invention of the steam engine, the "discovery" of the Periodic System of the elements, the formulation of the laws of thermodynamics, etc., are new combinations or syntheses of cultural elements.

zh: 因此，文化传统是由它所消耗的自然力所推动的一个动态系统。
en: A cultural tradition is therefore a dynamic system (powered by natural forces which it harnesses) that behaves and grows in terms of its own principles and laws.

zh: 但是，西方国家生活在城市中的嬉皮士们也和历史上的许多热情派有一点共同之处，那就是他们都热衷于扩大自己的团体，并且希望永远维持自身中介和局外的状态。
en: But the Western urbanized hippies shared with many historical enthusiastic sects a desire to generalize and perpetuate their liminal and outsider condition.

zh: 我带的一名研究生在康奈尔大学举行的一次研讨会上曾给过我一些居住在黑什伯里（Haight-Ashbury )地区的嬉皮士们写的文学作品，这些作品均出自“黑什伯里”文化的黄金时代。在此，我想介绍其中的几段，它们取自一本“大约两个月”发行一期的叫做《圣言》（Orade)的杂志，当时它的主要发行地区是旧金山，在那里，人们称它为嬉皮士的“家乡期刊”。
en: One of my graduate students in a seminar at Cornell gave me some Haight-Ashbury literature, produced during the brief heydey of the "Hashbury" culture, and I would like to quote some passages from a journal called the Oracle which used to be published "approximately bi-monthly" in San Francisco, where it was described as the hippies' "house journal."

zh: 莫斯也从来没有做过民族志田野调査，但是他广博的语言学知识和文化历史知识使他对献祭、赠礼、人格和民族等现象做出了一些迄今为止最尖锐的分析。
en: Mauss also never carried out ethnographic fieldwork, but his vast knowledge of languages and cultural history enabled him to present some of the most penetrating analyses to date of phenomena such as sacrifice, giftgiving, personhood and the nation.

zh: 不过，在两次世界大战之间，他的大量精力都花在了完善和出版在第一次世界大战中死去的同事们留下的未完成的著作。
en: Much of his energy in the inter-war years nevertheless was spent on completing and publishing unfinished work left by colleagues who died in the First World War.

zh: 《礼物》在20世纪的人类学界被看做是最重要的单篇文本，莫斯短暂的研究生涯也一直都有人解读和仰慕。
en: The Gift is seen by some as the single most important text in twentieth century anthropology, and Mauss's shorter studies also continue to be read and admired.

zh: 讽刺的是，杜蒙（Dumont）回忆道 ，从未亲自做过田野调查的莫斯竟花了好几个每周专题研讨会详细讲授观察中的各种技巧。
en: Ironically, recalls Dumont (1986), Mauss, who never did fieldwork himself, spent many of his weekly seminars giving detailed instructions in techniques of observation.

zh: 克鲁伯在最近的著作中再次对文化学观点给予表述：“我确信，对于文化现象，首先必须根据文化条件来解释，……心理学解释并末曾使任何人在历史现象的分类方面获得很大进展，我也不能转而依赖于它。
en: In a recent work, Kroeber has once again given expression to the culturological point of view: "I am convinced that, the phenomenon being cultural, the explanation must first of all be made in cultural terms…… psychological explanations have not got anyone very far in reducing the phenomena of history to order, and I shall not fall back on them."

zh: ”但在当前的人格研究与墨迹实验中，克鲁伯几乎成孤家寡人。
en: But in these days of personality studies and ink-blot tests, Kroeber stands almost alone.

zh: 如何解释人类学从文化学倒退到心理学和精神病学的现象呢？
en: How is anthropology's regression from culturology to psychology and psychiatry to be explained?

zh: 在斯图尔德的著作中（例如，Steward 1955），文化生态学的学说把文化的进化看成是不同种类的物质因素之间相互作用的一种结果：人口统计学、生态学和技术。
en: In Steward's writings (see e.g.Steward 1955), cultural ecology is a doctrine about cultural evolution seen as a result of the interaction between different kinds of material factors: demography, ecology and technology.

zh: 与马克思主义者不同，斯图尔德没有把生产关系当成是决定性的因素。
en: Unlike Marxists, Steward did not regard relations of production as decisive.

zh: 在他的文化进化的一般模型中，区别了社会文化一体化的不同水平，他的意思大致等同于本书在前面讨论过的小规模和大规模，也就是社会的不同大小和复杂程度。
en: In his general model of cultural evolution, he distinguishes between different levels of sociocultural integration, by which he means roughly the same thing as in the discussion earlier in this book on small and large scale, namely the varying size and complexity of societies.

zh: 我们很容易接受环境塑造文化的理论，因为它提供了解释所有文化特征的可能性，并通过环境的影响因素来阐释文化的多样性。要理解一个地区的环境就要理解该地区的文化。
en: It is easy to appreciate the simple appeal of the idea that environments shape cultures.It opened up the possibility of explaining all cultural features, thereby accounting for cultural diversity, through reference to environmental influences.Understanding the environment of a region would lead to an understanding of the cultures occupying that region.

zh: 相应地，早期的分析通过对不同地域的自然特色和文化类型的区分，以寻求它们之间的关联性，并根据人们所掌握的技术进行分类（如：Mason 1896)。
en: Accordingly, early analyses sought correlations between areas distinguished by their natural features and types of culture, classified in terms of their technologies (for instance, Mason 1896).

zh: 亨廷顿（Huntington）（1924）认为气候是文明进步的关键影响因素，气候不仅促进了生产技术方面的发展，而且对诸如宗教信仰和仪式等也产生了积极作用。
en: Huntington (1924) saw climate as the principal influence in the advancement of civilizations, not only in their more technological aspects, but also in matters such as religious belief and ritual.

zh: 这种把文化与环境机械地联系在一起的做法，经常被用来指涉现实情境中多少有些含糊不清的“环境决定论”（Ellen 1982:2）或“人类地理学” （anthrogeography）（Geertz 1963:1—2），它以欧洲的拉策尔（Ratzel)(1896)、美国的菲克斯（Fewkes)(1896)和霍尔木兹（Holmes)(1919)的著作为代表。
en: This mechanistic linking of culture to environment was often referred to, somewhat confusingly in the current context, as "environmentalism" (Ellen1982:1) or "anthropogeography" (Geertz 1963:1–2; Ellen 1982:2), and is represented, for instance, in the work of Ratzel (1896) in Europe and Fewkes (1896) and Holmes (1919) in America.

zh: 在这些事情上，人类学和大众流行文化的看法是有分歧的。
en: In these matters, anthropology and popular culture are directly at odds.

zh: 大众流行文化认为我们是文化的，认为文化存在于我们之中，存在于文学、文化修养、都市现代化之中，认为自然外在于这些东西，远离城镇，存在于遥远的异国他乡和未受破坏的地方。
en: Popular culture considers that we are culture, that culture is located among us, the literate,urban moderns, and that nature is somewhere out there, away from the cities and towns in the exotic and unspoiled places.

zh: 游人，甚至是更加认真的冒险家，通过逃入自然来远离文化。
en: Tourists, even the more serious adventurers, get away from culture by fleeing to this nature.

zh: 不用说，单个人类学家无法亲身研究与人类有关的每一件事情。
en: Needless to say, no single anthropologist is able to investigate personally everything that has to do with people.

zh: 实际上，人类学有许多分支，个別人类学家专攻某一个或多个分支。
en: For practical purposes, the discipline is divided into various subfields, and individual anthropologists specialize in one or more of these.

zh: 无论他们的专长是什么，他们都保持有较宽广的、全面的有关人类的视野。
en: Whatever their specialization, though, they retain a commitment to a broader, overall perspective on humankind.

zh: 例如，文化人类学家专门研究人的观念、价值和行为，而体质人类学家专门研究作为生物有机体的人。然而他们都无法忽视对方的工作，因为人类文化与自然在许多重要方面联系紧密，难分难解，相互影响。
en: For example, cultural anthropologists specialize in the study of human behavior, while physical anthropologists specialize in the study of humans as biological organisms.Yet neither can afford to ignore the work of the other, for human behavior and biology are inextricably intertwined, with each affecting the other in important ways.

zh: 例如，我们可以看到，生物学如何影响诸如为颜色定名行为的文化习俗。
en: We can see, for example, how biology affects a cultural practice such as colornaming behavior.

zh: 在公众心目中，人类学通常等同于找回远古人类祖先的尸骨，发掘古代营地和“消失的城市”，或者研究现代部落民族，他们的生活方式被错误地看成是“来自过去的”某种事情。人们经常没有注意到的是人类学知识的实际应用。
en: In the public mind, anthropology often is identified with the recovery of the bones of remote human ancestors, the unearthing of ancient campsites and "10st cities", or the study of present-day tribal peoples whose way of life is erroneously seen as something "out of the past" People often are unaware of the many practical applications of anthropological knowledge.

zh: 应用人类学的一个领域被称为法医人类学（Forensic Anthropology) 为合法的目的专门从事人的膏骼遗体的辨别。
en: One field of applied anthropology—known as forensic anthropology—specializes in the identification of human skeletal remains for legal purposes.

zh: 利奥泰高度成熟的殖民化观点，引发了把社会群体转变成一个与先前存在于殖民地的情形大不一样的权力关系领域的需求。
en: Lyautey's highly sophisticated view of colonization turned on the need to brin g social groups into a different field of power relations than had previously existed in the colonies.

zh: 在他看来，这只能通过大范围的社会规划而获得，其中城市规划起着核心的作用。
en: In his view, this could only be achieved through large-scale social planning, in which city planning played a central role.

zh: 正如他在给他的首席设计官亨利˙普罗斯特（Henri Prost)的赞词中所说的那样：“在古典时代如此流行的城市化的艺术与科学，似乎自第二帝国时代以来已经经历了一种彻底的衰退。城市化，也就是发展人类聚集的艺术与科学，经普罗斯特而妙手回春。在这个机械化的时代里，普罗斯特是‘人文主义’的一位园丁。
en: As he said in a eulogy for his chief planner, Henri Prost: "The art and science of urbanism, so flourishing during the classical age, seems to have suffered a total eclipse since the Second Empire. Urbanism, the art and science of developing human agglomerations, is coming back to life under Prost's hand. Prost is the guardian, in this mechanical age, of "humanism."

zh: 一个知识上的空白是什么时候被察觉的，被什么人？
en: When is a gap in knowledge perceived, and by whom?

zh: “问题”从何而来，显然这不止是发现-个错误、偏见或疏漏这样简单的问题。
en: Where do "problems" come from ?It is obviously more than a simple matter of noticing an error, bias, or omission.

zh: 我选择了两个例子（沃克和林哈特的），它们凸现了政治和历史因素对发现话语的不完全性的作用。
en: I have chosen examples (Walker and Lienhardt) that underline the role of political and historical factors in the discovery of discursive partiality.

zh: 这一点所暗含的认识论无法与科学依靠积累而进步的观念达成一致，而利害攸关的不完全性比常规的科学指令更强大——科学要求我们一点一点地研究问题，一定不能过于概化，通过积累有力的证据建构最美的科学篇章。
en: The epistemology this implies cannot be reconciled with a notion of cumulative scientific progress, and the partiality at stake is stronger than the normal scientific dictates that we study problems piecemeal, that we must not overgeneralize, that the best picture is built up by an accretion of rigorous evidence.

zh: 文化不是科学的“客体”（假设这种东西真在自然科学中存在）。
en: Cultures are not scientific "objects" (assuming such things exist, even in the natural sciences).

zh: 这种观点的一致性仍然没有改变。
en: So far the consensus holds.

zh: 但是有一点学者们是真正存在分歧的。
en: But there is one quite serious point on which scholars do genuinely disagree.

zh: 几乎所有的民族主义者(nationalists）都将他们本民族认同（national identity）的起源追溯到近代以前的时代。
en: Almost all nationalists trace the origins of their own national identity far back into the pre-modern era.

zh: 问题是他们这样做对吗？
en: The question is, are they right to do so?

zh: 现代民族（modem nation）可以在一无所有的条件下建立吗？或者存在一些近代之前的族裔认同（ethnic identity）供建立民族使用？
en: Can modern nations be constructed ex nihilo, or does there have to be some pre-modern ethnic identity on which to build?

zh: 布瑞格斯（Briggs 1970, 1998）在一项重要研究中提出，通过在与他人的情感冲突中个体将自己经验化为能动的过程，“因纽特儿童”成就了“因纽特人的文化”，包括制度、规则、实践、价值观、交流的习惯和含义。
en: In an important pair of studies, for instance, Briggs (1970, 1998) elucidates how, far from being givens, ‘Inuit children’ make ‘Inuit culture’, its institutions, rules, practices, values, habits of interaction and meanings, through processes whereby individuals experience themselves as agents engaged in emotionally charged conflicts with others.

zh: 个体的因纽特儿童和因纽特文化因此相互推动。
en: Individual Inuit children and Inuit culture are thus mutually created.

zh: 而且这一过程持续不断；个体的因纽特人从未停止作为“儿童”去创造他们的文化和身份认同（Briggs 1992）。
en: Moreover, the process is ongoing; Inuit individuals never stop being ‘children’ creating their culture and their identities (Briggs 1992).

zh: 另一方面，成人认知具有流动性和交错的具体性，这与儿童的一样（Toren 1993）。
en: Adult cognitions, in other words, can be expected to be as fluid, and contextually embodied, as those of children (Toren 1993).

zh: 本章的论述的重点是“相对论”  （这一术语在后现代主义兴起之前就已被人熟知）、相对论的支流（特别是认知人类学）和反相对论的某些流派。
en: The main concerns of the present chapter will be with ‘relativism’ as the term was understood prior to the rise of postmodernism; with offshoots, notably cognitive anthropology; and with certain strands of anti-relativism.

zh: 相对论人类学的第一 个伟大人物是 Franz 博厄斯， 他的主张基本属于描写性相对论。
en: The first great relativist in anthropology was Franz Boas, whose ideas were essentially of the descriptive relativist type.

zh: 业余语言学家本杰明•李• 沃尔夫是博厄斯的追随者，信奉一种认知相对论，以后的认知人类学者和民族科学家也是一样。
en: His follower, amateur linguist Benjamin Lee Whorf, embraced a form of cognitive relativism, as did later cognitive anthropologists and ethnoscientists.

zh: 认知相对论涉及描述性的命题，如“月亮是由绿奶酪做的”或“流行  音乐让人头痛”。它认为，就真实和虚假而言，所有关于世界的陈述都是有文化条件的，不带文化条件的陈述是完全不可能的。
en: Cognitive relativism concerns descriptive propositions, like ‘The moon is made of green cheese’, or ‘Pop music causes headaches.’ It holds that in terms of truth and falsehood, all statements about the world are culturally contingent, and therefore non-culturally-contingent statements are simply not possible.

zh: 换言之，所有科学都是民族的科学。
en: In other words, all science is ethnoscience.

zh: 尼采认为希腊悲剧中有两种因素：“日神精神”和“酒神精神”。
en: He had distinguished two elements of Greek tragedy: the ‘Apollonian’ and the ‘Dionysian’.

zh: 日神精神指审慎、克制、和谐。酒神精神指情感、激情、无节制。
en: The Apollonian aspect is that of measure, restraint, and harmony; the Dionysian aspect, that of emotion, passion, and excess.

zh: 尼采认为在希腊悲剧中两者并存，而本尼迪克特认为在北美印第安人文化中两者不能并存。
en: Greek tragedy, according to Nietzsche, had both.American Indian cultures, according to Benedict, have one or the other.

zh: 今天,他们为保持他们作为独特民族的身份，为了觅新获得对他们土地自然资源的控制权，仍在通过非军事手段继续斗争。如果人们在面对强大的外部统治的时候能够依然坚持自己的一些传统，那么结果可能（syncretism)。这是指本土元素和异族元素混合而形成的一个新的系统。关于这种现象的一个较好的例子是特罗布里恩德岛民所玩的板球运动，关于这个民族的一些习俗，我们在第七、八章和第九章已经考察过了。
en: Sometimes, though, people have managed to keep faith with their traditions by inventing creative and ingenious ways to express them in the face of powerful foreign domination.This blending of indigenous and foreign elements into a new system is known as syncretism, and a fine illustration of it is the game of cricket as played by the Trobriand Islanders, some of whose practices we looked at in Chapters 7, 8, and 9.

zh: 阿诺尔德·范·根纳普在人类学的一本经典著作中分析了生命礼仪，种仪式帮助个人度过他们生命中的重要关头，比如出生、青春期、结婚为人父母、踏入史高阶层、职业专业化以及死亡。
en: In one of anthropology's classic works, Arnold Van Gennep analyzed the rites of passage that help individuals through the crucial crises of their lives, such as birth, puberty, marriage, parenthood, advancement to a higher class, occupational specialization, and death.

zh: 他发现，将所有谊些为生命关口准备的典礼分为三个阶段：分离（separation)、过渡（transition)和融入（incorporation)——是有用的。
en: He found it useful to divide ceremonies for all of these life crises into three stages: separation, transition, and incorporation.

zh: 个人首先会被仪式性地从社会整体中排除出去，然后隔离上一段时期，最后重新融入社会，获得其新地位。
en: The individual first would be ritually removed from the society as a whole, then isolated for a period, and finally incorporated back into society in his or her new status.

zh: 所有文化都是习得的而不是生物学遗传的，著名的人类学家拉尔夫·林顿把这称为人的“社会遗传”。
en: All culture is learned rather than biologically inherited, prompting anthropologist Ralph Linton to refer to it as humanity "social heredity".

zh: 人们与文化一起成长，因而学会自己的文化，文化借以从 一代人传递到下一代人的过程被称为濡化（enculturation）。
en: People learn their culture by growing up with it, and the process whereby culture is transmitted from one generation to the next is called enculturation.

zh: 大多数动物每当冲动产生就要吃喝。
en: Most animals eat and drink whenever the urge arises.

zh: 然而，濡化了的人类在某种文化规定的时间进餐和饮水，而且在那些时间到来时感到饥饿。
en: Humans, however, do most of their eating and drinking at certain culturally prescribed rimes and feel hungry as those times approach.

zh: 这些进餐时间各种文化各不相同。同样，吃什么、如何安排吃、怎样吃，各种文化也不一样。
en: These eating times vary from culture to culture, as does what is eaten and how it is eaten.

zh: 另外一个例子是巴西玛瑙斯的奥尼格罗的文化宫殿，最近举办了一个盛大的亚马逊民族文化展，并组织了一个名为“身份的表达和民族的主张”的节日来歌颂其文化的真实性。
en: There is also the example from the Cultural Palace of the Rio Negro in Manaus, which recently engaged in a great cultural display of Amazonian ethnicity and a eulogy of its cultural authenticity in a festival entitled "Expressions of Identity and Ethnic Affirmation".

zh: 还有一个例子是雅诺马人的撒满教和马鲁波（Marubo)的阿雅瓦斯卡（一种至幻药品）仪式。
en: There was an example of Yanomami shamanism, and an ayawaska (hallucinatory drug) ritual of the Marubo.

zh: 其中有讲述神话、唱圣歌、仪式舞蹈表演和播放本地节日录像等。
en: There was myth-telling, and chanting, ritual dances performed and videos of indigenous festivals shown.

zh: 亚马逊大学管弦乐队甚至还演奏了名为“面具之舞”的奏鸣曲。
en: A sonata was even performed by the University of Amazonas orchestra, entitled "The Dance of the Masks".

zh: 第二类辅助语言的声音是由发嗓音（vocalimtiorus）构成的。
en: The second kind of paralinguistic noises consists of vocalizations.

zh: 这些嗓音是实际可辨别的声音，而不是基本特点。与音质不同，它们是在可觉察的和相对短的音程中出现和消失的。
en: Rather than background characteristics, these are actual identifiable noises that, unlike voice qualities, are turned on and off at perceivable and relatively short intervals.

zh: 但是它们与语言的语音是分开的。
en: They are, nonetheless, separate from language sounds.

zh: 发嗓音的一个类别是嗓音特征表露（vocal characterizes）:笑或哭，喊叫或低语，打哈欠或打哺等声音。
en: One category of vocalizations is vocal characterizers: the sounds of laughing or crying, yelling or whispering, yawning or belching, and the like.

zh: 但是我们却要依靠这种抽象去进行人类学中可能的比较，即使它并不构成本土文化范畴中的任何部分。
en: We nevertheless depend on this kind of abstraction for comparison to be possible in anthropology, even if it does not form part of native cultural categories.

zh: 原则上说，资本主义经济只认可一种商品交换的形式，也就是基于供需法则的市场交换。
en: In principle, a capitalist economy recognises only one form of commodity exchange, namely market exchange based on the laws of supply and demand.

zh: 在特罗布里恩德人中，大量的交换形式（根据Davis 1992b，大约有80种），都被包括在我们理解为“贸易”的形式里，而其中一些最著名的列举如下：吉姆瓦利（Gimwali）是市场交换，类似于资本主义的商品交换。,
en: Among the Trobrianders, a multitude of forms of exchange (about 80, according to Davis 1992b) are included in what we would translate as 'trade', and some of the most famous varieties are the following.Gimwali is market exchange, reminiscent of capitalistic commodity exchange.

zh: 在哲学上，人类解释上的同义反复或循环的特点被称为“解释循环”。
en: In philosophical deliberation, the tautological or circular nature of human interpretation has become known as ‘the hermeneutic circle’.

zh: 对人而言，除了事物的熵和流量外，还没有什么是必定或简单的存在于世界“那儿”。
en: For human beings, there is nothing that is necessarily or simply ‘there’ in the world besides the entropy of matter, or flux.

zh: 存在的只是我们所期望在那的，且只有通过特定的参与活动，我们才可作出有意义的解释，并就此“稳固”我们的世界。
en: What is there is a matter of what we anticipate to be there, and only by courtesy of a system of anticipations do we make meaningful interpretations and hence ‘fix’ our world.

zh: 所以伽达默尔认为：“是我们的成见造就了我们的存在”（Gadamer 1976: 9）。
en: Hence Gadamer’s conclusion: ‘it is our prejudices that constitute our being’ (1976:9).

zh: 另一种观点认为，本族语言使用者认为最能表达出词的意思的（当然在形式上也是正确的）分析，才是最好的分析。
en: There is a place for the alternative view that the best is precisely the one which is most meaningful to the native speaker (while also being formally correct, of course).

zh: 如果他们反对这种分析方法，那么这一方法就是错误的。
en: If native speakers disagree about which one this may be, then so be it.

zh: 这个问题的争论被称为“上帝真理与魔法的大对局”。“上帝真理”主张人们探究认知现实，而“魔法”对这种探知的可行性持怀疑态度。
en: The debate which ensued on this issue is called that of ‘God’s truth versus hocuspocus’, with the ‘God’s truth’ side favouring the search for cognitive reality and the ‘hocus-pocus’ side maintaining a scepticism of this very possibility.

zh: 把伊斯兰教徒视作一个少数者群体，会使14世纪的历史遭到多处修改。宗教允许个人从零开始：它是一部法典，不是文化；使用任何语言并生活在任何社会中的人，可以通过学习成为信徒。
en: To think of Islam as a minority group entails more than a few adjustments with 14 centuries of history.Religion allows one to start from nothing: it is a code, not a culture; one can learn to be a believer, using any language and living in any society.

zh: 宗教现在是新发明的“族性”的标识，没有文化，但表达了一个寻求认可的重建的身份。
en: Religion is now the marker of a new invented "ethnicity", void of culture, but expressing a reconstructed identity in search of recognition.

zh: 供养能力和社会密度都是复杂的变量。
en: Both carrying capacity and social density are complex variables.

zh: 供养能力不仅包括食物和水的即时存在，而且包括获得它们所必要的工具和劳动，以及在其可获得性方面的短期和长期波动。
en: Carrying capacity involves not only the immediate presence of food and water but also the tools and work necessary to secure them, as well as short- and long-term fluctuations in their availability.

zh: 社会密度不仅包括人数和他们的互动，也包括那些互动的环境和性质以及调节互动的机制。
en: Social density involves not only the number of people and their interactions but also the circumstances and quality of those interactions, as well as the mechanisms for regulating them.

zh: 由100个发怒的陌生人形成的人群与在街区上自娱自乐的同样数量的邻居有不同的社会密度。
于是，人们的注意力转移到了这些分析的更宽广的背景上，并越来越依赖于沟通理论和转型思维，例如克劳德·列维-斯特劳斯的作品中已经出现的那样——尽管列维-斯特劳斯的影响只是慢慢地渗入到英国传统中。在英国人类学家中出现了一种持久的不安，即人类学理论不能处理处理社会变化的问题。
en: Consequently attention shifted to a broader framing of such analyses, increasingly based on theories of communication and in transformational thinking such as had already emerged in the work of Claude Lévi-Strauss—though Lévi-Strauss's influence only slowly penetrated into the British tradition.A persistent disquiet arose among British anthropologists over the inability of anthropological theory to handle questions of social change.

zh: 在马林诺夫斯基的文化范式里，这个问题被认为是文化接触的事情：大体上，思想的影响以及文化整体的解体被当作外部力量侵入的后果。
en: In Malinowski's cultural paradigm the issue was thought of as a matter of culture contact: mainly, the effects of ideas and the breakdown of cultural integration as a consequence of the intrusion of outside forces.

zh: 社会工作者和传教士在走出去做好事、给予帮助，以及可能的宗教救赎上与医师非常相似。
en: The social worker and the missionary resemble the physician in that they are out to do good, to give aid, and perhaps ultimately religious salvation.

zh: 社会工作者经常被限制在他们的办公室。
en: Social workers are normally more confined to their offices.

zh: 传教士则会进入田野领域很长时间，并且会比我们能想到的任何其他类型的人们作出更多自我牺牲；实际上，许多最好的民族志一直都是由传教士完成的。
en: Missionaries move into the midst of the field for longer periods and with more complete commitment of self than any other people of the types we have considered; in fact, much of the best ethnography has been done by missionaries.

zh: 这些日常使用的术语的形而上学的分量超越了我们西方的“生物学”关系或通过婚姻缔结的社会联系的观念。
en: The terms, as used in everyday life, have metaphysical weight that goes well beyond our Western notions of "biological" relationship or a social relation through marriage.

zh: 每个术语在使用中都具有共享或不共享一系列社会的、道德的、或形而上学的特质的可能性，在给定的情景中，任何术语都不能被优先确保其显要性。
en: Each term in its application carries with it possibilities of sharing or not sharing a bundle of social, moral, or metaphysical qualities, and there is no a priori guarantee which will be salient to a given case.

zh: 这些关系的性质，比如抚养、教育、背叛、竞争或掠夺，经常过度强调了一种更加注重身体的联系。
en: The quality of the relationship, as for instance one of nurturing, teaching, treachery, competition or predation, often overrides a more physical sort of relating.

zh: 寻食调适的另一个特点是小规模的地方群体，通常不多于100人。
en: Another characteristic of the food-foraging adaptation is the small size of local groups, which usually include fewer than 100 people.

zh: 虽然我们还没有对群体规模提出完全令人满意的说明，但它涉及生态和社会这两个因素似乎是肯定的在所提到的因素中有土地的供养能力（carrying capacity），或者在一定的获取食物的技术水平上，那些可获取的资源所能供养的人数，以及社会关系密度（density of social relations），或者大体说来，营地成员的人数及成员之间互动的强度。
en: Although no completely satisfactory explanation of group size has yet been offered, it seems certain that both ecological and social factors are involved.Among those suggested are the carrying capacity of the land, or the number of people who the available resources can support at a given level of food-getting techniques, and the density of social relations, or roughly the number and intensity of interactions among camp members.

zh: 人数较多意味着较高的社会密度，反过来说，这也意味着较多的冲突机会。
en: More people means a higher social density, which, in turn, means more opportunities for conflict.

zh: 在此，社会化和早期的习得拥有其最深厚的根基。此时，文化在个体身上进行编码，而个体则成为传递和表达文化编码（如服饰与性别、规则与标准、控制与主导）的记忆承载媒介。
en: It is here that socialization and early learning put down their deepest roots; it is here that culture becomes encoded on the individual body, and the body becomes a mnemonic device for the communication and expression of cultural codes (of dress and gender; of propriety and normalcy; of control and domination).

zh: 在这一介于两端之间的习惯的领域中亦可发现社会交往中的资质：个体不假思索的正确行动。
en: Competency in social interaction is also to be found in the habitual domain between the two poles: individuals act properly by not thinking about it.

zh: 简而言之，人类行为中的习惯，其广泛来源正是外部的限定条件和制度性因素决定过程中的各种可能性的汇聚。
en: In short, the wide provenance of habit in human behaviour is a conduit for the potency of processes of exterior determination and institutionalization.

zh: 社会阶级可以被定义为这样一类个体:根据评价体系，他们拥有平等或几乎平等的声望。
en: A social class may be defined as a category of individuals of equal or nearly equal prestige according to the system of evaluation.

zh: “几乎平等”这一限定语非常重要，因为甚至在一个既定的阶级中，可能也有一定程度的不平等。
en: The qualification "nearly equal" is important，for a certain amount of inequality may occur even within a given class.

zh: 如果事实确实如此的话，那么在一个外部观察者看来，上层阶级中地位比较低的个体与下层阶级中地位最髙的个体并没有太大的不同。
en: If this is so, to an outside observer low ranking individuals in an upper class may not seem much different from the highest ranking members of a lower class.

zh: 然而，当阶级作为整体与另一个阶级加以比较时，就有很明显的差异。
en: Yet marked differences exist when the classes are compared as wholes with one another.

zh: 这里的关键点：在像北美那样的一些社会中，阶级差别并不泾渭分明，在这些社会有一连续系列的级差特权，例如，从完全没有特权到有几项特权。
en: The point here is that class distinctions are not clear-cut and obvious in societies such as those of North America that have a continuous range of differential privileges, for example, from virtually none to several.

zh: 林顿写作这本书的目的旨在提供一个关于人类学领域的一般的考察。
en: Linton wrote this book in 1936 with the intention of providing a general survey of anthropology.

zh: 他关于社会结构的研究，在今天仍然具有启发性。
en: His study of social structure is still illuminating today.

zh: 本书被人们视为经典，而且历来是一本重要的参考书。
en: This book is regarded as a classic and is an important source historically.

zh: 在社会科学（包括人类学在内）理论的重要转变时期，发生这样的事情并不奇怪，比如，在20世纪60—70年代就发生过。
en: This has tended to happen, notsurprisingly, during important fundamental shifts in social science theory, in which anthropology has participated.It happened, for instance, during the 1960s and 1970s.

zh: 当时，人类学与其他社会科学一样，通过结构主义的各种理论形式，正在摆脱一直占主导地位的实证主义的束缚，朝着更加解释性的研究方向发展。
en: At this time, anthropology, like the other social sciences, was shedding the cloak of positivism which it had worn conspicuously throughout its domination by various forms of structuralist theory, and moving towards a more interpretative approach.

zh: 接着，评述文化反思现状（Bohamian 1973，KeeSing 1974)的各类刊物开始发表关于文化本质的论述（Geertz 1966，Goodepough 1957，1981/1971)。
en: Pronouncements about the nature ofculture (Geertz 1966, Goodenough 1957, 1981 [1971]) were followed by publications which assessed the contemporary state of thinking on culture (Bohannan 1973, Keesing 1974).

zh: 当然，总的来说，对语言的这样一种兴趣早在泰勒之前就有了，但是在19世纪和20世纪早期，这种兴趣更多地被当作各种各样的民族主义文艺的理论和教育(参见Eagleton 1983:ch.2)，而非其他人文科学的中心内容。
en: In a general way, of course, such an interest in language predates Tylor, but in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries it tended to be central to varieties of nationalist literary theory and education (cf. Eagleton 1983: ch. 2) rather than to the other human sciences.

zh: 对英国社会人类学而言，这一兴趣是在什么时候、以什么方式变得至关重要起来了呢？
en: When and in what ways did it become crucial for British social anthropology?

zh: 我不打算在此尝试描画这样一段历史，而只是想提醒我们自己，“文化翻译”这个短语，这一从1950年代起逐渐变成了对社会人类学这份独特工作的一种几近陈腐的描述，显然并不一直是对社会人类学工作的描述。
en: I do not intend to attempt such a history here, but merely to remind ourselves that the phrase "the translation of cultures," which increasingly since the 1950s has become an almost banal description of the distinctive task of social anthropology, was not always so much in evidence.

zh: 我想强调，这个明显的转化与过去的前功能主义/功能主义时期的划分是不一样的。
en: I want to stress that this apparent shift is not identical with the old pre-Functionalism/Functionalism periodization.

zh: 因此，超越行动或反行动意味着具有一定约束力甚至是强制性的结构，存在并超越于特定个体的行动之上，并导致个体演绎一定的社会文化规则。
en: Over and against action, therefore, were certain structures which implied constraint, even coercion, and which existed and endured over and above the actions of particular individuals, lending to individuals' acts a certain social and cultural regularity.

zh: 因此社会科学要研究的是，这样的正式结构如何产生并怎样精确规约个体行为。
en: What social science should study, therefore, was how such formal structures were created and how precisely they determined individual behaviour.

zh: “能动性”存在的范围，简而言之，是从一定的集体表象中抽取出来的特质并属于之：在是非观念集结的社会事实中；仅存在于他们未被社会化之前，动物特点 (社会文化环境下的某种病态）即是个体能够发起的未被先验决定的行动。
en: To the extent that "agency" existed, in short, it was a quality which derived from, and resided in, certain collective representations: in the social fact of a conscience collective; only in their pre-socialized, animal nature (a pathological state within a socio-cultural milieu) were individuals able to initiate action which was not predetermined in this way.

zh: 克鲁伯在《社会心理学的可能性》一文中，指出了“社会学”这个用语的“致命缺点”，它不能把社会现象和文化现象分离开来。
en: Kroeber has pointed out in "The Possibility of a Social Psychology" "the fatal defect" of the term "sociology": its failure to distinguish the cultural from the social.

zh: 但是，在校正这个缺点方面，他却没做什么事情。因为，正是在揭露社会学缺点的这同一篇论文之中，他建议，应把文化的科学叫作“文化机械论”、“社会心理学”甚至“社会学”。
en: But he does little to remedy this shortcoming, since in the same essay where the defect of "sociology" is exposed, he suggests that the science of culture be called "cultural mechanics," "social psychology," and even "sociology."

zh: 他要是能把他的思想凝聚在“文化学”这个新术语上，情况就会好得多。
en: If only he could have crystallized his thought in a new term: "culturology"!

zh: 但在以后的论文中，他的确使用了“文化的科学”这个短语，而且，当他断言：“看来，未来的科学关心文化将甚于关心社会”时， 也表现出对科学正在确定的方向有敏锐的理解力。
en: In a later essay, he does use the phrase "science of culture," however.And he displays a keen understanding of the direction that science is taking when he observes: "It does look as if the future science would be more concerned with culture than with society."

zh: 现在，实证主义和阐释观点在人类学和社会科学内都可以找到，伴随着各自大量的阴影和着色。
en: Now, within anthropology and the social sciences are found both the positivist and the interpretive viewpoints, with myriad shadings and colorings of each.

zh: 不过，简单来说，我们可以认为，实证主义在社会科学(心理学、社会学、经济学）中占据主导地位，阐释则在民族志中占有主导地位。
en: Simplifying, however, we can identify the dominant viewpoint in the social sciences – psychology, sociology, economics – as positivist and an influential viewpoint in ethnography as interpretive.

zh: 实证主义社会学家和阐释民族志学者之间一个有些被夸张的对比，有助于突出其各自特有的逻辑。
en: A somewhat overstated contrast between the positivist social scientist and the interpretive ethnographer serves to highlight the distinctive logic of each.

zh: 对考尔徳（R˙H˙Gaut)来说，社会心理学“不过是个人心理学的一个侧面而已。
en: To R. H. Gault, social psychology is but "an aspect of the psychology of the individual."

zh: ”可见，心理学固然能够伸展它的领域，多少认识到行为中的社会因素，但是，它却又如此牢固地被限定在作为其研究对象的个人之上，不能把自己解脱出来，转而面对由众多个人所组成的心理学体系，而不是作为社会有机体和生物有机体的单个的个人。
en: Thus psychology was able to reach out and at least take cognizance of social factors in behavior.But it was so firmly anchored to the individual as its object of study that it was unable to free itself and envisage a psychological system composed of many individuals instead of only one, a social organism as well as a biological one.

zh: 因此这个领域给社会学家遗留下相当多的难题。
en: This field was left therefore pretty much to the sociologists.

zh: 在第三章，我讨论了道格拉斯关于社会组织与人们理解自然环境之关系的观点。
en: In Chapter 3, I discussed Douglas’ views on the relationship between social organization and people's understanding of thenatural environment.

zh: 许多人类学家都不会接受她的主张，即社会组织形式引起人们以某种方式思考自然，但是，人类社会为人们理解另一个世界(冥界）提供各种模式的观点却被广泛接受。
en: While many anthropologists would not accept her assertion that forms of social organization cause people to think about nature in certain ways, the view that human society provides models for understanding the world beyond is quite widely held.

zh: 比如，上述伯尔德的研究中就谈到这一点。
en: It is expressed, for instance, in the work of Bird-David referred to above.

zh: 狩猎一采集社会通过社会关系：为他们提供的框架来描述他们与其环境之间的互动。
en: Social relationships provide the framework through which selected hunter-gatherer communities describe their interaction with their environment.

zh: 人们一直认为这种分析曲解了我们所描述的文化。
en: This kind of analysis has been seen as misrepresenting the cultures being described.

zh: 英戈尔德认为它是对西方社会与自然二分法的复制，而这种分类在狩猎一采集文化中是被否认的（Ingold 1992b:42)。
en: Ingold argued that it reproduces a western dichotomy between society and nature which is denied by hunter-gatherer cultures (Ingold 1992b:42).

zh: 理查德（1993)认为人们对其环境的理解至少有一部分來自于直接经验性的观察。
en: Richards (1993) argued that at least some of what people know about their environment comes from direct empirical observation.

zh: 方言研究是社会语言学（sociolinguistics)研究的一个方面。
从技术方面看，所有的方言都是语言——在语言方面，没有什么分语言或次语言这种东西——而且两种不同方言成为不同语言的关键点，人致在于说一种方言的人几乎不能与 、说其他方言的人交流这一点。
en: Technically, all dialects are languages—they have nothing partial or sublinguistic about them一and at the point two dialects become distinctly different languages is roughly where speakers of one are almost totally unable to communicate with speakers of the other.

zh: 分界线可能在心理、地理、社会或经济的方面，而这 方面往往不是很清楚。
en: Boundaries may be psychological, geographic, social, or economic, and they are not always very clear.

zh: 人类学以研究文化变迁的细节著称， 但同时也因其忽略全景，不能应对大规模的社会运动和世界性交流而闻名。
en: Anthropology has become famous for analysing the minutiae of cultural change, but equally famous for ignoring the big picture, for failing to cope with large-scale social movements and worldwide communications systems.

zh: 很显然，这意味着除了个别情况之外，人类学家在全球化辩论中的作用微乎其微。
en: Not surprisingly, this failing has meant that, with a few exceptions, anthropologists have played little part in the debate over globalization.

zh: 人类学无力创建大规模的文化变迁模式可以部分地归结到人类学思维的两个最为突出的特征上：文化是制度的假说和文化相对主义的“幽灵”（Holy 和 Stuchlik 1981:28)。
en: The failure to develop models of large-scale cultural change can be attributed in part to two prevailing features of anthropological thought: the assumption that cultures are systems, and the "spectre" (Holy and Stuchlik 1981:28) of cultural relativism.

zh: 于是演讲者就能够暂时取代社会的正式领导，而以一种群众自身愿意接受的方式来统治人群。
en: Thus the orator temporarily replaced the official leader of society and governed the crowd in a way the crowd itself willed and accepted.

zh: 虽然勒庞谈论的人群因此都威胁到了社会秩序，但人群本身却并非无政府主义的。
en: Although Le Bon's crowd therefore threatened the social order, it was not itself anarchic.

zh: 勒庞从这种模型中看到了社会主义失败的一种原因，因为它将自身的运动建基于典型人群不会去倾听的理性论证之上。
en: Le Bon saw in this model a reason for the failure of socialism, because it based its campaigns on rational arguments that the typical crowd will not listen to.

zh: 印象管理的观念被巴思吸收并应用在对一艘离开西挪威的拖网渔船上的工作人员的社会组织研究上（Barth 1966)。
en: The notion of impression management has been taken up by Fredrik Barth in his study of the social organisation of the crew of a trawler off western Norway (Barth 1966).

zh: 船上有一位船长，5到8个渔民水手，还有一个“渔网指挥（netboss)”。
en: The boat has a captain, a crew of five to eight fishermen, and a "netboss".

zh: 他们所有人都具有多重身份，但在渔船上，他们的职业身份远比其他身份重要得多。
en: All of them have a variety of statuses, but in the boat their professional statuses are by far the most important.

zh: 不同部门的行动者具有不同的任务，船长的工作是掌舵和监督 其他人广渔网指挥”被指望发现渔群和命令渔民下网，当他“觉得”水下有大量的鱼的时候；而渔民的任务是，完成所有的体力活儿。
en: Each category of actors has specified tasks.The captain's job is to steer the boat and to supervise the others.The "netboss" is expected to find schools of fish and to order the fishermen to drop the net when he "feels" that there are large amounts of fish down below.The fishermen, for their part, carry out all the manual work.

zh: 在美国农业经济局（U.S. Bureau of Agricultural Economics) 领导下开展的大萧条时期的计划资助了许多人类学家对乡村社区的研究，这些研究的目的是让政府机构知晓美国农业的状况。
en: Depression-era programs under the U.S. Bureau of Agricultural Economics underwrote a number of anthropologists' studies of rural communities for the purpose of informing government agencies about conditions in American agriculture.

zh: 这些报告中的绝大多数都未发表，但少数报告，如卡尔˙威瑟斯对中西部 “普雷维勒”的研究（Withers 1945)成了新兴的社区研究文献的一部分。
en: Most of the reports remained unpublished, but a few, such as Carl Withers's study of "Plainville," in the Midwest (1945), became part of the emerging community-study literature.

zh: 值得特别注意的是沃尔特˙戈尔德施密特（Walter Goldschmidt) 对加州中部谷地的农业企业的研究（1947)， 它无疑是第一次以工业化农业生产的影响为核心来对乡村社会进行的人类学分析。
en: Of special note was Walter Goldschmidt's research on agribusiness in the Central Valley of California (1947), which was surely the first anthropological analysis of rural society to focus on the impact of industrial agricultural production.

zh: 这项研究被新政拥护者用以抵制集体土地所有者为了其自身的利益而要求修改法律的努力。在这一过程中，戈尔德施密特成为了政治攻击的靶子。
en: The study was used by New Dealers to repel an effort by corporate landholders to rewrite law to their own benefit; in the process, Goldschmidt became the target of political attacks.

zh: 在人类学和社会学中，一个行动着的人常常被称为行动者（actor或agent），这个术语也包括集体行动者，因而比“个体”、“个人”这样的词汇更加具有包容性。
en: In anthropology and sociology, an acting person is frequently spoken of as an actor (or agent).This term can also include collective actors and is therefore more encompassing than words like "person", "individual" and so on.

zh: 比如说，国家可以说是一个行动者，更进一步，在人类学研究中，社团也常作为一个行动者而出现。
en: The state, for example, may be an actor.Further, corporations frequently appear as actors in anthropological studies.

zh: 从一个或多个角度来看，社团是作为行动单位的人的集合体。
en: A corporation is a collective of humans which appears as an acting unit in one or several regards.

zh: 在许多社会，政治党派和贸易团体是典型的行动者；在另一些社会，亲属群体构成了社团（参见第五、第七和第十一章）。
en: In many societies, political parties and trade unions are typical actors; in others, kin groups make up corporations (see Chapters 5, 7 and 11).

zh: 各种社会制度和各种身份关系的整体构成了社会的结构。
en: The totality of social institutions and status relationships makes up the social structure of society.

zh: 在某种意义上下列假定已经成为一种常识：该结构独立于在任何地点及时而凑巧地填补了特定位置的个体而存在。拉德克利夫˙布朗在一次著名的报告中表述如下：汤姆、迪克和哈利的实际关系或杰克和吉尔的行为可能在我们的田野笔记本中被记述下来，并且可以为总体描述提供例证。
en: It has been common to assume that this structure, in a certain sense, exists independently of the individuals who at any point in time happen to fill particular positions.Radcliffe Brown expressed it like this in a famous statement: The actual relations of Tom, Dick and Harry or the behaviour of Jack and Jill may go down in our field note-books and may provide illustrations for a general description.

zh: 但是从科学的目的来看，我们需要的是对结构形式的解释。
en: But what we need for scientific purposes is an account of the form of the structure.

zh: 我后面将要说到，社会这一概念也面临过同样的批判，然而不管它们看起来可能多么成问题，文化和社会这两个概念仍然形成了人类学概念框架的中枢部分。
en: As I shall indicate later, the concept of society has been subjected to similar critiques, but problematic as they may be, both concepts still seem to form part of the conceptual backbone of anthropology.

zh: 亚当·库珀（Kuper 1999,p.226）在他那官气十足而又极其矛盾的文化概念评论中提到，“最近，人类学家们在谈到文化的时候变得异常不安——这很奇怪，尽管从表面上看，文化的人类学已颇有几分成名史的色彩。
en: In his magisterial, deeply ambivalent review of the culture concept, Adam Kuper (1999, p. 226) notes that these days, anthropologists get remarkably nervous when they discuss culture – which is surprising, on the face of it, since the anthropology of culture is something of a success story.

zh: ”这里所说的 “不安”，其原因不仅在于文化这个其含义备受争论的术语，还在于那些与经典人类学有同类性质的文化观念被身份政治从政治上加以利用的事实（参见第十七章到十九章）。
en: The reason for this "nervousness" is not just the contested meaning of the term culture, but also the fact that culture concepts that are close kin to the classic anthropological one are being exploited politically, in identity politics (see Chapters 17–19).

zh: 姿势一呼叫系统中的姿势成分由传达意义的姿势、面部表情和身体动作组成。
en: The gestural component of the gesture-call system consists of postures, facial expressions, and bodily motions that convey messages.

zh: 标记和分析这种“肢体语言”的方法通常被称为身势学（kinesics）。
en: The method for notating and analyzing this body language is known as kinesics.

zh: 就姿势来说, 身势信息可以直接传播。
en: Kinesic messages may be communicated directly, such as gestures do.

zh: 例如，在北美，搔头皮、咬嘴唇，或皱眉是表达怀疑的方式。
en: For example, in North America scratching one^ scalp, biting one's lip，or knitting one's brows are ways of conveying doubt.

zh: 由北美男人和女人发送的性别信号提供了一个比较复杂的例子。
en: More complex examples are the gender signals North American men and women send.

zh: 虽然有一些地位和阶级的差别，但当妇女站立时一般双腿并拢，有时大腿适当交叉，或者整条腿相交，足部仍并拢，脚外部相互平行，或者站立时，膝盖对着膝盖。
en: Although some regional and class variation occurs, women when standing generally bring their legs together, at times to the point the upper legs cross, either in a full leg cross with feet still together, the outer sides of the feet parallel to each other, or in standing knee over knee.

zh: 在一个熟悉或较为熟悉的环境里，你的优势是比在一个有文化距离的地方更熟悉语言和文化习俗，但是也更容易把太多东西想当然，这个问题有时被叫做“身在庐山的盲目”（homeblindness），至少在很大程度上，这个问题可以通过适当的训练而得到克服。
en: In a familiar or semi-familiar setting, one has the advantage of mastering the language and cultural conventions better than in a culturally distant place, but one also tends to take too much for granted.This problem is sometimes called "homeblindness", and it can, at least to a great extent, be overcome through proper training.

zh: 对文化多样性的详细的比较研究，是人类学家所受教育的核心，它也使我们能够用与研究遥远社会大致相同的方法和分析工具研究我们自以为熟悉的社会。
en: The comparative, detailed study of cultural variation which forms the core of the education of an anthropologist enables us to study societies we believe to be familiar with roughly the same methods and analytical apparatus we would apply to distant societies.

zh: 当现代人类学在20世纪早期已经成型的时候，世界上仍然有大片地区是欧洲人很少涉足的，更别提进行系统研究了。
en: When modern anthropology took shape in the early years of the twentieth century, there were still large areas of the world that had hardly been visited by Europeans, much less been subjected to systematic exploration.

zh: 可是更准确地讲，记忆和预测都是关于当前的紧张形态。

en: But then, memory and anticipation are more properly seen as tensed modalities of the present.

zh: 也就是说，上述两个方面不是相分离的，而是存在于当前的一个具有张力的实体之中；连续不断的经历将吸收记忆的历史和预测的细节从而对具体的现实进行深描，这样我们的身份认同就会延续下去（即使并不连续）。
en: That is, the above two stories are not separate but exist as a tensed unity in the present; an ongoing story absorbs the chronicle of memory and the scenario of anticipation into the thick description of an embodied present, so that our identity remains continuous (even if not coherent).

zh: 在我们对自我和他者的描述中，当前成为记忆中的过去和预期未决的未来之间，具有决定意义的时刻、决策的时刻和危机时刻。
en: The present becomes the decisive moment in our story of self and other, the moment of decision, and of crisis, between the remembered past and the anticipated but undetermined future.

zh: 第二卷的题目是《拉科塔社会》（Walker 1982b)，集中了与社会组织各方面和与时间、历史概念大致相关的文献。
en: The second volume to have appeared is Lakota Society (1982b), which assembles documents roughly relating to aspects of social organization, as well as concepts of time and history.

zh: 此书包括了大量“冬季合计”(Winter Counts)（拉科塔记录）和历史事件的个人回忆，这与质疑过于清晰地划分“有”历史和“没有”历史的人民的最近趋向一致（Rosddo1980；Price 1983)。
en: The inclusion of extensive Winter Counts (Lakota annals) and personal recollections of historical events confirms recent tendencies to question overly clear distinctions between peoples "with" and "without" history (Rosaldo 1980; Price 1983).

zh: 第三卷是《拉科塔神话》(Walker l983）最后一卷将包括译成英文的索德作品。
en: Volume three is Lakota Myth (1983).And the last will contain the translated writings of George Sword.

zh: 乔治˙索德是一位奧格拉拉武士，后成为松树岭的印第安人犯罪法庭（Court of Indian Offenses)的法官。
en: Sword was an Oglal a warrior, later a judge of the Court of Indian Offenses at Pine Ridge.

zh: 在沃克的鼓励之下，他详细地记录了当地的习俗生活，包括神话、仪式、战争与游戏，并附有他的自传
en: With Walker's encouragement, he wrote a detailed vernacular record of customary life, covering myth, ritual, warfare and games, complemented by an autobiography.

zh: 这张不同凡响的照片仅在两年前才出版——是我们时代的标志而不是他的时代的，我们不是从参与观察或(适合于阐释的）文化文本开始的，而是从写作、从制作文本开始的。
en: This remarkable picture was only published two years ago — a sign of our times, not his.We begin, not with participant-observation or with cultural texts (suitable for interpretation), but with writing, the making of texts.

zh: 写作不再是边缘或神秘的一维，而是作为人类学家在田野之中及之后工作的核心出现。
en: No longer a m arginal, or occulted, dimension, writing has emerged as central to what anthropologists do both in the held and thereafter.

zh: 人们直到最近才描绘或严肃地探讨写作，这一事实反映了主张再现的透明性和经验的直接性之意识形态的顽强。
en: The fact that it has not until recently been portrayed or seriously discussed reflects the persistence of an ideology claiming transparency of representation and immediacy of experience.

zh: 。按照这意识形态，写作被而化为方法：做好田野笔记.精确绘制地图，“详细描写”结果。
en: Writing reduced to method: keeping good field notes, making accurate maps, "writing up " results.

zh: 在人类历史中，人类起源和进化的故事尤为多产。每种文化都有其人类创造的神话，而且都会有进化故事出现（当然也有与之竞争的学说，例如神造论）。
en: Stories of human origins and evolution abound in human history.Every culture has its myth of human creation, and the story of evolution is within this genre(as also are competing doctrines,such as Creationism).

zh: 但进化论并不仅仅是一个故事，它是一个科学表达的理论，因此它可以激发人们进行研究。
en: But evolutionism is not only a story, it is a theory couched scientifically so that it stimulates research.

zh: 植物学家和地质学家与体质人类学家和考古学家通力合作，一起挖掘，加入所谓的跨学科团队工作，构建对未发现的过去的系统整合。
en: Botanists and geologists cooperate with physical anthropologists and archeologists as they all swarm around the dig, joining in so-called interdisciplinary teamwork to construct holistic syntheses of a past uncovered.

zh: 正统马克思主义之应用于人类学，正如在苏联所展现的情况那样，从这种观点来看，并没能超越对摩尔根划分的发展阶段的教条性接受，而这种观点早就被其他的人类学学派拋弃并归人本学科的历史之中了。
en: Orthodox Marxism's treatment of anthropology as purveyed in the Soviet Union had not, in this view, gone beyond a doctrinaire acceptance of Morgan's phases of development, which other anthropological schools had long since relegated to the historyof the discipline.

zh: 此外，尽管法国的马克思主义人类学家们很热爱摩尔根的人类学以及马克思本人的民族志笔记，但对他们来说，无论是马克思还是恩格斯都显然没有真正理解前资本主义社会，虽然他们能够接触到的人类学材料非常具有基础性作用。
en: In addition, despite French Marxist anthropologists' love of Morgan's anthropology and of Marx's own ethnological notebooks, it was clear that neither Marx nor Engels really understood precapitalist societies, though the anthropological materials available to them had been pretty basic.

zh: 和其他同代的马克思主义者一样，阿尔都塞对经典马克思主义仍然在宣称的各发展阶段的必然性提出了质疑因此他更深人地研究马克思并希望从中找到一个能够同时适用于阶级社会和无阶级社会的分析工具。
en: Althusser, like other contemporary Marxists, doubted the inevitability of the stages that orthodox Marxism still claimed.He therefore tried to dig deeper into Marx to find an analytical tool applicable to both class and nonclass societies.

zh: 他所找到的是生产方式（mode of production)这个概念。
en: What he came up with was the mode of production.

zh: 马克思主义人类学所有概念里最重要的是“生产方式” （mode of production)，这个概念出自卡尔•马克思的《资本论》第一卷 (特别参见 Mane 1974 [ 1867]: 667 -724)。
en: The most important of all concepts in Marxist anthropology is mode of production, based on Karl Marx’s ideas in Capital, Vol.i (see especially Marx 1974 [1867]: 667–724).

zh: 巴里•海因兹（Barry Hindess〉和保罗•赫斯特（Paul Hirst)对该词的用法作了经典注释 (Hindess and Hirst 1975: 9)。
en: The classic commentary on its usage is that by Barry Hindess and Paul Hirst (1975: 9).

zh: 他们将生产方式定义为“由生产关系的支配构成的生产关系和生产力相连接的结合”。
en: They define a mode of production as ‘an articulated combination of relations and forces of production structured by the dominance of the relations of production’.

zh: 民族志作者除了这些旨在树立其权威的技巧之外，还使用了别的手段 来直接构筑民族志呈现的有效性。
en: Aside from the devices the ethnographer uses to constitute his authority, he uses others to establish the validity of his ethnographic presentations directly.

zh: 我要列出卡特林、歌德和格尔茨在某种程度上使用过的其中三种技巧，他们藉此取得了大小不同的成功。
en: I single out three of these, which are used to various extents and with variable success by Catlin, Goethe, and Geertz.

zh: 生动叙述（hypotyposis)在卡特林文中占据了主导地位。
en: In Catlin it is a hypotyposis that predominates.

zh: 歌德的技巧是外部的（不是隐喻的说法）戏剧性叙述（narrativity）。
en: In Goethe it is an external (nonmetaphorical) theatrical narrativity.

zh: 格尔茨则主要依赖阐释技巧（interpretive virtuosity)。
en: Geertz depends primarily on interpretive virtuosity.

zh: 在所有三个个案中，正如我们将要看到的，正是作者用来使其读者——以及他们自己——相信其描述的那些辞（figure）其实恰恰质疑了这些描述，而且在所有三个个案里而，一种制度性地合法化了的对“意义”的关注掩盖了取信的失败.
en: In all three cases, as we shall see, the very figures the authors use to convince their readers—and themselves—of their descriptions in fact render them suspect, and in all three cases this failure to convince is covered by an institutionally legitimated concern for "meaning."

zh: 随后，特纳认为，繁荣的生活圈存在于确立的结构之间。

en: Turner shows, then, a communitas that flourishes in the "liminal" interstices of society, outside and in between the established structures.

zh: 格鲁克曼、道格拉斯和特纳全都肯定社区生活的力量，肯定小群体严密的组织、厚实的交织，维持一个强大的整体。
en: Gluckman, Douglas, and Turner all affirm the strength of community life, how the tightly knit, thickly braided entanglements of the small group sustain a strong unity.

zh: 因为人类所具有的可塑性、创造性和坏脾气，没有哪个纯粹“机械”的社会能够存在；但是社会人类学可以让我们了解，社会关系怎样以它们紧密连接、共同加强的方式发挥作用，维持社区的存在。
en: No purely "mechanical" society can exist, for humans are too plastic, creative, and ornery; but social anthropology brings home to us how social relationships function in their interlocking, mutually reinforcing ways to sustain the community.

zh: 然而他们忽略了这样一个赤裸裸的事实：西方世界的生活水平是建立在对不可再生资源的巨大消耗率基础之上的；他世界总人足50%,但却消耗了这些资源中远远超出50%的部分。例如，到20世纪70年代,美国人——不足世界总人口的（大约）5%——消耗着全世界资源的 50%还要多。
en: Overlooked is the stark fact the standard of living in the Western world is based on a rate of consumption of nonrenewable resources whereby far less than 50% of the worlds population uses a good deal more than 50% of these resources.By the early 1970s, for example, the people of the United States—less than 5% (approximately) of the world’s population—were consuming more than 50% of all the world's resources.

zh: 像这样的数据说明，期望世界上大多数民族在最近的将来都达到像西方世界那样的生活水平，是不现实的。
en: Figures such as this suggest it is not realistic to expect most peoples of the world to achieve a standard of living comparable to that of the Western world in the near future, if at all.

zh: 至少，西方世界的国家将不得不大大削减他们的资源消耗。
en: At the very least, the countries of the Western world would have to cut drastically their consumption of resources.

zh: 然而，我个人则倾向于联系“社会契约”的概念和人类天性、社会， 以及源自该概念的文化多样性等观念开始探讨人类学。
en: My choice, though, would be with the concept of the ‘social contract’, and the perceptions of human nature, society, and cultural diversity which emerged from this concept.

zh: 这就是我在 本书中的起点。
en: This is where I shall begin.

zh: 另外一个原本无关的起点是生命巨链（Great Chain of Being)的观点，它将人类位置确定在神和动物之间。
en: Another, essentially unrelated, beginning is the idea of the Great Chain of Being, which defined the place of the human species as between God and the animals.

zh: 在某些方面这个观点是进化论思想的先驱，在本章中我们将会在相关场景中审视这一观点。
en: This idea was in some respects a forerunner of the theory of evolution, and later in this chapter we shall look at it in that context.

zh: 例如，反结构在线性状态中可以被找到，在这一状态中，当人们在生命礼仪中经过童年进人成年，新加人的人会暂停下来。

en: Anti-structure,forexample, is found in the "liminal" state in which initiates are suspended as they pass from childhood to adulthood in rites of passage.

zh: 新加入的人既不是孩子也不是成人，而是位于这两个确立状态“之间”。
en: Initiates are neither child nor adult, they are "betwixt and between" these established statuses.

zh: 不过，在这一线性状态，新加入的人享受这种来自共有的苦难的团结和同伴关系。
en: Yet in this "liminal" state, the initiates enjoy that unity and fellowship which comes from shared suffering.

zh: 生态系统方法论在某些方面有助于淡化文化的概念。
正如艾伦（Ellen) (1982 :76)和莫兰（Moran) (1990:3)所述，在人类学领域，接受生态模式理论是反对把文化概念看作是有问题的一种反应。
文化决定论无法解释生态关系已是不言自明的事实，文化观念作为封闭系统的看法也已被贸易网络及其他各种跨越文化界线的事实所否认。
en: The inability of cultural determinism to address ecological relations was becoming clear, and the image of cultures as closed systems was everywhere denied by evidence of trading networks and other forms of exchange which spanned the boundaries between cultures.

zh: 生态系统模式为将人类社会的外部关系拓展为值得研究的领域提供了新的视角，同时也维持了强调生态学的传统，使其有别于民族生态学。
