en: The ecosystem model provided a way of reclaiming the external relations of human societies as a respectable field of study, and maintained an emphasis on ecology, as distinct from ethnoecology.

zh: 关于自然，人类学有两种主要的观念：外部自然或曰生态系统，内部自然或称人类天性。
en: Anthropology has two main kinds of concepts about nature: external nature, or the ecosystem, and inner nature, or human nature.

zh: 这两种观念代表文化的相反面。
en: Both of these concepts represent the opposite of culture.

zh: 有文化的东西总是区别于自然，而且文化总是意味着转变自然的东西，某些时候甚至是否定。
en: What is cultural is always something other than nature, and culture always implies a transformation, and sometimes a denial, of that which is natural.

zh: 列维-斯特劳斯的格言，所有的人类社会都区分文化和自然，被很多人类学家所接受（但是也被另外一些人类学家所质疑，参见Descola和Pálsson的相关著作，1996）。
en: Lévi-Strauss's axiom that all human societies distinguish between culture and nature is accepted by many anthropologists (but challenged by others, see the contributions to Descola and Pálsson 1996).

zh: 有时，我们非人性化的环境显得像是对人类事业的一种主要威胁：它们似乎会破坏我们的庄稼，杀死我们的牲畜，等等。
en: Our non-humanised surroundings may sometimes appear as a major threat to human projects: they may threaten to destroy our crops, kill our livestock and so on.

zh: 每一个文化事业似乎都暗含着一种对外部自然和内部自然的同时转变。
en: Every cultural project seems to imply a transformation of both external and human nature.

zh: 也许今天没有任何一位人类学家在写作时不把人与环境之间的关系描述为决定性的，要么是人类决定环境，要么是环境决定人类。
en: Probably no anthropologist writing today would describe the relationship between human beings and their environments as deterministic, in either direction.

zh: 但现在人们一改过去对环境因素塑造或被塑造的关注，开始从人与环境互惠的角度对文化理论进行改进，并以开放的姿态，关注人类与其生存环境的互动关系。
en: Instead of either shaping or being shaped by environmental factors, human beings are understood to interact with their environments in mutually constitutive ways.

zh: 有两种模式对文化理论具有重要的启发性：首先是生态系统模式，此模式在19世纪60年代以来一直在生态人类学领域占据着支配地位，其次是认知的概念，只是在近五年左右才由心理学引人人类学领域。
en: Within this broad approach, two models in particular have important implications for cultural theory: first, the ecosystem model, which has been prominent in ecological anthropology since the late 1960s, and second, the concept of direct perception, which has entered anthropological thought from psychology only during the past five years or so.

zh: 此外，人类学必须要成为非专门化的“跨学科的学科”，因为只有整体综合（也许似乎有些业余性）运用各种形态的信息才有望抓住处于文化建构和社会互动中的世界的“巨大的复杂性”（Bateson 1959: 296）。
en: Furthermore, anthropology had to be a non-specialist, ‘interdisciplinary discipline’ because only in a holistic(however seemingly seeming amateurish) use of all manner ofinformation could it expect to tackle the ‘vast intricacies’ of the worlds of cultural construction and social interaction (Bateson 1959:296).

zh: 因此，人类学理解需要与人种学、生态学、生物学、哲学、美学以及心理分析联系起来。
en: Hence the need for an anthropological understanding to connect up with ethnology, ecology, biology, philosophy, aesthetics and psychoanalysis.

zh: 这将会带来新的生态世界观，美学和意识能在此合二为一的形成“神圣的”关于生活惟一性以及生活一元实体论的认识。
en: This might then give onto a new ecological world-view where aesthetics and consciousness combined to form a ‘sacred’recognition of the one-ness of life, of life’s ontological monism.

zh: 但是即使在工业社会的条件下，反全球论视角也不等同于近年来一些研究提出的激进环境决定论。
en: But even within the context of industrial society, the antiglobalist perspective does not amount to what more recent analyses have identified as radical environmentalism.

zh: 对于多布森（Dobson) (1990) 和厄科斯雷 （Ecker Sley)(1992) 而言， 更为激进的环境决定论（他们分别称其为“生态主义”和“生态中心主义”）认为环境具有一种不依赖于其对人类的有用性而存在的价值，要正确对待环境，人类就必须视自己为生态系统中的一个元素，而不是宇宙的中心。
en: For both Dobson (1990) and Eckersley (1992), the more radical form of environmentalism (to which they refer, respectively, as "ecologism" and "ecocentrism") is based on the understanding that the environment has a value independent of its use to human beings and that our proper treatment of it requires us to see ourselves as just one element in an ecological system rather than as the centre of the universe.

zh: 联系这种观点，则上述环境辩论中的两种视角都称不上是激进的，因为他们争论的是资源利用的模式，除了这种人与自然的关系之外其他的都不属于这场辩论的范畴。
en: In relation to this view, neither perspective engaged in the debate analysed above can properly be seen as radical, for they are competing models of resource use.The debate is defined in terms which do not admit any other understanding of humanenvironment relations.

zh: 本书所收的文章并不代表一个内在一致的“人类学”(Wolf 1980)内部的一种趋向或视角。
en: The present essays do not represent a tendency or perspective within a coherent "anthropology" (pace Wolf 1980).

zh: 旧有的人类学定义包括学科“四领域”：体质（或生物”人类学，考古学，文化(或社会）人类学和语言学，对此博厄斯可能是最后一个鉴赏者了。
en: The "four-field" definition of the discipline, of which Boas was perhaps the last virtuoso, included physical (or biological) anthropology, archaeology, cultural (or social) anthropology, and linguistics.

zh: 今天很少有人能够严肃地说这些领域共享统一的方法或研究对象，尽管主要因为制度安排，这一梦想还在持续。
en: Few today can seriously claim that these fields share a unified approach or object, though the dream persists, thanks largely to institutional arrangements.

zh: 本书的文章占据了一片新天地，这是作为整个学科的终极目标的“人”的瓦解所开放出来的。它们吸收了文本批评、文化史学、符号学、哲学阐释学和心理分析领域的最近发展成果。
en: The essays in this volume occupy a new space opened up by the disintegration of "Man" as telos for a whole discipline, and they draw on recent developments in the fields of textual criticism, cultural history, semiotics, hermeneutic philosophy, and psychoanalysis.

zh: 人类学越来越有兴趣去纠正那些被高度的功能主义和结构主义拋弃或剔除的事物，相应调整他们的唯物主义加理性主义的世界观。
en: There is an increasing interest within anthropology to rectify the deletions and excesses of high functionalism and structuralism, along with their materialist-cum-rationalist world-view.

zh: 这种趋向强调理解文化表述的高度重要性，包括当地人眼中的神话。
en: The trend is to stress the foremost importance of understanding cultural expression, including the mythic, from indigenous points of view.

zh: 就像马凌诺夫斯基（Malinowski 1926: 18)观察到的那样，参与到神话诗学中的人相信“神话是活生生的现实”。
en: As Malinowski observed (1926:18), for people who engage with mythopoetics, myth is "reality lived".

zh: 许多人类学家如今希望去理解神话在日常生活中的运用，它们作为消遣、教育、治疗和阐释的表述价值，以及作为知识和丰富诗歌的明证（Brady 1991a；Turner and Bruner 1986)。
en: Many anthropologists now wish to understand the context of the use of myths in everyday life, their performative value as entertainment, as pedagogy, cure and explanation—and as evidence of knowledge and a rich poetics (cf. Brady 1991a; Turner and Bruner 1986).

zh: 把易洛魁人和欧洲人作一番比较同样是有教益的。
en: A comparison between the Iroquois and Europeans is also instructive.

zh: 在16世纪的某个时期（如果不是更早的话），五个易洛魁民族——莫霍克人、奥奈达人、奥农多加人、卡尤加人和塞尼卡人——决定用一个简单的办法来结束他们之间的战争，即把他们的掠夺活动指向外人，而非相互掠夺。
en: Sometime in the 16th century, five Iroquoian nations—the Mohawks, Oneidas, Onondagas, Cayugas, and Senecas—determined to end warfare among themselves by the simple device of directing their predatory activities against outsiders, rather than each other.

zh: 因此著名的易洛魁邦联诞生了。
en: In this way the famous League of the Iroquois came into being.

zh: 类似地，1095年罗马教皇乌尔班二世在发动十字军东征的时候，用这样的演讲鼓动欧洲的基督教贵族们：要结束他们相互之间无休止的战争，一致对外，将敌意转向信奉伊斯兰教的土耳其人和阿拉伯人。
en: Similarly, in the year 1095, Pope Urban II launched the Crusades with a speech urging European barons to end their ceaseless wars against each other by directing their hostilities outward against the Turks and Arabs.

zh: 在一个以连续性而非以变迁为主题的段落里，勒华拉杜里把过去和现在都空间化了。
en: In a passage that thematizes continuity more than change, Le Roy Ladurie spatializes the then and the now.

zh: 他在弯曲的街上看到了连续性，更特别的是，他在海拔高度和气候上也看到了连续性。
en: He sees continuity in a curving street and, more peculiarly, in the altitude and the climate.

zh: 自从14世纪初以来，这个村子的海拔和天气可能已经发生了很大的变化吗？
en: Could the village's elevation and weather have changed much since the early fourteenth century?

zh: 但是，就是这种长时段连续性的意识诱导这位历史学家去犯他的学科的重罪：时间错误anachmnism)。
en: Yet this very sense of long-term continuity tempts the historian into committing his discipline's cardinal sin: anachronism.

zh: 在1970年代的各项进展中，我们可以发现一条不断扩大的裂痕：一方是唯物主义、马克思主义和政治经济学的观点。另一方是唯心主义、象征主义和解释学的观点。
en: In the developments of the 1970s one can see a widening breach: between the perspectives of materialism, Marxism, and political economy, on the one hand, and those of idealism, symbolism, and interpretivism, on the other.

zh: 尽管如此，仍然存在着弥补这种裂痕的尝试。
en: However, there were also efforts to bridge this divide.

zh: 谢里˙奥特纳在术语“实践理论”（practice theory)的名义下进行的许多这样的努力都以失败而告终（Ortner 1984)。
en: Sherry Ortner collapsed a number of such efforts under the term practice theory (1984).

zh: “实践理论”并不是一个单一的范式，而是一个结合了行动者导向和结构导向理论的概念——随着安东尼˙吉登斯著作的问世，能动性 (agency)和结构（structure)成为人们青睐的术语。
en: This was not a single paradigm but a concept that brought together actor-oriented and structure-oriented theories—agency and structure became the preferred terms once Anthony Giddens's work was known.

zh: 人类学，实际上既是推理的也是归的（因为它既受理论和研究者其他心理构建的引导，也受被研究的事实的引导），既是内省的也是外省的（因为理解他者也包括理解自身），同时还是实验的（因为一个人是积极主动地参与社会生活而不是被动地记录数据）。
en: Anthropology is, in fact, deductive as well as inductive (because it is guided by theory and other mental constructions of the researcher as well as based on facts researched), introspective as well as extrospective (because understanding of the other entails understanding of the self), and experimental (because one is actively participating in social life rather than passively recording data).

zh: 田野工作是“反身性的”。
en: Fieldwork is "reflexive".

zh: 尽管它包含所有这些元素——推理、内省和实验——人类学还是与像哲学、心理学这样的学科有着明确的区分，后两个学科主要强调它们自己。
en: Despite its containing all these elements – deduction, introspection, and experimentation – anthropology is distinct from such disciplines as philosophy and psychology, which emphasize them.

zh: 人类学独特的重点依然是以田野工作为基础去理解人类的体验。
en: Anthropology's distinctive emphasis remains understanding of human experience based on fieldwork.

zh: 战后对殖民主义的批评——削弱了“西方”再现其他社会的能力——为理论化再现自身的局限之重要过程所强化。
en: The critique of colonialism in the postwar period — an undermining of "The West's" ability to represent other societies—has been reinforced by an important process of theorizing about the limits of representation itself.

zh: 我们没办法充分调査对维柯(Vico)称之为文化史的“严肃诗歌”的各种各样的批评。
en: There is no way adequately to survey this multifarious critique of what Vico called the "serious poem" of cultural history.

zh: 立场层出不穷：“阐释学”、“结构中义”、“心态史”、“新马克思主义”、“谱系学”、“后结构主义”、“后现代主义”、“实用主义”，还有大量“替代性认识论”——女性主义的、民族的、非西方的。
en: Positions proliferate: "hermeneutics," "structuralism," "history of mentalities," "neo-Marxism," "genealogy," "post-structuralism," "post-modernism," "pragmatism"; also a spate of "alternate epistemologies" — feminist, ethnic, and non-Western.

zh: 至关重要但并非总是得到承认的一环，是正在进行的对西方最自信、最有特色的话语的批评。
en: What is at stake, but not always recognized, is an ongoing critique of the West's most confident, characteristic discourses.

zh: 1970年代中期，这种立足实践而对实证主义的高理论的攻击其本身也是在一种抽象的理论讨论样式中进行的，既脱离于也指向各种实践体裁。
en: During the mid-1970s, this practice-focused attack on positivist high theory was itself conducted within the genre of abstract theoretical discussion, separate from, and pointing to, genres of practice.

zh: 到1980年代，这种批评进入到悬置范式权威的阶段，同时也质疑体系构建的效用。它赞成在对社会生括作特定记述处理方面进行自由操作和实验，在高理论方面对实证主义的挑战重点开始转为在本质更加民族志化和更具实验性，其中一个杰出的例子就是理査德˙J˙伯恩斯坦（Richard J. Bernstein）正在开展的工作。
en: By the 1980s, this critique has moved to a suspension of paradigmatic authority and a questioning of the utility of system building in favor of free play and experimentation in the specific rendering of accounts of social life.A perfect example of the shift in emphasis toward the more substantively ethnographic and experimental among the "high" theory treatments of the challenge to positivism is the evolving work of Richard J. Bernstein.

zh: 列维-斯特劳斯在《忧郁的热带》（1961）中“一小杯朗姆酒”那章，谈到两种遏制他者的危险的办法之间的对立，食人肉和吐人肉（Bauman 1995: 179-80）。
en: Lévi-Strauss, in the chapter entitled ‘A Little Glass of Rum’ in Tristes Tropiques (1961), discusses the contrast between two solutions for neutralizing the dangers of the other, the anthropophagic versus the anthropoemic strategy (cf. Bauman 1995:179–80).

zh: 他指出，首先食人肉无疑会引起西方人最强烈的恐惧与厌恶。

en: He notes that the first, the strategy of cannibalism, is repellent to Western sensibilities as the most barbaric of all customs.

zh: 可是在亚马逊的土著中存在一种普遍观念，即要增强自身的力量就只能消化掉危险的他者的力量（Overing Kaplan 1981）。
en: It is, however, a widely spread notion of native Amazonia that the powers of the self acquire their human potency only by assimilating the powers of dangerous others (Overing Kaplan 1981).

zh: 为了与这个模型相一致，列维-斯特劳斯认为很可能是这样：同族相食（endocannibals）（他们吃死去的亲戚的部分身体）会煮熟了吃，而异族相食（exocannibals）（他们吃敌人的身体）会烤着吃。
en: In accordance with this model, Lévi-Strauss held that it was likely that endocannibals (who eat parts of deceased relatives) would boil them, while exocannibals (who eat enemies) would roast them.

zh: 为了验证这个“假说”，哈佛大学的人类学家保罗·尚克曼（Paul Shankman）处理了60个被认为是食人族社会的资料，他发现，有17个是煮着吃的，而有20个是烤着吃的，还有6个是既煮着吃又烤着吃，其余的使用了其他食用技术，包括烘焙。
en: In a bid to test the 'hypothesis', the Harvard anthropologist Paul Shankman processed data from sixty societies assumed to practise cannibalism.He found that seventeen boiled while twenty roasted; six did both.The rest used other techniques for preparation, including baking.

zh: 而且，尚克曼发现，在食用对象的分类和备办的方法之间没有相关性（Harris 1979）。
en: Shankman found, further, that there was no correlation between the categorisation of the eaten and the mode of preparation(Harris 1979).

zh: 当早期原人的某些种群开始制造他们可用来屠宰动物以得到肉食的石制工具时，人类的文化看来就已经发展起来了。
en: Human culture appears to have developed as some populations of early hominines began making stone tools they could butcher animals with for their meat.

zh: 最早的石制工具和值得注意的食肉证据，与人类出现一起，可追溯到约250万年前，人脑显著地扩大，超过任何其他早期原人的脑。
en: Actually, the earliest stone tools and evidence of significant meat eating date to between 2.5 million and 2 million years ago, along with the appearance of the genus Homo, whose brain was significantly enlarged over that of any other early hominine.

zh: 从那时起，习得的行为——文化——在人的持续生存中越来越重要，有助于更好的人脑的演化，反过来，更好的人脑使作为手段的文化改进成为可能，人类借助文化手段保证他们的持续生存。
en: From then on the increasing importance of culture in human survival favored the evolution of a better brain, which in turn made possible improvement in culture as the vehicle humans used to secure their survival.

zh: 在40万年前到20万年前之间，人脑的脑量达到现代人脑的大小，而文化则一直到现在还在不断地演化和变化。
寻食是最古老、最普遍类型的人类调适。
en: Food foraging is the oldest and most universal type of human adaptation.

zh: 我们应把社会组织的重要要素归功于性別分工、食物分享，以及作为日常活动中心的大本营，而且在那里实现食物的分享。
en: To it we owe such important elements of social organization as the sexual division of labor, food sharing, and a home base as the center of daily activity and where food sharing is accomplished.

zh: 完全不同的调适，包括农业和畜牧业，在世界某些地区在9000—11000年前开始发展起来。
en: Quite different adaptations, involving farming and animal husbandry, began to develop in some parts of the world between 9,000 and 11,000 years ago.

zh: 借助于简单的手工工具种植家用植物的园艺，使比较永久的定居以及分工的重组成为可能在畜牧条件下，依靠放牧的家畜群，游牧生活得以持续，但是与其他民族互动的新模式发展起来了。
en: Horticulture—the cultivation of domestic plants with simple hand tools—made possible more permanent settlements and a reorganization of the division of labor Under pastoralism—reliance on raising herds of domestic animalsnomadism continued, but new modes of interaction with other peoples were developed.

zh: 传奇可能含有神话情节——特别是当它们诉诸超自然力量的时候——因此一直没有与神话截然分开。
en: Legends may incorporate mythological details, especially when they make an appeal to the supernatural, and are therefore not always clearly distinct from myth.

zh: 尼扬加民族的姆文多史诗仿效姆文多穿越大地、大气层、阴间和遥远的天空，为尼扬加民族关于他们世界的组织和界线的观点画了一幅全景图。
en: The Mwindo epic of the Nyanga people follows him through the earth, the atmosphere, the underworld, and the remote sky and gives a complete picture of the Nyanga people's view of their world's organization and limits.

zh: 传奇可能还包含谚语和附带的传说，因而可能与其他口头艺术形式相联系。
en: Legends also may incorporate proverbs and incidental tales and thus may be related to other forms of verbal art as well.

zh: 例如，门德人的坎姆比利史诗据说包含多达150条谚语。
en: A recitation of the Kambili epic of the Mande, for example, has been said to include as many as 150 proverbs.

zh: 在位于人口不太稠密的新几内亚高地边缘的社会中，恩加人的次级氏族是接近于最大规模合伙亲属群体的单位，如甄巴加人那样（参见第六章）。
en: The Enga subclan is a unit approximately the size of the largest corporate kin groups in societies occupying the less densely populated highland fringe of New Guinea, such as theTsembaga [see Chapter 6].

zh: 但是，恩加人组织为更高一级的群体（也以父系继嗣为基础），即氏族。每个氏族平均约有350个成员，他们是氏族领土的最终拥有者和捍卫者,所有氏族成员最终从氏族那里获得其生计。
en: But the Enga are organized into a still higher level grouping （also based on patrilineal descent）, the clan, which averages about 350 members and is the ultimate owner and defender of the territory of the dart, from which all clan members ultimately derive their subsistence.

zh: 氏族自身小心谨慎地界定领土并在战斗中以及在庆典场合中桿卫它们。
en: Clans own carefully defined territories and defend them both in battle and on ceremonial occasions.

zh: 头人领导他们，在氏族之间的关系方面为氏族代言，并在氏族内部工作，动员独立的家庭进行军事、政治和庆典的活动。
en: They are led by Big Men who speak for their clans in interclan relations and who work within their clans to mobilize the separate households for military, political, and ceremonial action.

zh: 最年幼的和最年长的有权不参加劳动，女人主要负责农活，只有男人外出打猎。村子的首领和巫师是村子里的最高权威。
en: The youngest and the oldest are entitled not to work, while the women are mainly responsible for agricultural activities, and only the men go hunting.The village headman and the shaman are the highest authorities in the villages.

zh: 这些职务都不是世袭的；他们要通过出色的人品和与他人对权力的角逐才能获得。
en: Neither of these offices is hereditary; they are achieved through outstanding personal qualities and through successfully competing for power with others.

zh: 因为劳动分工非常简单，也许每个家户各管各的事情有好处。
en: Since the division of labour is rather simple, it might be thought an advantage for each household to run its own business independently.

zh: 但是，让雅诺马马人大规模地团结在一起有更加充分的理由。
en: However, there are sound reasons for the Yanomamö to stick together in larger groups.

zh: 首先，有必须集体完成的任务，比如狩猎和典礼。
en: First, there are necessary tasks which have to be done collectively, such as hunting and rituals.

zh: 其次，雅诺马马人定期地卷入与邻村人的世仇中，很自然，当他们经常面对这种情形时，人数众多既更加有力量也会更加安全。
en: Second, the Yanomamö are periodically involved in feuds with their neighbours, and naturally there is both strength and security in numbers when they are regularly faced with this kind of situation.

zh: 夏威夷亲属称谓制（Hawaiian system)，在夏威夷和其他说马来一波利尼西业语的地区很普遍，但同时也能在其他地方发现。它是最简单的亲属称谓制，因为它使用的称呼最少。
en: The Hawaiian system of kinship terminology, common (as its name implies) in Hawaii and other Malayo-Polynesian-speaking areas but found elsewhere as well, is the least complex system, in that it uses the fewest terms.

zh: 夏威夷制又称世代制，因为同代同性别的亲属都用同一称呼指称（参见图10.6）。
en: The Hawaiian system is also called the generational system, since all relatives of the same generation and sex are referred to by the same term (Figure 10.6).

zh: 例如，在某人父母那一辈里，用来称呼其父亲的那个词也被用来称呼其父亲的兄弟和其母亲的兄弟。
en: For example, in one's parents' generation, the term used to refer to one's father is used as well for the father^ brother and mother's brother.

zh: 相似地，某人的母亲、母亲的姐妹，以及某人父亲的姐妹也都被归于同一个称呼之下。
en: Similarly, one's mother, her sister, and one's father's sister are all lumped under a single term.

zh: 寻食民族与食物生产民族之间另外一个不同点是世界观（worldviews）的不同。
en: Another difference between food-gathering and food-producing populations lies in their different worldviews.

zh: 一般而言，寻食者倾向于把他们自己看成是自然界的一部分，并与之保持某种平衡关系。
en: As a general rule, food foragers tend to conceive of themselves as a part of the natural world and in some sort of balance with it.

zh: 这一点反映在他们对所杀动物的态度上。
en: This is reflected in their attitudes toward the animals they kill.

zh: 例如，西部的阿贝那基人的猎手认为，动物和人一样是由肉体和灵魂组成的。
en: Western Abenaki hunters, for example, thought animals, like humans, were composed of both a body and a personal spirit.

zh: 虽然阿贝那基人猎杀动物来维持他们自己的生存，但他们明显意识到，动物应得到适当的尊重
en: Although Abenakis hunted and killed animals to sustain their own lives, they clearly recognized that animals were entitled to proper respect.

zh: 人类学不再带着启动的权威替那些被界定为不能为自己说话的人(“原始的”“前文字的'“无历史的”）说话。
en: Anthropology no longer speaks with automatic authority for others defined as unable to speak for themselves ("primitive," "pre-literate," "without history").

zh: 其他人群不再那么容易被抛入特殊的、几乎总是过去或正在过去的时代——把他们表现得仿佛他们没被包含在当下的世界体系之中，而正是这些世界体系把民族志学者和他们所研究的人民一道牵连其中。
en: Other groups can less easily be distanced in special, almost always past or passing, times—represented as if they were not involved in the present world systems that implicate ethnographers along with the peoples they study.

zh: “文化”并非为了他们的描绘而静止不动，试图使文化保持静态，必然包含了简化和排除，选择暂时的焦点，建构特定的自我-他者关系，以及一种权力关系的强加或讨价还价。
en: "Cultures" do not hold still for their portraits.Attempts to make them do so always involve simplification and exclusion, selection of a temporal focus, the construction of a particular self-other relationship, and the imposition or negotiation of a power relationship.

zh: 如果说对民族主义的彻底贬低是一个陷阱，那么另一个相关的陷阱也许就是对世界主义的绝对髙估。这是另一个问题。
en: If one pitfall lies in the absolute devaluation of nationalism, another related pitfall may lie in the absolute overvaluation of cosmopolitanism.

zh: 我们不能认为世界主义已经超越了民族主义的混乱，尽管有人这么认为。
en: This is the beginning of another story, but we cannot assume that cosmopolitanism – however conceived – is free from the equivocations which unsettle nationalism.

zh: 世界主义不是神药，它也不能超越现实政治世界的矛盾。
en: Cosmopolitanism is not a miraculous physic and cannot be above the contradictions of our political world

zh: 一个引人注意的现象是，“神话”作为一个词汇进入英语辞典是相当晚近的事，大约在19世纪早期才开始出现（Williams 1983a [1976])。
en: It is significant that "myth" as a word came late into the English lexicon, appearing only in the early nineteenth century (Williams 1983a [1976]).

zh: 它带着从古希腊理性主义者那里继承的传统进入语言体系，而且对理性和非理性进行辩论的目的是为了发现真理。
en: Its entry into the language carried with it the tradition inherited from the rationalist intellectuals of Classical Greece, and their debate on the rational and the irrational in their endeavours to discover truth.

zh: 这一词汇在欧洲 逐渐普及的过程，很大程度上与世俗化的进程有关，特别是科学在与教会和其他力量的斗争中通过宣称掌握现实的真理从而取得支配地位。
en: The growth of the popularity of the word in the European context is most likely associated with the process of secularization, and especially the battle of the sciences for ascendancy over the church and other powers in their "truth-claims" about reality.

zh: 这位国王决意在原型民族主义（protonationalist）这一最基本的君权统治以及封建主义政治经济结构的背后动员有组织的并且合法的力量来制约教会的势力，尽管法令本身矛盾重重，但是其原则就是要反对天主教会所主张的国际主义（internationalism)、教义的普及和学习以及任何潜在的社会流动性。天主教会的这些主张是克吕尼改革的集中体现，其目的在于应对世俗权威应凌驾于教会之上的观点（Caesaropapalism)的挑战。
en: They represent Henry's most determined attempt to mobilize the sanctions of organized and legitimate force behind the protonationalist monarchy and behind the politicoeconomic structures of feudalism, which with all their internal contradictions represent a principle opposed to the internationalism,learning, and potential social mobility then represented by the Catholic church, in the fine fleur of the Cluniac reform and before the emergent arrogance of Caesaropapalism.

zh: 贝克特没有同主教们协商就对亨利的要求妥协和迁就，这令他们十分失望和不满。
en: Becket dismayed the other bishops by giving way, without consulting them, to Henry's demands.

zh: 人们对被统称为世系理论的东西出现了一种不安，这是在逻辑和抽象意义上呈现的结构与现实状况之间经常出现的差异所导致的结果。
en: A certain unease with what can broadly be called lineage theory emerged as a result of the gap that often appeared between the structures as they were logically and abstractly presented and what seemed to be the facts on the ground.

zh: 埃文思-普里查德自己记录了努尔人中存在于他所描述的想象中的共同世系群体（1951)与实际存在的居民社区之间的不一致。
en: Evans-Pritchard himself had documented the disparity among the Nuer between the supposedly corporate lineage groups he described (1951) and the residential communities that existed in actuality.

zh: 在每一个村庄和领地内，相当多的村民原来都不是根据“主导”氏族的祖先来追溯血统的；这些村民也许是母系亲属、姻亲或只是依附者。
en: In every village and territory a significant number of villagers turned out not to trace descent from the ancestor of the "dominant" clan; these villagers might be matrilateral kin, affines, or mere hangers-on.

zh: 为了解答这一问题，埃文思-普里查德声称，对于努尔人来说，分支的系谱提供了地域分支的概念模型，因此出现的差异其实是无关紧要的。
en: Evans-Pritchard resolved the question by claiming that, for the Nuer, the segmentary genealogy provided the conceptual model of territorial segmentation, and so the disparity was made moot.

zh: 如西南亚的早期城市一样，阿兹特克人社会的基础是集约农业。
en: As in the early cities of southwest Asia, the foundation of Aztec society was intensive agriculture.

zh: 玉米是主要的作物，每个家庭由其世系群分配一份土地，种植各种各样的作物，包括大豆、南瓜、葫芦、胡椒、西红柿、棉花和烟草。
en: Com was the principal crop.Each family, allotted a plot of land by its lineage, cultivated any of a number of crops, including beans, squash, gourds, peppers, tomatoes, cotton, and tobacco.

zh: 然而，与旧世界的社会不同，只有几种动物是驯养的；这些动物包括狗和火鸡（都是供食用的）。
en: Unlike Old World societies, however, only a few animals were domesticated; these included dogs and turkeys (both for eating).

zh: 许多（但不是全部）庄稼种在特诺奇蒂特兰城周围的小块土地上，该城是在四周环湖的浅水中由人工建造的。
en: Many of the crops were grown in around Tenochtitlan in plots actually constructed artificially in the shallow waters of the surrounding lake.

zh: 在园圃或突起的田地之间的水道，不仅便于运输，而且也是用作堆肥的水生植物的来源。
en: Canals between these chinampas not only facilitated transport but were also a source of water plants used for heavy mulching.

zh: 非工业社会的人们通过互惠、再分配和市场交换过程来交换物品。
en: Nonindustrial peoples exchange goods through the processes of reciprocity, redistribution, and market exchange.

zh: 互惠包括大致相等价值的物品和服务的交换，而且它往往是为仪式目的或为获得尊重而进行的。
en: Reciprocity involves the exchange of goods and services of roughly equivalent value, and it is often undertaken for ritual purposes or in order to gain prestige.

zh: 再分配需要某种政府和(或)宗教精英，以物品或以服务的形式去搜集资源，然后，把它们再分配出去。
en: Redistribution requires some sort of government and/or religious elite to collect and then reallocate resources in the form of either goods or services.

zh: 在非工业社会中，市场交换意指到专门的地点直接交换物品，它也起消遣作用，并作为交换重要信息的手段起作用。后者往往是促使人们到集市去的主要驱动力。
en: Market exchange, which in nonindustrial societies means going to a specific place for direct exchange of goods, also serves as entertainment and as a way to exchange important information.The latter two are frequently primary motivating forces bringing people into the marketplace.

zh: 北美人类学家利奧波德•波西皮西尔1955年对新几内亚西部的山民巴布亚卡保库人的研究，可以说明文化在经济、政治和社会方面的整合。
en: The integration of the economic, political, and social aspects of a culture can be illustrated by the Kapauku Papuans, a mountain people of western New Guinea studied in 1955 by North American anthropologist Leopold Pospisil.

zh: 卡保库人的经济依赖植物耕作，以及养猪、狩猎和捕鱼。
en: The Kapauku economy relies on plant cultivation, along with pig breeding, hunting, and fishing.

zh: 尽管植物耕作提供了人们大部分的食物，但是，男子只有通过养猪才能获得政治权力和合法权威的地位。
en: Although plant cultivation provides most of the peopled food, men achieve political power and positions of legal authority through pig breeding.

zh: 在卡保库人那里，养猪是复杂的事务。
en: Among the Kapauku, pig breeding is a complex business.

zh: 饲养许多头猪显然需要许多食物。
en: Raising lots of pigs, obviously, requires a lot of food to feed them.

zh: 尽管继嗣群体在许多社会都很重要，但并非在所有社会都能发现继嗣群体，它们也不是所能发现的扩大亲属群体的唯一种类。
en: Important though descent groups are in many societies, they are not found in all societies nor are they the only kinds of nonfamilial kinship groups found.

zh: 双边亲属关系（有时被错误地称为双边继嗣）是西方社会的一个特点，也是很多食物采集社会的一个特点。它通过男女两性把一个人与其他近“血缘"亲戚（而非姻亲）联系起来，换句话说，个体是通过他的父母双方、所有的袓父母外袓父母四人等等来追溯他的系，并承认其多个祖先。
en: Bilateral descent, a characteristic of Western society as well as a number of food-foraging societies, affiliates a person with close relatives through both sexes; in other words, the individual traces descent through both parents, all four grandparents, and so forth, recognizing multiple ancestors.

zh: 在双重继嗣（double descent）,或者叫双重单边继嗣中，继嗣是同时依父系和母系两边计算的，这是一种非常罕见的继嗣。
en: Double descent, or double unilineal descent, whereby descent is reckoned both patrilineally and matrilineally at the same time, is very rare.

zh: 在这种继嗣体系中，为了某些目的，继嗣是母系的，而为了另一些目的，继嗣又是父系的。
en: In this system descent is matrilineal for some purposes and patrilineal for others.

zh: 一般而言，在采取这种继嗣方式的地方，母系群体和父系群体在社会的不同领域发挥作用。
en: Generally, where double descent is reckoned, the matrilineal and patrilineal groups take action in different spheres of society.

zh: 例如，在尼日利亚东部的亚科（Yako）人中，财产被分成父系的财产和母系的财产。
en: For example, among the Yako of eastern Nigeria, property is divided into both patrilineal line possessions and matrilineal line possessions.

zh: 父系拥有永久性的生产资源，比如土地；而母系则拥有消耗性的财产，比如牲口。
en: The patrilineage owns perpetual productive resources, such as land, whereas the matrilineage owns consumable property, such as livestock.

zh: 在思考如何阅读、分析、阐释当代的这些自传文本的时候，我想到族群归属的追寻反映了双重焦点，而这一直是人类学基本原理的部分：在我们自己的背景中观看他人，在他人的背景中观看我们自己。
en: In thinking about how to read, analyze, and interpret these contemporary autobiographical texts, it occurred to me that the ethnic search is a mirror of the bifocality that has always been part of the anthropological rationale: seei n g others against a background of ourselves, and ourselves against a background of others.

zh: 将外人奇异的习俗与我们熟悉的习俗并置，或者相对化我们想当然的预设，一直是人类学所许诺的文化批评。
en: The juxtaposing of exotic customs to familiar ones, or the relativizing of taken-for-granted assumptions, has always been the kind of cultural criticism promised by anthropology.

zh: 在一个各社会之间越来越相互依赖的世界，这种双重焦点，或者说交互视角，也变得越来越重要：所描述的文化中的成员日益成为民族志的批判性读者。
en: This bifocality, or reciprocity of perspectives, has become increasingly important in a world of growing interdependence between societies: members of cultures described are increasingly critical readers of ethnography.

zh: 举例来说,16世纪阿兹特克人以人为祭品供仪式之用的习俗。
en: Take, for example, the 16th-century Aztec practice of sacrificing humans for ritual purposes.

zh: 北美人今天很少——如果有的话——会宽恕这种做法，但是通过中止判断，人们就能洞悉表面现象以下的东西，并理解它怎么起作用使老百姓相信：阿兹特克人的国家兴旺发达，太阳仍将普照大地。
en: Few (if any) North Americans today would condone such practices, but by suspending judgment one can get beneath the surface and understand how it functioned to reassure the populace that the Aztec state was healthy and that the sun would remain in the heavens.

zh: 除此之外，人们可以用同样的方式理解今天死刑在美国的作用。
en: Beyond this, one can understand how the death penalty functions in the same way in the United States today.

zh: 不同社会科学家的许多研究已明确证明死刑并没有威慑住暴力犯罪，一点也不亚于阿兹特克人实际上为太阳提供食物的献祭。
en: Numerous studies by a variety of social scientists have shown clearly that the death penalty does not deter violent crime, any more than Aztec sacrifice really provided sustenance for the sun.

zh: 就在第二次世界大战以前的数年中，在东欧犹太人年轻一代移民后代中发展出一种令人关注的两可系继嗣群体的变体。
en: In the years just prior to World War II, an interesting variant of the ambilineal descent group developed among younger-generation descendants of east European Jewish immigrants.

zh: 由于受美国文化较多的同化，他们中的一些人努力便他们自己与老一代成员区别开来，他们认为后者有些过时了。
en: Being more assimilated into North American culture, some of them sought to separate themselves somewhat from members of older generations, who were perceived as a bit old-fashioned.

zh: 然而，他们却仍然希望维持犹太人家族团结的传统伦理。
en: Yet they still wished to maintain the traditional Jewish ethic of family solidarity.

zh: 因此他们成立了堂表兄弟姐妹俱乐部，这种倶乐部由一群有着共同祖先的第一代堂表兄弟姐妹及其配偶和子女组成。
en: The result was the cousins club, which consists of a group of first cousins who share a common ancestry, their spouses, and their descendants.

zh: 他们的父母、袓父、外袓父母因其陈旧观念和生活方式都被排除在外。
en: Excluded are parents and grandparents of the cousins, with their older views and lifestyles.

zh: 特殊化和概化是两个极端——它们是在与其他社会科学、人文学科和自然科学相比较时人类学所具有的双重特点。
en: Particularizing and generalizing at the extremes – these are the dual features of anthropology when compared to the other social sciences, humanities, and the natural sciences.

zh: 在一个极端，田野工作导致参与一个特定的群体，了解关于那一群体的知识。
en: At one extreme, fieldwork leads to involvement with a particular group and to learning about that group.

zh: 民族志学者与那一群体产生共鸣/身份认同，那一群体变成“我的村庄”、“我的部落”或“我的人民”。
en: The ethnographer identifies with that group, which becomes "my village", "my tribe", or "my people".

zh: 然后他成为一名臭名远扬的反对者。
en: He then becomes a notorious nay-sayer.

zh: 收集在本书中的论文断言，上述意识形态已经溃败。
en: The essays collected here assert that this ideology has crumbled.

zh: 这些文章认为文化是由相互激烈竞争的符码和表象构成，假设诗学和政治是不可分的，而科学位于历史和语言学过程之中，而不是之上，它们还假定，学术体裁和文学体裁相互渗透，描述文化的写作真正是试验性和伦理性的。
en: They see culture as composed of seriously contested codes and representations; they assume that the poetic and the political are inseparable, that science is in, not above, historical and linguistic processes.They assume that academic and literary genres interpenetrate and that the writing of cultural descriptions is properly experimental and ethical.

zh: 它们把焦点放在文本生产和修辞上，以便突出文化叙述的建构和人为的性质。
en: Their focus on text making and rhetoric serves to highlight the constructed, artificial nature of cultural accounts.

zh: 这种做法削弱了过度透明的权威模式，把注意力引向民族志的历史困境，亦即，民族志总是陷入发明文化而非再现文化的境地（Wagner 1975),
en: It undermines overly transparent modes of authority, and it draws attention to the historical predicament of ethnography, the fact that it is always caught up in the invention, not the representation, of cultures (Wagner 1975).

zh: 人们对“生态系统”提出了不同的定义。
en: Various definitions of "ecosystem" have been proposed.

zh: 其中一些定义强调其“有界的"（bounded)性质：“在生物圈某些特定的区域之内，整个有生命物质和无生命物质之间密切相关，并且进行着物质能量的交换”（Rappaport 1971:238)。
en: Some of these stress their bounded nature: "the total of living organisms and non-living substances bound together in material exchanges within some demarcated portion of the biosphere" (Rappaport 1971:238).

zh: 另一些定义关注于物质成分间转换的性质：“生物与非生物之间一系列动态的联系促进了能量的相互转，致使物质得以流通”(Hardesty 1977:14)。
en: Others focus on the nature of the exchanges among components: "a dynamic set of relationships between living and non-living things through which energy flows and materials cycle" (Hardesty 1977:14).

zh: 对生态系统的研究倾向于关注生态系统内部的运作，特别是“体内平衡”（homeostasis)的过程，同时也关注参与交换的有生命物质与无生命物质之间，通过物质及其能量的转换来维持其自身的稳定性（见Ellen 1982:74)。
“体现”（embodiment)甚至超越了它的性别方面，是一个越来越引人关注的领域。
en: ‘Embodiment’, even beyond its gender aspects, is an area of increasing interest.

zh: 特别是托马斯•朝达斯（Thomas Csordas)在梅洛-庞蒂（Merleau-Ponty，1962)的理论基础上提出的体现是不确定的（CSordasl990;参见CSordas 1994)。
en: In particular, Thomas Csordas (1990; cf. 1994) has built on Merleau-Ponty’s (1962) notion that embodiment is indeterminate.

zh: 他的观点比20世纪70年代出现的“身体人类学”的观点激进得多。
en: His view is much more radical than the notion of the ‘anthropology of the body’ which emerged in the 1970s.

zh: 身体要大于各部分的总和。
en: The body is more than the sum of its parts.

zh: 在传统上，人类学被划分为四个领域：体质人类学和三个文化人类学分支学科:考古学、语言人类学和民族学。
en: Anthropology is traditionally divided into four fields: physical anthropology and the three branches of cultural anthropology, which are archaeology, linguistic anthropology, and ethnology.

zh: 体质人类学（Physical Anthropology)主要研究作为生物有机体的人,而文化人类学（Cultural Anthropology）研究作为文化造者的人类。当然，二者是相互联系的。我们若不知道人类是如何创生的，我们就不能理解人是如何思考和行动的。
en: Physical anthropology is concerned primarily with humans as biological organisms, while cultural anthropology deals with humans as cultural animals.Both, of course, are closely related; we cannot understand what people do unless we know what people are.

zh: 我们想要了解生物特性焉如何影响文化，文化又是如何影响生物特性的。
en: And we want to know how biology does and does not influence culture, as well as how culture affects biology.

zh: 话语变得“普通平常”，不再是那些具有雄辩天赋的人的专利。
en: Discourse became ‘common’, no longer the exclusive privilege of those who possessed the gift of eloquence.

zh: 所有人现在都平等拥有演讲的权利，理性的语言被认为最能契合这一目标。
en: All members of the community were now judged to possess equally the right to speech, and it was the rational language of logos that was thought to best fulfil this purpose.

zh: 如此一来，理性就被引入到在公共场所相遇的人们中间。
en: Thus logos was brought into the encounters of the public square.

zh: 简要来说，这一历史包括种族、性别和天性的概念。
总的说来，人类学和其他社会科学巳经拒绝了那种认为种族、性别和天性是生物学或伪生物学原因所致的解释，转而强调社会和文化因素。
en: On the whole, anthropology and other social sciences have rejected explanations that assume such biological or pseudobiological causes as race, gender, and instinct and have emphasized instead social and cultural factors.

zh: 实际上，“文化”这一概念的发明和发展，部分就是想要解释那些自然原因（种族、性别、天性）无法说清的行为差异。
en: In fact, the invention and development of the concept of culture are in part an attempt to explain behavioral differences where the natural (racial, gender, or instinctual) explanations failed.

zh: 第2章考虑方法，即人类学家着手学习他们所学到的方式。
en: Chapter 2 treats method: the way anthropologists go about learning what they learn.

zh: 田野工作是人类学最有特色的方法。
en: Fieldwork is the distinctive method of anthropology.

zh: 田野工作所独有的身体考验、心理偏差和智力挑战相融合的要求，只有那些亲身做过田野工作的人才能真切地理解。
en: The peculiarly demanding combination of physical hardship, psychological disorientation, and intellectual challenge that constitutes fieldwork can be understood only by those who have done it.

zh: 实际上，即使对这些人来说，由于记忆很容易变模糊，很难对其体验作出准确的回忆和描述。
en: In fact, even for these, memory dims, so that the experience is difficult to recall and describe sharply.

zh: 民族志写作的一个亚体裁出现了：自我反思的“田野工作叙述”。
en: A subgenre of ethnographic writing emerged, the self-reflexive "fieldwork account."

zh: 或世故或天真，或自白或分析，这些叙述为讨论认识论、存在和政治的广泛议题提供了重要的论坛。
en: Variously sophisticated and naive, confessional and analytic, these accounts provide an important forum for the discussion of a wide range of issues, epistemological, existential, and political.

zh: 文化分析家的话语不再可能仅仅是一个“有经验”的观察者对习俗的描述和阐释。
en: The discourse of the cultural analyst can no longer be simply that of the "experienced" observer, describing and interpreting custom.

zh: 民族志的经验和参与观察的理想被证明是有问题的。
en: Ethnographic experience and the participant-observation ideal are shown to be problematic.

zh: 不同的文本策略得到尝试。
en: Different textual strategies are attempted.

zh: 例如，按照新的惯例采用第一人称单数 (民族志从来没有禁止过第一人称单数，民族志总是个人风格化的。
en: For example, the first person singular (never banned from ethnographies, which were always personal in stylized ways) is deployed according to new conventions.

zh: 在社会或文化人类学领域，学者们经常区分“田野民族志”和“理论”这两个概念。
en: In social or cultural anthropology, a distinction is often made between ‘ethnography’ and ‘theory’.

zh: 从字面意义上说，田野民族志是关于民族的写作实践。
en: Ethnography is literally the practice of writing about peoples.

zh: 因为人类学家通常更多地研究异文化而不是自己的文化，所以田野民族志常常意味着我们理解其他民族思维模式的方法。
en: Often it is taken to mean our way of making sense of other peoples’ modes of thought, since anthropologists usually study cultures other than their own.

zh: 而在某种程度上，理论也可以说是我们理解自身、理解人类学思维模式的途径。
en: Theory is also, in part anyway, our way of making sense of our own, anthropological mode of thought.

zh: 在平等群体中，进行交易的各个人之间都彼此认识且有亲属关系，而且大多数人都看重“和睦相处”，因此冲突产生的潜在可能性很小。
en: In egalitarian groups, where everyone is related to—and knows on a personal basis—everyone else with whom dealings are required and where most everyone values "getting along" with the natural order of life, the potential for conflicts to develop is reduced in the first place.

zh: 如果冲突真的产生，那么大都通过闲言碎语、嘲笑、直接谈判或者调解等非正式方式加以解决在后面这些情况中，重点在于获取大多数当事方都认为公正的解决方案，而不是遵循某条抽象的法律或规则。
en: Many of those that do arise are settled informally through gossip, ridicule, direct negotiation, or mediation.In the latter instances, the emphasis is on achieving a solution considered just by most parties concerned, rather than conforming to some abstract law or rule.

zh: 如果其他解决方法都失败了，不满意的个人还可以选择离开这个臥群，到另一个自己有亲属的队群中去生活。
en: Where all else fails, disgruntled individuals have the option of leaving the band to go live in another where they have relatives.

zh: 调适过程确立了人的需求与其环境潜能的动态平衡。
en: The adaptation process establishes a moving balance between the needs of a population and the potential of its environment.

zh: 新几内亚高原居民甄巴加人的例子可以说明这一过程。甄巴加人维持自己的生活主要靠园艺(horticulture)—用简单的手工工具种植庄稼。
en: This process can be illustrated by the Tsembaga, New Guinea, high landers, who support themselves chiefly through horticulture—the cultivation of crops carried out with simple hand tools.

zh: 尽管在永久定居的农业社区中人们积累财物的机会增加了，但是对财产获取的限制在他们那里就如在游牧民族那里一样显著。
en: In spite of the increased opportunities in sedentary farming communities for people to accumulate belongings, limits on property acquisition may be as prominent in them as among nomadic peoples.

zh: 在这类社区中，社会义务迫使人们放弃财富，而且没有人被允许积累比他人多得多的财富。更多的财富只不过招来要承担的更多的社会义务。
en: In such communities, social obligations compel people ro divest themselves of wealth, and no one is permitted to accumulate too much more than others.Greater wealth simply brings greater obligation to give.

zh: 人类学家把这类义务称为调整机制（leveling mechanisms） 。
en: Anthropologists refer ro such obligations as leveling mechanisms.

zh: 作为对现代经济体制日益增长的“面对无面”性质的部分反应，美国“跳蚤市场”（参见图7.3），有某种程度的复苏和增长。在“跳蚤市场”，任何人，付一小笔费用，就可以展示和销售手工艺品、二手货、农产品以及在面对面情境下作的绘画。
en: The United States, as part of a reaction to the increasingly "face-to-faceless" nature of the modern economic system, is having something of a revival and proliferation of "flea markets" (Figure 7.3), where anyone, for a small fee, may display and sell handicrafts, secondhand items, farm produce, and paintings in a face-to-face setting.

zh: 寻找便宜货和讨价还价的机会有令人兴奋的因素。
en: Excitement is felt in the search for bargains and an opportunity for haggling.

zh: 到处弥漫着欢乐的气氛，有吃有喝，欢声笑语，以及交谈，而且货物交易甚至可能没有任何现金过手。
en: A carnival atmosphere prevails, with eating, laughing, and conversation, and items even may be bartered without any cash passing hands.

zh: 这些跳蚤市场、商品交易会、节期和农民市场类似于非西方社会的集市。
en: These flea markets, including fairs, festivals, and farmers' markets, are similar to the marketplaces of non-Western societies.

zh: 这一问题的答案就像人类历史一样复杂。
en: The answer to this is as complex as human history.

zh: 在某种程度上说，它与人类的技术局限有关。
en: In part, it relates to the limits of human technology.

zh: 在大部分历史中，人们一直受限于他们的地理范围。
en: Throughout most of history, people have been restricted in their geographical horizons.

zh: 没有到世界遥远地方旅行的手段，对远远不同于人们自己的文化和民族的观察是艰难的——如果不是不可能的话——冒险。
en: Without the means for one to travel to distant parts of the world, observation of cultures and peoples far from one's own area was a difficult— if not impossible—venture.

zh: 大范围的旅行通常是少数人独享的特权；只有当适当的运输和通信方式得到发展，对其他民族和文化的研究才可能盛行。
en: Extensive travel was usually the exclusive prerogative of a few; the study of foreign peoples and cultures was not likely to flourish until adequate modes of transportation and communication could be developed.

zh: 后来，维克多·特纳（Victor Turner 1982a）提出，分类和不分类之间的这种认知性与社会性的摆动是人类生活中一项永恒的动态。
en: Victor Turner (1982a), finally, argued for an oscillation, cognitive and social, between the classificatory and the non-classificatory as constituting a universal dynamics of human life.

zh: 人在固有结构和反结构之间摆动，在分类和一体统一之间摆动，但人类文化应当被视为同时包含了这两个方面。
en: Human beings oscillated between inhabiting structure and anti-structure, between division and homogeneity, but human culture must be seen as comprising both.

zh: 日常生活由现有的社会秩序制约：根据分门别类的象征体系内的位置和角色区分人与物。
en: Everyday life, then, was characterized by a status-bound social order: persons and things differentiated according to their positions and roles in a segmentary symbolic system.

zh: 不过，特定时期中人会诉求并回复到相反的方面，即某种可称为“同感”（communitas）或全方位交流的原始状态的关系。
en: However, at periodic intervals human beings resorted and reverted to an antithetical, indeed primordial, modality of relationship characterized by ‘communitas’ or total communion.

zh: 事实上，许多创造了人与人之间持久稳固的约束力的亲属制度系统并不是那些我们所谓的“血族”。
en: Indeed, many kinship systems create enduring and strong commitments between people who are not what we would call "blood relatives".

zh: 要在这种理论框架下解释存在于大多数社会中的同性恋，似乎也很困难。
en: Homosexuality, which exists in most societies, also seems difficult to explain within this framework.

zh: 威尔逊在他最近的著作（Wilson 1998）中似乎调整了他的观点，并且呼吁跨学科的合作而不是将一门学科（人类学）包含在另一门学科（生物学）之内。
en: In his most recent work, Wilson (1998) seems to have modified his views, and calls for cooperation across disciplinary boundaries rather than subsuming one (anthropology) under the other (biology).

zh: 总的来说，大约自1980年代晚期，达尔文对人类生命的解读的拥护者已经修正了他们以前强烈的决定论的观点。
en: Generally, adherents of Darwinist interpretations of human life have modified their formerly strongly determinist views since – roughly – the late 1980s.

zh: 如今文化不再被当做一种偶发现象，并且没有人会认真地宣称，文化现象必然是“发挥生物功能的”或是适应的结果。
en: Culture is no longer regarded as an epiphenomenon, and nobody would seriously claim today that cultural phenomena are necessarily "biologically functional" or adaptive.

zh: 由于规模较大的资本主义公司越来越依赖贫穷国家的低成本商品制造业，使用童工已成为工业社会日益引人关注的问题。
en: The use of child labor has become a matter of increasing concern as large corporations rely more frequently on the manufacture of goods in the world's poorer countries.

zh: 虽然可靠的数字难以获得,但据估计，仅在南亚就有约1500万不自由的童工，包括一些4岁的幼童。
en: Although reliable figures are hard to come by, it is estimated that there are some 15 million indentured child laborers in south Asia alone, including some as young as 4 years old.

zh: 每年，美国进口的产品，至少有价值1亿美元的产品是领微薄工资的童工制作的，产品包括小地毯、地毯、服装和足球等等。
en: Each year, the United States imports at least $100 million worth of products children manufacture, ranging from rugs and carpets to clothing and soccer balls.

zh: 早在比尔·克林顿任总统期间，他就签署法律，阻止由被迫从事雇佣劳动的儿童制造的产品进口。但强制实施这一法律能有多大效果，我们还没有看到。
en: In 1990, President Clinton signed into law legislation that would prevent importation of products made by children who are indentured servants, but how effectively it can be enforced still remains to be seen.

zh: 米歇尔˙福柯对于权力关系的研究为我们提供了某些有益的分析工具。
en: The work of Michel Foucault on power relations provides us with some helpful analytic tools.

zh: 福柯（Fpucault 1982:212)在剥削、支配与主体之间作了区分。
en: Foucault distinguishes between exploitation, domination, and subjection (1982:212).

zh: 他认为，大多数权力的分析几乎无一例外地都集中在支配与剥削的关系上,谁在控制谁以及谁从生产者的生产中擭取成果。
en: He argues that most analyses of power concentrate almost exclusively on relations of domination and exploitation: who controls whom, and who extracts the fruits of production from the producers.

zh: 第三个术语：主体，集中在一个权力场域中离开力的直接应用最为遥远的向度上。
en: The third term, subjection, focuses on that aspect of a field of power farthest removed from the direct application of force.

zh: 权力关系的那一维度就是个体与群体的认同经受考验之所，那里也是体现最宽泛意义的秩序形态之所。
en: That dimension of power relations is where the identity of individuals and groups is at stake, and where order in its broadest meaning is taking form.

zh: 这是文化与权力最为紧密地交织在一起的王国。
en: This is there a lm in which culture and power are most closely intertwined.

zh: 福柯有时会称这些关系为“统怀"(governmentality)，而这个术语便是一个有益的术语。
en: Foucault sometimes calls these relations "governmentality," and the term is a helpful one.

zh: 实证主义模型是理性的，但它的合理性是由观察者而不是行动员来确定的。
en: The positivist model is rational, but it is rationality as defined by the observer rather than by the actor.

zh: 事先确定你的假说、合理性和效率，决定了你的测试只与那些相关的数据相联系。
en: Having defined your hypothesis, rationality and efficiency dictate that you limit your test to only those data that are relevant.

zh: 相应地，你也就通过你的做法创造了这些数据。
en: Accordingly, you create these data, manufacture them through your procedure.

zh: 在心理学中，这一做法通常是实验；在社会学中，这一做法是调查问卷；在经济学中，这一做法则是各种各样的统计测量。
en: In psychology, this procedure is typically the experiment; in sociology, the survey questionnaire; in economics, various kinds of statistical measurement.

zh: 1832年，第一次正式说明女性没有投票权。
en: In 1832, it had been formally clarified for the first time that women could not vote.

zh: 到 1867年，妇女的投票权问题已经长期成为女权主义者一个重要的问题，显然，投票权是公民身份的一个象征。
en: By 1867, women's suffrage had been an important issue for feminist groups for a long time, for it was clear that the vote was the symbolic crux of citizenship.

zh: 有人开展组织了一场请愿活动，致力于使女性获得和男性一样的投票权。约翰·斯图亚特·穆勒 (John Stuart Mill)在国会下议院代表她们提出了这个议题。
en: A petition was organised seeking the vote for women on the same terms as men, and John Stuart Mill raised the subject in the House of Commons on their behalf.

zh: 天人合一的古典模式叫作“图腾崇拜”。
en: The classic pattern of nature/humanunity is known as "totemism".

zh: 在图腾社会，每个群体都会有一个特有的与一个自然。类别相连的特征：例如熊氏族、狮氏族、狼氏族。
en: In totemic societies, each group identifies with a natural category: bear, lion, wolf clans, for example.

zh: 在某些领域我们仍然存在一些这方面的残余，例如体育队的名字——狼窝（the Wolfpack )、老虎（the Tigers)和水龟（the Terrapins)。
en: We have pale remnants of this in some spheres, such as sports team names – the Wolfpack, the Yellow-Jackets, the Tigers, and the Terrapins.

zh: 多贡人住在马里共和国（Mali）东南部干旱的大草原上，接近布基纳法索（Burkina Faso）的边界（Beaudoin 1984），游牧的富拉尼人也住在这里。
en: The Dogon live on the dry savannah in south-eastern Mali, near the border with Burkina Faso (Beaudoin 1984), in an area where nomadic Fulani also live.

zh: 多贡人是不迁徙的农民，他们种植小米、水果和蔬菜。
en: They are sedentary farmers and cultivate millet, fruit and vegetables.

zh: 他们住在村子里，这些村子传统上形成了独立的政治实体。
en: They live in villages which traditionally make up independent political entities.

zh: 这些村子在许多方面都是自给自足的，他们有自己的农民、政治领袖、工匠、田地和公共仪式。
en: These villages are in many ways self-sufficient, with their own farmers, political leaders, craftsmen, fields and public rituals.

zh: 通过以下事实可见，这些村子明显处于自治的状态：该地区的政治冲突常常发生在不同的村子之间，起因是对土地权利的不同意见或在几个村子共同的集市上的争吵。
en: The autonomy of the villages is evident through the fact that political conflicts in the area are frequently conflicts between villages, caused by disagreements over land rights or disputes at the market-place, where inhabitants from different villages meet.

zh: 多贡村落的居民点按照继嗣从属关系划分。
en: The settlements in the Dogon villages are divided according to lineage membership.

zh: 每个家系都有权利耕作特定的田地，居住在村子里标示出的地方。
en: Each lineage has rights to cultivate specific fields and lives in a delineated part of the village.

zh: 它们的用法代表了一种亚文化和社会关系中特定形式的功能（而不是个体心理学）。
en: Their usage was a function of subculture and of particular forms of social relationship (rather than individual psychology).

zh: 那么，严格代码是适用于“地位取向”的社会环境和社会关系，例如军队、监狱、年龄级次、长期建立的友谊与婚姻，而精细代码则适用于“个人取向”的那些社会环境和社会关系。
en: Hence, restricted code pertained to "position-oriented" social milieux and relations—armies, prisons, age-grades, long-established friendships and marriages—while elaborated code pertained to "person oriented" ones.

zh: 特别是这两种编码的使用方法将劳工阶级与中产阶级区分开 来；劳工阶级的社会性和团结的“基因”通过严格代码传导，而中产阶级的社会性和个体性的基因则通过精细代码传异。
en: In particular, the two codificatory usages differentiated the working class from the middle class; the "genes" of working-class sociality and solidarity were transmitted by restricted code, while the genes of middle-class sociality and individuality were transmitted by elaborated code.

zh: 不管乱伦禁忌是由什么引起的，考察它对社会结构的影响，我们可以看到它的效用。
en: Whatever its cause, the utility of the incest taboo can be seen by examining its effects on social structure.

zh: 与反对乱伦密切相关是反对内婚制（endogamy），即在特定的个人（譬如堂 兄弟姐妹和堂表姐妹夫或堂表嫂或弟媳等）的群体内婚配的规则。
en: Closely related to prohibitions against incest are rules against endogamy, or marriage within a particular group of individuals (cousins and inlaws, for example).

zh: 如果该群体只被定义为直系家庭，那么社会一般禁止或至少劝阻内婚制f因而鼓励外婚制(exogamy)，即在该群体之外的婚配。
en: If the group is defined as one's immediate family alone, then societies generally prohibit or at least discourage endogamy and practice or at least encourage exogamy, or marriage outside the group.

zh: 然而，在某一级上实行外婚制的社会，可能在另一级上实行内婚制。
en: Yet a society that practices exogamy at one level may practice endogamy at another.

zh: 例如，在特罗布里恩德岛民中，每个人都必须在其氏族或世系群之外婚配（外婚制）。
en: Among the Trobriand Islanders, for exam- ple, each individual has to marry outside of his or her own clan and lineage (exogamy).

zh: 为什么这一外省很重要？
en: Why this extrospective emphasis?

zh: 一个简单的答复就是，基于单独一个人（譬如你自已）来推论人性是有风险的。
en: The simple answer is that it is risky to generalize about humanity based on a single human, yourself.

zh: 同理，基于只知道一种文化（譬如你自己的文化）来推论所有文化，也是有风险的。
en: Likewise, it is risky to generalize about all cultures based on knowing only one, your own.

zh: 这个答案虽则有其合理性，但却还是显得有些太过简单。
en: This answer, though valid to a point, is too simple.

zh: 它在启我与他者、主体与客体、内省与外省之间，划出了一条太过清晰的界限。
en: It draws too sharp a line between self and other, subjectivity and objectivity, introspection and extrospection.

zh: 泰勒的宗教理论由一套源自“万物有灵论”的进化论图式组成。这种包括一切的学说认为，灵魂（拉丁语 animi 或 animae) 独立于物质世界而存在。
en: Tylor’s theory of religion consisted of a scheme of evolution from ‘animism’, the all-embracing doctrine that souls (Latin animi or animae) exist independently of the material world.

zh: 他指出，从实质上说，每个人类社会都有灵魂在生命死后依然存在的共同信仰。
en: He noted that in virtually every human society, there is a common belief in a spiritual essence which survives death.

zh: 道格拉斯（Mary Douglas)的网格与群体理论。
en: Mary Douglas's theory of grid and group.

zh: 道格拉斯将群体共同生活区分为两个方面：内部（网格，将一个人与另一个人联系起来并进行分类的网络）和外部（群体，与其界限之外相对的共同体的身份认同）。
en: Douglas distinguishes two dimensions of group communal life: the internal (grid, which is the network that binds and classifies persons in relation to one another) and the external(group, the community's identity contrasted to those outside its boundaries).

zh: 然后，她根据这两个维度怎样结合到一起对社区进行分类。
en: She then classifies communities according to how these two dimensions combine.

zh: 在古典社会，群体和网格都很强。
en: In the classic Gemeinschaft, both group and grid are strong.

zh: 由于这种冲动是个体天生的，因此巴塔耶实际上是用一种与意志和权力相关的现象学群体心理学来对涂尔干式的理性主义社会学进行了补充。这种心理学承袭自弗洛伊德、尼采、黑格尔，甚至与马基·德·萨德（Marquis de Sade），后者代表了一种打破性禁忌的极端形式。
en: And since this urge inhered in individuals, Bataille supplemented rationalist Durkheimian sociology with a form of phenomenological collective psychology that was linked to ideas of will and power drawn from Freud, Nietzsche, Hegel, and even the Marquis de Sade, who represented in an extreme form the violation of sexual taboos.

zh: 这种非理性冲动不但以违反禁忌的阻断替代了对禁忌的禁止，而且还代表了一种意愿，这种意愿会威胁到被社会和那些非理性的人推崇为神圣之物的东西，尽管非理性冲动也释放出了新的活力。
en: Not only did this irrational urge replace the interdiction of taboos with their transgression, it also represented a will to endanger what was sacred to society and to those who belonged to it, though this also released revitalizing energies.

zh: 后者认为，我们这个世界与生俱来的对不稳定性和创造性的偏好，绝对控制和精确预苫的不可能性，以及对人们在世界中的行动的处境的更清楚的看法，都使自然科学和社会科学的研究计划彼此靠得更近。
en: For Prigogine, an appreciation of the instability and creativity inherent in our world, the impossibility of absolute control or precise forecasting, and a clearer view of the place of human activity-within-the-world, now bring the projects of natural science and social science close to one another.

zh: 对两者来说，陈旧的决定论、唯物论和还原论观念在我们想象、表达自己的知识，并据此行动时都必须为“叙述性的因素”让路。
en: In both, old notions of determinism, materialism and reductionism, of knowledge as omniscient and timeless, must give way to "a narrative element" in the way we conceive of our knowledge, represent it, and act upon its implications.

zh: 因为，“实际上，所有人的社会互动和所有文献所表达的都是未来的不确定性，以及对未来的建构（Prigogine1989：389)
在田野工作中，人类学家面对道德问题，必须解决他和群体都受到影响的实际任务。
en: In fieldwork, the anthropologist faces ethical questions, he must solve practical tasks, and, like it or not, both he and the group are affected.

zh: 我在印度尼西亚所做的第一份田野工作，将我抛入一个和我们住在一起的贫困家庭从事特定交易中以挣钱糊口。
en: My first field work in Indonesia threw me into certain dealings to get money for an impoverished family with whom we were living.

zh: 三十多年后，我仍然在参与维持另一个印度尼西亚家庭的生存，由于政治迫害，其养家糊口的人（我的亲密朋友）消失了。
en: More than thirty years later, I still participate in the subsistence of another Indonesian family, whose breadwinner, my close friend, has disappeared because of political persecution.

zh: 在这个焦点之内，我们不能吸收女性主义所生发的关于民族志文本实践的任何展开的思考。
en: Within this focus we could not draw on any developed debates generated by feminism on ethnographic textual practices.

zh: 少数初露端倪的书或文章（例如，Atkinson 1982；Roberts，ed.1981)都是已出版过的，这一情形后来也没有显著改变。
en: A few very initial indications (for example, Atkinson 1982; Roberts, ed. 1981) were all that had been published.And the situation has not changed dramatically since.

zh: 女性主义无疑对人类学理论作出了贡献。
en: Feminism clearly has contributed to anthropological theory.

zh: 不同的女人类学家，像安妮特˙韦纳（Weiner 1976)，都在踊跃地改写大男子主义的经典。
en: And various female ethnographers, like Annette Weiner (1976), are actively rewriting the masculinist canon.

zh: 但女性主义民族志的焦点，或者是忠实地记录妇女的经验，或者是修正人类学范畴(例如文化/自然的对立）。
en: But feminist ethnography has focused either on setting the record straight about women or on revising anthropological categories (for example, the nature/culture opposition).

zh: 它还没有生产出非传统的写作形式，或对民族志的文本性等问题进行深入反思。
en: It has not produced either unconventional forms of writing or a developed reflection on ethnographic textuality as such.

zh: 对列维－斯特劳斯来说，乱伦禁忌是（人类）本性的一部分，因为它存在于所有社会之中。但乱伦禁忌也是文化的本质，因为不同文化对它的定义各不相同。
en: For Le ́vi-Strauss, the incest taboo is part of (human) nature because it is present in all societies, but it is the essence of culture because it is defined differently from culture to culture.

zh: 列维－斯特劳斯指出，有些文化禁止交表兄弟姊妹之间发生性关系，而另一些文化则恰好承认将表兄弟姊妹的范畴作为允许发生性关系的一种类别。
en: Some cultures, Le ́vi-Strauss points out, prohibit sex between cross-cousins, while other cultures recognize the category of cross-cousins as precisely the one within which sex is allowed.

zh: 在人类学中，文化比较不必局限于民族学的资料。
en: In anthropology, cultural comparisons need nor be restricted to ethnographic data.

zh: 例如，人类学家可以转向考古学的或历史的资料以检验有关文化变迁的假说。
en: Anthropologists can, for example, turn to archaeological data to test hypotheses about cultural change.

zh: 被认为因为某种特殊条件引起的文化特质，考古学可以通过研究这种条件过去事实上发生的处境对其加以检验。
en: Cultural characteristics thought to be caused by certain specified conditions can be tested archaeologically by investigating situations where such conditions actually occurred.

zh: 民族史学（Ethnohistory）是一种历史民族学，通过口述历史，探险者、传教士和商人的描述，以及通过对地名、生死记录和其他档案材料的分析来研究最近的文化。
en: Also useful are data the ethnohistorian provides.Ethnohistory is a kind of historic ethnography that studies cultures of the recent past through oral histories; through the accounts of explorers, missionaries, and traders; and through the analysis of data such as land titles, birth and death records, and other archival materials.

zh: 暗含在这其中的是贝特森用希腊语eidos (文化表象）和ethos (文化精神）界定的两种概念的区分。
en: Implicit in all this is a distinction between two concepts which Bateson called by the Greek words eidos and ethos.
Culture is made up of both (see, e.g., Bateson 1958 [1936]: 123–51, 198–256).

zh: 按照贝特森的用法，文化表象就是我们通常所说的“形式”或“结构”（参见Kroeber 1963 [1948]: 100 -103)。
en: In Bateson’s usage, eidos is what we more generally call ‘form’ or ‘structure’ (cf. Kroeber 1963 [1948]: 100–3).

zh: 贝特森在国民性研究中所描述的两组对立（旁观者和表现癖；控制和服从）是英美两国文化文化表象的一部分。
en: The sets of oppositions he describes in his study of national character (spectatorship v. exhibitionism; dominance v. submission) are part of the eidos of American and of English culture.

zh: 来自这类研究的一个重要的发现是，它产生了其他社会科学家所做的那类研究通常不会形成的知识。
en: An important discovery from such research is it produces knowledge that usually does not emerge from the kinds of research other social scientists do.

zh: 例如，在20世纪60年代产生的文化剥夺理论，人们用它来解释对许多少数民族儿童教肓的失败。
en: For example, the theory of cultural deprivation arose during the 1960s as a way to explain the educational failure of many children of minorities.

zh: 为了说明他们缺乏教育成就的原因，一些社会科学家提出，这类儿童“在文化方面受到了剥夺”。
en: To account for the students' lack of achievement, some social scientists proposed that such children were "culturally deprived".

zh: 然后，他们着手研究大部分来自美国原住民、非洲裔美国人、两班牙裔美国人家庭的儿童，通过他们的理论框架解释邦研究成果来进一步“确认”这一观点。
en: They then proceeded to "confirm" this idea by studying children, mostly from Native American, African American, and Hispanic populations, interpreting the results through the protective screen of their theory.

zh: 相比较而言，对“义化上受剥夺”儿童的文化所做的民族学研究揭示不同的情况。
en: By contrast, ethnographic research on the cultures of "culturally deprived" children reveals a different story.

zh: 既然一个单一、同质的世界文化并不必然是未来的潮流，那么什么才是呢？
en: Since a homogeneous world culture is not necessarily the wave of the future, what is?

zh: 有人把文化多元主义（cultural pluralism) 这个社会中存在不止一种文化视为人类的未来状态。
en: Some see cultural pluralism, in which more than one culture exists in a given society, as the future condition of humanity.

zh: 文化多元主义是指在同一个社会或多民族国家内具有不同生活和思维方式的人们的社会和政治互动。
en: Cultural pluralism is the social and political interaction of people with different ways of living and thinking within the same society or multinational state.

zh: 理想中的文化多元主义意味着抛弃偏执、偏见种族主义，倡导对其他公民的不同文化传统的尊重。
en: Ideally, it implies a rejection of bigotry, bias, and racism in favor of respect for the cultural traditions of other peoples.

zh: 事实上，还很少有人那样理解。
en: In reality, it has rarely worked out that way.

zh: 我们在后面会详细谈论到复杂的国家社会的政治和政治文化，特别是在第十六章和第十九章的文化复杂性的语境中。
en: The politics and political culture of complex state societies are dealt with in greater detail later, notably in the context of cultural complexity in Chapters 16 to 19.

zh: 不过，这里会涉及国家政治的一些方面，部分地是为了避免产生世界上的多数社会都是无政府的这样的印象。
en: Nevertheless a few aspects of state politics are considered here, partly to avoid the impression that most societies in the world are stateless.

zh: 当然不是如此，尽管在地方社区之间，国家政府的功能有很大差别——从几乎没有功能到在多数公共事态中发挥重要。
en: They certainly are not, although the role of the state varies greatly between local communities – from being nearly absent to being an important actor in most public situations.

zh: 一些人，如皮埃尔·克拉斯特斯（Pierre Clastres 1977），会认为国家的出现和无政府民族被强迫合并成的国家，是文化历史上最重要的分水岭。
en: Some, like Pierre Clastres (1977), would regard the emergence of the state, and the enforced incorporation of non-state peoples into the state, as the most important watershed in cultural history.

zh: 在社会的谋生方式中起作用的文化因素被称为文化核心（culture core）。
en: The cultural features that play a part in the society's way of making its living are called its culture core.

zh: 它包括社会对于可利用资源的生产技术和知识。
en: This includes the society productive techniques and its knowledge of the resources available to it.

zh: 它也包括涉及把这种技术应用于地方环境的劳动方式。
en: It encompasses the patterns of labor involved in applying those techniques to the local environment.

zh: 例如，人类是否每日工作固定的小时数？或者是否在一年的某段时间集中做大部分工作？
en: For example, do people work every day for a fixed number of hours, or is most work concentrated during certain times of the year?

zh: 文化核心规定那些影响食物生产和分配的义化的其他方面。
en: The culture core also includes other aspects of culture that bear on the production and distribution of food.

zh: 意识形态可能间接影响生存，它的影响方式的例了可以在一些文化中看到。在这些文化中，宗教可能使人们能利用当地可获取的和有营养价值的食物。
en: Examples of the way ideology can indirectly affect subsistence can be seen in a number of cultures where religion may lead to failure to use both locally available and nutritionally valuable foods.

zh: 当美国人类学超越博厄斯的极端相对论重拾进化论时，进化与传播之间的相互变得更为明显。
en: The interplay between evolution and diffusion became yet more apparent when American anthropology left behind the extreme relativism of Boas to take up evolutionism again.

zh: 在斯图尔德的著作中，它具有特殊的意义。
en: Thus it took on special meaning in Steward’s work.

zh: 我们已经在第三章介绍过这位多线进化论的设计者，但是他理论也有传播论的基础。
en: We met him in chapter 3 as the architect of multilinear evolutionism, but his theories also had a diffusionist basis.

zh: 这里至关紧要的是他对“文化核心”(culture core)和“总体文化" (total culture）的区分。
en: Crucial here is his distinction between the ‘cultural core’ (which is determined by environment and evolution) and the ‘total culture’ (which contains elements of culture susceptible to diffusion).

zh: 传播主义带有文化决定论的萌芽。
en: Diffusionism contained the seeds of cultural determinism.

zh: 文化决定论在博厄斯的相对论中发展到了极致。

en: This was elevated to an extreme with the relativism of Franz Boas.

zh: 后来，大西洋两岸的阐释主义者和近时的后现代主义者都反对先前对社会结构的强调，反对社会过程的单一视角。
en: Later, interpretivists on both sides of the Atlantic and the postmodernists of recent times all reacted against previous emphases on social structure and monolithic visions of social process.

zh: 由于早期原人女性已潜在地随时可以性交，所以占支配地位的男性可能会试图独占这些女性；另外的诱因可能是女性在食物采集中的出色本领。
en: With early hominine females potentially ready for sexual intercourse at any time, dominant males may have attempted to monopolize females; an added inducement could have been the prowess of the female at food gathering.

zh: （在寻食社会中，妇女通常凭借她们的采集活动提供大量食物。
en: (In food-foraging societies, women usually provide the bulk of the food by their gathering activities.)

zh: ）不管怎样，独占女性的倾向会把竞争、好斗的因素引入原人集群中去，在其他许多灵长目动物中有这种集群，集群不可能允许这一因素破坏和谐的社会关系。
en: In any event, a tendency to monopolize females would introduce the kind of competitive, combative element into hominine groupings seen among many other primate species —an element that cannot be allowed to disrupt harmonious social relationships.

zh: 解决这一难题的办法是把性活动置于文化的控制之下。
en: The solution to this problem is to bring sexual activity under cultural control.

zh: 因此，就如文化告诉人们应治吃什么、什么时候吃以及怎样吃，它也告诉他们应当在何时、何地、如何以及与谁发生性行为。
en: Thus, just as a culture tells people what, when, and how they should eat, so does it tell them when, where, how, and with whom they should have sex.

zh: 要探究特定地区的内部差异，人类学家朱利安˙斯图尔德提出了文化类型（culture type）概念,这概念指的是，一般跨文化发生的文化中各要素的集合，而且涉及一种特殊技术以及该技术与它所对付的环境特征的关系。
en: To deal with variations within a given region, anthropologist Julian Steward proposed the concept of culture type, or consideration of a culture in terms of a particular technology and its relationship with the environmental features that technology is equipped to deal with.

zh: 大盆地的例子表明，技术怎么有助于决定正好什么环境特征是有用的。
en: The example of the Great Plains shows how technology helps decide just which environmental features will be useful.

zh: 曾养活狩猎野牛者的同一片草原现在供养着牧牛者和农民。
en: Those same prairies that once supported buffalo hunters now support grain farmers.

zh: 印第安人不从事农耕，不是由于环境的缘故，也不是因为缺乏农业知识，因为他们某些人——如切延内人——在迁移到大平原之前已种植谷物了。
en: The Indians were prevented from farming the plains not for environmental reasons, nor for lack of knowledge about farming, since some of them, such as the Cheyenne, had been farmers before they moved onto the plains.

zh: 怀特的“灵长目革命" (Primate Revolution)  概念也是一个明显例子。
en: White’s notion of a ‘Primate Revolution’ is also a clear example.

zh: 然而，变革论只在20世纪80年代才以其自己的能力作为一种范式出现，在这之前曾经是进化论和反进化论（在此意义上，它将瞬间变化置于缓慢进化之上）（比如 Cucchiari 1981)。
en: Yet it emerged as a paradigm in its own right – at once evolutionist and anti-evolutionist (in the sense that it puts instantaneous change over slow evolution) – only in the 1980s (e.g., Cucchiari 1981).

zh: 今天它的主要特色是研究象征 文化的起源，或文化起源 (culturo-genesis)。
en: Its central feature today is the search for the origin of symbolic culture, or culturo-genesis.

zh: 大平原原住民文化区（culture area）(参见图6.1)，是有相似生活方式的许多社会存在的地理区域。
en: The aboriginal culture area of the Great Plains (Figure 6.1) was a geographic region where a number of societies with similar ways of life existed.

zh: 31个政治上独立的民族（其中前面提到的切延内人和科曼奇人是两个例外）都面临一个共同的环境，在这种环境里，野牛是食物以及衣服和居所原料的明显和实际的来源。
en: Thirty-one politically independent peoples (the aforementioned Cheyenne and Comanche were but two of them) faced a common environment, in which the buffalo was an obvious and practical source of food as well as materials for clothing and shelter.

zh: 因为他们相邻而居，所以他们能够分享新的发明和发现。
en: Living close by each other, the nations could share new inventions and discoveries.

zh: 他们达成对特殊生态地带共同的和共有的调适。
en: They reached a common and shared adaptation to a particular ecological zone.

zh: 20世纪30年代左右，传播论的重要性逐渐式微之时，它遗留下来的一些理念为其他理论传统所采用：“文化区域" (culture areas) 思想是其中最突出的例子。
en: By the time diffusionism was dwindling in importance, around the 1930s, it had left behind ideas which were picked up within other traditions: the idea of ‘culture areas’ is the most prominent example.

zh: 这一思想已经成为弗兰兹·博厄斯及其追随者田野民族志传统中重要的一方面（参见第七章）。
en: This had already become an important facet of the ethnographic tradition of Franz Boas and his followers (see chapter 7).

zh: 它也出现在朱利安·斯图尔德的进化论（第三章）以及在20 世纪前半期出现的功能主义、结构主义传统中（第五章及第八章）。
en: It also appeared within the evolutionism of Julian Steward (chapter 3) and within the functionalist and structuralist traditions which emerged in the Wrst half of the twentieth century (chapters 5 and 8).

zh: 弗罗贝纽斯是一位自学成才的非洲探险家、博物馆民族学家，热衷于寻找世界范围内文化发展中的相似性。
en: Frobenius, a self-trained African explorer and museum ethnologist, enjoyed looking for parallels in cultural development worldwide.

zh: 他发展了“文化圈” (Kulturkreise )的观点，设想在某些个案中，一些大的文化区域扩散至全球，并且与各地以前就存在的文化区域互相交叠，例如，弓箭文化覆盖枪矛文化。
en: He came up with the idea of ‘culture circles’ (Kulturkreise), conceived as great culture areas which in some cases spread across the globe and overlapped those which had existed before: for example, bow-and-arrow culture over spear culture.

zh: 19世纪90年代至20世纪30年代，这些文化圈的阐述在德国和奥地利人类学界占据支配地位。

en: The definition of these culture circles was to dominate German and Austrian anthropology from the 1890s to the 1930s.

zh: 当两个主要的倡导者在1954年和1961年分别退休和去世后，施密特和柯珀斯的历史传播论的神学版本早早地结束了。
en: Historical diffusionism's theological version under Schmidt and Koppers came to an early end when its two main proponents retired and died in 1954 and 1961, respectively.

zh: 柯珀斯的继任者约瑟夫˙哈克尔（Joseph HaekelM自学院建立后，他是这一职位上首位奥地利出生的非牧师）连同罗伯特˙海因-杰尔登（流亡后又移民回来的少数人之一）及其助手安娜˙霍恩瓦特-杰拉克史泰因（Anna Hohenwart Gerlachstein)以及沃尔特˙赫什伯格，接着很快宣布了施密特的文化圈理论过时了。
en: Koppers's successor, Josef Haekel (the first Austrianborn nonpriest in this chair since the institute's foundation), together with Robert Heine-Geldern (one of the few re-migrants from exile), his assistant Anna Hohenwart-Gerlachstein, and Walter Hirschberg, soon thereafter declared Schmidt's culture circle theory obsolete.

zh: 被关闭的圣言会人类学学派也走到了尽头，从那个时候开始，圣言会的理论体系完全改变了它整体的神学和学术取向。
en: The times of the closed SVD anthropological school were coming to an end, and the SVD order has completely changed its overall theological and academic orientation since then.

zh: 一开始介绍文化人类学研究，我们就将仔细考察该学科的性质。
en: To introduce the study of cultural anthropology, we will look closely at the nature of the discipline.

zh: 在第一章，我们将看到人类学领域是怎么划分的，各分支学科是如何相互联系的，以及它们与其他学科和人文学科的关系。
en: In Chapter I we will see how the field of anthropology is subdivided, how the subdivisions relate to one another, and how they relate to the other sciences and humanities.

zh: 在这之后，我们将把注意力转向文化——人类学的核心概念。
en: Following this, we will turn our attention to the core concept of anthropology, culture.

zh: 第二章讨论文化的性质及其对人类个体和社会的意义。
en: Chapter 2 will discuss the nature of culture and its significance for human individuals and societies.

zh: 我们将以一章的篇幅结束本书第一编，我们要看一看，作为解决生存问題的人类机制，人类文化是如何发生的，如何对生物变迁取得优势的。
en: We will conclude this part of the textbook with a chapter that looks at how human culture originated and gained primacy over biological change as the human mechanism for solving the problems of existence.

zh: 怀特去世后，他的学生们继承了他的这种进化论。
en: White’s style of evolutionism continued after his death through the work of his students.

zh: 马歇尔• 萨林斯（特别是其早期著作）、埃尔曼•塞维斯以及马文• 哈里斯，还有许多其他学者，都将自身的知识理性归功于怀特。
en: Marshall Sahlins (especially in his early work), Elman Service, and Marvin Harris, among many others, owe an intellectual debt to Leslie White.

zh: 然而，随着文化生态学的出现，他们的观点比怀特更加细化，其研究也明显地趋向于更多途径。
en: However, with the dawn of cultural ecology, their vision became more particularistic than White’s, and their approaches decidedly more multilinear.

zh: 然而，社会学家着重研究在工业化的北美和欧洲社会生活的人，因而下述可能性就越来越大，即他们有关人类行为的理论是受文化束缚叫（culture bond）的，也就是说，他们关于世界和实在的假定以社会学家自己的西方文化那部分为根据。
en: Sociologists, however, have concentrated heavily on studies of people living in modern—or at least recent—North American and European societies, thereby increasing the probability that their theories of human behavior will be culture bound: that is, based on assumptions about the world and reality that are part of the sociologists, Western culture, usually the middle-class version most typical of professional people.

zh: 因为文化人类学家主要也是他们由以成长的文化的产物，所以他们从事理论活动也可能受到文化束缚。
en: Since cultural anthropologists, too, are products of the culture they grew up with, they also are capable of culture-bound theorizing.

zh: 然而，他们通过研究各个时代和各个地方的所有人，不断努力使偏见问题最小化，他们不使自己局限于当代西方民族的研究。人类学家已经发现，要充分理解人的观念和行为的复杂性，必须研究过去的和现在的所有的人。
en: However, they constantly seek to minimize the problem by studying the whole of humanity in all times and places, and they do not limit themselves to the study of recent Western peoples; anthropologists have found that to fully understand human behavior, all humans, past and present, must be studied.

zh: 博厄斯、罗维 、萨丕尔这些学者，特别是克虏伯（例如 Kroeber 1939 ) 帮助发展了文化区域概念。
en: Of these, Boas, Lowie, Sapir, and especially Kroeber (e.g., 1939) helped to develop the notion of the culture area.

zh: 他们将他们的努力方向放在定义具体区域并记录“文化特质" (culture traits) 上。文化特质是每个文化内部最小的文化单位。
en: They directed their efforts towards the definition of specific areas and the recording of ‘culture traits’, the minimal units of culture, within each.

zh: 另一位受到马克思主义学派影响却又反对该学派新发展方向的美国人是马文•哈里斯（例如 Harris 1979: 216-57 )。
en: Another American influenced by but opposed to new directions in Marxist anthropology, Marvin Harris (e.g.

zh: 他攻击结构马克思主义者过于偏向结构主义而不够唯物主义,并在此观点上建立了自己的理论。
en: , 1979: 216–57), built his attack on the notion that the structural Marxists were too structuralist and not materialist enough.

zh: 哈里斯的“文化唯物主义" (cultural materialism) 被马克思主义学派重要学者乔纳森•弗里德曼 ( Friedman 1974 ) 批判为“庸俗的唯物主义”。哈里斯力求将文化归纳为几乎纯粹的物质力量。
en: Harris’ ‘cultural materialism’ – labelled ‘vulgar materialism’ in an important Marxist attack by Jonathan Friedman (1974) – sought to reduce culture to virtually pure material forces.

zh: 古典文化相对论产生于弗朗兹•博厄斯及其学生的著作中。
en: Classic cultural relativism emerged from the work of Franz Boas and his students.

zh: 在20世纪上半叶，它一直是美国人类学研究的首要范式。
en: For the first half of the twentieth century it was the dominant paradigm of American anthropology.

zh: 一些古典文化相对论的拥护者（包括博厄斯本人）强调文化的丰富性，而在当时人们普遍认为文化是“原始的" (primitive) ;  其中有儿位拥护者（也包括博厄斯）用相对论来反对种族主义、犹太主义和民族狂热；
en: Some adherents (including Boas himself) stressed the richness of cultures then generally thought of as ‘primitive’, and several (again including Boas) used relativist ideology to argue the case against racism, anti-Semitism, and nationalist zealotry.

zh: 因此，19世纪欧洲人和美国白人只不过表现出他们自己的种族中心主义罢了。
自人类学家开始生活在所谓野蛮民族之中并发现他们与任何人一样以后，他们就一直积极地参与同种族中心主义的斗争。
因此，人类学家开始根据文化自身的条件考察每一种文化，探讨文化是否满足人们自己的需要和期望 问题。例如，一个民族实行人祭，他们就问，根据当地人的准则，夺人生命是否可以接受。
en: As a consequence, anthropologists began to examine each culture on its own terms, asking whether or not the culture satisfied its people's needs and expectations.If a people practiced human sacrifice, for example, anthropologists asked about the circumstances that made the taking of human life acceptable according to native values.

zh: 为了根据其他民族自己的文化条件来理解它们，一个人必须中止对其他民族习恪的判断，这一观念被称为文化相对主义（cultural relativism）。
en: The idea that one must suspend judgment on other peoples' practices in order to understand them in their own cultural terms is called cultural relativism.

zh: 只有通过这种研究方式，人们才能获得关于其他民族习俗的未扭曲的观点，也能获得对人们自己社会的洞力。
en: Only through such an approach can one gain an undistorted view of another people's ways, as well as insights into the practices of one's own society.

zh: 面对普遍化和全球化，人类学具有可能除了历史学外其他学科所不具备的力量去理解独特性、地方性的重要意义。
en: It has strengths unparalleled by other traditional fields of study, except perhaps history, in that it understands the importance of the particular, and thus the local, over against the universalist and the global.

zh: 人类学保持着对相互关联的价值观念和实践体系的敏感，在文化背景中关注特定的生活方式。
en: Anthropologists contextualize specific lifeways by keeping intact the systems of values and practice to which each is tied.

zh: 严谨的人类学家并非总是发布全球化普适主义扫荡的言论。
en: Careful anthropologists do not usually go around making global, universalist sweeping statements.

zh: 人类学的文化相对主义已受到来自认为人性是普遍的现代性模型的支持者们的攻击（Hollis and Lukes 1982），而另一方面又得到持较为人文观点的人们的赞赏（MacIntyre 1985；Taylor 1985）。
en: The cultural relativism of anthropology has been subjected to major attack by all those defensive defenders of universalist modernist models of human nature (cf. Hollis and Lukes 1982), and conversely praised by defenders of more humanist, perspectival concerns (MacIntyre 1985; Taylor 1985).

zh: 少数社会学家看到了杜尔克姆所谈论的是文化特质及其表现，而不是人类有机体及其互动。但是，他的大多数后继者不是试图将他的文化学转变为人类互动的社会心理学，就是把它误解为“神秘主义”。
en: A few sociologists have been able to see that Durlcheim is talking about culture traits and their behavior rather than human organisms and their interactions, but most of his successors have either tried to reduce his culturology to the social psychology of interaction or have dismissed it as "mysticism".

zh: 然而，尽管存在着对他的误解，杜尔克姆的影响仍是巨大的，他最终将被公认为文化科学的奠基人之一。
en: Despite misunderstanding, however, Durkheim's influence has been considerable, and he will eventually come to be recognized as one of the founders of the science of culture.

zh: 所有的事物都是相对的。田野民族志中没有真理。
en: Everything is relative; there is no truth in ethnography.

zh: 人类学家应该融入文学批评领域，或最好归入承担了人类学中一大块的研究对象的那类文学批评——文化研究（参见例如 Bratlinger 1990) 。
en: Anthropology should dissolve into literary criticism, or at best into that brand of literary criticism that has taken over a big piece of anthropology’s subject matter – cultural studies (see, e.g., Bratlinger 1990).

zh: 文化变迁包括创新、传播、文化遗失和涵化。
en: The mechanisms involved in cultural change are innovation, diffusion, cultural loss, and acculturation.

zh: 变迁的最终来源是通过创新：一些新的做法、工具或原理。
en: The ultimate source of change is innovation: a new practice, tool, or principle.

zh: 其他个人接受这一创新，于是它就变成社会分享的了。
en: Other individuals adopt the innovation, and it becomes socially shared.

zh: 首次创新是对一些新原理的偶然发现——例如黏士经火焙烧能够变得永久坚硬这一发现。
en: Primary innovations are chance discoveries of new principles—for example, the discovery that the firing of clay makes the material permanently hard.

zh: 二次创新是通过对已知原理的应用而带来的改进——例如，用已知的技术将黏土烧铸成人们所熟悉的物体。
en: Secondary innovations are improvements made by applying known principles—for example, modeling the clay to be fired by known techniques into familiar objects.

zh: 首次创新可以促进快速的文化变迁，并激发其他发明。
en: Primary innovations may prompt rapid cultural change and stimulate other inventions.

zh: 一种创新被接受的机会，部分地（而非全部地）取决于它相对于自己将要取代的那种方法或物体的明显可见的优越性。
en: An innovation's chance of acceptance depends partly, but not entirely, on its perceived superiority to the method or object it replaces.

zh: 相对论人类学的第一个伟大人物是Franz博厄斯， 他的主张基本属于描写性相对论。
en: The first great relativist in anthropology was Franz Boas, whose ideas were essentially of the descriptive relativist type.

zh: 业余语言学家本杰明•李•沃尔夫是博厄斯的追随者，估奉一种认知相对论，以后的认知人类学者和民族科学家也是一样。
en: His follower, amateur linguist Benjamin Lee Whorf, embraced a form of cognitive relativism, as did later cognitive anthropologists and ethnoscientists.

zh: 早期的“文化与人格”学派的心理人类学与道德相对论有特定的联系。
en: Early psychological anthropology of the ‘culture and personality’ school was characteristically associated with moral relativism.

zh: 卢梭所说的“最初社会" ( socie ́te  naissante )  是一个黄金时代，但是对于大多数人来说，该时代并没有持续很久。
en: Rousseau’s ‘nascent society’ (socie ́te ́ naissante) was a golden age, but for most of humankind it did not last.

zh: 嫉妒出现了，私有财产的出现导致财富积累，并因此出现了人们之间的财富争夺。
en: Jealousies emerged, and the invention of private property caused the accumulation of wealth and consequent disputes between people over that wealth.

zh: 文明，或说“ 文明社会” 就以这样不平等日益加剧的方式发展。
en: Civilization, or ‘civil society’ developed in such a way that inequalities increased.

zh: 从某种程度上来说，这些情况延续了早期唯物主义和心智主义之间的分歧，但是现在，这种分歧表现为政治经济学与解释人类学相对立的形式，后者导致了一种文本人文主义的诞生。
en: To some extent these continued the earlier division between materialists and mentalists, but now the division took the form of political economy as against interpretive anthropology, with the latter giving rise to a textual humanism.

zh: 这一分歧可以从赋予“批评的”（critical)这一术语的不同意义中略见一斑。
en: The divergence may be seen in the different meanings attached to the term critical.

zh: 双方都将这一称号据为己有：对一方而言，其所指涉的批评（critique)是政治上的；而对另一方而 言，这一模式指的是文学批评（literary criticism)。
en: Both sides claimed that label: for one side, the critique it referred to was political; for the other side the model was literary criticism.

zh: 在1970年代 至1980年代期间，双方之间变得越来越对立，但没有哪一方是一成不变的：每一方都涵盖了一系列的理论观点和政治立场，而且在数十年的进程中也都历经了变迁。
en: During the 1970s and 1980s the sides grew more antagonistic to each other, but neither one was monolithic: each covered a range of theoretica and political positions, and each side underwent change over the course of these decades.

zh: 18世纪时，支配模式是围绕着乌托邦主义这一关键概念的“作为寓言的民族志”，其中“高贵的野蛮人”作为一种治疗者的形象，扮演着使人高贵（ennobling)的角色。
en: In the eighteenth century, the dominant mode was "ethnography as allegory," centering around the key concept of utopianism in which the "noble savage" played his ennobling role as a therapeutic image.

zh: 19世纪时，“野蛮人”不再高贵；她或者是持久不衰的圣经寓言中的“堕落的”形象，或者是治疗性讽刺故事中的形象一一一根起威吓作用的魔鬼的手指，或是最初的“原始”的例子，在新出现的进化论寓言中标志着过去的不完美性被时间所治愈的“活化石”。
en: In the nineteenth century, the "savage" was no longer noble; she was either "fallen," in the continuing biblical allegory, or a figure of therapeutic irony — a minatory Satanic finger, or an instance of the primordial "primitive," a "living fossil" signifying past imperfection healed by time in the emerging evolutionary allegory.

zh: 20世纪时，“野蛮人”甚至不再是“原始的”。
en: In the twentieth century, the "savage" was no longer even "primitive."

zh: 在这样的社会中，群体（社区和氏族）拥有我们如今很难想象的权力。
en: In such societies, the group – the community and clan – has power difficult for us to imagine.

zh: 最引人注目的事例最易被引用。
en: The dramatic instances are easiest to cite.

zh: 例如，在“巫毒教（voodoo) 死亡”中，如果群体宣称一个人死了，他就死了。
