en: And even if the subjects engaged in ritual journeys outside everyday space and time—rites of passage; pilgrimage; vision quests—in search of sacred centres to their lives (Eliade 1954:12–20), these anti- structural events served in fact to fix them even more; as special, extraordinary, aberrant experiences, the rituals merely emphasized and legitimated an everyday identity which derived from fixity in a social environment.

zh: 仪式的主角利用他们（想象的）迁移的关键时刻来建立在平日里固定的面对周围世界的态度（参见：Yamba 1992)。
en: Ritual pilgrims used their moments of (imagined) movement to establish routinely fixed orientations to a world around them (cf. Yamba 1992).

zh: 很可能这种差别的原因是由于各自的经验发现之间的差异。
en: It is very likely that this difference is caused by differences between the respective empirical findings.

zh: 当然，这些相异点，似乎使建立一种仪式的总体理论变得更加复杂。
en: Such dissimilarities, of course, seem to complicate even further the matter of building a general theory of ritual.

zh: 不过，我们应该意识到，从拉帕波特的生态系统到利奇复杂的多层次分析，再到卡普费热和格尔茨所代表的解释学的方法，都赞同：仪式是从强烈的意识形态的维度对社会做出的一种迂回间接的复杂陈述。
en: Nevertheless, we should be aware that from the system ecology of Rappaport, to the complex multi-level analysis of Leach, to the hermeneutic approach represented by Kapferer and Geertz, there is a clear continuity in that they all agree that ritual is an oblique, indirect way of making complex statements with a strong ideological dimension about society.

zh: 通过对今天赞比亚的德布人的一些研究，维克多·特纳（Victor Turner 1967，1969，1974）建立了一个仪式符号论的复杂模型，该模型总结了许多其他人关注的要点。
en: Through a number of studies of the Ndembu of present-day Zambia, Victor Turner (1967, 1969, 1974) has developed a sophisticated model of ritual symbolism, which sums up many of the concerns taken up by others.

zh: 在比斯帕拉，贝利从事田野调査的1950年代，贾吉摩尼制度仍然或多或少是完整无缺的，但是某些影响因素已经从外部进入。
en: In Bisipara, the jajmani system was still more or less intact when Bailey carried out his fieldwork in the 1950s, but some disturbing elements had entered from outside.

zh: 这个村子已经被整合到现代印度国家，尤为显著地表现在重要的政治职业机会在当时已经可以提供给低级种姓的成员了。
en: Notably, the village had been integrated into the modern Indian state in the sense that important political career opportunities were now available to members of the low castes.

zh: 贝利描述了村子内部不同种类的政治冲突和竞争。我们将仔细观察以下两种：种姓攀升和种姓冲突。
en: Bailey describes different kinds of political conflict and competition within the village, and we shall look more closely at two: caste-climbing and caste conflict.

zh: 人们有三种可能的方式可以提髙他们的地位。
en: A person has three possible ways of improving his or her situation.

zh: 他或她可以试图改变种姓身份（这在一个小村子里是极其困难的），试图提高他或她自己的种姓相对等级，或者抛弃整个种姓制度并试图在外面获得事业。
en: He or she may try to change caste membership (which is exceedingly difficult in a small village), try to improve his or her own caste's relative rank, or dismiss the entire caste system and try to make a career outside it.

zh: 几十年来，比斯帕拉的制酒者（distiller）已经稳步地提高了他们的经济地位，但这并没有使其仪式化洁净度也获得提高。
en: The distiller caste in Bisipara had improved its economic condition steadily for decades, but this did not entail an improvement of its ritual purity.

zh: 据目击这一仪式的人类学家布罗尼斯拉夫·马·林诺斯基说，这种仪式的同类相食，“是在极度的厌恶和恐惧中进行的，往往紧接着一阵狂吐。但同时，这又被认之为尊敬、爱和奉献的崇高行为”。
en: This ritual cannibalism, witnessed by anthropologist Bronislaw Malinowski, was performed with "extreme repugnance and dread and usually followed by a violent vomiting fit. At the same time it is felt to be a supreme act of reverence, love and devotion".

zh: 这一习俗以及与 此相伴的种种情感，清楚地表明对于死亡的两可态度：一方面，活着的人渴望维持与死者的联系，而另一方面，他们又对因死亡引起的转变深感厌恶和恐惧。
en: This custom and the emotions accompanying it clearly reveal the ambiguous attitude toward death: On the one hand, the survivors desire to maintain the tie to the dead person, and, on the other hand, they feel disgust and fear at the transformation wrought by death.

zh: 在马林诺斯基看来，葬礼为个人表达这些情感提供了社会许可的集体手段，同时也维系了社会的凝聚力，防止社会发生断裂。
en: According to Malinowski, funeral ceremonies provide an approved collective means for individuals to express these feelings while maintaining social cohesiveness and preventing disruption of society

zh: 这不仅仅是一个空间运动问题而且也是个时间问题：第一代移民和他那不说乌尔都语的孙子对于“穆斯林印度人”身份的定义是截然不同的。
en: This is not only a question of spatial movement but also of time: what defines the ‘Muslim Indian’ identity is rather different for a firstgeneration immigrant and for his grandson who does not speak Urdu.

zh: 我们在此面对的是过渡身份。

en: We are confronted here with transitional identities.

zh: 这并不一定意味着，我们在朝着完全融入“主导性”群体前进，而意味着我们不能将相对定义明确的“少数者群体”概念作为我们分析的基础。
en: This does not necessarily imply that we are heading towards full integration into the ‘dominant’ group, but that we cannot base our analysis on relatively well defined ‘minority groups’.

zh: 最近大量出现的以族群（ethnicity)为焦点问题的自传作品似乎很难被传统上关于族群的社会学著作所容纳。
en: The recent proliferation of autobiographical works that take ethnicity as a focal puzzle seems to be poorly accommodated within the traditional sociological literature on ethnicity.

zh: 像玛克辛˙洪˙金斯顿的《女战士》（Kingston 1976)，迈克尔˙阿伦的《亚拉腊山之行》(Arlern 1975)和玛丽塔˙戈尔登的《心灵的漂泊》（Golden 1983)，用群体的团结、传统价值、家庭的流动性、政治动员或其他类似的杜会学范畴来讨论难以充分地理解它们。
en: Works such as Maxine Hong Kingston's The Woman Warrior (1976), Michael Arlen's Passage to Ararat (1975), and Marita Gulden's Migrations of the Heart (1983) are inadequately comprehended through discussions of group solidarit traditional values, family mobility, political mobilization, or similar sociological categories.

zh: 以反叛家庭为主题的移民小说、异族通婚和文化同化与这些社会学概念更为相关。
en: Immigrant novels of rebellion against the family, intermarriage, and acculturation are more relevant to these sociological conceptions.

zh: 黑猩猩不是类人猿语言实验的唯一受试者。
en: Chimps have not been the only subjects of ape language experiments.

zh: 人们也教大猩猩和猩猩北美式手势语，结果重现了在黑猩猩那里获得的那种成果。
en: Gorillas and orangutans also have been taught American Sign Language with results that replicate those obtained with chimps.

zh: 因此，现在已产生了一种日趋扩大的共识:所有类人猿都可能获得起码达到2—3岁人类水平的语言技巧。
en: As a consequence, there is now a growing consensus that all of the great apes can develop language skills at least to the level of a 2- to 3-year-old human.

zh: 不仅理解技术是相似的，而且获得语言技巧的顺序也是相似的：什么和什么地方，做什么和谁,以及怎么提问，类人猿和人都是以这个顺序获得语言能力的。
en: Not only are comprehension skills similar, but so is acquisition order: What and where, what-to-do and who, as well as how questions are acquired in that order by both apes and humans.

zh: 就像人一样，类人猿能够提到在时间和空间上分离的事件,这一现象被称为移位（displacement），是人类语言的独特特点之一。
en: Like humans, apes are capable of referring to events removed in time and space, a phenomenon known as displacement and one of the distinctive features of human language.

zh: 亲属制度的一个更具有深远的重要性的维度是其司法制度：人类学有关亲属制度的大部分词汇来自罗马法（Roman Law）并非巧合。血浓于水，在世界的很多地方都这么说（虽然不是所有的地方），圣经上那个著名的浪子回头之后，迎接他的是父亲为他举办的盛宴。
en: A further important dimension of the kinship institution is the judicial one: it is no coincidence that a large part of the anthropological kinship vocabulary derives from Roman law.Blood is thicker than water, it has been said in many parts of the world (though not everywhere), and the famous return of the biblical lost son was celebrated with a great feast.

zh: 杀害兄弟和杀死父亲在世上的许多社会都被认为是所能想到的最严重的罪行，而父母也总是会对孩子们的婚姻大事进行干预——不论婚前婚后。
en: Fratricide and patricide are considered the most serious crimes imaginable in many of the world's societies, and parents have always meddled in the marriages of their children – both before and after their consummation.

zh: 这些几乎永久存在的问题与这样一个事实有关，那就是家族关系与遗产和继承密切相关。
en: These nearly perennial problems are tied to the fact that kinship is connected with inheritance and succession.

zh: 这两种制度都与各种资源的代际传递有关。
en: Both institutions are to do with the transmission of resources from one generation to the next.

zh: 这可能是为什么宗教总是人类学研究中的一个核心领域的主要原因所在，即使，如同埃文思-普里査德曾经指出的那样，社会科学家自己对于宗教往往是不感兴趣的甚或是敌对的。
en: This may be a major reason why religion has always been a central field of inquiry in anthropology, even if, as Evans-Pritchard (1962) has pointed out, social scientists have themselves often been indifferent or hostile to religion.

zh: 为了对政治、经济、自然、性别和其他一些核心概念试图做出无我族中心主义、比较有用的定义，常常出现的情况是，我们陷入通常与以下事实相关的问题：这些概念在我们自己的社会和人类学的词汇中被使用并具有特定的含义，但是，它们却并非也必然地存在于其他社会中，这使它们作为“主位的”概念是成问题的。
en: In attempting to give non-ethnocentric, comparatively useful definitions of politics, economy, nature, gender and other core concepts, it has repeatedly been shown that we run into problems usually related to the fact that these notions are in use, and have a specific meaning, in our own society and in the anthropological vocabulary, but not necessarily in other societies.This makes them problematic as "etic" concepts.

zh: 对于宗教而言，这些问题也同样存在，而且很少有社会科学的概念比这个概念更频繁地被定义、修正和批判。
en: This problem is certainly valid where religion is concerned, and few concepts of social science have been defined, revised and criticised more often than this one.

zh: 大约只比一个世纪之前更早一点，在专业文献中，一方面区分宗教和异教信仰（paganism），一方面区分宗教和迷信是很常见的做法。
en: Only a little more than a century ago, it was commonplace in the professional literature to distinguish between religion and paganism on the one hand, and religion and superstition on the other.

zh: 此外，即使是科学的民族志作者也不能完全控制由他们的报告引起的意义——理解（readings）。
en: Moreover, even scientific ethnographers cannot fully control the meanings—readings—provoked by their accounts.

zh: 这尤其符合那些没有将其对象历史化的表述，它们在一种“民族志的当前”(事实上总是过去）描绘异域社会。
en: This is especially true o f representations that have not historicized their objects, portraying exotic societies in an "ethnographic present" (which is always, in fact, a past).

zh: 这种共时性的悬置有效地将他者文本化，在一种既不在时间的流动中，也不在同样暧昧不明、变动的历史的当前创造出一种真实感，这种真实感包括并定位了他者、民族志作者和读者。
en: This synchronic suspension effectively textualizes the other, and gives the sense of a reality not in temporal flux, not in the same ambiguous, moving historical present that includes and situates the other, the ethnographer, and the reader.

zh: 用约翰尼斯˙费边的话说，“异时的”表述已经弥漫在20世纪的科学民族志里，它们用罗萨尔多所反对的神话化方式鼓励寓言性的挪用。
en: "Allochronic" representations, to use Johannes Fabian's term, have been pervasive in twentieth-century scientific ethnography.They invite allegorical appropriations in the mythologizingmode Rosaldo repudiates.

zh: 自从热内·笛卡尔（Rene Descartes（1596-1650））提出那个著名的纯粹我思：“我思故我在”，意识就成为现代哲学关注的对象。
en: Consciousness has been of modern philosophical concern since René Descartes (1596–1650) formulated what became known as the cogito: ‘I think therefore I am’.

zh: 之后，哲学的重心从宇宙转移到个体的人；控制人行动的力量和个体内心的宿命感，以及先前感受到的内在于外部世界的精神生活和精神活动的观念——上帝、行星、药草、诙谐、教堂仪式——这些都越来越减弱了。
en: Thereafter, the centre of philosophical gravity shifted from the cosmos to the individual human being; forces which controlled human behaviour and destiny were felt to arise more and more from within the individual, while belief in the spiritual life and activity previously felt to be immanent in the world outside—gods, planets, herbs, humours, church ritual—grew feebler.

zh: 哲学家开始从思考自身出发由内而外地进行研究，而非由外而内地从宇宙研究到灵魂；约翰·洛克（John Locke（1632-1704））采用了一个新词汇“意识”来指称“在个体的脑中经历的感知”。
en: Philosophers began to work outwards from the thinking self rather than inwards from the cosmos to the soul; and John Locke (1632–1704) adopted the new word ‘consciousness” to mean: “perception of what passes in an individual’s own mind’.

zh: 意识逐步被看作是人的行动、社会、语言和知识的基础。
en: Consciousness came to be seen as fundamental to human behaviour, society, language and knowledge.

zh: 比如，许多人类群体在成年以后缺乏乳糖酶，这是消化牛奶所必需的一种酶。
en: For example, many human groups when adult lack the enzyme lactase, which is necessary for digesting milk.

zh: 根据这个标准，北欧人应该和阿拉伯人以及一些西非人归为一类，比如富拉尼人；而南欧人属于大多数非洲人和东亚人那一边。
en: Following this criterion, North Europeans must be classified together with Arabs and some West African peoples such as the Fulani, while South Europeans belong with most Africans and East Asians.

zh: 按照外貌特征，将人类区分为不同种族是武断的，从科学上说也是无趣的，因而对人种的研究属于政治和意识形态的人类学，而不是文化差异的范围。
en: The classification of humanity into races, based on physical appearance, is arbitrary and scientifically uninteresting.The study of race thus belongs to the anthropology of power and ideology, not to the area of cultural variation.

zh: 需要补充的是，许多具有生物学倾向的人类学家现在打着“进化心理学”的旗号（Barkow et al. 1992），他们更容易被人类群体之间的共同点而不是不同点所打动。
en: It should be added that biologically oriented anthropologists, many of them nowadays flying the banner "evolutionary psychology" (Barkow et al. 1992), tend to be more struck by the similarities than by the differences between human groups.

zh: 他认为，亲属称谓是保守的，反映的是古代的、常常是已消失的社会事实。
en: Being conservative, he argued, terminology tends to reflect ancient, and often extinct, social facts.

zh: 所以，亲属称谓可以用作一种语言考古学，以便理解社会组织的历史变化。
en: Thus it could be used as a kind of linguistic archaeology in order to understand historical changes in social organization.

zh: 这正是摩尔根曾经做过的研究 ( Morgan 1877 ) 。
en: This is precisely what Morgan (1877) had done.

zh: 虽然里弗斯已经宣布他皈依了传播论， 但在这里他代表了古典进化论者的终结观点；而他的学生拉德克利夫－布朗以否定臆测历史重要性为基础的新研究则将浮出水面。
en: Rivers here represented the last of the classic evolutionists, though he had in fact already announced his conversion to diffusionism; and his student, Radcliffe-Brown, was on the verge of a new approach based on a denial of the importance of conjectural history.

zh: 这正是因为许多人类学家认为因果模式不足以理解人类思想转变的关系。
en: It was precisely because many anthropologists considered a causal model inadequate for understanding this relationship that the shift in thinking occurred.

zh: 社会与文化体系一旦被当作由机能部分构成的机器似的实体，则会被认为是人类活动的因果产品，是“集体选择的统计结果”（Leach 1960:124)。
en: Social and cultural systems, once treated asmachi ties composed of functioning parts, came to be seen as the emergent products of human activity, "the statistical outcome of multiple individual choices" (Leach 1960:124).

zh: 这个新范式中选择的重要性使因果关系不再是一个适合的分析概念。
en: Thecentral importance of choice in this new paradigm made causality an inappropriate analytical concept.

zh: 做出选择是为了可能实现的目标而不是因为特殊条件在起作用（见Stuchlik 1977)。
en: Choices are made, it was assumed, in order that goals might be achieved and not because  certain conditions prevail (see Stuchlik 1977).

zh: 类似的，人类学已从族群科学多样化的论断开始转向提倡研究人类认知结构中的普遍性规则，包括个体或个人、自我与他者、相关性和因果性、认知与分类、叙述以及空间和时间（Sperber 1985）。
en: Similarly, from assertions of ethnoscientific diversity, anthropology has moved to an appreciation of underlying, universal principles in human cognitive structurings of the individual or person, of self and other, of relationships and causality, of recognition and classification, of narration, and of space and time (cf. Sperber 1985).

zh: 这并不是说人们的认知之间的差异不大（实际上，变化着的差异正是人们认知中唯一恒久和统一的特点）。
en: This is not to say that people will not differ vastly in their cognitions; (indeed, transformative differences may represent the only permanency and sameness in human cognition).

zh: 但是这个差异的逻辑是共同的、属人的，而不是文化或特例性的。
en: But the logic of difference is a common and human rather than cultural and particular issue.

zh: 阴性书写（Ecriture feminine），或“女性书写”，是露丝·伊丽格瑞（Luce Irigaray 1985）提出的一个术语，指的是女性的象征性表述这一概念，能够克服当前语言结构中的霸权，这一霸权结构不仅是阳性的，而且是绝对男权主义和族长制的，特别是使女性的表述处于默默无闻的境地。
en: Ecriture feminine, or ‘women’s writing’, is a term coined by Luce Irigaray (1985) to convey a notion of female symbolic expression which can overcome a hegemony in current linguistic structures which is not just masculine but positively phallocentric and patriarchal, and which renders specifically female expression silent.

zh: 经过伊丽格瑞、埃莱娜·西苏（Helene Cixous 1990）、朱丽娅·克里斯蒂瓦（Julia Kristeva 1984）等人的发展，这一概念迅速混合了语言学和心理分析学的理论。
en: As employed by Irigaray, and by the likes of Hélène Cixous (1990) and Julia Kristeva (1984), the concept amounts to a heady concoction of linguistics and psychoanalysis.

zh: 关于生物决定论或是女性表述中的本质主义的范围，她们尚未达成总体上的一致见解，但有一点是相同的，即在身体上的特征：“在爱与恨这一经典的对立之外……存在着一个半开放的区域，由那些二分法中十分陌生的嘴唇组成”（Irigaray 1993）。
en: There is no overall agreement between the above on the extent of biological determinism or essentialism in female experience, but all draw upon its bodily nature: ‘[B]eyond the classic opposites of love and hate…lies this perpetually half-open threshold, consisting of lips that are strangers to dichotomy’ (Irigaray 1993).

zh: 语言人类学提供了这一观点一个最引人注目的例子——音素。
en: Linguistic anthropology offers one of the most striking examples of this: the phoneme.

zh: 音素是对交流至关重要的声音的一个特征。
en: The phoneme is a feature of sound that is crucial for communication.

zh: 对比一下不同人说话的方式，即便是那些讲同一种语言并有相同口音的人，你也可以从中听到各种各样的变异。
en: If you compare the way different people talk, even those who speak the same language and have the same "accent," you can hear all kinds of variations.

zh: 发言人会使用不同的音高、音量、音质、重音和呼吸模式。
en: Speakers use different pitch, volume, tone quality, stress, and patterns of breathing.

zh: 1954年，美国语言学家肯尼斯•派克发表了他的一篇长达762页的文章中的第一部分，文章的题目是《语言及人类行为结构的统一理论》（1976年最后完成，见Pike 1976)。这是一次伟大的突破。
en: American linguist Kenneth L. Pike made a great breakthrough in 1954 when he published the first part of an essay of 762 pages called Language in Relation to a Unified Theory of the Structure of Human Behavior (completed as Pike 1967).

zh: 他提出“声音” （sounds，the phonetic，语音）和“声音的意义单 位”（meaningful unit of sound，the phonemic,音位）之间是有关系的主张，并且认为“任何种类的单位”（the etic，音素/客位）和“任何种类的有意义的单位”（the emic，音位/主位）之间都有广泛的联系。
en: He took the idea of the relation between sounds (the phonetic) and meaningful units of sound (the phonemic) and postulated a more general relation between units of any kind (the etic) and meaningful units of any kind (the emic).

zh: 音位/主位是在某种语言或文化中有意义区别的层次。
en: The emic is the level of meaningful contrasts within a particular language or culture.

zh: 我们可以根据许多框架（framework)和格栅（grid)来解释音位/主位的特征。
en: We can explain emic distinctions in terms of various frameworks or grids.

zh: 最典型的例子包括：林奈氏分类系统、医学中疾病、光波长度的测量、音乐中半音音阶的衡量，还有最重要的谱系的格栅。
en: Classic examples include Linnaean taxonomy; disease, in medical science; the measurement of the wavelength of light; the chromatic scale in music; and above all, the genealogical grid.

zh: 第二类辅助语言的声音是由发嗓音（vocalizations）构成的。
en: The second kind of paralinguistic noises consists of vocalizations.

zh: 这些嗓音是实际可辨别的声音，而不是基本特点。与音质不同，它们是在可觉察的和相对短的音程中出现和消失的。
en: Rather than background characteristics, these are actual identifiable noises that, unlike voice qualities, are turned on and off at perceivable and relatively short intervals.

zh: 但是它们与语言的语音是分开的。
en: They are, nonetheless, separate from language sounds.

zh: 发嗓音的一个类别是嗓音特征表露（vocal characterizes）：笑或哭，喊叫或低语，打哈欠或打哺等声音。
en: One category of vocalizations is vocal characterizers: the sounds of laughing or crying, yelling or whispering, yawning or belching, and the like.

zh: 通常，但并不总是，母系社会中，会存在一个“苛刻的舅舅”。
en: The 'severe uncle' usually, but not always, appears in matrilineal societies.

zh: 列维-斯特劳斯的观点很复杂，而且从理论和经验上都涵盖了很多领域。
en: Lévi-Strauss's argument is complex and covers much ground, both theoretically and empirically.

zh: 我们在之前关于继嗣和联盟的相关讨论中的一个重要观点却仍然是他的思路中所蕴涵的一个重要脉络：群体之间的联盟比人们之间共同的血缘关系更为根本。
en: An important point, pertinent to the earlier discussion about descent and alliances, is nevertheless that his line of thought implies that alliances between groups are more fundamental than shared descent.

zh: 因此，姻亲成为理解社会整合的一把万能钥匙。
en: Affinality is thus a universal key to the understanding of the integration of society.

zh: 我们离开纳亚尔人之前，需要指出的是，在他们的社会，没有任何东西是与北美社会的已知家庭类似的这一点很重要。
en: Before we leave the Nayar, it is important to note that nothing in this society is comparable to the family as we know it in North America.

zh: 形成家户的群体不包括姻亲(affinal kin),即由婚姻建立夫妻关系(conjugal bond)所加入的那些个人。
en: The group that forms the household does not include affinal kin, or individuals joined by a conjugal bond established by marriage.

zh: 就如在第九章我们将证明的，家户并不非得是像我们所知道的那种家庭。
en: As will be shown in Chapter 9, a household group does not have to be a family as we know it.

zh: 在纳亚尔人中，家户完全是由我们通常所谓的“血缘”亲属组成的，“血缘”亲属技术上被称为血亲（consanguineal kin)。
en: Among the Nayar the household is composed wholly of what we often call“blood”relatives,l:echnicallyknownascon- sanguineal kin.

zh: 性关系是与非血亲、因此而住在另一个家户的那些人的关系。
en: Sexual relations are with those who are not consanguineal kin and thus live in other households.

zh: 如果不假设我们已经进入了一个由文化建构的独立世界，如果不假设并不是所有的知识都是由社会决定的，那么就不可能这么说。
en: It would not be possible to say this without assuming that we have access to a world independent of cultural construction, that not all knowledge is socially determined.

zh: 相同的文化观点可以用道格拉斯关于《旧约》 中的饮食法则来解释（《圣经一申命记》第十四章，《圣经一利未记》第十一章）。
en: The same point can be illustrated using Douglas' analysis of the dietary laws listed in the Old Testament (Deuteronomy, chapter 14 and Leviticus, chapter 11).

zh: 在众多的物种中，（耶和华）规定人们不允食用猪肉，因为猪肉是不洁净的。
en: Pigs, among other species, were not allowed to be eaten because they were seen as unclean.

zh: 根据道格拉斯的分析，原因是猪仅仅拥有可食动物的一个特征——猪是分趾类动物，但它却不反刍。
en: The reason for this, according to Douglas, was that they only possess one of the features which identified animals as edible—they have cloven feet, but they do not chew the cud.

zh: 因此，它跨越了分趾、反刍（因而是可食用的）类动物与其他动物之间的边界。
en: Thus, pigs straddle the boundary between clovenfooted, cud-chewing (and therefore edible) animals and the rest.

zh: 不许食用猪肉的禁忌保护了这些文化分类（Douglas 1966)。
en: The prohibition against eating pork served to protect these culturalcategories (Douglas 1966).

zh: 也可以说，有些环保组织对文化差异性十分敏感。
en: It should also be said that some environmental organizations have been sensitive to cultural differences.

zh: 从1986 年世界自然基金会（WWF)发起一场通过宗教教义的多样性来提高环保意识的运动起，世界五大宗教（佛教、基督教、印度教、伊斯兰教和犹太教）的领袖便汇集于阿西西（Assisi，译注：意大利中部的一个城市），发表了他们保护环境的联合声明（WWF 1986，Beyer 1994:209)。
en: From 1986, the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) ran a campaign to promote environmental awareness through diverse religious doctrines.Leaders of five world religions, Buddhism, Christianity, Hinduism, Islam and Judaism, met in Assisi to declare their commitment to conservation (WWF 1986, Beyer 1994:209).

zh: 在其后的两年内，巴哈依教（Baha’i，译者注：波斯泛神教的一个教派）和塞克教（Sikh)的领导人也加入了这一运动（WWF 1988)。
en: Within two years, Baha'i and Sikh leaders had also joined the initiative (WWF 1988).

zh: 历史语言学在确定不同语言之间的谱系关系方面已经取得巨大成就，这些成就反映在分类图表之中。
en: Historical linguists have achieved considerable success working out the genealogical relationships between different languages, and these are reflected in classification schemes.

zh: 例如，英语是归类在印欧语系语（参见 图4.2）中约140种语言中的一种。
en: For example, English is one of a number of languages classified in the Indo-European language family (Figure 4.2).

zh: 这一语族又分为11个语言亚族，这就反映了这一事实:从一种古代统一的语言（指原始印欧语）向独立的“女儿”语言的语言趋异（linguistic divergence）要经历很长一个时期（约6000年左右）。
en: This family is subdivided into 11 subgroups, which reflect the long period (8,000 years or so) of linguistic divergence from an ancient unified language (referred to as Proto-Indo-European) into separate "daughter" languages.

zh: 英语是日尔曼语亚族(参见图4.3)中几种语言的一种，这几种语言之间的相互关系比它们与印欧语系语族的其他亚族的关系更为紧密。
en: English is one of a number of languages in the Germanic subgroup (Figure 4.3)； all are more closely related to one another than to the languages of any other subgroup of the Indo-European family.

zh: 在他对社会过程的描述中，戈夫曼使用了剧场词句，如演员、角色和表演，并且区分了前台和后台。
en: In his descriptions of social processes, Goffman uses expressions from the theatre.He talks of actors, roles and performances, and distinguishes between the frontstage and the backstage.

zh: 他这么做的要点在于指出：有一些是我们熟练支配和感到相对安全的情境，就像在后台化妆间的演员，能够“真正是他们自己”，开开玩笑、表露他们的真实情感、从舞台角色的严格要求中解脱出来。
en: His point in doing so is that there are situations we master well and feel relatively secure in, as when the (literal) actors, in their backstage dressing-rooms, can "truly be themselves", make jokes, display their true emotions and feel free of the strict requirements of their roles on stage.

zh: 相反，在前台，印象管理变得重要：演员不得不自觉地意识到他或她给别人所造成的印象，并努力用自己所希望的方式去塑造它。
en: In the frontstage area, on the contrary, impression management becomes important: the actor has to be self-consciously aware of the impression he or she makes on others, and tries to shape it in the desired ways.

zh: 这种情境，就像一个正式的会面，或另一种因为你缺乏对角色的完全掌控而感到有点不自在的情境，你会努力用某种方式表现自己，也就是戈夫曼所谓的印象管理。
en: In this kind of situation, as in a formal interview or another kind of situation where one feels slightly uncomfortable for lack of complete mastery of the role, one will contrive to appear in a specific way through what Goffman calls impression management.

zh: 此外，20 世纪 50 年代所听到的“英国结构主义者 ” 这个词， 是要将拉德克利夫－布朗的思想同列维－斯特劳斯的思想或称“法国结构主义”区别开（在第八 章中叙述）。
en: Furthermore, the term ‘British structuralist’ was heard in the 1950s to distinguish Radcliffe-Brownianism from Lévi-Straussianism or ‘French structuralism’ (described in chapter 8).

zh: 令人不解的是，20 世纪 60 年代初，新一代英国人类学家开始转向列维－斯特劳斯，他们给他们自己戴上了“英国结构主义者”的标签。
en: Confusingly, when in the early 1960s a new generation of British anthropologists turned to Lévi-Strauss, they assumed the label ‘British structuralist’ for themselves.

zh: 从广义上说，后来这个“英国结构主义”实际上是“法国结构主义”的英国版！
en: In broader terms, the latter ‘British structuralism’ was actually a British version of ‘French structuralism’!

zh: 英人类学的研究领域缘起于学术世界的边缘，当时学术界认为其他主题远比研究人类社会和文化多样性更重要和更有趣。
en: The field of study that became British anthropology arose on the fringes of a scholarly world that regarded other topics as far more important and interesting than the study of human social and cultural diversity.

zh: 当时它所面临的学术界似乎极不愿意把它作为学术机构内值得探索的一系列专业学科之中的亲密一员来欢迎。
en: It faced an academic establishment that seems to have been most reluctant to welcome it as a bona fide discipline within the range of academic specialties worth pursuing in scholarly institutions.

zh: 在这种情况下，对英国人类学传统的叙述不能仅限于那些关于学者们如何在学术思想、创新和正统观念上相互较劲的内部故事：我们必须还要考虑在学者们所处的较大的社会环境中普遍存在着的那些令他们不得不受其影响的兴趣和偏见，以及他们在学术生活中所能接触到的、帮助他们实现研究目标的具体组织和资源。
en: Under such circumstances, an account of the British tradition of anthropology cannot be restricted to an internal story of scholars wrestling each other over intellectual ideas, innovations, and orthodoxies: we must also take account of the interests and prejudices that prevailed in the larger society, to which these scholars had to accommodate, and of the particular organizations and resources in academic life that were available to them as the means of pursuing their goals.

zh: 虽然在当代世界一夫一妻制和一夫多妻制是最普遍的婚姻形式，但是也有其他的婚姻形式存在，尽管很少见。
en: Although monogamy and polygyny are the most common forms of marriage in the world today, other forms do occur, however rarely.

zh: 一妻多夫制（polyandry），即一个女子同时与两个或多个男子的婚姻，只在儿个社会中见到，部分原因或许是男子的预期寿命比女子的短，而且男婴的死亡率高，所以在一个社会中男子过剩是不大可能的。
en: Polyandry, the marriage of one woman to two or more men simultaneously, is known in only a few societies, perhaps in part because men's life expectancy is shorter than women's, and male infant mortality is high, so a surplus of men in a society is unlikely.

zh: 在性别 比例平衡的地方，如在拉达克人的社会中，许多妇女可能一直不结婚。
en: Where sex ratios are balanced, as in Ladakh, many women are likely to remain unmarried.

zh: 一妻多夫制少见的另一个原因，是这种婚姻形式比任何其他形式更加限制一个男子的后代。
en: Another reason for polyandry rarity is that it limits a man's descendants more than any other pattern.

zh: 然而，在纳亚尔人中，一妻多夫制使女子怀孕的机会最大化，确保其继嗣群体孩子的生育。
在20世纪，应用人类学的范围扩大了。
en: In the present century, the scope of applied anthropology has broadened.

zh: 20世纪早期，弗朗兹˙博厄斯在美国几乎单枪匹马地训练了一代人类学家，帮助改革美国的移民政策。
en: Early on, the applied work of Franz Boas, who almost single-handedly trained a generation of anthropologists in the United States, was instrumental in reforming the country immigration policies.

zh: 30年代，带着非常明确的实际目的的人类学家，对美国的工业环境和制度环境做了相尚多的研究。
en: In the 1930s, anthropologists with avowedly applied goals did a number of studies in industrial and other institutional settings in the United States.

zh: 随着第二次世界大战的到来，首次尝试由受过人类学训练的官员来管理美国疆土之外(尤其是太平洋上）的殖民地。
en: With World War II came the first efforts at colonial administration beyond U.S. borders, especially in the Pacific, by officers trained in anthropology.

zh: 日本的迅速复苏在很大程度上归功于人类学家在安排美国军事占领中的影响。
en: The rapid recovery of Japan was due in no small measure to the influence of anthropologists on structuring the U.S. occupation.

zh: 米德以及她同时代的其他人类学家的观点是关于文化可变性的基本经验。
en: Mead's point, and that of other anthropologists of her time, was the fundamental lesson of cultural variability.

zh: 虽然弗里曼和其他一些现代批评家对它们进行了残酷的歪曲，但这仍是整个20世纪的人类学家们不得不一次又一次重新关注的：从博厄斯的圈子对纳粹关于种族和优生学观点的回应，到种族主义主张在像《钟曲线》（Herrnstein and Murray 1994)这样的书中的多次重现，再到作为族群暴力借口的“文化”这一概念的滥用。
en: It was cruelly distorted by Freeman and some other latter-day critics, but it is a message that anthropologists have had to return to again and again throughout the twentieth century: from the responses of Boas's circle to Nazi ideas about race and eugenics, to the multiple reappearances of racialist claims in books like The Bell Curve (Herrnstein and Murray, 1994), to the misuses of "culture" as justification for ethnic violence.

zh: 人类学的这一职责至今仍然伴随着我们。
en: This task for anthropology is still with us.

zh: 其他学者展示了这些发挥作用的过程。
en: Other scholars have demonstrated these processes at work.

zh: 如南希·利斯·斯捷潘(Nancy Leys Stepan)在她关于拉丁美洲优生运动的书中，研究了后殖民社会（1920—1930年）的巴西、墨西哥和阿根廷天主教社会优生的含义，那时，新民族诞生于不同种类的人群。
en: Nancy Leys Stepan, for example, in her book on the eugenics movement in Latin America investigates the particular meanings of eugenics in the Catholic, post-colonial societies of Brazil, Mexico and Argentina in the 1920s and 1930s, when new nations were being constituted out of heterogeneous populations.

zh: 优生学家在建构民族群体中的融入和排斥概念方面发挥着作用，赋予民族群体种族的、有性别差异的认同。
en: Eugenicists played a part in structuring notions of inclusion and exclusion in national bodies, giving that body its ethnic and gendered identity.

zh: 这种思维方式，在我们的文化中的许多方面都可谓是根深蒂固。
en: This way of thinking is embedded in our culture from many sources.

zh: 它存在于我们的语言中：我们的语言（不同于许多非欧洲语言）有时态，它把人的体验划分成过去、现在和未来。
en: It is in our language, which, unlike many non-European languages, has tense;it categorizes experience in past, present, and future.

zh: 它存在于我们的犹太一基督教宗教传统中：这一传统想象我们有一个历史——一个始于遥远的过去，从创世记经由亚伯拉罕、摩西和先知一直到现在的进步——和一个未来。
en: It is in our Judeo-Christian religious tradition, which imagines that we have a history – a past progressing from the creation of the world through Abraham, Moses, and the prophets – and a future.

zh: 新教传统强调，是个体自身，作为一个独立单位，遭受天谴被罚人地狱永远受苦，或是得到拯救升入天堂享受极乐。
en: Protestant Christian tradition emphasizes that it is the individual self, as an independent unit, which is damned to eternal suffering in hell or saved for eternal bliss in heaven.

zh: 其他重点也存在于其他宗教中，例如，在早期犹太教中，上帝给予惩罚或奖励的是国家。
en: Other emphases are present in other religions; for example, in early Judaism it was the nation that God punished or rewarded.

zh: 一个人有投票表决权，是美国民主的一个规则，但像20世纪早期的日本就不是这样，在那里是户主代表所有家庭成员进行投票。
en: One person, one vote is the rule in American democracy, but not, say, in early-twentieth-century Japan, where it was the household head who voted, representing the household group.

zh: 他的著作中处处都强调有意识的主体和能动性所发挥的作用，而他的反对者则批评他的这一思想是“主观性”的观点。
en: Everywhere in his work he emphasized the role of conscious agents or actors—an emphasis which his opponents were inclined to criticize as the "subjective" point of view.

zh: 然而人是他人行为的对象而非主体，因此非主体的人符合了社会信息系统的各项标准。
en: It is persons as the objects of the actions of others, however, not as subjects, that meet his criteria for sociological data.

zh: 兹纳涅茨基在这些信息的来源中列举了社会学家的个人经验——这种经验既有原初的又有从他人经验中间接获得的；社会学家的直接的和间接的观察；其他人的个人经验及其观察。
en: Among the sources of these data Znaniecki listed the personal experiences of the sociologist, both original and vicarious; observation by the sociologist, both direct and indirect; the personal experience of other people; and the observations of other people.

zh: 自从热内·笛卡尔（Rene Descartes（1596-1650））提出那个著名的纯粹我思：“我思故我在”，意识就成为现代哲学关注的对象。
en: Consciousness has been of modern philosophical concern since René Descartes (1596–1650) formulated what became known as the cogito: ‘I think therefore I am’.

zh: 之后，哲学的重心从宇宙转移到个体的人；控制人行动的力量和个体内心的宿命感，以及先前感受到的内在于外部世界的精神生活和精神活动的观念——上帝、行星、药草、诙谐、教堂仪式——这些都越来越减弱了。
en: Thereafter, the centre of philosophical gravity shifted from the cosmos to the individual human being; forces which controlled human behaviour and destiny were felt to arise more and more from within the individual, while belief in the spiritual life and activity previously felt to be immanent in the world outside—gods, planets, herbs, humours, church ritual—grew feebler.

zh: 哲学家开始从思考自身出发由内而外地进行研究，而非由外而内地从宇宙研究到灵魂；约翰·洛克（John Locke（1632-1704））采用了一个新词汇“意识”来指称“在个体的脑中经历的感知”。
en: Philosophers began to work outwards from the thinking self rather than inwards from the cosmos to the soul; and John Locke (1632–1704) adopted the new word‘consciousness’ to mean: ‘perception of what passes in an individual’s own mind’.

zh: 意识逐步被看作是人的行动、社会、语言和知识的基础。
en: Consciousness came to be seen as fundamental to human behaviour, society, language and knowledge.

zh: 新弗洛伊德主义：比较不同社会中的童年，有时从很大的数据量中取样，来检验弗洛伊德的假设，即成年人的性格是童年中冲突的反映（Erikson 1977）。
en: Neo-Freudianism: Childhood practices in different societies have been compared, sometimes in large numbers (Whiting and Child 1953), in terms of Freudian assumptions concerning the way adult character is a reflection of childhood conflicts (cf. Erikson 1977).

zh: 杜·波伊斯（Du Bois 1944）经过进一步的研究指出，埃勒人中母亲对年幼儿童的忽视造成了埃勒成年人在情感上的浅薄、怀疑和不稳定，一个民间传说加强了成年人和儿童之间的这种挫折感和憎恨以及怀疑神性的宇宙观。
en: In an extended study, Du Bois (1944) argued that maternal neglect of young children on Alor was responsible for affective shallowness, suspicion and instability among Alorese adults, for a folklore which stressed adult-child frustrations and hatred, and a cosmology of suspect deities.

zh: 类似的，斯皮罗（Spiro 1958, 1982）把弗洛伊德理论引入到对特罗布里恩德岛人和克布兹人的童年研究中。
en: Spiro similarly introduced Freud into Trobriand and kibbutz childhoods (1958, 1982).

zh: 另一种促使语言变化的广泛力量是语言民族主义（linguistic nationalism)， 整个国家通过把“外国的”术语从他们自己的词汇中清除出去，以显示其独立的一种努力。
en: One other far-reaching force for linguistic change is linguistic nationalism, an attempt by-whole countries to proclaim their independence by purging their vocabularies of "foreign" terms.

zh: 这种现象尤其是今天非洲和亚洲的前殖民地国家所特有的。
en: This phenomenon is particularly characteristic of the former colonial countries of Africa and Asia today.

zh: 然而，这绝不限于这呰国家，因为人们可以看到法国人周期性地从他们的语言中清除诸如“汉堡包”等美语用法。
en: It is by no means limited to those countries, however, as shown by periodic French attempts to purge their language of such Americanisms as le hamburger.

zh: 在语言民族主义范畴内，还有长期以来从少数族群、有时甚至从整个国家的共同用法中产生的语言复活（估计有6000种语言已经在过去500年里消失了）。
en: Also in the category of linguistic nationalism are revivals of languages long out of common use, by ethnic minorities and sometimes even whole countries.

zh: 历史语言学在确定不同语言之间的谱系关系方面已经取得巨大成就，这些成就反映在分类图表之中。
en: Historical linguists have achieved considerable success working out the genealogical relationships between different languages, and these are reflected in classification schemes.

zh: 例如，英语是归类在印欧语系语（参见图4.2）中约140种语言中的一种。
en: For example, English is one of a number of languages classified in the Indo-European language family (Figure 4.2).

zh: 这一语族又分为11个语言亚族，这就反映了这一事实：从一种古代统一的语言（指原始印欧语）向独立的“女儿”语言的语言趋异（linguistic divergence）要经历很长一个时期（约6000年左右）。
en: This family is subdivided into 11 subgroups, which reflect the long period (8,000 years or so) of linguistic divergence from an ancient unified language (referred to as Proto-Indo-European) into separate "daughter" languages.

zh: 英语是日尔曼语亚族（参见图4.3）中几种语言的一种，这几种语言之间的相互关系比它们与印欧语系语族的其他亚族的关系更为紧密。
en: English is one of a number of languages in the Germanic subgroup (Figure 4.3); all are more closely related to one another than to the languages of any other subgroup of the Indo-European family.

zh: 文化人类学可以划分为考古学、语言人类学和民族学（通常被称为社会文化人类学，参见图l.l）。
en: Although the findings of cultural anthropologists often have challenged the conclusions of sociologists, psychologists, and economists, anthropology is absolutely indispensable to them, as it is the only consistent check against culture-bound assertions.

zh: 虽然每个分支有自己的专业兴趣和方法，但它们都研究文化资料。
en: Anthropology is to these disciplines what the laboratory is to physics and chemistry: the essential testing ground for their theories.

zh: 考古学家、语言学家和民族学家对研究主题采取不同的研究方式，但是，它们每一学科都捜集和分析有助于说明人类文化相似性和差异性的数据，以及在任何地方不同文化发展、调适和持续变迁的方式。
en: Cultural anthropology may be divided into the areas of archaeology, linguistic anthropology, and ethnology (often called sociocultural anthropology; Figure 1.1).

zh: 另一类别的发嗓音是由语音修饰（vocal qualifiers）构成的。
en: Another category of vocalizations consists of vocal qualifiers.

zh: 有一种比嗓音特征表露更短暂的音延，一般限于单个语调空隙里，而不是遍及整条短语。
en: These are of briefer duration than vocal characterizers, limited generally to the space of a single intonation, rather than over whole phrases.They modify utterances in terms of intensity—loud versus soft; pitch—high versus low; and extent—drawl versus clipping.

zh: 它们根据强度音的响亮与柔和、音调的高与低、迟缓与快速来修饰话语这些表示说话人对诸如“滚出去”这类特殊短语的态度。
en: These indicate the speaker's attitude toward specific phrases, such as "Get out!"

zh: 第三类别是由发声间隔（vocal segregates) 构成的。
en: The third category consists of vocal segregates.

zh: 历史语言学在确定不同语言之间的谱系关系方面已经取得巨大成就，这些成就反映在分类图表之中。
en: Historical linguists have achieved considerable success working out the genealogical relationships between different languages, and these are reflected in classification schemes.

zh: 例如，英语是归类在印欧语系语（参见图4.2）中约140种语言中的一种。
en: For example, English is one of a number of languages classified in the Indo-European language family (Figure 4.2).

zh: 这一语族又分为11个语言亚族，这就反映了这一事实：从一种古代统一的语言（指原始印欧语）向独立的“女儿”语言的语言趋异（linguistic divergence）要经历很长一个时期（约6000年左右），英语是日尔曼语亚族（参见图4.3）中几种语言的一种，这几种语言之间的相互关系比它们与印欧语系语族的其他亚族的关系更为紧密。
en: This family is subdivided into 11 subgroups, which reflect the long period (8,000 years or so) of linguistic divergence from an ancient unified language (referred to as Proto-Indo-European) into separate "daughter" languages.English is one of a number of languages in the Germanic subgroup (Figure 4.3); all are more closely related to one another than to the languages of any other subgroup of the Indo-European family.

zh: 特纳延续了范·盖内普将仪式分为三阶段的做法：分离、阈限 （liminality）和再融合。
en: Turner follows van Gennep in dividing the rites into three phases: separation, liminality and reintegration.

zh: 分离的特征是个人或群体从社会结构中的一个固定点离开朝向某个未知的事物。
en: Separation is characterised by the individual's or group's movement away from a fixed point in social structure towards something unknown.

zh: 当这种突破行为被完成，行动者就进入了阈限阶段，这是一个模糊的发展进程，某种意义上说，他或她置身于社会之外，在两种稳定状态之间“悬而未决，模棱两可”（Turner 1969)。
en: When the breach is completed, the agent enters a liminal phase, an ambiguous stage where he or she is in a certain sense placed outside society, "betwixt and between" (Turner 1969) two stable conditions.

zh: 这将行动者置于了一个危险的境地。
en: This puts the actor in a dangerous position.

zh: 社会所承担的风险是，行动者拒绝被融合并且抛弃了社会的价值和权力等级。而行动者个人所冒的风险是个人失范状态和没有社会归属。
en: Society runs the risk that the actor refuses to be reintegrated and rejects its values and power hierarchies, while the individual for his or her part risks anomie and social homelessness.

zh: 特纳写道，几乎在每个社会，处在阈限阶段的人“按照他的文化的标准定义和分类法，即便不是身体上，从结构上看也是隐形的”（1974，P.232)。
en: Turner writes that in nearly every society, a person in a liminal phase is "structurally if not physically invisible in terms of his culture's standard definitions and classifications"(1974, p. 232).

zh: 最后的这些观察让人回忆起他无拘无束的狂飙突进（Storm and Drang)生涯.却似乎对狂欢节没有任何的指涉。
en: Reminiscent of his unrestrained Sturm und Drang period, these last observations seem removed from any specific referent in the carnival.

zh: 狂欢节只是歌德沉思的一个借口 。
en: The carnival is an excuse for Goethe's meditation.

zh: 他关心的不是它对于参与者的意义，而是对于他自己和他的读者的意义。
en: His concern is with ils meaning not for the participants, but for himself and his readers.

zh: 歌德把狂欢节简化为一则关于个人命运的传统寓言，无视历史的和集体的维度，也无视巴赫金（Bakhtin 1965)所强调的、在充满了喜剧精神的大众命运与土地之间的联系。
en: Ignoring the historical and the collective, the link, as Bakhtin (1965) stresses, between popular destiny, penetrated by the comic principle, and the earth, Goethe reduces the carnival to a conventional allegory of individual destiny.

zh: 这节日的意义在于一个关于超越的故事——一个卡特林想为欧吉帕仪式寻找却从来没能真正找到的那种故事。
en: Its meaning lies in a transcendent story—the kind Catlin sought for the O-Kee-Pa ceremony but could never really find.

zh: 歌德的寓言把个人从来回折腾、躁动和喑嚣——非个人化（unindividuated)—一的人群中拯救出来。
en: Through Goethe's allegory, the individual is, so to speak, resurrected from the milling, seething, tumultuous—the unindividuated—crowd.

zh: 代码也必须携带信息，这些信息是否含蓄，取决于它们所含信息的种类、对象和随后的加工过裎。
en: Codes must also carry information, however implicitly, concerning what kind of information they contain, who it is for, and what is to be done with it.

zh: 信息不仅仅涉及外部事件，而旦处于代码系统中的这些信息也会传递关于系统本身及其使用者的讯息。
en: Besides information about external events, therefore, the messages in a codification system also convey information about the system itself and those who are using it.

zh: 因此，讯息不仅交换信息，而且是交流的交流，或者说是“元信息传递” (Bateson 1951: 209)。
en: Hence, not only do the messages communicate information, they are also communications about communication, or "metacommunications" (Bateson 1951:209).

zh: 倘若气候保持不变，看起来似乎有两种交互作用的因素极大地加速了生态环境的变化过程：人口增长和技术变化。
en: Provided the climate remains constant, it seems as though two interrelated factors may dramatically speed up processes of change in the ecological environment: population growth and technological change.

zh: 技术的变化倾向于指增加对自然资源的开采和对能量的使用。
en: Technological changes tend to imply an intensified exploitation of natural resources and an increased use of energy.

zh: 人口增长往往是技术进步的后果，但也并不总是这样。
en: Population growth is often, but not always, a result of technological change.

zh: 一个可以养活大约1000个狩猎采集者或是2000个园艺种植者的区域，大约能够支持20000位使 用拖拉机和化肥的农民，但是他们将不能回复到园艺农业，而从这个角度上说，他们就失去了机动性（Bateson 1972）。
en: An area which is capable of sustaining perhaps 1,000 hunters and gatherers, or 2,000 horticulturalists, may perhaps be able to support 20,000 farmers with tractors and chemical fertiliser, but they will not be able to revert to horticulture and have in this sense lost flexibility (Bateson 1972).

zh: 借用弗洛伊德的术语，我们可以暂且将这场暴动所展现出 来的革命行为称作一个“原初心理过程"（primary process），这样，我们便将伊达尔戈领导的革命同其他地方所发生的相似的过程联系起来，因为这些“原初心理过程”就其本质而言是一致的。
en: If we can provisionally label the kind of revolutionary actions manifested in the insurrection, by analogy with Freud's usage, as a "primary process" as Dario Zadra has suggested, we have a clue to the nature of similar processes elsewhere.

zh: 原初心理过程并不源自习得性的和有意识的模式，它是所有的人经过长期的经验累积之后突然迸发出来的行为。这些人内心深处的物质需要和精神需要长期以来不能通过任何合法的方式来表达，他们被掌握权力的精英们所统治和约束，而这些精英们统治广大民众的方法类似于弗洛伊德心理分析体系中的“潜意识压抑作用"（censorship）。
en: A primary process does not develop from a cognitive, conscious model; it erupts from the cumulative experience of whole peoples whose deepest material and spiritual needs and wants have for long been denied any legitimate expression by power-holding elites who operate in a manner analogous to that of Freud's "censorship" in psychological systems.

zh: 当早期原人的某些种群开始制造他们可用来屠宰动物以得到肉食的石制工具时，人类的文化看来就已经发展起来了。
en: Human culture appears to have developed as some populations of early hominines began making stone tools they could butcher animals with for their meat.

zh: 最早的石制工具和值得注意的食肉证据，与人类出现一起，可追溯到约250方年前，人脑显著地扩大，超过任何其他早期原人的脑。
en: Actually, the earliest stone tools and evidence of significant meat eating date to between 2.5 million and 2 million years ago, along with the appearance of the genus Homo, whose brain was significantly enlarged over that of any other early hominine.

zh: 从那时起，习得的行为——文化——在人的持续生存中越来越重要，有助于更好的人脑的演化，反过来，更好的人脑使作为手段的文化改进成为可能，人类借助文化手段保证他们的持续生存。
en: From then on the increasing importance of culture in human survival favored the evolution of a better brain, which in turn made possible improvement in culture as the vehicle humans used to secure their survival.

zh: 在40万年前到20万年前之间，人脑的脑量达到现代人脑的大小，而文化则一直到现在还在不断地演化和变化。
en: By about 200,000 years ago, the human brain had reached its modern size, but culture has continued to evolve and change down to the present.

zh: 后面我会回到这个问题，但现在我想阐明我的立场。
en: I shall come back to this question of perception later, but I want to make my own position clear.

zh: 我会接受原生论不能很好地解释族裔差异这个观点，但是，当然要承认它对包含于族裔情感之中的非同一般的力量的一种描述。
en: I would accept that primordialism does not work well as an explanation of ethnic difference, but it certainly works as a description of the extraordinary force that is contained in ethnic sentiment.

zh: 对很多人来说，族裔纽带是忠诚、骄傲、定位、归属、避难、认同、信任、接纳和安全一类的事情。
en: For many people, ethnic ties are a matter of loyalty, of pride, of location, of belonging, of refuge, of identity, trust, acceptance and security.

zh: 我在本章开篇时指出，通过对环境的广泛文化比较，我们可能会逐渐了解环境决定论与其他认识世界的方式之间的异同性。
en: At the beginning of this chapter I suggested that, by comparing a range of cultural perspectives on the environment, we might come to understand how environmentalism differs from, and is similar to, other ways of understanding the world.

zh: 在开始进行比较分析时，我选择探讨环境决定论者和其他工业社会的人们普遍信仰的神话，即非工业社会拥有能与其 环境和睦相处的原始生态智慧。
en: As a starting point for the comparative analysis, I chose to examine the myth, commonly held by environmentalists and others within industrial society, that nonindustrial societies possess a primitive ecological wisdom that enables them to live in harmony with their environments.

zh: 以下我们通过比较的方法从文化的角度来分析神话以及环境决定论的特性。
en: It is timeto consider what the comparison reveals, both about the myth and about the character of environmentalism as a cultural perspective.

zh: 同一小群具有相同想法的学者一起，泰勒继续为此新学科设计出问题和概念，并在其具有影响力的《原始文化》（1871)中为其提供了一个连贯的表述。
en: With a small handful of likeminded scholars, Tylor proceeded to work out the issues and concepts for the new discipline and gave them a coherent formulation in his influential Primitive Culture (1871).

zh: 他明确提出的理论前提——“人类心智同一性”极为重要：这一理念巧妙地运用其多义性将人种学者的废奴主义和人道主义信念转变为对全人类平等和其精神价值的承认。
en: Of greatest importance was his explicit premise of "the psychic unity of man" — a felicitously polysemous transformation of the ethnologists' abolitionist and humanitarian commitment to the equality and moral value of all of humankind.

zh: 这为人类学引入了一种相对主义，以调和维多利亚时代的民族中心主义。
en: It introduced into anthropology a relativism with which to temper Victorian ethnocentrism.

zh: 这并不是说，人们一直没有注意到世界上与他们自己在看法和行为上不同的其他民族的存在。
en: This is not to say people always have been unaware of the existence of others in the world who look and act differently from themselves.

zh: 例如，圣经《旧约全书》与《新约全书》充分提到各种各样的民族， 其中有犹太人、埃及人、赫梯人、巴比伦人、埃塞俄比亚人、罗马人等等。
en: The Old and New Testaments of the Bible, for example, are full of references to diverse peoples, among them Jews, Egyptians, Hittites, Babylonians, Ethiopians, Romans, and so forth.

zh: 这些民族之间的差异，比之他们中任何人与（例如）澳大利亚、亚马孙森林或北极的北美原住民的差异，就显得逊色了。
en: The differences among these people pale by comparison to those between any of them and (for example) indigenous people of Australia, the Amazon forest, or arctic North America.

zh: 借助于向真正遥远地方旅行的手段，人们有可能第一次遇到这类根本不同的民族。
en: With the means to travel to truly faraway places, people found it possible to meet for the first time such radically different people.

zh: 不过，人类学一般沿用林顿（Linton 1936）的定义，认为角色是身份的动态方面，也就是，人在身份定义限制下的实际行为。
en: In anthropology, however, the role is generally defined – following Linton (1936) – as the dynamic aspect of the status, that is, a person's actual behaviour within the limitations set by the status definition.

zh: 如，在现代社会中的一个典型身份可以是“巴士司机”；巴士司机的角色将由这个作为巴士司机的人的所作所为来定义。你的特定的社会身份直接决定着你应该以怎样的特定方式行动。
en: A typical status in a modern society may be "bus driver"; the role of the bus driver will then be defined by what one actually does as a bus driver.Being the incumbent of a particular social status directs one's actions in specified ways.

zh: 例如，公主被认为是不能在深夜的下流娱乐场所喝啤酒的；因纽特人的巫师被认为在必要的时候应该与超自然力建立联系；特罗布里恩德群岛的妻子被认为在性的方面应该是一夫一妻制的；德国工厂的工人被认为每个工作日的早晨8点以前就应该来报到。
en: A princess, for instance, is expected not to drink beer late at night at seedy joints.A shaman among the Inuit is expected to establish contact with supernatural powers when necessary; a wife in the Trobriand Islands is expected to be sexually monogamous; a worker in a German factory is expected to register for work before 8 a.m.every weekday.

zh: 如果有谁破坏了其身份所设定的角色的规则和期望，社会的其他成员会通过施加制裁或其他不同的惩罚形式作为反应。
en: When one breaks the rules and expectations connected with the role enactment of a status, other members of society may react by imposing sanctions or different forms of punishment.

zh: 所以，社会同时定义了越轨和正常。
en: Society therefore defined both deviance and normality.

zh: 但是规训的统治不仅仅是从外部得到强化的——它们还常常为那些被迫承受它们的人所内化，这些人于是开始规训自身。
en: But regimes of discipline were not just enforced from the outside—they were also frequently internalized by those made subject to them, who therefore came to discipline themselves.

zh: 这种状况在现代世界当中被更连贯的和更广泛的监督所加强，其例证之一即为最近城市中心的安全摄像头的大量涌现，这简直堪称圆形监狱监控模式的现代运用。
en: This situation was enforced in the modern world by the greater continuity and comprehensiveness of surveillance, now exemplified by the recent explosion in city-center security cameras as a modern form of panopticon.

zh: 这些规训措施都是由福柯称之为知识的结构或编码的东西，无论是宗教的、法律的或者科学的，来指导实施的。
en: These disciplinary operations were conducted through what Foucault called structures, or codes of knowledge, whether religious, legal, or scientific, which were created by self-appointed experts in such a way as to appear both natural and neutral.

zh: 阈限的概念来自拉丁文“极限（limen）”（英文threshold），意指所有间隙性的或模棱两可的状态，这个概念与维克多·特纳的作品，以及他所拓展的阿诺德·范·盖纳普的原创观点是分不开的。马科斯·格拉克曼、玛丽·道格拉斯和埃德蒙·利奇都从这个概念中获益匪浅，并产生大量的附属应用。
en: The concept of liminality, from the Latin word for ‘threshold’ (limen) and implying all manner of interstitiality, of being betwixt and between, is most associated with the work of Victor Turner, and his extending of the original ideas of Arnold van Gennep; it has also been put to profitable use by Max Gluckman, Mary Douglas and Edmund Leach, and given rise to a host of spin-off applications.

zh: 通过阈限，人类学才有可能在概念上关注边缘、改变、反抗、排斥、附属、污染、反常和越轨等现象。
en: Through liminality, anthropology has found it possible to focus conceptually upon such phenomena as marginality, alterity, rebellion, ostracism, subalternality, pollution, eccentricity and deviance.

zh: 长老会几乎每天都要聚会讨论村子的各种由土地争论、遗产情况、和邻村之间发生的纠纷或罪行等引起的问题，以及计划即将到来的宗教庆典。
en: The council of elders meets almost daily to discuss village problems ranging from land disputes, inheritance cases, to crimes or conflicts with neighbouring villages, as well as planning upcoming religious festivities.

zh: 传统上，村委会和贺贡是对超出个体家户的问题施加政治权力。
en: The village council and the hogon traditionally have exerted political authority over problems above the level of the individual household.

zh: （今天，国家制度已逐渐接管了他们的许多传统任务。
en: (Today state institutions are gradually taking over many of their traditional tasks.)

zh: ）他们有权接受村民的礼物，也有义务给遭受了不同程度的伤害的村民以补偿。
en: They are entitled to receive presents from the inhabitants, but are also committed to paying compensation to inhabitants who have suffered various damages.

zh: 贺贡拥有很多权力，和现代社会的政府一样。
en: The hogon has many of the same kinds of power as the state in modern societies.

zh: 当人们违反法律时，由贺贡来定罪量刑，他是“总理”和“大主教”，并负责再分配。
en: He measures out punishment when the law is broken, he is "prime minister" and "archbishop" and he is responsible for redistribution.

zh: 他从社区成员那里收受的礼物可以看成是税收，他有义务为了公共利益对此进行再分配。
en: The presents he receives from the members of the community can be seen as taxes, and he is obliged to redistribute them for the common good.

zh: 当涉及“事件”(events)，即历史中无法预知的变化的问题时，他提出了“局势结构”(the structure of the conjuncture)的概念。在这一概念中，事件按照文化排序整理，并且在这一过程中文化自身也得到重新整理。
en: To deal with the problem of "events," the unpredictable twists of history, he proposed the notion of "the structure of the conjuncture," whereby events are ordered by culture and, in the process, culture itself is reordered.

zh: （他对此的表述是：“一种结构的再生产”可能会“成为它的转变。
en: (As he phrased it, "the reproduction of a structure" may "become its transformation.")

zh: ”）在一系列对1778年库克船长与夏威夷人的相遇以及接下来发生的事件进行重新解释的作品中(Sahlins 1981,1985),他极为详尽地发展了这些观点。
en: He developed these ideas in great detail in a series of works reinterpreting the encounter of Captain Cook with the Hawaiians in 1778 and the events that followed (1981, 1985).

zh: 社会戏剧以及社会事业——以及其他类型的过程化单位——代表了社会事件的前后连贯性，如果一个观察者将这些事件加以回溯，便能发现它们的结构。
en: Social dramas and social enterprises—as well as other kinds of processual units—represent sequences of social events, which, seen retrospectively by an observer, can be shown to have structure.

zh: 这种“时间性”的结构不同于非时间性结构（包括“概念的”、“认知的”以及“句法的”结构），尽管认知过程本身是一种智力过程并具有程序性的特点，但时间性结构基本上按照时间的关系而非空间的关系来组织。
en: Such "temporal" structure, unlike atemporal structure (including "conceptual," "cognitive," and "syntactical" structures), is organized primarily through relations in time rather than in space, though, of course, cognitive schemes are themselves the result of a mental process and have processual qualities.

zh: 如果有人能像看动作片一样注意到社会过程并且能够仔细审视“静止”的部分——即一个社区中与社会过程并存的社会关系，那么他可能就会发现这些暂时性的结构既不完整也并非完美无缺，而是需要不断地进行调整。
en: If one were able to arrest the social process as though it were a motion film and were then to examine the "still," the coexisting social relations within a community, one would probably find that the temporary structures were incomplete, open-ended, unconsummated.

zh: 没有专职工作高度分化的社会比那些有这种高度分化的社会存在的时间要长得多，而在前一种社会中，总是有一些个人拥有特殊的能力和技巧，使他们可以接触并操纵超自然存在和力量。他们通常独自通过个人体验而获得此类力量和技巧。
en: Societies that lack full-time occupational specialization have existed far longer than those with such specialization, and the former always have had individuals who acquired religious power individually, usually in solitude and isolation, when the Great Spirit, the Power, the Great Mystery, or whatever is revealed to them.

zh: 在一种异常的意识状态之下，他们得到某种幻象，这种幻象陚予他们力量去医治疾病、改变天气、控制动物的活动以及预言未来。当这些个人出色地做到这些以及其他相关技巧时，他们就扮演了萨满（Shamans）的角色。
en: These persons become the recipients of certain special gifts, such as healing or divination; when they return to society, they frequently are given another kind of religious role, that of the shaman.

zh: 在美国，上百万的人是通过布莱克·埃尔克的自传和卡洛斯·卡斯塔涅达的叙述对萨满有所了解的。前者叙述的是传统的印第安部落拉科塔人的圣人，而后者叙述的则是关于他与印第安部落雅基人的萨满唐璜之间大部分虚构的故事。
en: In the United States millions of people have learned something about shamans through reading the popular autobiography of Black Elk, a traditional Oglala Sioux Indian "medicine man，" or Carlos Castaneda's apparently fictional accounts of his experiences with Don Juan, the Yaqui Indian shaman.

zh: 在所有人类社会中，尽管女性可能是照顾孩子的首要人选，但她们同样得承担其他责任。
en: In all human societies, even though women may be the primary providers of child care, women have other responsibilities as well.

zh: 虽然在她们所从事的传统经济活动中，有几项是与她们抚养孩子的角色兼容的，因而不会使她们的后代面临危险，但这并非说她们从事的所有活动都这样。
en: Although several of the economic activities they traditionally have engaged in have been compatible with their child-rearing role and have not placed their off-spring at risk, this cannot be said of all their activities.

zh: 想想最普通的抚养孩子和烹饪食物这两项工作加在一起，是如何造成一种对孩子具有潜在危险的环境的,尤其是当食物是在野外烹制的时候如果母亲（或者其他的抚养者)被其他任务分心，那么小孩就很可能被严重地烧伤或割伤。
en: Consider how the common combination of child care with food preparation, especially if cooking is done over an open fire, creates a potentially hazardous situation for children.With the mother (or other caregiver) distracted by some other task, the child all too easily may receive a severe burn or bad cut, with serious consequences.

zh: 对诺德和其他许多艺术家来说，将非欧洲人的艺术风格合并到他们自己的作品中，提供了一种获得真实性的方法，他们感觉在自己那个时代的生活方式中这种真实性已经丢失了（Lloyd 1991: 96ff.）。
en: For Norde and many other artists the incorporating of the art styles of non-European peoples into their own work provided the means through which they could achieve an authenticity that had been lost, they felt, in the art and lifestyle of their own times (see Lloyd 1991:96 ff.).

zh: 通过捕捉原始手工制品的原初的生命力和儿童、民间和土著艺术的自发性和直觉力，他们希望能够直抵“本质”。
en: The desire was to penetrate into the ‘essential’ by capturing the primal vitality of primitive hand-made production and the spontaneity and intuitive force of child, folk and native arts.

zh: 类似部落、民间和儿童的创造被认为是真实的，也尚未被工业革命所离间（unalienated）（see Lloyd 1991）和玷污。
en: Tribal, folk and child creations alike were considered to be objects that were authentic, and also unalienated (see Lloyd 1991), unsullied by the Industrial Revolution.

zh: 为比较和分析起见，人类学家习惯上把文化分解成许多看起来分离的各个部分，虽然这种区分是武断的。
en: For comparison and analysis, anthropologists customarily break a culture down into many seemingly discrete parts, even though such distinctions are arbitrary.

zh: 因为文化是系统，所以，始终如一地考察文化某一方面的人类学家,发现也有必要考察文化的其他方面。
en: The anthropologist who examines one aspect of a culture invariably finds it necessary to examine others as well.

zh: 就如在任何系统中，为了发挥作用，文化的各个方面必定合理地整合在一起。
en: This tendency for all aspects of a culture to function as an interrelated whole is called integration.

zh: 北美人类学家利奧波德˙波西皮西尔1955年对新几内亚西部的山民巴布亚卡保库人的研究，可以说明文化在经济、政治和社会方面的整合。
en: The integration of the economic, political, and social aspects of a culture can be illustrated by the Kapauku Papuans, a mountain people of western New Guinea studied in 1955 by North American anthropologist Leopold Pospisil.

zh: 现代化的另外两个特征与上文已经提到的那些方面同时出现。
en: Two other features of modernization go hand in hand with those already noted.

zh: 第一，结构分化（structural differentiation），即承担两项或多项功能的单一传统角色，分化成两个或多个只具备一项特定专门功能的角色。
en: One, structural differentiation, is the division of single traditional roles, which embrace two or more functions, into two or more separate roles, each with a single specialized function.

zh: 这意味着社会的某种分裂，如果不希望社会分裂成若千分散的单元，就必须用新的整合机制（integrative mechanism）来抵消这种分裂。
en: This represents a kind of fragmentation of society, which must be counteracted by new integrative mechanisms if the society is not to disintegrate into a number of discrete units.

zh: 这些新的整合机制的形式有：正式的政府结构、官方意识形态、政党、法典、工会和其他的共同利益团体。
en: These new mechanisms take such forms as formal governmental structures, official state ideologies, political parties, legal codes, and labor and trade unions as well as other common-interest associations.

zh: 要成为所研究文化的参与观察者并不意味着，为研究战争频繁的文化，民族志学家要加入人们的战斗；但是由于生活在好战的人群中，民族志学家应当能够理解战争是如何与整个文化结构相契合的。
en: Participant observation of the culture under study does not mean the ethnographer must join in a peopled battles in order to study a culture where warfare is prominent; but by living among a warlike people, the ethnographer should be able to understand the role of warfare in the overall cultural scheme.

zh: 他或她必须是谨慎的观察者，以便能够达到对一种文化的深入概观，而没有不适当地强调文化的某一方面而忽略了另一方面。
en: He or she must be a meticulous observer to get a broad overview of a culture without placing undue emphasis on one of its parts at the expense of another.

zh: 只有通过发现所有的文化制度——社会的、政治的、经济的、宗教的制度——是怎样相互联系的，民族志学家才可能开始理解文化体系。
en: Only by discovering how all cultural institutions—social, political, economic, religious— relate to one another can ethnographers begin to understand cultural systems.

zh: 人类学家把这—研究方式称为整体论视角（holistic perspective），而且它是人类学的基本原则之一。
en: Anthropologists re¬fer to this as the holistic perspective, and it is one of the fundamental principles of anthropology.

zh: 尽管与北美文化的消极态度正相反。但是，进入类似出神状态和体验（一种范围广泛的幻觉）的能力，本身没有什么是反常的。
en: The negative attitude of North American culture notwithstanding, nothing is abnormal perse about the ability to enter trancelike states and experience a wide range of hallucinations.

zh: 相反，周期性改变意识的欲望是一种天生的、正常的冲动，类似于饥饿和性欲的冲动甚至有很好的证据表明，黑猩猩、狒狒、其他猴子、猫、狗和其他动物也产生幻觉，而且这种能力是哺乳动物不只是人类神经系统的功能。
en: To the contrary, The desire to alter consciousness periodically is an innate, normal drive analogous to culture, the concept of normal personality is quite not just human, nervous system.

zh: 因此，进入变异状态和体验幻觉及其他感觉的能力似乎在智人出现前就有了，毫不令人惊讶，进入出神状态的能力是人类共同的能力。
en: Thus, the ability to enter altered states and experience visions and other sensations appears to predate the appearance of Homo sapiens, and it is not surprising that the ability to enter trance is a human universal.

zh: 为什么要告诉全世界？
en: Why tell it to the world?

zh: 卡特林没有为他的经验提供框架——没有证明他的报道是正当的。
en: Catlin has no framework for his experience—no justification for his reportage.

zh: 他的目的是忠实地记录，但是这个目的足以让目击和描述一个“让一位乡间旅行者的心甚至胃都生出厌恶”(第182—183页），同时却使这样一位旅行者充满同情的“惊人而恶心的习俗”变得正当吗？
en: His intention is documentary, but does this intention justify witnessing and describing a "shocking and disgusting custom" that "sickens the heart and even the stomach of a traveller in the country" (182 — 83) and yet that fills such a traveler with pity?

zh: 卡特林用一种含混的方式使他的描述理性化了。
en: Catlin rationalizes his description in a confused manner.

zh: （他从来就不是一个有系统的思想者。
en: (He was never a systematic thinker.)

zh: ）他在文中说这仪式“对文明世界来讲会相当新奇，因此值得了解”(第157页）。
en: He writes that the ceremony "will be new to the civilized world, and therefore worth knowing" (157).

zh: 他暗示着此仪式的某些部分很奇特、很有意思，而与洪水相关的其他部分则“无害且充满了趣味”(第177页）。
en: He suggests that parts of the ceremony are grotesque and amusing and others, having to do with the deluge, are "harmless and full of interest" (177).

zh: 这一复杂的跨学科领域的发展始自人类学的危机，如今仍是变化的、多样的。
en: This complex interdisciplinary area, approached here from the starting point of a crisis in anthropology, is changing and diverse.

zh: 因此我不想给本书的探索性文章强加一种虚假的一致性。
en: Thus I do not want to impose a false unity on the exploratory essays that follow.

zh: 虽然作者们都于一种混合了诗学、政治学和史学的方法心有威威，他们也常常有不一致的时候。
en: Though sharing a general sympathy for approaches combining poetics, politics, and history, they frequently disagree.Many of the contributions fuse literary theory and ethnography.

zh: 一些人査考上述态度的局限，强调制度化权力的限制和唯美主义的危险；其他人热情倡导试验性写作形式。
en: Some probe the limits of such approaches, stressing the dangers of estheticism and the constraints of institutional power.Others enthusiastically advocate experimental forms of writing.

zh: 但他们都出于对未来的可能性的承诺，以不同的方式共同分析了过去和现在的实践。
en: But in their different ways they all analyze past and present practices out of a commitment to future possibilities.

zh: 他们视民族志写作为变动不居的、创造性的：以威廉˙卡洛斯˙威廉斯（William Carlos Williams）的话说，“历史对于我们，应该像小提琴家的左手一样”。
en: They see ethnographic writing as changing, inventive: "History," in William Carlos Williams's words, "that should be a left hand to us, as of a violinist."

zh: 与形式论一实质论的争论相似的是在政治体系和法律方面展开的讨论。
en: A parallel to the formalist/substantivist debate was played out in discussions of political systems and law.

zh: 一方声称法律和政治的普遍原理能够适用于所有社会，例如因纽特人（Inuit）的社会制裁模式可以被视为初始的法律。
en: On one side were those who claimed that there were universal principles of law and politics that could be applied to all societies; modes of social sanction among the Inuit, for example, could be treated as incipient law.

zh: 另一方是像弗里德（Fried 1967)这样的政治实体论者，他们强调这些社会与那些制裁受到制度化力量支撑的社会存在着性质上的差异。考虑到他们对国家的定义，即一个以垄断暴力为基础的实体，那么对他们而言，国家社会和非国家社会是无法比较的。
en: On the other side were the political substantivists, such as Fried (1967), who insisted that there was a qualitative difference between such societies and those in which sanctions were backed by institutionalized force; for them, state and nonstate societies were incommensurate, given their definition of the state as an entity based upon a monopoly on force.

zh: 这样的一些观点得到了详细的说明和连篇累牍的论证。
en: These positions were elaborated on and argued at length.

zh: 事实上，要把这些问题和其他与之抵触的要求进行调和并不容易。每一个政治团体都必须找到自己的平衡点。
en: There is no easy way to reconcile these and other conflicting requirements, and each political community has to strike its own balance.

zh: 然而，有几个一般性的考量可以指导它的选择。
en: There are, however, several general considerations that could guide its choice.

zh: 虽然，一个政治团体不能否定和拒绝它从历史上继承来的认同，但是，它可以正式宣称自己属于多元文化，像加拿大、澳大利亚和其他国家所做的那样。
en: Although a political community cannot deny or reject its historically inherited identity, it can officially declare itself multicultural, as Canada, Australia and other countries have done.

zh: 当民族志学家参与不熟悉的文化时，不是盲目地瞎闯，而是谋取个别知情人（informant)的帮助。
en: When participating in unfamiliar cultures, ethnographers do not just blunder about blindly but enlist the assistance of individual informants.

zh: 这些人是作为民族志学家的人类学家在其中工作的那个社会的成员，他或她与他们形成了密切关系，他们帮助人类学家成为社区的新来者，弄清正在发生的任何活动。
en: These are members of the society the anthropologist as ethnographer is working in, who she or he develops close relationships with and who help interpret whatever activities are occurring.

zh: 就如儿童从其父母那里学会正确行为那样，知情人有助于人类学家在田野中理解先前陌生文化中的“奥秘”。
en: As a child learns proper behavior from its parents, so do informants help the anthropologist in the field unravel the "mysteries" of what is，at first, a strange culture.

zh: 民族志的田野工作对民族学来说是如此基本的工作，以致英国人类学家C.G.塞利格曼曾断言:“人类学的田野研究就如殉道者的血之于教会。”
en: So basic is ethnographic fieldwork to ethnology that the British anthropologist C. G. Seligman once asserted, "Field research in anthropology is what the blood of the martyrs is to the church."

zh: 与上述所有这些（和其他）关于从“文化”或“社会”的角度如何感知世界的视角不同，那些强调行为者观点的人类学家辩称道，没有两个个体是以一种同样的方式看世界的，因此将整个社会进行归纳是荒谬的。
en: Against all of these (and other) perspectives regarding how "cultures" or "societies" perceive the world, anthropologists stressing the actor's point of view have argued that no two individuals see the world in the same way and that it is therefore preposterous to generalise about entire societies.

zh: 在此，女性主义的冲击是决定性的。
en: The impact of feminism has been decisive here.

zh: 1970年代以来，女性主义人类学家区分了常常具有很大差异的男人和女人的世界观，他们展示了“社会”的传统解释实际上指的只是男人的视角，因为不管是人类学家还是主要资料提供者都好像是男人（Ardener 1977）。
en: Since the 1970s, feminist anthropologists have identified often profound differences between male and female world-views, showing how classic accounts of "societies" really refer to male perspectives on them as both the anthropologist and the main informants tended to be male (Ardener 1977).

zh: 从另一条脉络来说，早先从个体方法论的角度批判过结构-功能主义的巴思分析了新几内亚和巴厘岛的知识体系（Barth 1975，1993，参见第六章），揭示了哪怕是很小的社会其内部所具有的种种巨大变化。
en: In a different vein, Fredrik Barth, who had earlier criticised structural-functionalism from a methodological individualist perspective, presented analyses of knowledge systems in New Guinea and Bali (Barth 1975, 1993, see Chapter 6) revealing great variations within societies, even very small ones.

zh: 对于道格拉斯而言（正如杜尔凯姆一样），意义之源就是社会本身。
en: For Douglas (as for Durkheim), the source of meaning is society itself.

zh: 文化视角的内容不是由“现实”世界中的物质决定的，而是由需要人们维持的社会组织形式决定的。
en: The content of cultural perspectives is determined, not by what exists in the "real" world, but by the form of social organization they are required to sustain.

zh: 比如，人们对于什么是脏的、什么是可以食用或不可以食用的（Douglas 1966)或动物的分类（Douglas 1957)等方面的知识都源自于社会结构。
en: People's knowledge of what constitutes dirt, for instance, or of what is or is not edible (Douglas 1966), or of animal categories (Douglas 1957), is generated by their social structure.

zh: 在道格拉斯的理论体系中，人们对于周围事物的认识并不源自于他们的社会条件（参见Richards 1?93)，社会是知识产生的惟一源泉，除此之外再没有别的可以直接感知的对象。
en: There is no room here for knowledge to arise from any source other than society, for people to discover things about the world that are not derived from their social conditioning (cf. Richards 1993); no room for direct perception.

zh: 基本结构包括直接交换的各种体系，也就是说，一个集团与另一个集团互换妻子。
en: Elementary structures include systems of direct exchange, where a group may ‘take’ wives from the same group it ‘gives’ wives to.

zh: 最简单的一种形式就是一个男人与其母亲的兄弟的女儿 (MBD)  或父亲的姊妹的女儿 (FZD) 结婚，就像在南美和澳大利亚的一些地方那样。
en: The simplest type is one involving marriage between a man and his mother’s brother’s daughter (MBD) or father’s sister’s daughter (FZD), as in some parts of South America and Australia.

zh: 基本结构还包括延迟直接交换制度。
en: Elementary structures also include systems of delayed direct exchange.

zh: 米勒和冯·奥彭的分析表明，建立有界限的族性需要做的事情是彻底瓦解覆盖面广且不稳定的殖民前期贸易网络，交流和仪式参与。
en: The analyses of Miller and von Oppen show that one thing that was needed to set the scene for territorially-bounded ethnicity was the disruption of the fluid and wide-ranging pre-colonial networks of trade, exchange, ritual participation etc.

zh: 殖民主义就需要这种瓦解分裂。

en: And colonialism involved just such a disruption.

zh: 非洲人的贸易和市场被逐渐剥夺；地域和部落边界被建立起来，成为村落和人们移动的障碍。
en: Trade and marketing was increasingly taken out of African hands; territorial and ‘tribal’ frontiers were established as barriers to the movement of villages and people.

zh: 对大多数人而言，后现代和后殖民主义依旧是振奋人心的。
en: For many of us the breezes of post-modernism and post-colonialism have been refreshing.

zh: 即便如此，依然不能简单地去谴责人类学曾作为殖民控制与统治的帮凶，也不可对具有明显现代主义倾向的学术模式的大部分成就，进行简单的定性（Ardener 1985）。
en: Be that as it may, there is no simple answer to the accusations that anthropology has served as handmaiden to colonial conquest and government, and for the most part was developed within intellectual frameworks distinctly modernist in design (see Ardener 1985).

zh: 尽管大多数曾在殖民地开展研究的人类学家已通过修正错误减少其作品中殖民主义的色彩，人类学至少在某种程度上依旧自视为社会科学而不是艺术，它不过是无意中契合过殖民主义的目标。
en: Although most anthropologists working among the colonized have viewed their programme as one to alleviate the weight of colonialism by reducing its mistakes, anthropology—at least to the extent it has considered itself a social science and not of the arts—has nevertheless inadvertently served colonialism’s aim.

zh: 对古德曼的各种创造性的制造世界的方式提出补充的，是普里斯顿 (Preston)的尝试（然而好像自相矛盾），他描述了想象的创造能力。
en: Complementary to Goodman's account of the various processes of creative world-making is Preston's attempt (however seemingly oxymoronic), then, to describe the inventive qualities of the imagination (1991).

zh: 普里斯顿认为想象一般沿着四个维度改变世界：空间的、时间的、形态学的和理解的。
en: The imagination commonly transforms the world along four dimensions, Preston suggests: the spatial, the temporal, the morphological and the comprehensive.

zh: 在每个维度里都存在各种可能的改造过程，可能单独发生，也可能一起发生。
en: Within each of these dimensions, there then exists a variety of possible processes of transformation, which can occur singly or together.

zh: 例如，在空间维度，现存世界可以用“扩大”、“缩小”、“浓缩”（就像缩写一样）或“移动”（从观察者看来）等方式来想象。
en: For example, "spatially" an existing world might be imaginatively transformed through "magnification" and "miniaturization", through "condensation" (as in a shorthand), or through "translocation" (of the viewing eye).

zh: 例如，在“巫毒教（voodoo)死亡”中，如果群体宣称一个人死了，他就死了。
en: In "voodoo death", for example, if the group declares a person dead, he dies.

zh: 相反，在治愈仪式中，如果群体宣称一个人好了，他就好了。
en: Conversely, in rituals of healing, if the group declares a person well, he gets well.

zh: 在这里，个体意识是如此深陷于群体意识中，以至于谈论像我们所知道的个体主义是不准确的。
en: Here individual consciousness is so deeply enmeshed with group consciousness that it is not accurate to speak of individualism as we know it.

zh: （夸大这样社会里的集体主义特征也是不准确的，因为他们同样有其个体主义的一面；只不过是在与我们自己的生活进行更宽广的比较中，这一点被掩盖了。）
en: (It is also inaccurate to exaggerate the collectivist character of such societies, for they have their individualistic aspects too; yet, in broad comparison with our own lives, the point holds.)

zh: 他也多少注意到了体现在教职工和其他学生中的中产阶级文化，并认识到女孩、西印度群岛裔人和亚洲裔人之间视角的不同，但他主要还是把自己限定在写作一部选点于学校的、关于他的12个叛逆男孩的民族志。
en: He pays some attention to middle class culture, as manifested in staff and other students, and he recognizes distinct perspectives for girls, West Indians, and Asians, but mainly he keeps to a school-situated ethnography of his twelve nonconformist boys.

zh: 在各个标题下，这部民族志逐字逐句地记录了这些年轻人之间的讨论，在场的作者也是参加谈话者之一，威利斯对谈话的直接阐释与从男孩们与他的群体讨论中剪切下来的对话片段交替出现。
en: This ethnography, arranged by topical headings, is presented as verbatim discussions among the lads, with the author present as interlocutor.Straightforward commentary elaborating on the discourse alternates with cuttings of dialogue from group discussions with Willis.

zh: 书中不时有对学校这一地点的氛围的描述，但威利斯要是釆用对话记录作为其民族志证据的主要形式。
en: There are occasional descriptions of the atmosphere of the school as a place, but the reporting of dialogue is the main form of ethnographic evidence employed by Willis.

zh: 另外， 民族学家们依然在收集现存文化的资料，但人们知道，历经多个世纪文化会有变化。
en: Moreover, ethnologists were collecting data on living cultures, but cultures known to have changed through the centuries.

zh: 威斯勒的假说认为，在任何文化区域，文化特质都趋向于从中心向外围扩展。
en: Wissler’s hypothesis was that culture traits tended to spread from the centre to the periphery of any culture area.

zh: 所以，那些在外围发现的文化特质较为古老，而在中心地区发现的那些文化特质则是较新的。
en: Therefore those traits found at the periphery were older, and those found at the centre were newer.

zh: 对殖民官员的嘲弄性的批评和描绘似乎与广为接受的那种认为被殖民者是缺乏领悟力的受害者的观念不相符。
en: The mocking critiques and images of colonial masters would make, it seems, a bad fit with the widely accepted view that the colonized are uncomprehending victims.

zh: 今天，这种关于无家可归者的艺术已经经常和伦敦或巴黎训练出来的关于“回家”的世故的意象联姻，力图清晰地展现中心与边缘之间辩证的文化论题及其与权力的关系。
en: Nowadays, this art of the unhomely, which often weds a ‘sophisticated’ Western training in Paris or London with imagery from ‘back home’, tends to make explicit the dialectics of cultural discourses between centre and periphery, and their related relations of power.

zh: 有很多有影响的艺术家从边缘国家来到广大的艺术市场，但仍旧不为西方所知，被忽视甚至被强制地方化（Brett 1991）。
en: There have been, however, many powerful artists from countries peripheral to the great art markets who on the whole are unknown to the West, ignored by it and thereby forcibly localized (Brett 1991).

zh: 在城里，人们根据他们的出身（一种只在更早期才具有很少相关性的标准）相互归类，并且许多新的在城里成为可能的联系形式——同龄人群体、俱乐部，等等——是建立在民族成员身份的基础上的。
en: In towns, people categorised each other according to their place of origin (a criterion which had only rarely been relevant earlier), and many of the new forms of association made possible by the town – peer groups, clubs, etc.– were based on ethnic membership.

zh: 意义重大的是，米切尔注意到，都市化之后，“部落”和群体成员的概念仍然是重要的，但是为了适应整个社会组织的转变，它的重要性发生了变化。
en: Mitchell notes, significantly, that the notion of "tribe" and group membership continues to be important after urbanisation, but that its significance changes in response to shifts in the overall social organisation.

zh: 这样，他——和团体中的其他成员——预示了后来种族符号论研究的发展（参见第十七章）。
en: In this way, he – and other members of the group – foreshadows later developments in the study of ethnic symbolism (see Chapter 17).

zh: 但是，这部著作的主体却被批评对社会变化所持观点过于肤浅，因为它将乡村生活到城市生活的转变看成是一种过于线性的过程（Ferguson 1990）。
en: This body of work has nonetheless been criticised for taking too facile a view of social change, seeing the transition from village life to city life as an overly linear process (Ferguson 1990).

zh: 传统和传统主义之间的不同可能有助于我们理解这种差别。现代语境下的传统文化的“再度觉醒”，对于要继续生存下去的土著民族来说似乎是必要的，它通常从一种更广义的种族复兴的角度被提起。
en: The distinction between tradition and traditionalism may help us to understand the difference.That "reawakening" of traditional culture in a modern context, which seems necessary for indigenous peoples to survive, is often spoken of in more general terms as ethnic revitalisation.

zh: 前面描述过的对挪威历史的发现或发明是一个经典的例子，复兴的概念从字面上看意思是隐匿了一段时期的文化的符号和实践重新获得它们失去的意义。
en: The discovery, or invention, of the Norwegian past described earlier is a classic example.The concept of revitalisation literally means that cultural symbols and practices which have lain dormant for a while regain their lost relevance.

zh: 但是，我们应该意识到，一种复兴的文化总是与原先的那种文化有很大差异，复兴运动是传统主义者要在一个并非传统而是现代的语境中为传统寻求意义的运动。
en: However, we have to be aware that a revitalised culture is always very different from the original.Revitalisation movements are traditionalist in that they seek to make tradition relevant in a context which is not itself traditional, but modern.

zh: 我列举一个极端的例子。
en: I shall give just one, admittedly extreme, example.

zh: 1989年南非种族隔离解除以前，黑人、白人、有色人和亚洲人是彼此分离的。同时 黑人又被再分成不同的族体：祖鲁人（Zulu）、茨瓦纳人（Tswa-na）、科萨人（Xhosa）等等。
en: Until the end of legal apartheid in South Africa in 1989, blacks, whites, coloureds and Asians were legally separated from one another, while the black section of the population was subdivided into ethnicities – Zulu, Tswana, Xhosa etc.

zh: 我们从中均可识别出这一系列限制的人为因素。
en: While we can all recognise the artificiality of a number of these distinctions,

zh: 此外，他还是一个活跃于公共问题如民族主义、种族关系、教育和优生学的评论家。他所参与的这些活动并非出自某种特别的政治目的，而是基于人类学知识应能为解决社会问题指明道路的信念。
en: He was, moreover, a frequent commentator on public issues such as nationalism, race relations, education, and eugenics, not as part of a specifically political program but in the conviction that anthropological knowledge would itself point the way to societal solutions.

zh: 尽管博厄斯的学生经常自称为该学派的成员，但是他们之间仍然存在着巨大的差别。
en: Although Boas's students are often spoken of as Boasians, there were strong differences among them.

zh: （同时有必要指出的是：博厄斯本人习惯于自我批评，他经常会改变看法并且否定其以前的观点。）
en: (It must also be said that Boas himself was selfcritical, often changing his views and retracting earlier opinions.)

zh: 幻想型精神分裂症的一个准确的形象是以温迪戈闻名的所谓种族精神病（ethnic psychoses）。
en: A precise image of paranoid schizophrenia is one of the so-called ethnic psychoses known as Windigo.

zh: 这种精神病与特定族群特有的精神错乱症状（参见表5.1)直接相关。
en: Such psychoses involve symptoms of mental disorder specific to particular ethnic groups (Table 5.1).

zh: 食人狂精神病限于诸如克里人和奥吉布瓦人那种北部阿尔衰琴印第安人群体内。
en: Windigo psychosis is limited to northern Aigonkian Indian groups such as the Chippewa, Cree, and Ojibwa.

zh: 在这些北部印第安人的传统信念体系中，他们承认被称为温迪戈的食人妖怪的存在。
en: In their traditional belief systems, these northern Indians recognized the existence of cannibalistic monsters called Windigos.

zh: 患这种精神病的人形成一种幻想，他们陷入这些妖怪的控制之下，他们自身正在变成温迪戈，渴望吃到人肉。
en: Individuals afflicted by the psychosis developed the delusion that, falling under control of these monsters, they themselves were being transformed into Windigos, with a craving for human flesh.

zh: 在这种情况发生的同时，他们看到他们周围的人正变成各种各样的可吃的动物——例如，多脂多汁的河狸。
en: Meanwhile, they saw people around them turning into various edible animals—fat, juicy beavers, for instance.

zh: 刚才所引述的巴西印第安人的例子，提出了种族灭绝（germcide）的问题——一个族群把另一个族群的人彻底消灭，这常常是蓄意的，而且常常是在“进步”的名 义之下进行的。
en: The Brazilian Indian case just cited raises the issue of genocide—the extermination of one group of people by another, often deliberately and in the name of "progress".

zh: 种族灭绝在这个世界上并不是什么新事物,我们只需要看看北美历史就可以见到了。
en: Genocide is not new in the world, as we need look no farther than North American history to see.

zh: 例如，1637年就发生过一次蓄意灭绝佩科特印第安人的事，那些人纵火焚烧了佩科特印第安人在康涅狄格州米斯蒂克的村庄，并用枪打死所有那些企图逃跑以免被火烧死的人——首先是妇女和儿童。
en: In 1637, for example, a deliberate attempt was made to destroy the Pequot Indians by setting afire their village at Mystic, Connecticut, and then shooting down all those— primarily women and children—who sought to es­cape from being burned alive.

zh: 为了连他们的记忆都被扑灭，殖民当局甚至还禁止提到佩科特人的名字。
种族偏见与种族冲突时常被认作和解释为主要是一种心理现象。
en: The phenomenon of race prejudice and inter-racial antagonisms is frequently regarded and explained as primarily a psychological phenomenon.

zh: 由于种族问题是在个人有机体的行为和态度中显现出来的，因此，人们时常想当然地认为，从科学解释的立场出发，种族偏见和种族冲突问题属心理学领域；而从治理这些问题的观点来看，它们则又属于精神病学范畴。
en: Since the phenomenon is manifested in acts and attitudes of individual human organisms it is frequently taken for granted that the problem of race prejudice and inter-racial antagonisms is psychological from the standpoint of scientific explanation, and psychiatric from the point of view of therapy.

zh: 精神分析学提出如下的一些解释：犹太人是制订法典和形成超我的家长，也是不知悔悟的叛逆者。

en: Psychoanalysis has come forward with interpretations such as these: The Jew is identified with the law-giving, super-ego forming father, and also wdth the unrepentant parricide.

zh: 事实上，一旦强权被侵蚀，对臣民的法律安排就不可能继续了。
en: But legislated arrangements for subject peoples are not likely to last once coercive powers are eroded.

zh: 然而，不尊重历史权利和要求的宪法或法律又会为未来的冲突和最终的分离做铺垫。族裔民族（ethnic nation）的思想往往孕育着悲惨事件诸如人口迁徙、领土瓜分和种族清洗的种子。
en: A constitution or legislation that is not derived from respect for historic rights and claims will set the stage for future conflict and ultimate separation.The very idea of the ethnic nation carries with it the seed of traumatic events: population transfers, territorial partition and ethnic cleansing.

zh: 在毛里求斯，黑白混血儿的境况也是以类似的两难困境为特征，他们混合了非洲人/欧洲人的出身，他们不被允许加入毛里求斯白人的种族群体，在总体上也不被克利奥尔黑人（非洲后裔）认为是优秀的克利奥尔人。
en: In Mauritius, a similar dilemma characterises the situation of the gens de couleur or "mulattoes"; people of mixed African/European origin.They are not allowed to join the ethnic community of Mauritian whites, nor are they generally perceived as good Creoles by the black Creoles (of African descent).

zh: 通常，他们被工人阶级的克利奥尔黑人描述为“Kreol fer blan”——也就是想要变白的克利奥尔人。
en: Frequently, they are described by black working-class Creoles as kreol fer blan – as Creoles who try to be white.

zh: 从全局的角度看，种族异类是分类的霸权系统的无助的“受害者”。
en: Seen from a systemic perspectives, ethnic anomalies are helpless "victims" of a hegemonic system of classification.

zh: 但是，从参与者的角度看，有时他们可以被当成是成功地成为两者的种族中间人，例如，既是印第安人也是非洲人而且可以在这些身份之间有策略地转换（Eriksen 1993a）。
en: Seen from an actor perspective, however, they may sometimes be regarded as ethnic entrepreneurs who succeed in being both, say, Indian and African and switching strategically between these identifications (Eriksen 1993a).

zh: 对美国种族主义的控诉没有比查利˙明加斯的《受压迫者之下》（Mingus，1971）、劳尔˙萨利纳斯的“心灵牢狱之行”（Salinas，1969)、弗兰克˙钦（Frank Chin）那些愤怒的作品，以及詹姆斯˙韦尔奇（James Welch)或格拉尔德˙韦泽诺尔（Gerald Vizenor)对创伤的描绘，表达得更充分的了。
