en: These immigrants had, for the most part (but not in all cases), a very different background of culture, languages and religion.

zh: 然而，它们中没有一部作品仅仅是控诉，也确实没有一部作品只谴责了自我和族群之外的压迫者。所有人都想象性地描述了新的身份和世界的创造。
en: None of these, however, merely indicts, and certainly none blames only oppressors outside the self and ethnic group; all Actively demonstrate the creation of new identities and worlds.

zh: 并非幼稚地致力于直接再现，而是暗承或召唤文化的生成（emergence)(参见本书中泰勒的文章）。
en: Rather than naive efforts at direct representation, they suggest or evoke cultural emergence (see Tyler in this volume).

zh: 这些描述是那么套式化，具有相对感，一个原因是，他们都关注文本技巧的无效性（ineffectiveness）——也就是对这些技巧有意识的使用：移情、梦的转译、讲故事、多声音和多视角、突出幽默的颠覆和多个身份/传统/文化的辩证并置，以及对覇权话语的批评。
en: One of the reasons for the relative sense that these portraits are less stereotyped is their attention to the ineffectiveness of textual techniques — that is, the self-conscious employment of such devices as transference, dream-translation, talk-story, multiple voices and perspectives, the highlighting of humorous inversions and dialectical juxtaposition of identities/traditions/cultures, and the critique of hegemonic discourses.

zh: 关于涵化的最极端的例子，通常是军事征服、大规模入侵的后果，新来的统治者摧毁传统的政治结构，他们对他们所控制的文化一无所知或者毫不关心。
en: The most extreme cases of acculturation usually occur as a result of military conquest and displacement of traditional political authority by conquerors who know or care nothing about the culture they control.

zh: 原住民不 能有效地抵制强加给他们的这些变化，而且这些变化阻碍他们开展很多传统的社会、宗教和经济活动，他们还可能被迫进行往往会孤立个人和破坏社会整合的新活动。
en: The indigenous people, unable to resist imposed changes and prevented from carrying out many of their traditional social, religious, and economic activities, may be forced into new activities that tend to isolate individuals and tear apart the integration of their societies.

zh: 纳米比亚的朱瓦西人就是这样的一个民族，他们于20世纪60年代早期被集中起来，并被驱逐到一块保留地里去，在那里，他们不能满足自己的各种生活需要。
en: Such a people are the Juhoansi of Namibia, who were rounded up in the early 1960s and confined to a reserve where they could not possibly provide for their own needs.

zh: 遗产涉及财产的传递，而继承与“职责的传递”有关（Rivers 1924），即根据所属的身份传递特定的权利和义务。
en: Inheritance concerns the transmission of property, while succession refers to "the transmission of office" (Rivers 1924); transmission of specified rights and duties as ascribed statuses.

zh: 所有社会都有管理条例规定：当某人死后，谁会继承什么，虽然这些条例常有不同方式的争议或解释。
en: All societies have rules regulating who is to inherit what when someone dies, although these rules are often contested or interpreted in varying ways.

zh: 不同的社会中，亲属制度系统和遗产规则之间没有普遍联系。
en: There is no universal link between the kinship system and the rules of inheritance in societies.

zh: 有的是按照父系继嗣的系统，男人和女人在遗产方面是平等的；有的是对某种性别给以优先权的遗产继承系统，通常是对男性优先；在一些社会，长子比其他子女会继承更大部分的遗产（长子继承制）；另一些社会遵循相反的准则，对幼子给以优先权（幼子继承制）。
en: There are patrilineal systems of descent where men and women are equals in terms of inheritance, and there are systems which give priority to one of the genders, usually the male.In some societies the eldest son receives a larger part of the inheritance than his siblings (primogeniture); others follow the opposite principle and give priority to the youngest son (ultimogeniture).

zh: 异教信仰的概念与非基督教信仰相联系，尤其又与非基督教信仰表达宗教内容的公共仪式有联系。
en: The concept of paganism was associated with non-Christian religions and, in particular, their practices of public rituals which expressed aspects of the content of the religion.

zh: 迷信的概念大部分用来描述世界上的那些既不是科学、权威的宗教也不是“常识”能够解释的看不见的关系。
en: The concept of superstition was largely reserved for descriptions of invisible interrelationships in the world which neither science, authorised religion nor "common sense" could account for.

zh: 从这个角度看，伊斯兰和非洲的祖先崇拜都将被划归异教信仰的领地，而特罗布里恩德岛民相信他们会因为巫术而死以及地中海等地区的人认为某些人拥有邪恶的眼睛之类的常见观念，都是迷信思想的体现。
en: From this kind of perspective, Islam and African ancestral cults would be located in the domain of paganism, while, say, the Trobriand islanders' belief that they die because of witchcraft and the common notion, in the Mediterranean region and elsewhere, that some persons are possessed by the evil eye, would be expressions of superstition.

zh: 在当代人类学中，这对应着经常被援引的宗教和知识之间的区别。
en: In contemporary anthropology, this corresponds to a frequently invoked distinction between religion and knowledge.

zh: 宗教从而可以被说成是包括了公共的超自然力量的社会信仰形式，并且通过仪式得到公共表达。
en: Religion may thereby be said to include forms of social belief in supernatural powers which are public and which are given public expression through rituals.

zh: 洛克曾说，意识可以定义为：“运动中的思维，既认识到它自身的形态”，又能在遇到冲击和变化时维持这一形态”（Ellmannn 1977: 1）。
en: To elaborate upon Locke, consciousness may be defined as denoting:‘the movement of the mind both in recognizing its own shape and in maintaining that shape in the face of attack or change’ (Ellmann 1977:1).

zh: 它包括感觉、认知、情绪、情感、倾向性的个人态度状况以及叙事结构（Flanagan 1992: 213），而且它是具体的：思维不能脱离躯体而存在。
en: It includes sensations, perceptions, moods, emotions, propositional-attitudinal states, and narrative structures (Flanagan 1992:213), and it is embodied: there can be no mind without a body.

zh: 或许意识最独特的特征是它能认知自己：我们意识到自己的意识。
en: Perhaps the diacritical feature of consciousness is its awareness of itself: we are conscious about being conscious.

zh: 作为被限制的领域，社会依然是分析单位，虽然马克思主义称社会为“社会构成”（social formation)。
en: Societies as bounded universes remained the units of analysis, though they were called by their Marxian term, ‘social formations’.

zh: 同样，称文化为“意识形态”，经济为“生产方式”。
en: Likewise, culture became ‘ideology’, and the economy was the ‘mode of production’.

zh: 结构马克思主义与功能主义在许多方面也有共同点，两者都强调仪式和世系组织等的共时性特征和功能性特征。
en: Structural Marxism had much in common with functionalism too, as both emphasized the synchronic and the functional qualities of ritual, lineage organization, and so on.

zh: 假设在1823年-1827年，或1833年至1837年的欧洲，还没有人有足够的智能形成能量守恒定律；而到1843年才出现了头一个这样的人。到1847年才接着出现了四个以上富于这种智能的人，这是对或然率法则的严峻考验。
en: To assume that there was no one in Europe with sufficient mental ability to formulate the Law of Conservation of Energy in 1823-27, or in 1833-37, but that in 1843 one such person appeared only to be followed by four more in 1847, is to put a severe strain upon the laws of chance.

zh: 而文化学解释却作出了非常适当的假设。
en: The culturological interpretation, however, makes very modest assumptions.

zh: 有很多方式可以说明社会内部的知识和技能的差异。
en: There are many ways of accounting for differences in skills and knowledge within societies.

zh: 女性主义者的方式倾向于接受这样一到两种论点：（1）女人体验世界的方式与男人不同，因为她们是女人；（2）让有价值的社会技能远离女人是符合父权制（男性规则）的利益的。
en: Feminists have tended to follow one or both of two lines of argument: (1) women experience the world differently from men because they are women; (2) it is in the interest of patriarchy (male rule) to keep socially valuable skills away from women.

zh: 由马克思主义所激励的分析倾向于将知识和技能的研究与权力和意识形态的研究相联系（参见第九章和第十四章），而由涂尔干所激励的社会人类学家则会将这些差异与劳动分工相联系，由此对社会一体化有所贡献。
en: Analyses inspired by Marxism tend to link the study of knowledge and skills to that of power and ideology (see Chapters 9, 11 and 14), while social anthropologists inspired by Durkheim may relate such differences to the division of labour, which thereby contributes to the integration of society.

zh: 还应该注意到，“有价值的知识”的说法，以及更加广泛地，对世界的真正的定义，是一种权力的形式（参见Bourdieu 1982；同样参见第十五章）。
en: It should be noted that the designation of "valuable knowledge" and, more generally, the very definition of the world, is a form of power (see Bourdieu 1982; see also Chapter 15).

zh: 或许研究人权的人类学提供了一种途径。
en: Perhaps an anthropology of human rights offers a way forward.

zh: 关于人权的话语和法规中最常见的是“跨国界的公正过程”（Wilson 1997: 9），人类学可以以一种新的方式研究这些权利，即“最普遍的世界意识形态”（Weissbrodt 1988：1）。
en: For, in highlighting the discourse and the laws surrounding human rights as ‘transnational juridical processes’ (Wilson 1997:9), anthropology can point the way towards an appreciation of such rights as perhaps ‘the worlds first universal ideology’ (Weissbrodt 1988:1).

zh: 也就是说，人权，作为一种话语和法律，可以看成是政治进程的一种具体的形态，其中包含了全球自由政治和公正的思想（Rorty 1986）。
en: That is, human rights, as discourse and law, can be seen as a concrete form of political procedure on which a global liberal polity and justice is to be founded (cf. Rorty 1986).

zh: 摒弃因果论对人类学从业者审视人类学的方式有重大影响。
en: The abandonment of causality had a significant effect on the way anthropology is viewed by its practitioners.

zh: 在20世纪早期，人类学与其他社会科学都为确立自己作为一门解释性和预测性学科的学术地位而努力。
en: In the early part of this century it had struggled, alongside other social sciences, to establish its status as an explanatory and predictive discipline.

zh: 文化现象具有原因的假设——无论是环境的（如第二章所讨论的一些模式）还是社会的（如道格拉斯的模式）都能够使人类学家声言，只要找出这些原因他们就可以对他们所研究的文化做出确定的或最终的解释。
en: The assumption that cultural phenomena have causes—be they environmental, as in some of the models discussed in Chapter 2, orsocial, as in Douglas' model—enabled anthropologists to claim that, by identifying those causes, they were explaining culture insome final and definitive sense.

zh: 如果选择一旦成为分析文化的核心概念，人类学家就这不那么有把握声称他们的分析能够得出确定的解释了
每种语言都会在声音上分辨出数量很小但却绝对是很重要的区别（有些语言会少到只有12个，没有超过90个的，英语有约40个）；这些区分就是音素。
en: Every language identifies a small number of distinctions in sound (some languages have as few as a dozen, none has more than ninety, English has about forty) that are absolutely critical; these distinctions are phonemes.

zh: 只要它们被呈现出来并被理解，交流就会发生。
en: So long as these are produced and understood, communication can occur.

zh: 例如，在英语中，发言人区分“b”“p”之间的不同是很有必要的（否则他会混淆“pin”与“bin”、“bull”与“pull”、“pan”与“ban”）。
en: For example, in English it is necessary that the speaker distinguish between "b" and "p" (otherwise he would confuse "pin" and "bin", "bull" and "pull", "pan" and "ban").

zh: 但他没有必要作出所有的区分。
en: It is not necessary that he make all possible distinctions.

zh: “emic”一词的准确意义长期以来一直存在争议。
en: The precise meaning of ‘emic’ has long been a subject of debate.

zh: 哈里斯认为 (Harris, 1968: 568 -604)它可以被看作是报道人（informant)的陈述，但派克却强调音位系统的结构特征（Pike 1967: 37 -72)。
en: Harris (1968: 568-604) saw it essentially as equatable with informants’ state- ments, whereas Pike (1967: 37-72) emphasized instead the structured nature of the emic system.

zh: 正如报道人不能描述隐藏在他们自己所使用的语言中的语法规则一样，他们也可能无法描述隐含在文化理解和实践中的主位系统。
en: Just as informants cannot necessarily describe the grammatical rules behind their own use of language, so too they might be unable to describe the emic system which underlies their cultural understandings and practices.

zh: 因此，探索音位/主位系统是分析家而不是报道人的任务。
en: The discovery of that system is the task of the analyst, not the informant.

zh: 语言学是人类学家、心理学家和其他科学家对于语言各方面的现代科学研究，语音学专门研究语音,或音位的产生、传播和接受。
en: Linguistics is the modern scientific study of all aspects of language.Phonetics focuses on the production, transmission, and reception of speechsounds, or phonemes.

zh: 音系学研究语言的声音模式， 旨在引申出支配语音组合方式的规则。
en: Phonology studies the sound patterns of language to extract the rules that govern the way sounds are combined.

zh: 形态学关心语言中声音组合的最小意义单位——词素。
en: Morphology is concerned with the smallest units of meaningful combinations of sounds—morphemes—in a language.

zh: 句法涉及一些原则，短语和句子根据这些原则构成。
en: Syntax refers to the principles phrases and sentences are built with.

zh: 语言的完整形式结构构成语言的语法，它由关于语言的词素和句法的所有观察资料组成。
en: The entire formal structure of a language, consisting of all observations about its morphemes and syntax, constitutes its grammar.

zh: 人类语言根植于我们从灵长目动物祖先继承来的姿势一呼叫系统。姿势一呼叫系统起到“为”言语“定基调”的作用，为解释语言形式提供合适的框架。
en: Human language is embedded in a gesture-call system inherited from our primate ancestors that serves to "key" speech，providing the appropriate frame for interpreting linguistic form.

zh: 这一系统的姿势成分由用来传递信息的身体运动组成；把这些身体运动做成标记并记录下来的系统叫作声势学。
en: The gestural component of this system consists of body motions used to convey messages; the system of notating and recording these motions is known as kinesics.

zh: 辅助语言代表呼叫成分，它是由包括各种各样音质和发嗓音的语言外声音构成的。
en: The call component is represented by paralanguage, consisting of extralinguistic noises involving various voice qualities and vocalizations.

zh: 这些交叉分割的纽带创造了不能被简化为单纯的同心圆的效忠的复杂系统，却也减低了不同家系之间的世仇的危险度。
en: These cross-cutting ties, which create complex systems of loyalties that cannot be reduced to mere concentric circles, reduce the danger of feuds between lineages.

zh: 地方社区通过父系家族关系、母系家族关系和姻亲而得以扩充（Gluckman 1982 [1956]）。
en: The local community is recruited through agnatic kinship, matrilateral kinship and affinality (Gluckman 1982 [1956]).

zh: 如果一个男人被卷入一场以效忠于父方家族关系为基础的血仇中，他就会面临不得不冒着将仇恨指向他最亲近的邻居和合作者的风险，因此，许多努尔人都试图尽可能避免与其他家系发生公开的冲突。
en: If a man becomes entangled in a blood feud based on agnatic kinship loyalties, he thus runs the risk of having to direct his revenge towards his nearest neighbour and collaborator.Many Nuer therefore try to avoid open conflict with other lineages as far as possible.

zh: 印象管理的观念被巴思吸收并应用在对一艘离开西挪威的拖网渔船上的工作人员的社会组织研究上（Barth 1966）。
en: The notion of impression management has been taken up by Fredrik Barth in his study of the social organisation of the crew of a trawler off western Norway (Barth 1966).

zh: 船上有一位船长，5到8个渔民水手，还有一个“渔网指挥（netboss）”。
en: The boat has a captain, a crew of five to eight fishermen, and a "netboss".

zh: 他们所有人都具有多重身份，但在渔船上，他们的职业身份远比其他身份重要得多。
en: All of them have a variety of statuses, but in the boat their professional statuses are by far the most important.

zh: 不同部门的行动者具有不同的任务，船长的工作是掌舵和监督其他人；“渔网指挥”的任务则是发现渔群和命令渔民下网，当他“觉得”水下有大量的鱼的时候；而渔民的任务是，完成所有的体力活儿。
en: Each category of actors has specified tasks.The captain's job is to steer the boat and to supervise the others.The "netboss" is expected to find schools of fish and to order the fishermen to drop the net when he "feels" that there are large amounts of fish down below.The fishermen, for their part, carry out all the manual work.

zh: 以这个简单的身份分配作为研究的起始点，巴思描述了船上的角色扮演。
en: With this simple status distribution as his point of departure, Barth describes the role play on the ship.

zh: 相反，日后的人类学领域生发于一批富有同情心的激进主义者所关注的事业，这些人同英国社会的一个独特的圈子联系在一起:非英国国教徒，尤其是辉格党的慈善家。
en: Instead, the field that was to become anthropology arose out of the concerns of compassionate activists who were linked to a distinctive circle in British society: that of Nonconformists and especially Quaker philanthropists.

zh: 下面对英国人类学的出现所进行的讨论尤其倚重于小乔治˙斯托金（George W. Stocking Jr.) 关于皇家人类学协会（Royal Anthropological Institute) (1971)起源的一篇详细而富有洞见的论文。
en: The following discussion of the emergence of British anthropology leans heavily on a detailed and perceptive article by George W. Stocking Jr. on the origins of the Royal Anthropological Institute (1971).

zh: 对于整个时期丰富和详细的论述详见斯托金1987年的著述（Stocking 1987)。
en: For a rich and detailed account of the whole period, see Stocking 1987.

zh: 在华盛顿，就像在美国其他地方一样，由于大量的、并且越来越多的社会地位低下的“黑人”妇女，婴儿天折已经成为美国黑人的一个主要的健康问题，她们婴儿的死亡率几乎是“白人”婴儿的两倍。
en: In Washington, as in the rest of the United States, infant mortality is mainly an African American health problem because of the large and increasing number of disadvantaged Black women; their infants die at almost twice the rate of White infants.

zh: 在布恩调査的那所医院里，所住的绝大部分病人都是贫穷的美国黑人。

en: The hospital where Boone worked served an ovethelnningly impoverished and African American population.

zh: 在接下来的一年半中，布恩集中翻阅了医疗、出生和死亡记录，做了统计分析，还访问了夭折婴儿的母亲、护士、汽科医生、社会工作者和行政人员。
en: For the next year and a half, Boone worked intensively reviewing medical, birth, and death records; doing statistical analyses; and interviewing women whose infants had died, as well as nurses, physicians, social workers, and administrators.

zh: 只要产品能找到市场，价格与利润体系就能刺激生产与技术进步。
en: The price and profit system stimulated production and technological progress as long as the output could find a market.

zh: 但和青铜时代的社会——经济系统一样，燃料时代的新型商业主义亦有其国有局限。
en: But, like the socio-economic system of the Bronze Age, the new commercialism of the Fuel era had its inherent limitations.

zh: 没有一个工业国家曾经有或可能有足够的购买力，以保持和吸收其自己的产品。工业利润体系的真正基础，就在于产品的价值高于按支付给产业工人以工资计算的生产资本。
en: No industrial nation had or could have purchasing power sufficient to keep and absorb its own output; the very basis of the industrial profit system was an excess in value of product over the cost of production in terms of wages paid to the industrial workers.

zh: 因此，剩余物品的出口是必不可少的：“我们必须出口，要么就得完蛋！”这是近年来从不止一个国家听到的绝望的呼声。
en: Export of surplus was therefore essential; "we must export or die" is a cry of desperation heard from more than one nation in recent years.

zh: 当时的许多人类学研究依然以博物馆为基础。博厄斯提升了博物馆的专业化程度并且将他的学生安插到关键位置上，如在美国自然历史博物馆工作的克拉克˙威斯勒（Clark Wissler)。
en: Much anthropological research at the time was still based in museums; Boas fostered the professionalization of museums and placed his students in key positions (such as Clark Wissler at the AMNH).

zh: 博厄斯还积极地创建专业协会，其中包括1902年成立的美国人类学协会（尽管博厄斯直到1907年才当选为主席）。同时，博厄斯还积极创办期刊并确保在国家机构中有人类学的代表。
en: Boas was also active in creating professional associations, including the AAA in 1902 (although he did not become its president until 1907); in founding journals; and in ensuring anthropological representation in national organizations.

zh: 此外，他还是一个活跃于公共问题如民族主义、种族关系、教育和优生学的评论家。他所参与的这些活动并非出自某种特别的政治目的，而是基于人类学知识应能为解决社会问题指明道路的信念。
en: He was, moreover, a frequent commentator on public issues such as nationalism, race relations, education, and eugenics, not as part of a specifically political program but in the conviction that anthropological knowledge would itself point the way to societal solutions.

zh: 这类经验其实也就是人类学家尼达姆（Rodney Needham）举例说明“信仰”并不是一个描述多数宗教体验合适的术语时所暗示的。
en: This sort of experience is what anthropologist Rodney Needham implies when he demonstrates that "belief" is not a suitable term for describing much of religious experience.

zh: 实际上，信仰最适合起源于近东有着独特经典和神学传统的宗教——像犹太教、伊斯兰教和基督教。
en: Belief, in fact, best suits those peculiarly textual and theological traditions of Near Eastern origin – Judaism, Islam, and Christianity.

zh: 信仰就是主张：我相信有上帝；我相信有天堂。
en: A belief is a proposition: I believe there is a God; I believe there is a heaven.

zh: 但是，人类与宗教/魂灵之间的联系要比这更深、更复杂。
en: The relation of humans to the spiritual is deeper and more complex than this.

zh: 有机团结描述的是像我们自己的当代、都市化的社会。
en: Organic solidarity characterizes contemporary, urbanized society like our own.

zh: 在这里，联系基于劳动分工：屠户用他的肉来换钱，面包师用他的面包来换钱，然后屠户才能用换来的钱去买面包，而面包师也才可能用换来的钱去买肉。
en: Here connections are based on division of labor: the butcher exchanges his meat for money, the baker exchanges his bread for money, and with that money the butcher can buy bread and the baker, meat.

zh: 每个人都先完成他自己的工作，彼此有益的交换，就是将社会连接到一起的东西。
en: Each does his own work, and mutually useful exchange is what holds the society together.

zh: 皮亚罗亚人不仅仅对幽灵和神明的存在，而且对这些事物的影响能力，表现出他们的深信不疑。
en: The Piaroa express their strong conviction, not only in the existence of spirits and gods, but also in the efficacy of these beings.

zh: 讲述者的目的是，通过“神话诗学”展示宇宙观方面的知识和历史初创时期的宇宙事件，以此来治愈病人并阻止病患，同时也滋养人们以及周围的土地、森林。
en: The chanter’s intention is, through ‘mythopoetics’, to display knowledge of cosmology, of the cosmogonic events of creation-time history, and in so doing to cure illness and prevent it—and also to generate the fertility of people and the land and forest around them.

zh: 所以神话的讲述者掌握了深奥的存在论的素材，具备相当的能力来加以处理（Overing 1990；1995）。
en: The chanter of myths therefore demonstrates a deep knowledge of ontological matters, and also considerable power in dealing with them (Overing 1990, 1995).

zh: 历史语言学家已成功地描述了当语言从比较古老的母体语言中分离时所发生的各种变化。
en: Historical linguists have successfully described the changes that have occurred as languages have diverged from more ancient parent languages.

zh: 他们还根据语言的相似与差异，形成了一些方法，以估计某些人口迁徙、入侵、接触发生的时间。
en: They also have developed means of estimating when certain migrations, invasions, and contacts of peoples have taken place, on the basis of linguistic similarities and differences.

zh: 例如，语言趋异概念就是用来推测操一门语言的一个群体从另一个群体中分离出来的时间。
en: The concept of linguistic divergence, for example, is used to guess when one group of speakers of a language separated from another group.

zh: 有一种比较复杂的技术，被称为词源统计分析法（glottochronology），它是由莫里斯·斯沃德什和萨拉·古德西斯基在20世纪50年代早期提出来的，他们试图推测诸如拉丁语和希腊语一类的相关语言从一种较早的共同语言中分离出来的时期。
en: A more complicated technique, known as glottochronology, was developed by Swadesh and Lees in the early 1950s to try to date the divergence of related languages, such as Latin and Greek, from an earlier common language.

zh: 归根到底，语言使人类能够保留其文化并使它代代相传。
en: Ultimately, language is what allows people to preserve and transmit their culture from generation to generation.

zh: 研究人类语言的文化人类学分支学科被称为语言人类学（Linguistic Anthropology）。
en: The branch of cultural anthropology that studies human languages is called linguistic anthropology.

zh: 语言学家可能从事于语言描述（句子形成或动词词形变化的方式）或者语言历史（随时间推移语言的发展和相互变化的情况）的研究。
en: Linguists may deal with the description of a language (the way a sentence is formed or a verb conjugated) or with the history of languages (the way languages develop and influence each other with the passage of rime).

zh: 两种研究方式都产生有价值的信息，不仅有关于人类如何交流的信息，而且也有关于他们如何理解周围世界的信息。
en: Both approaches yield valuable information, not only about the ways people communicate but also about the ways they understand the world around them.

zh: 当个体的选择受到语法约束(此时共同使用者仅可理解部分代码）和社会约束（此时仅有部分代码被认为是真实可信的）时，在语言社区内部也依然存在很多可能的可被接受的形式，每一形式之间都有细微差别。
en: While an individuals choice is subject to grammatical restraints (whereby only some codifications are intelligible to fellow users) and social restraints (whereby only some codifications are considered pukka), still there will likely be a range of possible, acceptable formulations within a speech-community, each with a subtly different effect.

zh: 这样一来，个体从指令系统中的选择就取决于从器械库中选择何种武器了（Gumperz 1970)。
en: Thus the individual's selection from the repertoire is akin to a choice of weapon from an arsenal (Gumperz 1970).

zh: 这很重要，而且不要低估个体说者和听者的能力，他们能在不同指令系统之间、不同语法之间以及不同言语社区之间进行策略性发掘，创造出新的事物，或是促使某些天生的发音差异被夸奖、夸大或忽略（Hymes 1979)。
en: It is important, moreover, not to underestimate the extent to which individual speaker—hearers can strategically deploy their competencies, switching between repertoires, grammars and speech communities, creating anew, and having their innate differences of voice socially celebrated, exaggerated or ignored (Hymes 1979).

zh: 为了“清除”之前的个人身份，这种艰难而危险的阈限却是必 要的，这可以使得他或她做好准备重生为新类型的社会人。
en: This difficult and dangerous liminality is nevertheless necessary in order to "clean off" the earlier statuses of the individual, to make him or her ready to be reborn as a new category of social person.

zh: 在研究坦桑尼亚的一支母系民族卡古鲁人的时候，贝德尔曼 (T.O. Beidelman 1971)写道，如果一个男孩在割礼之后立即死去，他不会被按照常规的方式下葬，因为他死的时候既不是孩子，又不是成人，而是一个边缘的、中间类型的人，甚至不是人。
en: In a study of the Kaguru, a matrilineal people in Tanzania, T.O. Beidelman (1971) writes that if a boy dies immediately after circumcision he cannot be buried in the ordinary way, since he will have died neither as a child nor as an adult, but as a liminal, indeterminate kind of person, or even non-person.

zh: 过渡仪式的最后一个阶段是融合，在这个阶段，候选人返回成为新的人，通常比原来等级更高。
en: The final phase in rites of passage is reintegration.During this phase, the candidates return as new persons, usually at a higher level of rank.

zh: 贝德尔曼对卡古鲁人的启蒙仪式进行了详细的描述，在其中很容易就能确认特纳所说的那三个阶段。
en: Beidelman provides detailed descriptions of initiation rites among the Kaguru, and it is easy to identify the three phases analysed by Turner in these.

zh: 仪式中必定包含了对两种性别的道德教育和身体改造，但它们的内容不尽相同。
en: The rites entail both moral education and physical alterations for both genders, but their content differs.

zh: 无论卡特林还是歌德，都没有孜孜以求地去描述他们所观察的仪式的参加者的经验。
en: Neither Catlin nor Goethe make any sustained effort to describe the experience for the participants of the ceremonies they observed.

zh: 卡特林只是修辞性地采取了曼丹人的视角。
en: Catlin assumes the perspective of the Mandan only rhetorically.

zh: 对他而言，欧吉帕是一件“耸人听闻的事”[“仪式的这一部分（折磨)依然历历在目，真是让人不忍卒睹，当他们读到它的时候甚至会叫人对这世界产生怀疑（1857:157)]，他徒劳地努力陚予它意义，他没法在仪式中找到熟悉的故事，好让它不那么支离破碎。
en: For him, the O-Kee-Pa was a "shocker" ("This part o f the ceremony [the torture], as I have just witnessed it, is truly shocking to behold, and will stagger the belief of the world when they read of it" [ 1857 : 157 ] ) ; and he struggled unsuccessfully to give it meaning.He could find no familiar story in which to fit it in more than a fragmented way.

zh: 罗马狂欢节对于歌德变成了一则个人命运的寓言。
en: T h e Roman carnival became for Goethe an allegory o f individual destiny.

zh: 它当然没那么陌生。
en: It was o f course not that unfamiliar.

zh: 最初在殖民主义时期被人类学家研究过的那些民族现在怎么样了？
en: What has become of the peoples first explored by anthropologists during colonialism?

zh: 几乎他们所有人，在不同的程度上，都被整合到了更大的一最终是全球化的——经济、文化和政治系统中。
en: Nearly all of them are, to varying degrees, integrated into larger – in the final instance global – economic, cultural and political systems.

zh: 对于某些民族来说，例如巴布亚新几内亚的赞巴加的马林人（Tsembaga Maring），这种整合在他们的日常生活中仍然是相对不重要的。
en: To some, such as the Tsembaga Maring of Papua New Guinea, this integration is still of relatively minor importance in their everyday life.

zh: 虽然为工资工作和货币经济已经进入了他们的社会，他们仍然靠养猪和园艺农业维持生计。
en: Although wagework and a monetary economy have entered their society, they still get their livelihood from pig-raising and horticulture.

zh: 因为国家垄断暴力的有效性日益增强，在高原上作战却变得困难了。
en: Because of the increasingly efficient state monopoly of violence, it has nevertheless become difficult to go to war in the highlands.

zh: 此类原初心理过程所具有的一个共同特点是，它不可避免地要发展变化。
en: One characteristic of such a primary process is that it has a seeming "inevitabilty" of development.

zh: 众所周知，大多数文化过程都是一些业已确立的原则和规范的结果，然而无论这些规则是单一的、合并还是相互冲突的，它们都不能支配原初心理过程。
en: It should not be envisaged, as most cultural processes may be, as the product of established principles and norms, whether taken singly, conjointly, or in conflict.

zh: 原初心理过程来自人类深层次的需要，人们的内心深处都渴望着更直接和更平等的交往关系，而这些愿望却又受到社会规范的阻碍和扭曲。
en: Rather it arises from deep human needs for more direct and egalitarian ways of knowing and experiencing relationships, needs which have been frustrated or perverted by those secondary processes which constitute the homeostatic functioning of institutionalized social structure.

zh: 社会规范作为制度化结构保持稳定的手段总是试图运用伦理的和法律的制裁来约束原初心理过程过于极端的方面，所以原初心理过程总是很迫切地要扫除任何对自己加以约束的个人和群体。
最早的毫无疑义的原人（ hominines）（人，也就是说，近似的人）以追溯到560万年前到580万年前东非的化石为代表。
en: The first undoubted hominines (humans or, in this case, near humans) are represented by fossils from East Africa that go back 5.6 million to 5.8 million years.

zh: 所有化石都是极小的碎片，尽管一个个 体的大约45%的碎片是从埃塞俄比亚的一个遗址中见到的。
en: All are extremely fragmentary, although about 45% of one individual is known from a site in Ethiopia.

zh: 它通常被称为阿迪皮特卡斯，有440万年之久。
en: Known as Ardipithecus, it is 4.4 million years old.

zh: 虽然它比现代黑猩猩要小得多，但在其特征上，它比任何其他原人都史像黑猩猩。
en: Though much smaller than a modern chimpanzee, it is more chimpanzee-like in its features than any other hominine.

zh: 但是与黑猩猩不同，而是像所有其他原人，它完全以人的方式行走，这就是说，用两足行走。
en: But unlike chimpanzees, and like all other hominines, it walked in a fully human manner, that is, bipedally.

zh: 我认为原生论为族裔情感（ethnic sentiment)的力量做了很好的描述，我们还可以运用社会学和历史学等方面的客观文献更好地解释族裔差异。
en: So far I have suggested that primordialism provides a good description of the power of ethnic sentiment, but that we can better explain ethnic differences through objective historical and sociological data.

zh: 然而，我不想忽略主观因素在族裔意识产生和存在过程中所发挥的作用。
en: However, I do not want to neglect the subjective elements in the making and sustaining of ethnic consciousness.

zh: 现在应该转到我前面提到的观念问题上。
en: It is time now to turn to the question of perception, which I flagged earlier.

zh: 由原始生态智慧讨论所引发的问题，无论对环境话语，还是对人类学在话语中的参与，都是至关重要的。
en: This discussion raises questions which are of central importance both to environmental discourse and to anthropology'sparticipation in that discourse.

zh: 非工业社会中的民族能够与其环境和谐共处的说法在多大程度上是真实的？
en: To what extent is the impression that non-industrial peoples live in harmony with the environment an accurate one?

zh: 生态系统民族被认为具有更强的环境责任意识，那么在现寒中他们是否履行了自身的责任？
en: Are the expectations that ecosystem peoples have a greater sense of responsibility towards their environments fulfilled in reality?

zh: 他们是否真的拥有一种“原始生态智慧”？
en: Do they really possess a kind of "primitive ecological wisdom"?

zh: 非工业社会民族能够与环境和谐共处的看法在环境决定论思想中已经确立起来，取得了全球环境话语的广泛共识，尤其是受到了非工业民族自身的赞同。
en: 14 The image of non-industrial communities living inharmony with the environment is well established in environmentalist thought and widely accepted in global environmental discourse, not least by non-industrial peoples themselves.

zh: 但事实上，我认为这种认识犹如一个“神话”。我之所以这么说，并不是要完全否定它的真实性，也不是说它包含某种特殊的、“象征性的”真理，而是说它已 经被看作是一种无需证明也难以驳倒的教条和定论（Robinson 1968，Milton 1977)。
en: Indeed, I think it reasonable to suggest that this image has the status of a "myth", by which I mean, not that it is necessarily untrue, nor that it has some special, "symbolic" truth, but that its truth is treated as a dogma (Robinson 1968, Milton 1977), in no need of proof and not easily amenable to refutation.

zh: 进化论的英国人类学家阅读广泛，并且与源流相近的德国、美国和法国学者交流思想。
en: Evolutionist British anthropologists read widely and exchanged ideas with cognate German, American, and French scholars.

zh: 他们的讨论和意见分歧非常尖锐——或许确切地说是因为他们的解释性观点太过软弱无力，以致经常导致他们得出完全不同的说法。
en: Their discussions and disagreements were remarkably acrimonious—perhaps precisely because their explanatory ideas were so flimsy and so often led them to construct entirely different accounts.

zh: 泰勒在他们当中的领导地位虽部分得自他在学术上的深刻洞见，但在相当的程度上也是因为他超乎一般的通情达理和礼貌谦逊的气质。
en: Tylor's leading position among them may have been won by his exceptional reasonableness and decorum as much as it arose from the profundity of his scholarship.

zh: 虽然如此，他的《原始文化》被认为质量极高，使他被选为皇家学会的成员，并且在1896年得到了牛津的教授之职，之后更在1912年获封骑士称号。
en: His Primitive Culture, nonetheless, was judged of a quality to lead to his election as a fellow of the Royal Society and in due course to a professorship at Oxford in 1896 and to knighthood in 1912.

zh: 因此，民族志学家要花费漫长时期与他们所研究的人们生活在一起，分享他们的欢乐，经历他们的艰辛，包括疾病，偶尔还有过早天折。
en: Thus, ethnographers spend prolonged periods living with the people they study, sharing their joys and suffering their deprivations, including sickness and, sometimes, premature death.

zh: 他们不会那么幼稚地相信，他们能够、甚或应当对他们与之分享考验和痛苦的人们无动于衷。
en: They are not so naive as to believe they can be, or even should be, dispassionate about the people whose trials and tribulations they share.

zh: 就如罗宾˙福克斯说的:“我们的心和脑应理解我们男人和女人讲的话。
en: As Robin Fox puts it, "our hearts, as well as our brains, should be with our men and women".

zh: 人类学家不会自欺欺人地相信，他们能对他们的发现所带来的道德和政治后果避而不谈。
en: Nor are anthropologists so self-deceived as to believe they can avoid dealing with the moral and political consequences of their findings.

zh: 的确，人类学有保护和促进当地民族权利的悠久传统，在本书后面的章节，我们将回到这一主题。
en: Indeed, anthropology has a long tradition of advocacy for the rights of indigenous peoples, a topic we shall return to in later chapters of this textbook.

zh: 由于身份有差别以及对制裁的常规执行，社会生活具有一定程度的规律性和可预测性。
en: Thanks to status differentiation and the regular implementation of sanctions, social life has a certain degree of regularity and predictability.

zh: 不过，这种可预测性远非对全部社会生活的预测，如果是这样，社会科学家将会变成杰出的先知。
en: However, this predictability is far from total.If it were, social scientists would be outstanding prophets.

zh: 社会身份及其对应的动态的角色提供社会期望和可能的制裁，通过给予相关的特定权利和义务，身份和角色为行动者可能的行动范围画出了轮廓。
en: The social status and its dynamic counterpart, the role, delineate some of the possible scope for the actor, by giving him or her certain rights and duties connected to expectations and possible sanctions.

zh: 但是，一个人的社会身份永远不能定义他或她的行动的全部领域。
en: However, the social status of a person never defines his or her entire field of agency.

zh: 这部分地归因于一种身份很少会被精确地限定、详细地规定在每个情境中应该怎么做的事实，以及角色从来都不会与身份完全一致的事实，也就是说，你被迫为你的角色进行即席表演。
en: This is partly due to the fact that a status rarely entails exact, detailed rules concerning how to behave in every situation, and also to the fact that the role is never identical with the status.

zh: 比如说，尽管“父亲”这个身份的社会定义包含有一些详细的特定期望，每个社会却有着非常不同的扮演父亲的方式。
en: One is, in other words, forced to improvise – for example, there are many, widely different ways of enacting the father role in every society, although the social definition of the status "father" also entails certain expectations.

zh: 行动者（演员）不得不在行动（演出）之前理解一下角色，从这个意思上说，每一个身份又都是暧昧不清的。
en: Every status, however, is ambiguous in the sense that actors have to interpret it before enacting it.

zh: 这就意味着那些被社会定义为越轨者的人事实上只是遭受到任意隔离的被迫害的个体。
en: This meant that those whom society defined as deviants were in reality persecuted individuals suffering arbitrary exclusion.

zh: 但这里似乎也提到任何社会都有一种不变的需求，它们要运用越轨作为一种手段来定义可接受的规则并给自身提供一道边界和一种认同。
en: But there also seems to be a reference here to any society's invariable need to use deviance as a way of defining acceptable norms and providing itself with both a boundary and an identity.

zh: 考虑到他对社会控制的消极态度，福柯所提供的前景最终只能是绝望的。
en: Given his negative attitude toward social control, Foucault's vision could ultimately only be one of despair.

zh: 虽然福柯隐晦地预言了科学的终结，认为它与法律一起已经成为现代社会主要的制造规训的工具，但是他似乎又相信，只要人类是社会性的，他们就总是会受制于这种或那种规训控制的恣意统治。
en: Although obscurely predicting the end of science, which had become, with law, the chief instrument producing discipline in modern society, he also appears to have believed that as long as humans were social, they would always be subjected to arbitrary regimes of disciplinary control of one sort or the other.

zh: 礼物在被定义的同时就是具有社会整合功能的，并且能再次确认个体之间的特定关系。
en: Gifts are socially integrating at the same time as they define and reconfirm specified relationships between individuals.

zh: 而资本主义系统中的商品交换以一种不同的方式运作。
en: Commodity exchange in a capitalist system works in a different way.

zh: 当你在超市买食品的时候，非常可能的是，过后你会想不起收银员的脸。
en: When buying food at the supermarket, it is exceedingly likely that one will not remember the face of the cashier later.

zh: 在一个旨在解释历史转变为资本主义的重要研究中，卡尔·波拉尼（Karl Polanyi 1957[1944]；也可参见 Godelier 1991）区分了物质产品流通中三种不同的原则，或不同的分配形式：互惠、再分配和市场交换。
en: In an important study which aimed to explain the historical transition to capitalism, Karl Polanyi (1957 [1944]; see also Godelier 1991) distinguishes between three different principles in the circulation of material goods, or forms of distribution: reciprocity, redistribution and market exchange.

zh: 互惠是礼物经济分配的主导原则，例如在美拉尼西亚之类的那些以平等主义为基础的社会中，它们的社区在很大程度上是通过互惠原则、通过由给予礼物所创造的相互义务关系而被整合起来的。
en: Reciprocity is the dominant principle of distribution in gift economies such as those found in the egalitarian societies of Melanesia.Such communities are to a great extent integrated through the principle of reciprocity; through those mutual obligations created by gift-giving.

zh: 一种特定的疾病是否由纳瓦霍人的巫技引起的，由占卜（divination）来决定，占卜是一种能够揭示女巫身份的巫术程序。
en: Whether or not a particular illness results from Navajo witchcraft is determined by divination, a magical procedure that also reveals the witch's identity.

zh: 一旦某个人被指控使用了巫技，他或她就会受到公众的质询——在过去，他或她甚至还可能被折磨到坦白为止。
en: Once a person is charged with witchcraft, he or she is publicly interrogated, possibly even tortured, until there is a confession.

zh: 人们相信，一旦一个女巫承认自己的罪过，她自己的咒语便会转向她自身，因此人们指望她将在一年之内死去。
en: It is believed the witch's own curse will turn against the witch once this happens, so it is expected the witch will die within a year.

zh: 有些认罪的女巫因此被允许活下来，但得流放。
en: Some confessed witches have been allowed to live in exile.

zh: 根据克莱德˙克拉克洪的观点，纳瓦霍人的巫技所起的作用是疏导由美国白人的压力所造成的焦虑、紧张和挫败感。
en: According to Clyde Kluckhohn, Navajo witchcraft served to channel anxieties, tensions, and frustrations caused by the pressures from Anglo Americans.

zh: 尽管家庭也许很适合承担这些任务，但我们不应该认为它是能够提供这些条件的唯一的、甚至是最好的单位。
en: Well suited though the family may be for these tasks, we should not suppose it is the only unit capable of providing such conditions.

zh: 事实上，其他同样有效的安排也是可能的，比如说以色列的基布兹,在那里，成对的男性和女性组成的专职人员抚养成群的孩子。
en: In fact, other arrangements are possible, such as the Israeli kibbutz, where paired teams of male and female specialists raise groups of children.

zh: 在很多寻食社会（第五章和第六章讨论过的朱瓦西人和姆布蒂人就是很好的例子），社区中所有的成年成员都共同分担照顾孩子的责任。
en: In many food-foraging societies (the Juoansi and Mbuti, discussed in Chapters 5 and 6, are good examples), all adult members of a community share in the responsibilities of child care.

zh: 因此，当父母出去狩猎或者采集植物和调味草的时候，他们就可以把他们的孩子放心地留在象里,确信他们会得到任何留在营地的成年人的照看。
en: Thus, when parents go off to hunt or to collect plants and herbs, they may leave their children behind, secure in the knowledge they will be looked after by whatever adults remain in the camp.

zh: 根据定义，“无家可归者”者是“间生物”（hybrid），也就是说，他们不再是“确定的”了。
en: By definition, ‘unhomely’ peoples are ‘hybrids’, that is, people who are no longer authentic.

zh: 为了保持确定性和可鉴赏性，绝对的真实性观念——即使被用来作为非常积极的结果——曾经导致了他者被冻结于一个无法摆脱的虚构的过去。
en: The very idea of authenticity—even when thought to be used for very positive ends—had the consequence of freezing other peoples into a mythic past, where to remain authentic and thus appreciated they could not leave.

zh: 指导非常晚近的时期，人类学中才出现了非常一个强大的规则，一个真正的人类学家不应研究那些被玷污了的、穿着西方服饰——男人穿裤子、女人穿裙子——的人；而应该研究那些缠着树皮腰带或穿着自制棉布的人。
en: Until very recently there has been a strong code in anthropology that a real anthropologist did not study people who were so tainted as to wear Western clothes—men in trousers, women in skirts, rather than loincloths of beaten bark or selfspun cotton.

zh: 直到最近，妇女还在使用兵器方面得到训练。
en: In modern guerilla uprisings, women frequently fight.

zh: 显然，根据性别的分工无法简单地解释为性别差异的结果，无论它们是男性的力量和能耗，还是女性的生殖的生活规律和现象。
en: Clearly, the sexual division of labor cannot be explained simply as a consequence of male strength, expendabilicy, or female reproductive biology.

zh: 为了看到根据性别的分工是怎样与其他文化和历史的因素相关的，不是去寻找生物学规则来解释它，更富有成效的策略是考察在具体社会环境中男子和妇女所做工作的种类。
en: Instead of looking for biological imperatives to explain the sexual division of labor, a more productive strategy is to examine the kinds of work men and women do in the context of specific societies to see how the work relates to other cultural and historical factors.

zh: 研究者发现三种形态，其一，以灵活性和男女相协调为特点，其二，根据性别严格分开，其三，以其他两种的各要素为特点。
en: Researchers find three configurarions, one featuring flexibility and sexual integration, another involving rigid segregation by sex, and a third combining dements of the other two.

zh: 对实现世界政治统一的抵制力量，在某种程度上似乎被跨国公司的兴起抵消了。
en: The world's resistance to political integration seems to be offset, at least partially, by the rise of multinational corporations.

zh: 因为这些公司跨越了国界，它们是推进全球整合的力量，尽管有各种政治差异把人们分开。
en: Because these cur across the boundaries berween states, they are a force for global unity despite the political differences that divide people.

zh: 人类学家非常熟悉这种情形，就像下面这段对祖尼印第安人整合机制的描述那样：四五个不同层面的系统相互交织，因而维持了整个社会的统一性，如果这些不同层面相互整合的话，这种统一性很快就会消失，因而很有可能带来隔离和分裂宗族、兄弟互助会、祭司群体、地下大会堂，在某种意义上还有赌博团伙，都是分化机构。
en: Situations such as this are well known to anthropologists, as illustrated by this description of Zuni Indian integrative mechanisms: segregation and fission.The clans, the fraternities, the priesthoods, the kivas, in a measure the gaming parties, are ail dividing agencies.

zh: 如果它们相互一致的话，社会结构的裂缝就会很深；通过彼此相互交织，它们制造出各种分支，这些分支造成了一种几乎不可思议的复杂性，但却绝不会导致这个民族实体的分裂。
en: If they coincided, the rifts in the social structure would be deep; by countering each other they cause segmentations which produce an almost marvelous complexity, but can never break apart the national entity.

zh: 整体论是一个十分重要并且必要但却也是不可能完全实现的美好理想。
en: Holism is an important but impossible ideal.

zh: 你不可能注意到所有地方或是考虑到所有事情。
en: You cannot see everywhere or think everything.

zh: 你必须进行选择，找出重点关注所在。
en: You must select and emphasize.

zh: 为了做到这一点，你必须进行分类和作出区分。
en: To do this, you must categorize and make distinctions.

zh: 只有这样你才能对事物进行分析，获得理解。
en: Only in this way can you analyze and understand.

zh: 唤起——也就是说，“民族志”——是后现代世界的话语，因为制造科学并由科学制造的世界已经失落，科学思想现在只是意识的一个陈旧模式，如果没有民族志语境来创造和维持它，它就只能幸存一阵子，还是以衰退的形式而幸存。
en: Evocation—that is to say, "ethnography"—is the discourse of the post - modern world, for the world that made science, and that science made, has disappeared, and scientific thought is now an archaic mode of consciousness surviving for a while yet in degraded form without the ethnographic context that created and sustained it.

zh: 科学思想的衰微乃是因其违背了文化的第一法则，即，“人所控制之物越多，人和物就越变得无法控制。
en: Scientific thought succumbed because it violated the first law of culture, which says that "the more man controls anything, the more uncontrollable both become."

zh: ”在其神话的总体化修辞中，科学声称它是自身正当存在之理由，并寻求控制其话语，使之获得自主地位。
en: In the totalizing rhetoric of its mythology, science purported to be its own justification and sought to control and autonomize its discourse.

zh: 这里并不是要证明林哈特的欺骗性；尽管他的书对性别的限定到了不同寻常的程度。
en: The point is not to convict Lienhardt of duplicity; his book specifies gender to an unusual extent.

zh: 真正浮现的，是干预了我们的阅读的历史和政治议题。
en: What emerges, instead, are the history and politics that intervene in our reading.

zh: 属于一个特定时代和特定社会集团的英国学术界，比其他的社会团体更爱用“men”一词表示“人”（people）的意思，这个文化和历史语境现在不像过去那样隐于无形了。
en: British academics of a certain caste and era say "men" when they mean "people" more often than do other groups, a cultural and historical context that is now less invisible than it once was.

zh: 我们现在在这里讨论的性别偏见在林哈特的书出版的1961年还不成问题。
en: The partiality of gender in question here was not at issue when the book was published in 1961.

zh: 如果有问题的话，林哈特就已经直接提出这个问题了，就像更近一代的民族志学者现在感到有这个责任-样[例如梅格斯（Meigs 1984:xix)]。
en: I fit were, Lienhardt would have directly addressed the problem, as more recent ethnographers now feel obliged to (for example, Meigs 1984: xix ).

zh: 那个时候人们读“丁卡人的宗教”不像现在现在人们必定读成丁卡男人的宗教，只是或许也可能是丁卡女人的宗教。
en: One did not read " The Religion of the Dinka" then as one now must, as the religion of Dinka men and only perhaps Dinka women.

zh: 我们的任务就是历史地思考林哈特的文本和它可能的阅读，包括我们自己对它的阅读。
en: Our task is to think historically about Lienhardt's text and its possible readings, including our own, as we read.

zh: 利佐的主要作品是关于雅诺玛米（Yanomami)人的，他们或许是南美洲被研究得最多的人群。
en: Lizot's major work has been on the Yanomami, perhaps the most studied people in South America.

zh: 美国的人类学家拿破仑˙夏格农 (Napoleon Chagonn) —直关注于勾勒出雅诺玛米文化和社会组织的结构原则，而利佐却更纯粹地专注于描述，就和贝尔诺和乔治˙孔多米纳所做的一样，在最大程度上避免作理论推断。
en: While the American anthropologist Napoleon Chagnon has always been heavily concerned with delineating the structural principles of Yanomami culture and social organization, Lizot is more purely descriptive, for the most part eschewing theoretical extrapolations as much as Bernot and Georges Condominas did.

zh: 不过，利佐还是强调了雅诺玛米人政治体系的缺陷，而这种缺陷既是由令雅诺玛米人远近闻名的暴力所引起的，反过来又导致了这种暴力的发生。
en: Nonetheless he stresses the weakness of the political system, which both is caused by and causes the violence that theYanomami have become so famous for, and which he attributes largely to illicit sexual relations.

zh: 民族认同的第二个维度与政治团体对自身的假想方式有关。
en: The second dimension of national identity has to do with the way a political community imagines itself.

zh: 政治团体是高度复杂的实体，成千上万的成员从未见过面，但为了这些从未见过面的人，他或她需要交税、作出牺牲，甚至付出生命。
en: Political communities are highly complex entities, involving millions of people the individual member has never seen, but for whom he or she is expected to pay taxes, make sacrifices, and even die.

zh: 政治团体还包括不计其数的过去和将来的世世代代，通过共同的利益和纽带与团体的每一个成员发生联系。
en: They also encompass countless past and future generations, to whom each member is bound, again by common interests and attachments.

zh: 这两个相反的例子揭示了有关政治一体化水平的一个重要差异。
en: These two contrasting examples reveal an important difference regarding the level of political integration.

zh: 美拉尼西亚系统是以亲属制度为基础的平等主义，其特征是平等和成就。
en: The Melanesian system is kinship-based, egalitarian and characterised by equality and achievement.

zh: 而波利尼西亚系统则相反，它是世袭的，并且以归属身份为基础，建立在贵族和平民的差异之上。
en: The Polynesian system, by contrast, is hierarchical and ascription-based, founded on differences between the aristocracy and commoners.

zh: 当平等原则没有被充分考虑的时候，美拉尼西亚系统会崩溃，而当制度化的等级系统不再是合法的，波利尼西亚的秩序也会垮掉。
en: The Melanesian system collapses when the principle of equality is not taken care of sufficiently, while the Polynesian order folds when the institutionalised hierarchy is no longer legitimate.

zh: 一个重要的差异涉及各自的社会类型在累积剩余产品方面的能力。
en: An important difference concerns the ability of the respective societal types to accumulate surplus.

zh: 美拉尼西亚社会所实行的临时性农业（swidden agriculture）使得非常不容易生产出比维持生存所需要的更大量的产品，而波利尼西亚的火山群岛发展出的灌溉技术使其有可能供养一个由专业军人和官僚组成的阶级。
en: The swidden agriculture practised in Melanesian societies did not make it easy to produce much more than the requirements for subsistence, while irrigation technology developed in the volcanic Polynesian islands made it possible to support a class of full-time soldiers and bureaucrats.

zh: 因为田野工作需要田野工作者与知情人之间的信任关系，人类学家首先显然要对他或她的知情人和他们的人民负责。
en: Because fieldwork requires a relationship of trust between fieldworker and informants, the anthropologist's first responsibility clearly is to his or her informants and their people.

zh: 必须做任何可能的事情以保护他们物质的、社会的福利和心理的健康，尊重他们的尊严和隐私。
en: Everything possible must be done to protect their physical, social, and psychological welfare and to honor their dignity and privacy.

zh: 换言之，使他们毫无损害。
en: In other words, do no harm.

zh: 虽然早期人类学家经常为殖民地的行政官员提供“控制”原住民所必要的信息，但是他们很久以前已不再从事这类工作，他们视为首要的事情是人们对其自己文化的权利。
en: Although early ethnographers often provided the kind of information colonial administrators needed to control the "natives", they long since have ceased to be comfortable with such work and regard as basic a peopled right to their own culture.

zh: 分类，从人类学的意义上说，意味着根据社会上已经确定的范围和类型区分物体、人、动物和其他现象。
en: Classification, in the anthropological sense, entails dividing objects, people, animals and other phenomena according to socially pre-established categories or types.

zh: 在任何社会，这都是知识体系的一个重要组成部分，而知识总是与社会组织和权力有关。
en: This is an important part of the knowledge system of any society, and knowledge is always related to social organisation and power.

zh: 之前刚刚出现的论点正好反击了认为有些种类的知识是“客观的而且是普遍正确的”的观念，而为了探究知识体系，有必要意识到知识和社会世界的其他部分之间的相互关系，包括你自己的知识。
en: Arguments have just been presented against the notion that some kinds of knowledge are "objectively and universally true", and in exploring systems of knowledge it is necessary to be aware of the interrelationship between knowledge and other parts of the social world; this includes one's own knowledge.

zh: 正如对于有民族优越感的观察者来说，巫术信仰可能是“无理性的”，对于那些认为西方体系是理所当然的人来说，异邦的分类系统可能也是无规律的。
en: Just as witchcraft beliefs may seem "irrational" to the ethnocentric observer, alien systems of classification may seem unsystematic to someone who takes the Western system for granted.

zh: 民族志的研究已经揭示，其他民族的分类方式是多种多样的。
en: Ethnographic studies have revealed great variations in the ways other people classify.

zh: 第一章的讨论表明，许多人类学家还在另一方面反对道格拉斯的理论模式。
en: As the discussion in Chapter 1 indicated, many anthropologists would also dissent from Douglas' model in another way.

zh: 对道格拉斯来说，社会组织是社会力量的首要产物，其次才是文化视角。
en: For Douglas, social organization was primary and cultural perspectives the secondary products of social forces.

zh: 许多人类学家都会把社会与文化之间的关系视为一种辩证关系。
en: Many anthropologists would see the relationship between the cultural and the social as a dialectic.

zh: 人们如何认识、思考、感觉形成了他们社会活动的基础，这些活动则产生维持与校正他们文化视角的经验。
en: What people know, think and feel forms a basis for their social activities, and these activities generate experiences which both sustain and modify their cultural perspectives.

zh: 我一直把这种过程看作是发展一种适合于探讨人类学研究环境话语的文化模式的起点。
en: I have taken this formula as the starting point for developing a model of culture appropriate for exploring anthropology's contribution to environmental discourse.

zh: 但是，在第二章里，我建议不要遵循这个过程。
en: But, in Chapter 2, I suggested a departure from it.

zh: 因为文化不只与人们的社会活动相关，此文化也不仅仅是由人们与他人的相互交往中所习得的知识构成。
en: I argued that culture does not relate only to people's social activities and does not, therefore, consist only of what they learn through their interaction with others.

zh: 相反，文化通过我们赖以理解世界的所有意义构成，无论是与他人交流所获取的意义，还是我们自己积极认识周围环境（在“直接感知”的过程中）所获取的意义。
en: Instead, it consists of all the meanings through which we understand the world, whether they are communicated to us by others or discovered through our active engagement with our surroundings (in the process referred to as "direct perception").

zh: 在我看来，由于我们从社会情景之外获得一部分文化，因此把我们对现实的理解当作是“社会建构的”几乎没有什么意义。
en: It is partly because we acquire some of our culture outside social contexts that it makes little sense, in my view, to regard our understanding of reality as being "socially constructed".

zh: 我们依然不知道是哪一夜。
en: Again we have no idea which evening.

zh: 更有另外几次，在对一件事进行概括化的、时间的和空间的情景化描述时，他突然来一句“正当此时”，一个“inzwischen”不知所谓者何。
en: And at still other times, in the midst of a generalized, spatially and temporally decontextualized description of an event, he will suddenly make use of a "meanwhile," an inzwischen, that has no coordinates.

zh: 正如我说过的，这些直示词的作用纯粹是修辞，好给他的描述增加些生气，让它们显得更为可信。
en: As I have said, the function of these deictics is purely rhetorical, to add life to his descriptions and make them more convincing.

zh: 它们证明了歌德的在场，并邀约读者“加入”他的行列。
en: They attest to Goethe's presence, and they appeal to the reader to "join" him.

zh: 歌德的直示词，也许是所有的直示词，都有作为命名（appellative) 的一面。
en: There is an appellative dimension to Goethe's deictics, perhaps to all deictics.

zh: 他把读者带进了一个似乎颇为真实的观察场景之中，这其实只是他文本里的一个小花招而已。
en: He draws his readers into a seemingly real moment of observation that is in fact only an artifice of his text.

zh: 一边是读者们见证着科索发生的种种事件中逗人心痒的混乱场面，一边是歌德向他们保证，他绝对在场。
en: He offers them the security of his presence as they witness the tantalizing disorder of the events that take place in the Corso.

zh: 格尔茨认为，困境既存在于道德方面，也有认识论方面的因素。
en: The nature of the difficulty is both moral and epistemological, Geertz continues.

zh: 道德上的困境涉及“去那里”的逻辑，这一逻辑曾经主要是基于殖民主义的背景，如今则以权力的不对称为基础而重现；人类学家依然未经请求的扮演成那些拥有较少西方“资源”的群体的终身代言人和专家，虽然他们只是短暂地在“外围环境”中遭遇对方。
en: The moral difficulty concerns logistics of ‘going there’ which were laid largely in the context of colonialism, but whose powerasymmetries can be seen to be replicated today; still anthropologists act as unrequested, lifelong spokespersons-cum-experts for groups of people with fewer Western ‘resources’, whom they briefly meet in some‘peripheral’ environment.

zh: 即便很多人类学家如今希望自视为参与者，但是在道德政治关系的重组过程中依旧未能摆脱这种殖民主义的陷阱。
en: And yet, such colonialist trappings are a far remove from the reorganization of ethnic political relations in which many anthropologists would nowadays hope to see themselves involved.

zh: 古德曼承认（Gooddman 1978:17-20),上文只是制造世界的方式的一些例子，而不是全部。
en: The above represents a sample of ways of world-making, not an exhaustive set, Goodman admits (1978:17–20).

zh: 新的方式总是在不断产生，既然新的方式可以通过组合和分层产生，变化就可以从不止一个过程中同时产生。
en: New ways are always being created, and since these can also occur in combination and in layers, change can also issue from more than one process at the same time.

zh: 另外，新的世界还可能由不同的象征形式来构成：言语、数字、图画、声音、气味，或者这些象征符号的组合；从一种象征符号向另一种的转译也等于创造了一个新的世界。
en: Moreover, worlds can be made up from different kinds of symbolic forms: words, numerals, pictures, sounds, smells, or any combination of these; and the translation of one kind of symbolic notation into another is also tantamount to the creation of a new world.

zh: 跳出这些历史传统之外考虑人类体验的所有方面，我们发现，整体视角经常发生。
en: Going beyond these historic traditions and considering the gamut of human experience, we discover that the holistic view occurs frequently.

zh: 按照这一看法，自然，不论是我们自己的或是外在的自然，都只是整个存在的一部分。
en: In this view, nature, whether our own or external nature, is simply part of the totality of existence.

zh: 疾病与愈合、恐惧与希望、无意识与有意识，在完整的生活中都会被体验到。
en: Disease, healing, fears, and hopes, the unconscious and consciousness, are experienced in unity with all life.

zh: 这一根深蒂固的融为一体感，引发了强有力的医疗仪式，这些仪式可以在从非洲到马来半岛到土著美国人的部族背景中找到。
en: This deep-rooted sense of unity generates the powerful healing rituals found in tribal contexts from Africa to Malaya to native America.

zh: 这位民族志作者对批判理论的表述是嵌入在工人阶级的经验当中的。
en: The ethnographer's articulation of the critical theory embedded in working class experience.

zh: 对于西方的文化批评传统，尤其是马克思主义传统来说，民族志目前最具吸引力之处就是威利斯（也是陶西格）所采取的这一动向，即用民族志来表现嵌入于民族志对象日常境遇与谈话中的对资本主义社会最有力而独特的批判，其力度和独特性甚至超过了那些自觉地以文化批评为职责的知识分子所作出的贡献。
en: One of the great current attractions of ethnography to traditions of cultural criticism in the West, and especially the Marxist tradition, is the move that Willis makes (as does Taussig) in letting ethnography demonstrate that the most powerful and novel criticisms of capitalist society lie embedded in the everyday conditions and talk of ethnographic subjects, more powerful and novel even than the contributions of intellectuals whose self-conscious task cultural criticism has been.

zh: 可以说，民族志作者是助产士，他接生出并清晰地表达出在工人阶级生活中用俚词俗语所表述的东西，由此也表现了中产阶级的生活。
en: The ethnographer is the midwife, as it were, who delivers and articulates what is vernacularly expressed in working class lives, and for that matter, middle class lives.

zh: 因此，种姓制度根据归属身份将人分等级，它提供了各种规范调整不同种姓成员之间的相互关系，并通过劳动分工制造了种姓间的相互依赖，而劳动分工则意味着特定的任务只能由特定类别的种姓来执行。
en: The caste system thus entails a ranking of people according to ascribed statuses, it provides rules regulating the interrelationships between members of different castes, and it creates mutual dependence of the castes through the division of labour, which implies that certain tasks can only be carried out by members of specified castes.

zh: 关于意识形态和宗教方面，种姓制度基于仪式化的洁净和不洁净的观念，而这种观念用来证明不同种姓之间的分离和劳动分工的正当性。
en: Regarding ideology and religion, the caste system is based on notions of ritual purity and impurity, which serve to justify the segregation and division of labour between the castes.

zh: 仪式化洁净的变化程度意味着，如果高级种姓的成员吃了由低级种姓成员所准备的食物，那么这个高级种姓成员就被污染了，诸如此类。而且，只有婆罗门（Brahmin）的成员才有资格领导宗教仪式。
en: The variations in ritual purity imply, among other things, that a member of a high caste will be polluted if he or she eats food prepared by a member of a low caste, and that only members of the Brahmin caste are entitled to lead religious rituals.

zh: 现代单一民族国家内部的文化同质化也可以从另外的角度有助于解释种族复兴。
en: Cultural homogenisation within the modern nation-state may contribute to explaining ethnic revitalisation in other ways as well.

zh: 第二次世界大战以来，印度-特立尼达人与其余的特立尼达人进入了更加密切的关系，这使许多领域中的种族边界或是被消解掉或是面临了挑战，许多印度人因此感到他们的身份受到了威胁，并且将“克里奥尔化当成对印度人的“生活方式”完整性的一种危险物。
en: Since the Second World War, Indo-Trinidadians have entered into more intensive relationships with the rest of the Trinidadian population, which has led to the erasure or challenging of ethnic boundaries in a number of fields.Many Indians have therefore felt that their identity is threatened, and speak of "creolisation" as a danger to the integrity of the Indian "way of life".

zh: 他们对于所理解的克里奥尔化做出的反应之一是有意识的二分法和对独特性的过度传达。
en: A response to perceived creolisation has been conscious dichotomisation and overcommunication of distinctiveness.

zh: 一般来说，我们可以认为，当种族身份的载体感到身份受到威胁的那一刻，那么种族身份就开始变得重要。
en: In general, we might say that an ethnic identity becomes important the moment its carriers feel that it is threatened.

zh: 大型的考古学项目也启动了。
en: Major archaeological projects were launched.

zh: 此外，人类学家们还受聘于各类对种族关系和乡村社区的研究。
en: Anthropologists were also hired to do studies of race relations and of rural communities.

zh: 激进的政治活动是普遍存在的，尤其是在纽约，博厄斯的第三代学生与他们的前辈相比，政治的参与度要更高。
en: Radical politics were common, especially in New York, and this third generation of Boas's students was more politically engaged than their predecessors.

zh: 这也反映在他们的研究项目中，这些项目通常在启动时像正规的博厄斯学派的研究，但随后就加入了经济学和历史学的成分——历史学这时意味着与美国印第安人接触的真实经历。
en: This was reflected in their research projects, which often started out as formal Boasian studies but then incorporated economics and history—history that now meant the real contact experiences of American Indians.

zh: 19世纪最著名的种族灭绝事件之一，是对位于澳大利亚以南的一个大岛——塔斯马尼亚岛上的原住民的大清洗。
en: One of the most famous 19th-century acts of genocide was the extermination of the Aboriginal inhabitants of Tasmania, a large island just south of Australia.

zh: 在这个案例中，军事力量没能完全消灭塔斯马尼亚人，但军队没做到的，却被一个传教士做到了。
en: In this case, the use of military force failed to achieve the complete elimination of the Tasmanians, but what the mil­itary could not achieve, a missionary could.

zh: 乔治·奥古斯特·鲁宾逊设法把剩下的原住民都集合到他的传教所里，在那里，精神沮丧和欧洲人疾病的致命结合导致最后一批纯种塔斯马尼亚人的死亡，此时鲁宾逊——颇为富有的人士——退休回到英国。
en: George Augustus Robinson was able to round up the surviving natives, and at his mission station the deadly combination of psychological depres­sion and European diseases brought about the demise of the last full-blooded Tasmanians in time for Robinson to retire to England a moderately wealthy man.

zh: 我们所熟悉的对种族偏见最软弱无力的一个心理学解释来自已故的博阿斯。
en: One of the weakest of psychological explanations of race prejudice with which we are acquainted is that given once by the late Franz Boas.

zh: 他说，种族偏见“本质上是建立在……将个人溶合在他所隶属的阶级之中，并将其全部阶级特性归属到他身上的人类精神倾向之上的。
en: The prejudice, he said, "...is founded essentially ... on the tendency of the human mind to merge the individual in the class to which he belongs, and to ascribe to him all the characteristics of his class."

zh: 尽管博阿斯向我们保证，根据人类精神的这一倾向，“并不难理解”这一切，但我们对于将个人与“他所隶属的阶级”融为一体的人类精神倾向究竟怎样导致种族偏见和种族冲突，仍然不甚明了。
en: Just how the tendency of the human mind to identify an individual with "the class to which he belongs" produces racial prejudice and antagonism is not quite clear although Boas assures us that it "is not difficult to understand" in the light of this tendency of the human mind.

zh: 否则将会有太多的边界需要进行巨大的变更，而且即使进行了变更，之后仍会有很多的少数民族继续占据很多的居留地，原因是为了实现一个领土国家对应一个民族而以这种方法来和平解决国家和民族的问题，希望极其渺茫。
en: Too many boundaries would require too drastic revision, too many minorities would persist in too many settings even after revision, for there to be the remotest possibility of peacefully resolving the states-and-nations question in such a way as to match up a single territorial state to each nation.

zh: 甚至更进一步说，要确定一对一的模式，还不得不变更大量的边界并进行种族清洗。正如戈特利布所说的，民族主义是当代政治生活中的一个棘手问题。
en: There would have to be many boundaryshifts and ethnic cleansings before any one-to-one pattern could be settled.Yet nationalism, as Gottlieb says, is one of the stubbornest facts of contemporary political life.

zh: 就像非洲一开始是“我的过去”的过于浪漫化的形象，一个自信的形象，它不可避免地会在切近的观察中动摇——尼日利亚有它自己的问题，一个美国人不可能如此容易地进入一套非洲的角色——同样，美国也因它的种族主义现实或个人幻想（例如她父亲的）也不能被接受。
en: Just as Africa is initially an over - romanticized image of "my past," an image of self - confidence, one that inevitably is shaken by a closer look — Nigeria has its own problems, an American does not slip so easily into an African set of roles — so, too, America is not to be accepted in its realities of racism or individual fantasies (such as those of her father).

zh: 戈尔登从她非洲的痛苦经验中回到波士顿（是波士顿，因为它不是华盛顿或纽约，她在后两个城市长大，那里有太多回归的牵引力）。
en: Golden returns from her or deal in Africa to Boston (Boston because it is not Washington or New York, where she grew up and where there are too many regressive pulls).

zh: 在那里她发现种族的氛围几乎是不可忍受的。
en: There she finds the racial atmosphere almost unbearable.

zh: 不过，人们有一种感觉，她现在只有通过成为一个更强更富的人才能帮助改变这种情形。
en: One has the feeling, however, that she will now help to change the situation simply by being a stronger, richer person.

zh: 重负体制是一种公民宗教等级制度，在轮流的基础上，它把大部分社区的公职和礼仪职务结合起来。
en: A cargo system is a civil-religious hierarchy, which, on a revolving basis，combines most of a community's civic and ceremonial offices.

zh: 所有职务都向所有人开放，最终每个人实际上至少任一个职务一期，每一任期延续一年。
en: All offices are open to all men, and eventually virtually every man has at least one term in office, each term lasting for 1 year.

zh: 这一等级制度是金字塔形的，这就是说在比较低的层次上有比较多的职位，向顶端职位逐级递减&例如，一个约有8000人的社区可能有4个层次的职位，在最底层有32个职位，向上一层有12个，再上一层6个，而顶端有2个。
en: The scale is pyramidal, which means more offices exist at the lower levels, with progressively fewer toward the top.For example, a community of about 8,000 people may have four levels of offices, with 32 on the lowest level, 12 on the next one up, 6 on the next, and 2 at the apex.

zh: 在最底层的职位包括那些做各种各样不体面家庭杂务的职务，诸如扫地和送信。
en: Positions at the lowest level include those for the performance of various menial chores, such as sweeping and carrying messages.

zh: 与此相反，后现代的世界在某种意义上是没有时间的；过去、现在和未来共存于所有话语中，因此我们可以以同样的意义说所有的重复都是虚构的，所有的差异也都是幻想。
en: In contrast, the postmodern world is in a sense timeless; past, present, and future coexist in all discourse, and so we may say with equal sense that all repetitions are fictive and all differences are illusions.

zh: 我们会说守恒（conservation）状态不是客体的而是时间的。
en: We may say that conservation is not of objects but of time.

zh: 客体在变，但时间不变，这就使得我们有理由说，当我们两次看到相同的客体时，其实它们并不相同。
en: Objects change, but time does not, which makes it reasonable for us to say that when we see the same object twice it is not the same.

zh: 没有什么事物是相同的，只有时间，但它不是事物也无法觉察。
en: No thing is the same, just time, which is no thing and not perceivable.

zh: 以同一性的语言说“我看到了相同的东西”或“它变化了”或“它移动了”，需要变化的时间和不变的客体与主体，但话语可以随心所欲地制造这三者——时间、主体和客体，它并不被名词的霸权所奴役，也不被不变的主体对不变的客体的感知所奴役。
en: To speak in the language of identities, to say "I saw the same thing," or "it has changed," or "it has moved" requires a changed time and changeless objects and subjects, but a discourse can make all three — time, subject, and object — what it will.It is not enslaved by the hegemony of the noun, by the perception of changeless objects by changeless subjects.

zh: 我的历史主义的观念受到了弗雷徳里克˙杰姆逊最近作品（Jameson 1980，1981，1984a.b)的很大影响。
en: My notion of historicism owes a great deal to the recent work of Fredric Jameson (1980, 1981, 1984a, b).

zh: 不过，我没有接受他时常援用的、作为对后现代碎片化（认为历史是由各种地方叙亊织成的）之替代物的主导叙事（生产模式的全球序列）。
en: I am not, however, persuaded by the master narrative (a global sequence of modes of production) he invokes from time to time as an alternative to post-modern fragmentation (the sense that history is composed of various local narratives).

zh: 我在导自中力主的不完全性（partiality)总是预先假定了一个地方性历史的困境，这一历史主义的不完全性不同于拉比诺指责一个有点僵硬地定义的“后现代主义”所说的没有置于情境之中的“不完全性与变迁”（见本书第304）页。
en: The partiality I have been urging in this introduction always presupposes a local historical predicament.This historicist partiality is not the unsituated "partiality and flux" with which Rabinow (see p. 352 ) taxes a somewhat rigidly defined "post-modernism."

zh: 实际上，所有的思考和所有的人类经验都可以说具有主观性：我们脑中的想象构建了“外部世界”，协调了我们的感觉器官和神经网络。
en: Indeed, all thinking and all human experience can be said to be subjective: a matter of the images our brains make about the "external world", a matter of the mediation of our sense organs and neural pathways.

zh: 即使疼痛也是创造出来的想象。
en: Even pain is a created image.

zh: 虽然19世纪的科学声称这种主观性“实际上”是客观的，可是后者才是一种幻觉。
en: And while nineteenth-century science founded itself on the claim that this subjectivity was "in fact" objective, it was the latter which was illusory.

zh: 人的知识和知识的前提条件无疑都是个人性；知识是观察者眼中的关系。
en: Human knowledge and conditions of knowledge are always, and inevitably, personal; knowledge is a relationship in the eye of the beholder.

zh: 主位-客位的二分法是由马文·哈里斯（Marvin Harris 1964，1979）引人人类学的，但是其最先是由语言学家肯尼思·派克（Kenneth Pike）提出（参见 Headland et al. 1990），从语言学对音位术语和语音术语进行区分而来，分别指语音间的客观关系和语音意义间的客观关系。
en: The emic–etic dichotomy was introduced into anthropology by Marvin Harris (1964, 1979), but it was first developed by the linguist Kenneth Pike (see Headland et al. 1990), who derived the terms from the linguistic distinction between phonetics and phonemics, referring to the objective relationship between sounds and the meaning of sounds, respectively.

zh: “当地人的观点”是主位，而人类学家的分析视角是客位。
en: The "native's point of view" is emic, whereas the analytical perspective of the anthropologist is etic.

zh: 但是，尽管人类学家的目标是用受访者的感知方式重现现实，却有三个理由可以说明这种结果不可能成为一种主位描述。
en: However, even if the anthropologist aims to reproduce reality the way it is perceived by the informants, there are three reasons why the result may never be an emic description.

zh: 首先，我们必须经常在两种不同的语言之间进行翻译，而翻译与原样是有区别的。
en: First, we must usually translate between two different languages, and the translation is different from the original.

zh: 一个家户通常但不是必然地由亲戚们组成；同样，常常是但不必然地，家户由同一屋檐下的人们组成。
en: A household usually, but not always, consists of people who are relatives; it also frequently, but not always, consists of people who live under the same roof.

zh: 最常见的家户定义如下：一个家户包括那些定期在一起共进午餐的人。
en: The most common definition of a household is as follows: a household includes those persons who regularly eat their main meals together.

zh: 为什么住在同一居所不能构成主要的标准？原因很简单，许多民族的居住安排中，男人、女人和青年住在不同的小屋。下面的例子，一个来自西非，一个来自加勒比海，揭示了家户结构之间的重要区别，可能也暗示了对于不同群体之间的其他异同点来说，这种差异的意义。
en: The reason that a shared domicile does not form the chief criterion is simply the fact that many peoples have living arrangements whereby men, women and youths live in different huts.The following examples, one from West Africa and one from the Caribbean, reveal important differences between household structures and may hint at the significance of such variation for other differences and similarities between societies.

zh: 他们还倾向于将民族主义看成是现代化的产物和现代特征。
en: They also tend to see nations and nationalisms as products of modernisation and features of modernity.

zh: 从根本上说，许多“现代主义者”实际上都是唯物主义者。
en: Many of these "modernist" theories are, at root, materialist.

zh: 在一些情况下，唯物主义是明确的。
en: In some cases, the materialism is explicit.

zh: 举例来说，汤姆·耐恩（Tom Nairn）视民族主义为资本主义“不平衡发展”的产物和回应。
en: Tom Nairn, for example, regards nationalism as the product of, and response to, the "uneven development" of capitalism.

zh: 此书包括了大量“冬季合计” (Winter Qnmts)(拉科塔记录）和历史事件的个人回忆，这与质疑过于清晰地划分“有”历史和“没有”历史的人民的最近趋向一致（Rosaldo 1980；Price 1983）。
en: T h e inclusion of extensive Winter Counts (Lakota annals) and personal recollections of historical events confirms recent tendencies to question overly clear distinctions between peoples "with" and "without" history (Rosaldo 1980; Price 1983).

zh: 第三卷是《拉科塔神话》（Walkerl983）。
en: Volume three is Lakota Myth (1983).

zh: 最后一卷将包括译成英文的索德作品。
en: A n d the last will contain the translated writings of George Sword.

zh: 乔治˙索德是一位奧格拉拉武士，后成为松树岭的印第安人犯罪法庭（Court of Indian Offenses）的法官。
en: Sword was an Oglala warrior, later a j u d g e of the Court of Indian Offenses at Pine Ridge.

zh: 在沃克的鼓励之下，他详细地记录了当地的习俗生活，包括神话、仪式、战争与游戏，并附有他的自传。
en: With Walker's encouragement, he wrote a detailed vernacular record of customary life, covering myth, ritual, warfare and games, complemented by an autobiography.

zh: 这就是我向第二组撰稿人提出的问题：他们中一位是国际法方面的杰出理论家和实践者，再一位是国际关系方面的学术权威。前者是达尼洛·蒂尔克（Danilo Türk)，在民族自决的特殊表演中扮演着重要的角色。他的国家斯洛文尼亚在1991年6月宣布独立，从此南斯拉夫联盟开始瓦解（恰巧，他现在在联合国担任斯洛文尼亚代表）。
en: This was the question I posed to the next pair of contributors: an outstanding theorist and practitioner of international law, and a leading academic authority on international relations.The former, Danilo Türk, played an important role in a specific act of national self-determination, when his country, Slovenia, declared itself independent in June 1991, thereby initiating the formal dissolution of the Yugoslav Federation.(Appropriately enough, he now represents Slovenia at the United Nations.)

zh: 自我意识不是一下子获得的。
en: Self-awareness does not come all at once.

zh: 例如，在现代北美社会,儿童直到大约2岁时才达到自我与非自我的明确区分。
en: In modern North American society, for example, self and nonself are not clearly distinguished until about 2 years of age.

zh: 然而，北美儿童这种自我意识的发展，可能有点落后于其他一些文化。
en: This development of self-awareness in North American children, however, may lag somewhat behind other cultures.

zh: 自我意识与运动神经的发展是同步的，我们知道，北美婴儿开始这种同步发展，其比率要低于许多（也许甚至是大多数）非西方社会的婴儿。
en: Self-awareness develops in concert with neuromotor development, which is known to proceed at a slower rate in infants from North America than in infants in many, perhaps even most, non-Western societies.

zh: 虽然我们知道婴儿接受人的接触和刺激的量起重要作用，但我们还不明白这种较低比率的原因。
en: The reasons for this slower rate are not yet clear, although the amount of human contact and stimulation infants receive seems to play an important role.

zh: 例如，在美国，婴儿一般并不与他们的父母同睡，大多数婴儿通常被放在他们自己的房间里。
en: In the United States, for example, infants generally do not sleep with their parents, most often being put in rooms of their own.

zh: 人们把这种做法看作是重要的一步，这使他们成为个人，他们自已和他们能力的“所有者'而不是某个社会整体的一部分。所以，他们被剥夺了一系列刺激，包括他们与父母一起睡觉时会得到的抚摸、气味、运动和温暖。
en: This deprives them of a steady stream of stimuli, including touch, smell, movement, and warmth, they would receive by cosleeping.

zh: 我反对这种看法，将其称为“主权国家民族主义”（sovereign-state nationalism）。它与英国和其他地方的保守的欧洲怀疑主义密切相关。
en: This view, which I reject, I shall here name "sovereign-state nationalism", associating it with Conservative Euro-scepticism in the United Kingdom and elsewhere.

zh: 现在的问题在于，能否找到其他更能令人接受的民族主义来抗衡主权国家民族主义。
en: The issue is whether there is any more acceptable nationalism to set against sovereign-state nationalism.

zh: 我认为这完全可能，并且提出“自由民族主义”（liberal nationalism）的概念。
en: I think there is.What I propose goes by the name of "liberal nationalism".

zh: 民族认同主要源自公民因素，虽然要承认的是，它也会包含文化和族裔因素，但后者只有符合我所提出的其他限制条件时才能实现。不必说，自由主义是一个颇具争议的概念或政治思想、计划的集合体。
en: The identity of the nation is conceived primarily in civic terms, though it is to be acknowledged that this will also draw in elements of the cultural and the ethnic; these latter are accepted only to the extent that they are compatible with the other constraints for which I argue.Needless to say, liberalism is a much-contested concept or family of political ideas and programmes.

zh: 但是，要想准确判断一种思想是否属于自由主义思想，必须以两种原则或态度为基础，即普遍主义和个人主义。
en: But two principles or attitudes should be seen as fundamental for anything credibly recognisable as belonging to the family of liberal thought.These are universalism and individualism.

zh: 全球化、政治动荡、共产主义体系出现的崩溃和世界各地为自决发生的流血冲突，重新唤醒了原生论的载体：族性、部落、种族、语言、宗教和民族。
en: Globalisation, political instability, the collapse of communism and the bloody fights for self-determination all over the globe have re-energised the primordial standard-bearers – ethnicity, tribe, race, language, religion and nation.

zh: 这些冲突以及助长冲突的情绪无疑存在构成因果关系的潜在因素。
en: Such conflicts and the sentiments that fuel them may – indeed do undoubtedly – have underlying causal elements.

zh: 但是冲突参与者将这些冲突定义、理解和接受为原生性质。
en: But these conflicts are defined, understood and accepted as primordial by their participants.

zh: 板球就这样被用来加强传统的宗族身份。
en: Cricket is thereby used to strengthen traditional clan identity.

zh: 另一方面，很明显，特罗布里恩德的文化遭遇了殖民以后，远非毫无变化。
en: On the other hand, it is clear that Trobriand culture is far from unchanged after its colonial encounter.

zh: 对现代化的一种不同类型的反应体现在美拉尼西亚和波利尼西亚的所谓船货崇拜中（Worsley 1968）。
en: A different kind of reaction to modernisation is represented in the so-called cargo cults of Melanesia and Polynesia (Worsley 1968).

zh: 这些千禧年的政治或宗教崇拜最初出现于第一次世界大战之后，作为与外界越来越多的交往的一种后果，而其中有些交往是最新近的。
en: These millenary political or religious cults first emerged as a result of increased contact with the outside world after the First World War, and some are much more recent.

zh: 他们具有双重目的：重建传统权威，并获得对外来者（大多数是美国人）的巨大财富的控制权。
en: They have a double aim: to re-establish traditional authority and to achieve control of the immense wealth of the foreigners (mostly Americans).

zh: 因此，这些行动在意识形态的层面上，好像可以说，代表了一种新事物和旧事物之间的愉快结合。
en: In this, such movements represent, at the ideological level, a happy marriage, as it were, between the old and the new.

zh: 因为，如同汝森斯（Roosens 1989）所谈到的，本土民族可能希望既保留他们传统中的重要方面，又想要获得现代商品。
en: For as Roosens (1989) has remarked, indigenous peoples may wish to retain important aspects of their tradition, but they also tend to want modern commodities.

zh: 必须补充的是，通常，两个目的都不会实现。
en: Often, it must be added, neither aim is achieved.

zh: 所有人类社会都有这样一些个人——他们的任务是引导和帮助他人完成宗教实践。
en: In all human societies there exist individuals whose job it is to guide and supplement the religious practices of others.

zh: 这样的人非常擅长于同超自然存在打交道，对超自然存在施加影响，操纵超自然力量。
en: Such individuals are highly skilled at contacting and influencing supernatural beings and manipulating supernatural forces.

zh: 通常，他们之所以有此素质是因为他们受过专业训练。
en: Their qualification for this is that they have undergone special training.

zh: 人类学理论往往在两者之间游离。
en: Anthropological theory has tended to shift between the two enterprises.

zh: 在大多数时间里，人类学家都在研究文化事项而不是文化概念本身。
en: For much of the time, anthropologists have studiedcultural things, rather than culture itself.

zh: 他们时不时地瞟一眼黑匣子的特性，因为理论的焦点一直都在关注文化所包含的内容：亲属制度、象征主义、交换系统、宗教信仰等等。
en: The nature of the black box has been glimpsed from time to time, as the theoretical spotlight has focused on its contents: kinship, symbolism, systems of exchange, religious beliefs.

zh: 然而，关注的焦点偶尔也会转向文化概念本身，重新勾勒黑匣子的形貌和层面。
en: Periodically, however, the spotlight has been turned on culture itself, and the shape and dimensions of the black box have been redrawn.

zh: 在社会科学（包括人类学在内）理论的重要转变时期，发生这样的事情并不奇怪，比如，在20世纪60—70年代就发生过。
en: This has tended to happen, not surprisingly, during important fundamental shifts in social science theory, in which anthropology has participated.It happened, for instance, during the 1960s and 1970s.

zh: 第三个区分是“横组合关系”和“纵聚合关系"    (Saussure 1974: 122 - 127 ) 。
en: The third distinction is between syntagmatic and associative relations (Saussure 1974: 122–7).

zh: 继路易斯• 叶姆斯列夫 ( Louis  Hjelmslev )  之后的近数十年，大多数结构主义者都把后者称为”选择关系”。
en: Following Louis Hjelmslev, most structuralists of recent decades have referred to the latter as ‘paradigmatic’.

zh: “横组合关系”实际是指句子中的各种关系。
en: Syntagmatic relations are literally those within a sentence.

zh: 如果能区分爱国主义与民族主义，问题似乎就迎刃而解了。
en: If we distinguish between patriotism and nationalism, our difficulties appear to be resolved.

zh: 如果能将爱国主义视为民族主义的温和形式也可以解决问题，因为大部分人（即使不是所有的人）都认为存在一些在道德上值得尊敬的爱国主义形式。
en: We could call patriotism the benign sort of nationalism and end the matter there, since most, though not all, people think that there are morally respectable forms of patriotism.

zh: 当然，正如萨缪尔·约翰逊（Samuel Johnson）所说，爱国主义依然是恶棍、流氓的最终避难所，但只发生在它作为流氓行为的借口的时候。
en: Of course it remains the last refuge of a scoundrel, as Samuel Johnson said, but only when it is offered as an excuse for the behaviour of scoundrels.

zh: 即使是大国的政府尚且会因为毒品交易而受到指责。
en: The governments of even large states are known to have been tarnished by the drug trade.

zh: 试想如果这个世界是由大量独立的小国组成的，那么那些具有致命威胁的活动，诸如核物资的违法交易、恐怖主义行为和传染病的传播等将会极其难以对付。
en: The control of deadly threats – such as the illicit trade in nuclear materials, terrorism and the spread of epidemics – would be greatly complicated in a world of many more small independent states.

zh: 可见，当少数民族和小群体的文化、权利不被承认时，分离或完全独立便成为它们唯一的出路。
en: However, where small nations and communities are denied their culture and the exercise of their rights, the problem has a different hue.Separation and full independence may then be the only way out.

zh: 因此，我们可以说，在任何情况下，都不能借口“消极共识”分裂和巴尔干化来阻止民族摆脱种族灭绝或残暴统治的愿望。
en: The ‘negative consensus’ against fragmentation and Balkanisation cannot be allowed to block, in every case, the aspirations of nations desperate to free themselves from genocidal or tyrannical masters.

zh: 在离婚仍是丑闻而离婚率又十分低的社会中，包办婚姻不仅是新娘与新郎之间，也是两个家庭之间终身关系的开端。
en: In a society where divorce is still a scandal and where, in fact, the divorce rate is exceedingly low, an arranged marriage is the beginning of a life-time relationship not just between the bride and groom but between their families as well.

zh: 因此，姑娘的外貌很重要，性格更加重要，因为人们同时从两方面评价她:未来的媳妇和未来的新娘。
en: Thus, while a girl's looks are important her character is even more so, for she is being judged as a prospective daughter-in-law as much as a prospective bride.

zh: 她将生活在联合家庭内，我朋友的情况就是这样，因此，在评价姑娘是否合适时，她与家庭成员和睦相处的能力也许是最重要的品质。
en: Where she would be living in a joint family, as was the case with my friend, the girl's ability to get along harmoniously in a family is perhaps the single most important quality in assessing her suitability.

zh: 然而，这种无知并不出人意料。
en: This ignorance is not surprising however.

zh: 我们放弃对女巫施以火刑、为驱赶恶魔鞭挞癔病患者和其它原始作法尚为时不久，甚至在往往走在社会和意识形盔因桌之前的技术领域，我们也只是在两方面，即用火和使用弓箭这两方面超过了原始人。
en: It has not been very long since we gave up burning witches, cudgelling hysterics to drive out demons, and other savage practices.Even in technology, which tends to outstrip the social and ideological sectors, we have surpassed the savage at two points—fire-making and the use of the bow and arrow—only within the last century or two.

zh: 化学火柴不过有一个世纪的历史，而在以往100年间，箭在用于捕猎美洲平原上的野牛方面优于当时可资利用的任何一件火器。
en: Chemical matches are but a little more than a century old and the bow and arrow was used in bison hunting on the American plains in preference to the best firearms available at the time within the last hundred years.

zh: 从文化上说，人类中的一小部分脱离原始状态不过是昨天的事情。
en: It is only yesterday, culturologically speaking, that a small portion of mankind began to emerge from a condition of savagery.

zh: 包括人在内的生态系统，被当做一个自我调节的体系进行了分析。
en: The ecosystem, including the people in it, is analysed as a self-regulating system.

zh: 拉帕波特显示了：在给定的地区内，当猪群和人的数目达到临界水平时，宰牲节就开始了，接着会爆发暴力事件；然后，生态系统接近其维持的极限。
en: Rappaport shows that the kaiko begins, and violence breaks out, when the number of pigs and humans in a given area has reached a critical level; then the ecosystem is near the limits of its sustainability.

zh: 在仪式循环完成之后，临界值会降低而系统被稳定。
en: After the completion of the ritual cycle, the critical values decrease and the system is stabilised.

zh: 对于这个雄心勃勃的计划，埃文斯·普里查德已经做过敏锐的阐述：“在社会人类学中只有一种方法——比较方法——那是不可能的。
en: Of this ambitious project, Evans-Pritchard is reported to have remarked, shrewdly, "There's only one method in social anthropology – the comparative method – and that is impossible."

zh: ”埃文斯·普里查德暗示了两个真理。
en: Evans-Pritchard implies two truths.

zh: 没有哪一个民族志描述是彻底的特殊化，至少在下面这一意义上所有的民族志都是比较的：即民族志学者必须将其从其研究的人民那里学到的东西传达给其他人民，他的读者；在这一传递中就包括隐含的比较。
en: No ethnographic descriptionis entirely particularistic, all are comparative in at least one sense: the ethnographer must communicate the truths of the people he studies to other people, his readers; such communication entails implicit comparison.

zh: 否则将会有太多的边界需要进行巨大的变更，而且即使进行了变更，之后仍会有很多的少数民族继续占据很多的居留地，因此，企图以一个领土国家对应一个民族的办法来解决国家和民族的问题，以实现和平，这种希望是极其渺茫的。甚至更进一步说，要确定一对一的模式，还不得不变更大量的边界并进行种族清洗。
en: Too many boundaries would require too drastic revision, too many minorities would persist in too many settings even after revision, for there to be the remotest possibility of peacefully resolving the states-and-nations question in such a way as to match up a single territorial state to each nation.

zh: 问题：错译改1：否则将会有太多的边界需要进行巨大的变更，而且即使进行了变更，之后仍会有很多的少数民族继续占据很多的居留地，原因是为了实现一个领土国家对应一个民族而以这种方法来和平解决国家和民族的问题，希望极其渺茫。
甚至更进一步说，要确定一对一的模式，还不得不变更大量的边界并进行种族清洗。
en: There would have to be many boundaryshifts and ethnic cleansings before any one-to-one pattern could be settled.

zh: 交谈作为焦点、主题和描述的对象对于人类学的表述来说并不陌生。
en: Conversation as focus, theme and image is no stranger to anthropological representation.

zh: 有人认为人类学的文本将会传达出与消息人的交谈。消息人的讲述、与之的辩论、信息的加工甚至责备，这些都会引发田野中精确的口头表述或其他表达方式（参照 Favret-Saada 1980；Rapport 1987；Cohen 1989)。
en: It is expected that the anthropological text will convey conversation between informants; oratory, disputation, curing and cursing might all elicit precise reportage of the verbal and other expression and exchange in the field (cf. Favret-Saada 1980; Rapport 1987; Cohen 1989).

zh: 社区曾被视为是经验主义上的自在之物（社会组织作为功能性的整体，与其他亊物相区分。
en: Communities have been regarded as empirical things-in-themselves (social organisms), as functioning wholes, and as things apart from other like things.

zh: 这后来成为社区研究的逻辑基础：人类学传统上的基础研究就是基于这样一种观念，即一个相可关联的人的群体，具有文化上的同质性，定居于某一地点，因为这样的“社区”能够为近距离地观察他们之间的相互关系和延续的相互作用提供试验平台；也为那些史大规模或更复杂的社会图景提供一个缩影。
en: This was in turn the logical basis of "the community study": the tradition in anthropology of basing research on what could in some sense be treated as a bounded group of people, culturally homogeneous and resident in one locality, because this "community" would provide a laboratory for the close observation of the interrelations, the continuing interfunctioning, between interests, sub-groups and institutions; and also serve as a microcosm of a bigger social picture which might prevail as societies grew in size and complexity.

zh: 人类学家研究社区(村庄、部落和岛屿）是因为这些被看作是社会生活的关键性结构单元：比如亲属制度的基本结构体现了什么；比如复杂的社会结构由哪些部分构成。
en: Anthropologists conventionally studied communities (villages, tribes, islands) because these were regarded as the key structural units of social life: what the elementary structures of kinship gave onto; what the complex structures of society were composed of.

zh: 我们可以研究它是怎样被制造出来的，我们可以发现在它之前存在着什么。
en: We can study how it was made, and we can discover what there was before it.

zh: 首先，有必要界定我所指的“族性”的含义是什么。
en: It is necessary, first, to define what I mean by ethnicity.

zh: 在非洲，我把它与“部落制”等同使用，也就是说，是一个相当大的人民群体（group of people）的自我意识存在，他们使用相同的语言，抱有相同的政治思想、法律观念和宗教信仰，拥有历史起源相同的神话故事。
en: In Africa I equate it with "tribalism", that is to say, the self conscious existence of a fairly large group of people who share the same language, operate with the same political, judicial and religious ideas, and hold the same myths of historical origin.
