zh: 性别和年龄都具有生物的和文化的方面。
en: Gender and age have both biological and cultural aspects.

zh: 年龄并不必然地直接和性别相互关联。
en: Age is not necessarily directly correlated with gender.

zh: 例如，在喀麦隆的白克瑞人（Bakweri）中间，一个男人要在40岁之前结婚几乎是不可能的，因为他必须要拥有财产和政治影响力才能得到一个妻子。
en: Among the Bakweri of Cameroon, for example, it is nearly impossible for a man to get married before he reaches the age of 40, since he must have property and political influence to find a wife.

zh: 另一方面，女人在性成熟以后不久就结婚了。
en: Women, on the other hand, are married shortly after sexual maturity.

zh: 相对来说，孩子们通常被认为是没有性的，他们的社会化常常以获得双重结果为目的：使他们成为社会的成员，以及使他们成为男人和女人。
en: Children are often considered relatively sexless, and their socialisation frequently aims at achieving a double end: to turn them into members of society, and to turn them into men and women.

zh: 因为这样的原因，男孩和女孩的过渡仪式通常明显不同。
en: For this reason, rites of passage for girls and boys usually differ markedly.

zh: 居住在新几内亚高地哈根山（Mount Hagen）附近的民族有一个普遍的观点认为，婴儿出生时既具有男性特质，也具有女性特质。
en: Among the people who live near Mount Hagen in highland New Guinea (Strathern 1988), it is a common view that infants are born with both male and female properties.

zh: 为了成为男人和女人，他们必须经历一个很长的学习过程，这个过程在一系列的青春期的仪式中画上句号。
en: For them to become women and men, they have to go through a long process of learning which culminates in a series of puberty rites.

zh: 尽管裁决过程并非人类社会的普遍特征,但每个社会都会用某种形式的谈判来解决争端。
en: Although the adjudication process is not universally characteristic, every society employs some form of negotiation to settle disputes.

zh: 谈判往往是裁决的先决条件或替代办法。
en: Often negotiation acts as a prerequisite or an alternative to adjudication.

zh: 例如，在美国解决劳资纠纷，罢工工人首先会与资方谈判，通常借助于第三方的调解。
en: For example, in the resolution of U.S. labor disputes, striking workers may first negotiate with management, often with the mediation of a third party.

zh: 彩礼创造了人们之间的几种道德纽带。
en: Payment of bridewealth creates several kinds of moral bonds between people.

zh: 首先，它在不同家系之间创造了一种契约关系，作为相互信任的一种符号。
en: First, it creates a contractual tie between lineages, being a sign of mutual trust.

zh: 当彩礼是以一种长期的方式给付时，如新郎为他的岳父母劳动一段时间提供服务，这种纽带会被进一步加强。
en: When the bridewealth is paid over a long period, for example through bride-service whereby the groom works for a certain period for his parents-in-law, the bonds are strengthened further.

zh: 其次，彩礼系统为给付彩礼的家族群体内部加强了团结。
en: Second, the system of bridewealth strengthens solidarity within the paying group.

zh: 通常，一些亲戚必须为彩礼贡献一二，而新郎也常常从他的亲戚那里借债。
en: Frequently, several relatives must contribute to the payment of the price, and often the groom must borrow from his relatives.

zh: 文化是阐释视角的核心概念。
en: Culture is the central concept of the interpretive perspective.

zh: 文化是共有的意义。
en: Culture is shared meaning.

zh: 要领会意义，一个人必须像其他人看世界那样去看世界，必须按照他人的框架参照系去理解他人的体验。
en: To comprehend meaning, one must see the world as others see it, to comprehend experience in terms of the others' frame of reference.

zh: 这是阐释性民族志的努力所在。
en: This is the endeavor of interpretive ethnography.

zh: 阐释性民族志没有宏大的故事要讲，至少从进化论视角来看那一点不是特别引人注目。
en: Interpretive ethnography has no grand story to tell, at least none that is particularly striking from the evolutionary viewpoint.

zh: 在《文化的阐释》一书的前言中，格尔茨论述了阐释主义人类学的核心。这本书于1973年完成并出版——正是埃文斯-普里查德去世的那一年。
en: The core of his interpretivist anthropology, though, lies in the introductory essay to his book The Interpretation of Cultures, which was com- pleted and published in 1973 – the year of Evans-Pritchard’s death.

zh: 书中格尔茨总结他的方法是一种“深描”（Geertz 1973: 3 -30)。
en: There Geertz (1973: 3–30) sums up his approach as one of ‘thick description’.

zh: 格尔茨称之为“常识性的声音”，具有五个基本特征。
en: There is what Geertz calls a ‘commonsensical voice’, with five distinctive features.

zh: 首先，常识确定哪些事物是“自然的”：即世界固有的内在特征。
en: First, common sense claims to identify things which are ‘natural’: inevitable, intrinsic to the world.

zh: 其次，常识提供了至高无上的做事情的实践智慧。
en: Second, common sense claims to be a superlatively practical wisdom for getting things done.

zh: 它采取奇闻轶事、笑话、格言和谚语的形式；与此同时带来相互分离且异类的区分，甚至是相互冲突的矛盾和迥异的风格，但也会为参与社会生活提出各种各样的实际的策略。
en: The forms it takes are anecdotes, jokes, maxims and proverbs; together these may amount to a disparate, heterogeneous, even contradictory, pot-pourri, but they also provide practical advice for engaging with life in all its multifariousness.

zh: 第三，常识所涉及和阐释的关于世界的真理是明晰、显著和朴素的；是任何清醒的人都能够明了的。
en: Third, common sense claims that the truths of the world which it enunciates are obvious, patent and plain; it is what anybody who is sober can see.

zh: 第四，常识能为当下提供适宜的处事智慧。
en: Fourth, common sense provides immediate wisdom that fits the moment.

zh: 最后，常识是每个人都可获得的智慧，无需专门或特殊的能力，只需成熟和人世。
en: Finally, common sense promises wisdom which is accessible to all, needing no expertise or special powers, only maturity and some worldliness.

zh: 这些特点勾勒出一个具有普遍性的日常认知和存在模式，而且这与地域相互匹配（“常识”一词与“宗教”、“科学”或“社会学”的区别，基本上是西方的模式）。
en: These features, to repeat, demarcate a mode of everyday knowing and being-in-the-world which is universal, however it may locally be dubbed; (the term ‘common sense’, and its distinction from ‘religion’, ‘science’ or ‘sociology’, is merely a Western framing).

zh: 从这个角度看，民族志写作的过程似乎更加复杂。
en: Seen in this light, the processes of ethnographic writing appear more complex.

zh: 正如德里达可能会说，如果人类学家研究的各种文化往往已经在描写它们自己，“将文化带人写作”的田野工作者-学者的特殊地位就被削弱了。
en: If, as Derrida would say, the cultures studied by anthropologists are always already writing themselves, the special status of the fieldworker-scholar who "brings the culture into writing" is undercut.

zh: 然而，事实上，是谁写下了那个被录到录音机里或被记下来变成田野注释之一部分时神话？
en: Who, in fact, writes a myth that is recited into a tape recorder, or copied down to become part of field notes?

zh: 是谁写下了（在超越抄写的意义上）通过与知识渊博的本土合作人热情交谈面产生的那种对风俗的解释？
en: Who writes (in a sense going beyond transcription) an interpretation of custom produced through intense conversations with knowledgeable native collaborators?

zh: 我已然论证,这些问题可以，也应该产生一种对民族志权威（Clifford 1983a)的再思考
en: I have argued that such questions can, and should, generate a rethinking of ethnographic authority (Clifford 1983a).

zh: 这些功能源自对话而不是作者及其文本的单声部的内部方言。
en: They derive from dialogue rather than the monophonie internal dialectic of the author with his text.

zh: 即使阿多诺提出，通过否定的辩证法，文章旨在清査所有的观点，但只要它是单声部的，是从一个作者的观点那里投射出来的，它就不能达成这一目标，它只是表达了作者的认知乌托邦（Kauffmann 1981:343—353)。与否定的辩证法不同，对话的相对方无需停留在没有超越可能性的未定的悬置中，但与之一样的是，后现代民族志不在文本内实践综合e
en: Even though Adorno argues that the essay, by means of negative dialectics, aims at the liquidation of all viewpoints, it cannot achieve this goal so long as it is monophonie, projected from the viewpoint of a single author.It expresses only the cognitive utopia of the author (Kauffmann 1981:343—53)- Unlike negative dialectics, the oppositions of dialogue need not be held in unresolved suspension without the possibility of transcendence, but like negative dialectics, postmodern ethnography does not practice synthesis within the text.The synoptic transit is a nonsynthetic transcendence that is evoked by, not immanent in, the text.

zh: 超自然主义的笞案是封闭式的、终极的答案：上帝创造化石，它是上帝的愿望，事情就是如此，再也没有什么可说的了。
en: The answers of supernaturalism were complete and final: God did it; it was God's will, and that was that; there was nothing left to say.

zh: 实际上，这些答案没有说出什么东西，它是最终的，因而也是空洞的。
en: Actually, of course, these answers told one nothing; they were as empty as they were final.

zh: 而且最糟的是它们关闭了通往任何更为完善的解释的大门。在被告知一桩事件不过是上帝的行动使然之后，一个人还能询问或学得什么呢？
en: And, worst of all, they shut the door to anything better; what else could one ask or learn after being told that an event was but an act of God?

zh: 用孔德的术语来说，“形而上学”的解释类型至少使人从人类中心主义的束缚中解脱出来。
en: The metaphysical—to use Comte's term—type of interpretation at least freed one from the bondage of anthropomorphism.

zh: 如果化石是由“形成石头的力”所形成的，那么，也就暗含着要人去探讨这一力量的本性，并因而使人与现实世界而不是从现实世界中反射出来的人类自身的形象，建立起直接的联系，从而了解到现实世界的某些知识。
en: If fossils were formed by "stone-making forces," one was, by impHcation, invited to inquire into the nature of such forces and thus come into direct contact with the real world—instead of one's own image reflected therein—and to learn something about it as a consequence.

zh: 形而上学的解释尽管本身是空泛的，却无疑具有进步性：它开拓了通往更完善的解释即科学的道路。
en: The metaphysical explanations though empty in themselves were nevertheless progressive; they opened the way to something better: science.

zh: 这些最早的毫无疑义的人科成员可能在560万年前就生活在非洲。
en: The earliest undoubted members of the human family were living in Africa by 5.6 million years ago.

zh: 这些原人完全是用两足行走的（能直立行走和奔跑）。
en: These hominines were fully bipedal (able to walk and run erect).

zh: 最著名的是南方古猿，他们有很好的资质在相对开阔的环境里从事广泛的食物采集。
en: Best known are the australo-pithecines, who were well equipped for generalized food gathering in a savanna environment.

zh: 虽然从腰部以上起仍然明显地像类人猿，但是南方古猿具有完整的人类齿列，这种齿列所具有的许多特点很容易溯源到较早的像类人猿的灵长目动物。
en: Although still strikingly apelike from the waist up, australo-pithecines had a fully human dentition with many features easily derivable from earlier apelike primates.

zh: 在这些像类人猿的动物中，其中有些动物的生活条件迫使它们花相当多的时间在地上活动，而且他们仿佛已有能力至少偶尔两足直立行走。
en: Some of these latter lived under conditions that forced them to spend considerable time on the ground, and they appear to have had the capacity for at least occasional bipedal locomotion.

zh: 这些冲突以及助长冲突的情绪无疑存在构成因果关系的潜在因素。
en: Such conflicts and the sentiments that fuel them may – indeed do undoubtedly – have underlying causal elements.

zh: 但是冲突参与者将这些冲突定义、理解和接受为原生性质。
en: But these conflicts are defined, understood and accepted as primordial by their participants.

zh: 如许多悲伤的家庭所知道的那样，民族冲突可以真的带来后果。
en: And as many grieving families know, ethnic conflicts can become very real in their consequences.

zh: 虽然文化变迀是下一章才要加以讨论的主题，但如果一点也不提及复兴运动，那么任何对宗教的人类学考察都是不完整的。
en: Although the subject of culture change is taken up in a later chapter, no anthropological consideration of religion is complete without some mention of revitalization movements.

zh: 1931年，在(太平洋)所罗门群岛上的布卡人，突然兴起了一场本地人的宗教运动，运动的先知预言道，不久会有一场洪水吞没所有的白人。
en: In 1931, at Buka in the Solomon Islands, a native religious cult suddenly emerged, its prophets predicting a deluge would soon engulf all Whites.

zh: 之后，会有一艘满载着西方工业品的船来到。
en: This would be followed by the arrival of a ship laden with European goods.

zh: 信奉者得建造一个家庭储藏室来储存这些物品，并准备好驱逐殖民地的警察。
en: The believers were to construct a storehouse for the goods and to prepare themselves to repulse the colonial police.

zh: 因为这艘船只有在当地人把他们自己的供给用完之后才会到来，所以他们就停止在田地里劳作了。
en: Because the ship would arrive only after the natives had used up all their own supplies, they ceased working in the fields.

zh: 尽管这次运动的领导人被捕了，但崇拜持续了好几年。
en: Although the cult leaders were arrested, the movement continued for some years.

zh: 阿切提很快发现，豚鼠并不只是被界定为某种食物：它们是一种种类的食物，同时是宠物和可以食用的动物。
en: Archetti quickly discovered that guinea-pigs were not just defined as any kind of food: they were a special kind of food, simultaneously pets and edible animals.

zh: 在村民的生活中，它们具有一种重要的象征地位。
en: They had an important symbolic place in the lives of the villagers.

zh: 豚鼠不是日常被食用的，而是只在特殊的场合食用，比如过渡仪式、宗教庆典和促进康复的时候。
en: Guinea-pigs were not eaten daily, but only at special occasions such as rites of passage, religious feasts and in connection with healing.

zh: 豚鼠具有特殊性（而从这个角度考虑可以说与厘哩人的穿山甲相当），它也可以被看成是一种预测天气和解释社会事件的神谕。
en: The guinea-pig had special qualities (and may in this regard be compared to the pangolin among the Lele).It was also seen as an oracle which could divine the weather and interpret social events.

zh: 因此，让豚鼠待在身边是很重要的。
en: For this reason, it was important to have one's guinea-pigs nearby.

zh: 那些具有轻微缺陷的动物会被认为是不寻常的聪明动物，例如，因为它们多了一个脚趾(可能是近亲繁殖的结果）。
en: Animals which were mildly disfigured, for example because they had an extra toe (possibly as a result of inbreeding), were considered unusually wise creatures.

zh: 尽管传播的重要性很明显，但接受来自另一种文化的创新与接受“本土的”创新相比，要面对更多的障碍。
en: Despite the obvious importance of diffusion, accepting an innovation from another culture probably has more obstacles than accepting a "homegrown" one.

zh: 除了面临与“本土的”创新所面临的相同障碍之外，构 成借来文化障碍的，是这一事实：这些借用品就其性质来说终究是外来的。
en: In addition to the same obstacles that stand in the way of homegrown inventions is the fact a borrowed one is, by its very nature, foreign.

zh: 例如, 在美国，这就是人们为什么不愿意完全放弃麻烦难用的旧英制度平衡，而去使用更合理的公制的一个原因，而后者几乎已经被地球上其他所有人接受了（坚持使用这种英制度平衡的，除了美国，就只有南也门和利比里亚了）。
en: In the United States, for example, this is one reason why people have been so reluctant to abandon completely the awkward and cumbersome old English system of weights and measures for the adopted by just about everyone else on the face of the earth.(The only hold-outs besides the United States are South Yemen and Liberia.)

zh: 传播论和文化区域研究构建了人类学先后产生的思想中最为有意思的观点之一。
en: Diffusionist and culture-area approaches constitute one of the most interesting sets of ideas anthropology has produced.

zh: 但是，与进化论不同,当前的传播论（例如全球化理论）已经失去了与过去的延续性。
en: Yet unlike evolutionist ideas, diffusionist ones today (e.g., globalization theory) have lost continuity with the past.

zh: 传播论的遗产以其古典形式存在于文化区域研究中——既存在于这些区域之间的历史联系中，而且更重要的，也存在于透彻的区域研究中。
en: The primary legacy of diffusionism in its classic form is in the study of culture areas – both historical relations between such areas and, more importantly, the intensive study of regions.

zh: 在本文的工作稿中，我将少数族群自传的五个来源（五种族群）分别作为一节讨论，这样做是想提示每个族群内部的自传写作的范围和历史轨迹，以及在每一部分突出一种不同的族群感和获得这种感觉的技术。
en: In the working draft o f this paper, the five sources (ethnicities) of ethnic autobiography each provided a separate section.I attempted to suggest something about the range or historical trajectory of autobiographical writing within each ethnicity, as well as to highlight in each section a different sense of, and technique for capturing, ethnicity.

zh: 这种组织方式更接近民族志的探索策略，但事实表明读者不太好把握。
en: That organization, although close to the ethnographic discovery strategy, proved unwieldy for readers.

zh: 在现在的稿子中，我颠倒了等级强调：每-部分集中讨论一种写作策略，但我保留了按民族划分的做法，因为在族群的特定经验和他们获取、提示和运用这些经验的技术之间的确存在某种联系。
en: In the present draft, I have reversed th e hierarchical stress: each section focuses on a writing tactic, yet I retain the division by ethnicity because there does seem to be some connection between particular experiences of ethnic groups a nd the techniques used to capture, reveal, or exorcise those experiences.

zh: 口头艺术包括叙事、戏剧、诗歌、咒语、谚语、谜语和文字游戏，甚至还有取名的程序、赞美和侮辱——只要它们具有特定的结构形式。
en: The verbal arts include narratives, dramas, poetry, incantations, proverbs, riddles, word games, and even naming procedures, compliments, and insults, when these take structured and special forms.

zh: 叙事似乎是最容易记录和 搜集的一种口头艺术。
en: Narratives seem to be one of the easiest kinds of verbal arts to record or collect.

zh: 也许因为它们也是最适于公开发行的一种口头艺术而且在北美文化中最受欢迎，所以它们得到大量研究和关注。
en: Perhaps because they also are the most publishable, with popular appeal in North American culture, they have received the most study and attention.

zh: 一般而言，叙事分为三个基 本的、一再出现的类别：神话、传奇和故事。
en: Generally, narratives have been divided into three basic and recurring categories: myth, legend, and tale.

zh: 拉迪斯拉夫˙霍利和米兰˙斯达克利科（Ladislav Holy and Milan Stuchlik 1983，p.
en: Ladislav Holy and Milan Stuchlik (1983, p. 13) do not agree.

zh: 13)却不赞 同，他们宁愿认为，从夫居的规则确实是存在的，因为萨米人自己说，女人应该加人男人的群体，即使这个规则常被违背。
en: They argue, rather, that the rule of virilocality definitely exists, since the Sami themselves say that the woman ought to join the man’s group, even if the rule is often violated.

zh: 显然这是一种正确观点。
en: This is obviously a valid point.

zh: 在很多社会，性不忠很普遍，即使身在其中的大多数人也会同意有一个规则，其大意是这种行为从道德上是令人讨厌的。
en: In many societies, sexual infidelity is quite widespread, even if most of the persons in question would agree that there is a rule to the effect that such a practice is morally objectionable.
